review_content: Looks new. Great location downtown. About 5 blocks away is an amazing city park with a planetarium.  Hotel: If you get a room on the upper floors on the back side of the hotel, you overlook a AAA ballpark and can watch the games if in town. Very cool!  Rooms clean and up-to-date. Pleasant staff. Parking is $11 if you park yourself. Have to walk a block+ to park in the garage using your room key for access. Also connected to Hilton Garden is a Homewood Suites and Hampton Inn.  Walking/running path about 2 blocks away by Bass Pro.Spend the $20 and valet, or risk your life trying to use the horrible parking garage that's down the block.    By the way the receptionist failed to activate our room keys, so we had no access to the garage and had to do the check in process two times. I stayed here for 4 nights and housekeeping forgot to stop by twice.   Housekeeping also  dumped a pile of toiletries on the counter each time rather than set them out, & they  forgot to take out trash.     Oh, and the tiny indoor pool has windows to the sidewalk for creepers to stand and watch you swim. Lots of winos getting their share of the free wine at the evening reception so watch out if you don't want your small children to over hear vulgar conversations during.  Instead walk over to the garden side and pay for dinner.One star for an extremely  rude staff person named Stephanie. I was there I'm federal business and received a call that the federal rate wouldn't be honored... never had that problem and when I checked in at a different Hilton Hotel, they had no knowledge of any regulation changes other than an increase in lodging rates.I stayed here for two nights in a single King room. Not bad. I frequent Hilton properties 2-3 weeks a month so I have come to know what to expect. I don't want to give any of them any more or less than three stars unless they are deserving when I do remember to review them. This one was just fine. It was clean, the staff was friendly, and the room was fine. Nothing blew me away and nothing made it a bad experience. It is a little pricy, but you have to pay to stay in the nicer areas. I will say that the breakfast was quite good. I enjoyed an omelet each morning and they were perfect as far as I am concerned. I don't know how people screw up a simple omelet, but this staff didn't. Anyways, I will be traveling through OKC a few more times over the next couple of months. I would stay here again, but I tend to stay at different properties when given the chance in an effort to mix it up. I wouldn't have a problem staying here again at all though.Very nice room, reasonable price. Great valet parking. Hotel is in idea walking spot, close to everything.While traveling to OKC for the AVCA convention and NCAA Division 1 volleyball finals I was informed my room at a rival hotel was canceled. I began calling other hotels in the downtown area, which were all booked. I called the Hilton Garden Inn and Deborah found me a room for 2 of the three nights so I took it and figured I'd work out the final night when I got in. Not even 10 minutes later Deborah called me back and told me she had me booked for my third and final night. I was stoked! She saved me a ton of worry and made my convention so much more convenient. My king room was comfortable, roomy and quite. I sept extremely well! The Keurig coffee maker in my room was a nice touch. The location of the hotel is excellent. I was within walking distance of everything I needed. If I return to OKC this will be my hotel of choice.Wonderful stay! The room was neat and clean! The bath had a bit of a weird smell but nothing that was alarming. The staff was wonderful! The bar stools at the bar were the most comfortable seats! Would definitely recommend!This was a very clean, very friendly hotel. Beds were comfortable, bathroom very clean. Very nice for the price!So I get here @ the garden to try and eat & people that come In after me are helped before I was! Seriously! It was 13 degrees outside & I just left the thunder game...ughhh. This was so not a good impression.  I am a corporate professional & clearly was profiled differently because I was bundled up???  I had a thunder skully hat on bc its cold. Not to be overlooked & prejudge by my appearance. You should never judge a book by its cover. My 1st impression of the garden restaurant was trashed by poor service, however the manager tried to accommodate me, but when he came back to me he had nothing to say. Uhmm excuse the hell out of me! The night clerk did give me a credit to try breakfast.  So I'll try the garden on a different day & time! The decor in the lobby is exquisite though.Just checked into this brand new hotel. :-)Valet is available for the garage parking @$12.00 per day. The valet was excellent and brought in my bags without hesitation. The front desk is very friendly and accommodating. My room still smells "new" and the design is soothing. Very nice flat screen television with an extensive channel selection. The bathroom offers neutrogena amenities and there is a walk-in shower sans a bathtub. Very nice. The towels are big and fluffy...not worn out from thousands of washings.The bed is w-o-n-d-e-r-f-u-l :-). I give this place 5 stars for the price of the room, great location in bricktown, and the exceptional staff.The hotel is really nice and clean. All the staff is helpful and friendly. But don't eat here! I had pasta the first night and it was so salty I couldn't finish it. The second night the food had no flavor at all. I only ate it because I was starving.The staff here must have attended the best training school in the world because they are all so friendly, professional, and cool. And helpful. The rooms are clean the carpets don't smell like old musty hotels. The mattresses are ok. The omelet was delicious. The staff make this place awesome. I will stay here again.I loved this hotel!! We had a great view of the ballpark that is across the street from the hotel. I only at breakfast at the hotel on our last day. It was ok. The price was nice! Only ten dollars and some change for myself and my 9 year old. The front desk staff was very nice, especially Debra. She was extremely helpful. I would definitely stay here again!!!

Ooooops.  I posted this review when I thought it was for genghis grill.  Don't know how to delete .  Sorry yelpersPerfect for a quick business trip to Oklahoma.  The rooms are quite spacious and clean - basically what you'd expect in business travel.  The lobby is small but efficient.  There's a small bar next to the front desk and they serve wine and other drinks.  I will be back when in Oklahoma!Where should I start.  I stay at Hyatt Place hotels all across the United States.  They make sure the customer is always happy and gives a great place to stay when traveling.  I have stayed at this Hyatt Place on several occasions, but never again.  I made a reservation several months ago, they placed me on a floor (4th) that's being remodeled.  When I was leaving the next morning, I couldn't even get to the elevator because it was taped off due to a crew painting.  It was 9:45 am.  The guys working were very nice, but fumes were terrible.  If checkout is at noon, why start renovations when people are trying to checkout and use the elevator?  My heater didn't work in my room.  A kid was on his phone sitting in the hall outside my door for about 2 hours, no privacy.  The water pressure was non-existent from 8-9.  The garbage truck woke me up at 3am outside banging the dumpsters.  The big issue was my bill.  I used free points and my bill had $45 worth of charges when I found it under my door.  The desk person, I hope took care of it, but I'm not sure until I get my statement.  She was too busy answering the phone to take care of my need.  I waisted 5,000 points for a terrible experience.  I will never stay at the NW OKC Hyatt Place again.  How about thinking about your customers?  Also leaving the parking lot they were working on power lines, you couldn't even get out of the lot after the terrible experience.Upscale feel with a budget friendly price hotel with a lot of included amenities. The free full breakfast was wonderful. My favorite was the REAL egg served on a croissant with spinach, mushroom and swiss cheese - delish. The room was large, clean and nicely furnished with a very comfy bed. The staff was friendly and attentive.I stayed here when I was driving from Chicago to Scottsdale. My room was reasonably priced, clean and had plenty of square footage. It was a comfortable room and very quiet where I got plenty of rest to continue my trip. There was a desk and a comfy couch in the room as well. I didn't eat here so I can't comment on that as I got in pretty late and left about 5 in the morning. I would definitely stay here again the next time I'm visiting OKC.What friendly staff! Clean, updated and spacious rooms.  Very nice complimentary breakfast. Walls are bit thin - you might hear your noisier neighbors. Location is kind of odd - behind another set of hotels but very near stores if you need them which I found to be a very good option. I was in town for business. I would return.I've stayed at better.  I've stayed at worse.  When traveling on business, there are a few "must haves", and then there are the "nice to haves."MUST HAVES:1. High-speed, reliable internet: The internet was free and easy to use, but the speeds were terribly slow in the evenings. Grade: C2. Comfortable beds: The beds were comfortable, and the linens clean--but the HVAC next to the bed was incredibly loud. Grade: B3. Decent breakfast: whether it's complimentary or for-fee, decent breakfast options are a must for business travel.  The breakfast at this Hyatt fell flat.  The variety was mediocre (but passable), but the quality of some of the foods was just not there: Grade: DNICE TO HAVES:1. Easy check-in/out: It was a piece of cake checking in, but checking out at 4:00am was a surreal and bizarre experience.  Grade: B2. Friendly/helpful staff: The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating: Grade: A3. Room layout: The rooms have very nice layouts, with a desk, couch, wet bar w/ mini-fridge. Grade: AThe hotel is not walkable to anything but an IHOP and a Mexican Cantina, but you can get to a lot with a quick drive.Overall, this place offers a perfectly reasonable stay.  However, there are other nearby OKC hotels that offer a better experience/value.  I did fill out a guest survey after my stay, and I was contacted very promptly afterwards indicating that they will do their best to address the shortcomings--which is a good sign.I was driving from Chicago to Arizona and after dealing with snowstorms and being stuck in the car for 12 hours I was probably not the best to talk with, but the entire staff was absolutely fantastic. They could not have been nicer or more helpful. I can't comment on the amenities of the hotel as I got in late and left early. But the room was fantastic. Larger then I expected and it was very clean. I thought it was strange to have the sink outside of the bathroom but as I was alone it didn't matter. Thinking about it, I can see how handy that would be if I had the wife with me.The staff was helpful and friendly. There was a cricket in our room, which gave me a start until I put my glasses on to see what it was, but we were on the first floor so I think it is understandable. Crickets are OK with me. The room was tidy and comfortable, and I really enjoyed their breakfast room, which reminded me a bit of the breakfasts we had in hotels in Germany.The hotel was a wee bit hard to find, but it was also hard to get around in the general area.Place was noisy (they had lots of kids and families staying there). I was under the impression it was more of a business hotel. Walls are paper thin so stay away from rooms near the elevator. AC sounds like a semi truck idling beside your bed. I only made it 1 night before checking into a better hotel. Place was clean and seemed updated. The staff was sincerely apologetic for the issues I had.I traveled to OKC for business and chose to stay here because I am familiar with the chain. This place did not disappoint! Upon entering the hotel I was greeted by the very familiar and welcoming fragrance. The desk clerk was very knowledgable and courteous. The room that I was assigned was next to the elevator so I was worried that I would be bothered by the noise, but it was very quiet. The free continental breakfast is also a great plus!! The only negative is that I found it very hard to find the place. It sits back in a lot behind McDonalds and Courtyard Marriott, and it was not visible from the interstate.Sketchy location...but hotel and rooms were nice and clean.  The beds were pretty comfortable and staff was friendly.  Free breakfast until 10am and indoor pool.  Rooms are good sized.Avoid room 422! (and 208) The staff here is hit an miss. The ones who hit... hit solidly on the right things to do. Those who miss... miss the mark widely. While the rooms SEEM nice and updated, the overall quality of the work was shoddy. (shelves not attached, doors not closing, etc). The design of the room is pretty neat - until you realize that more than one business man has... fully enjoyed what he was watching on the big screen TV. We have been in at least 4 rooms and every single one had... discernible...stains on them. Yes, the kinds of stains that made Monica keep the blue dress. Room 422 has a great view of the highway off-ramp. You can hear every single truck coming off... the A/C does nothing to drown it out.. but it does add to the cacophony of sounds designed to keep you awake. Room 208 has the distinction of being EXACTLY where the spotlights hit the building. Even with the blinds drawn, you cannot tell if it is midnight or noon outside. It is seriously annoying. All-in-all, it could have been a great place.. but just isn't.Wow. I was simply blown away by the staff at this hotel. Kareline and Katty and the rest took such incredible care of myself and my crew, bending over backward to make sure we had a great stay. I arrived 2 hours after totaling my jeep and they turned a bad day around for me. I absolutely recommend this place and if I am ever back in Oklahoma City I will stay here. Thank you so much for makin me feel at home!Not completely horrible, but not quite great either. The hotel is located right next to the expressway overpass, so try to get a room away from that side if you have trouble sleeping. My room was fine, with the white noise of the AC unit drowning out anything else, so I slept very well. The room is large and very well furnished in what I would call an IKEA modern look, in warm tans and browns. The bathroom is small, with the door opening into the bathroom, making it difficult to manuver once in the room, especially since the bottom of the door, in my room, is not clearing the floor, and is scrapping the floor as it opens, so it cannot be opened all the way to the opposing wall. I will report this upon checkout. A poor design. It would have been better if it opened out. There were also two large silverfish in the tub this morning. Although silverfish are no big deal, suffice it to say, no one wants to see bugs of any kind in their room. A nice big 42" flat screen TV sits in the middle of the room, allowing it to be viewed from either the living room or the bedroom side, but not when sitting at the desk which is around the corner and behind the TV. No big deal, but I sometimes like to watch the TV while I'm surfing the net. There is free WIFI throughout the hotel, but the best signal I could get in my room was 11mbps! Pretty bad. There is a small bar area with a small fridge, but no microwave. On the desk, there are two small plackards with pictures of food, that say "freshly prepared". I went down to breakfast this morning expecting to find some of this "freshly prepared" food, but am sad to say, I was a bit dissappointed. The breakfast buffet was a complimentary cold continental buffett, which included breads, cereals, fruits, pastries, yogurt, juice and coffee. The hot items had to be ordered via a touch screen not unlike those at a WAWA. This was not unpleasing to me, but the end product was! I ordered a ham & cheddar omlette with breakfast potatoes for $7.04. The omlette and potatoes were obviously "freshly prepared" via MICROWAVE! HORRIBLE!  I had a few bites of the omlette, tried one potato, and then it went into the garbage. How they have the nerve to say "freshly prepared" and charge $7.04 for microwaved food is beyond me! Don't order the food! Save your money. Enjoy the cold buffet items or walk over to the McDonalds! All in all, not the worst place I've ever stayed, but certain aspects need work.Compared to the other Hyatt Place in OKC, this one is far better.  The staff at this location is friendlier and less intrusive. Unfortunately, the internet still sucks but knowing that there isn't someone out there stalking me makes it all more the better to stay in this location.  Unlike the airport, there is not a lot to do (e.g bars and restaurants) within walking distance.  I would rather have to drive that than to feel like I need to stay in my room to avoid someone.

Stayed at this Country Inn & Suites when work required me to be in OKC early the following morning. The location on Northwest Expressway is close to shopping, a variety of well known chain restaurants & some local gems. My room faced the busy street, which did allow for quite a bit of noise from the street. During the heart of the night, the street does slow down significantly & wasn't all that bad. This hotel was very, but did show some signs of wear. The only staff I saw during my stay was the person working behind the checkin desk, but that staff member was very friendly & helpful each time I saw them. The beds were surprisingly comfortable & I slept very well.Our room was prepaid.  The price seemed very reasonable.  Upon entering our room, the chemical smell was overwhelming and musty.  We were sent to a handicapped room that was sparsely furnished, even though we are not handicapped.  I never like to complain, but this room triggered allergies.  I called the front desk to inquire about the smell.  Nicky came to our room and immediately noticed the odor.  She came bearing an air freshener.  I told her that we didn't want any other chemicals in our roomNicky upgraded us to a suite on a higher floor and the chemical smell is still overwhelming.  At least the room is a thousand times better and the odor is purely chemical and not musty.  I know now to never to buy a prepaid room.  The first room was TERRIBLE for just a few dollars less than the large suite.  Scam.The suite is quite nice, but the smell is giving me a headache and making me feel terrible.  Thanks to sweet Nicky, we have a nicer room, but that damned chemical smell is making me really sick.  I definitely do not recommend this hotel if you have allergies.Just looking did a clean room, comfortable bed, and hot shower for the night as I was traveling across the country for work. I was worried at first when I saw buckets in the lobby collecting water that was pouring from the ceiling. And the front desk clerk was efficient but not particularly friendly. But my room was very clean and quiet and after a long, hot shower I got a good night's sleep in a very comfy bed. My car that was packed full was safe in the well lit lot. And this morning as I went for the free breakfast, there were Contractors there working on the water/ceiling. The cleaning and kitchen staff were very pleasant. I would stay here again without hesitation.Stayed two nights with my husband and child, and we were pleased with the room. The room was nice, clean (as was the rest of the hotel), and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast buffet was just what we expected for the amount paid, but nothing special. The only thing we could complain about was that our room never saw housekeeping during our stay. We were gone most of the day, and upon return noticed that not even the garbage was taken out. The front desk staff was helpful and efficient, but not the friendliest. We had a nice, quiet stay, just what we wanted.It's clean. The staff was friendly. The breakfast was better then normal for a hotel. The hallway is small and odd. Located near shopping, like petco, home depot, best buy, and many chain restaurants. The drive way is a hard to spot.I started this review early in the week. Now it's Saturday. My original reservation was till Sunday. Saturday my card died. I got to the desk. He tells me I was to checkout today. He's already got my 2 rooms booked for tonight. Tell him this is wrong I know what I ordered. So he gets me 2 other rooms. Turns out they are singles. I need double for at least one room. In the end they are not big on compromise. I end up paying for 3 rooms do to them screwing up the reservations. With NO offer of compensation.This is my 2nd time staying in a Country Inn & Suites and I have to say that it was very pleasant as was my first time staying at one in Atlanta. This hotel has a great location in Northen Oklahoma City close to I44 & I40 and is situated on North West Expressway. There are lots of restaurants near by and there is Penn Square Mall right down the road as well so good for shopping. The service has been great with helpful front desk workers. The hotel is really clean has a clean gym, small pool and is really quiet. They have fresh baked cookies at the front desk all day and the breakfast is great. Eggs, bacon, french toast, waffles, yogurt, fresh fruit, bagels, toast, cereal and is cooked fresh and is great, not just because it is free with your stay but it tastes good. Did I meantion free wifi as well.So if you want to stay in a great hotel try this one...old school charm and feel and it isnt very expensive either. I have been here for 3 days and I didnt spend too much money.My fiance and I booked this hotel the night before an early-morning convention right down the street. We saw the pictures on Expedia and noticed that for $20 more (total of $102 with tax instead of $80 with tax) we could get a room with a big free-standing jacuzzi tub in the corner. Heck yes! So we sprung for that room, called and reserved it the night before, and were all excited to have a relaxing night after a hectic week. Well we get to the hotel around 9pm, get checked in, and lo and behold the jacuzzi tub is a shower/tub combo in the bathroom rather than a free-standing jacuzzi tub in the corner of the room. We are sure we were given the wrong room (because other, cheaper rooms had advertised a shower/jacuzzi tub combo.) We called the front desk to tell them and all the guy would tell us was that the picture we had seen was not their property. We kept telling him that the photos and title of the hotel that we had seen on Expedia certainly had been advertised as the same place. He just kept arguing that it wasn't their fault and that it wasn't the right property. So we asked him if there was anything he could do to 'help us out' since we had not gotten the room/location that had been advertised. He just kept telling us the same unhelpful things. We finally convinced him to give us the time of day if we went down and showed him the website we had seen. He agreed. We found the website [crossing our fingers that we somehow weren't the ones mistaken]...sure enough, hotel name and exact picture of the room we had expected....went down and showed him, and immediately he said "Yeah, that's not our property." Yes! We know that now!! But regardless we were misled and falsely advertised to. We paid extra money to get the room pictured under that hotel name. It might not be their fault but it certainly wasn't ours either. We kept trying to tell him that and he just kept saying that it wasn't their fault. He said something about "they" aren't allowed to rent out that property so they are slow to fix errors in the listings. Whatever that meant. FINALLY he offered to give us the room for $70 + tax, which we agreed to and thanked him for graciously. About 3 other customers had been lined up at the desk waiting on him while he argued with us over this. As we left I heard him say loudly to the next customer, "It was miserably slow here for a while...but there's always something..." I felt it was rude to talk to the other customers as if we had been guests from hell, when all we were trying to do was work out a compromise. I went out to the car to get some things and when I came back in I told him "Have a good night and sorry for the trouble. Thank you for working with us." To which he responded, "Well, it's not our fault. " GAHHH!!!!! The man is actually really nice but he needs to learn how and when to back down! I told him "Yes, we know that, but I hope it gets taken care of soon so no one else runs into this problem." To which he goes on another spiel about how they have no rights to rent the property and blah blah blah. I still don't understand what he even meant by all that but I guess it has to do with Expedia's advertisement contract with them. Anyways he kept chatting it up for about 5 minutes, possibly trying to make amends so I wouldn't write a nasty review like this one. Well after all that we had a pleasant evening/night. The jacuzzi tub, while not as romantic and special as a free-standing one would have been in the room, was still relaxing and nice. Although I did spend probably 10 minutes trying to wash out some crap in the bottom of the tub that looked like black pepper. The king bed was comfortable, they had a nice TV and a concealed mini fridge. Everything was quite modern and in good condition. Our view was pretty cool of Oklahoma City. In the morning they had a variety breakfast of waffles, omelets, sausage, and potato patties, and fresh fruit salad along with the usual cereals, breads, and yogurts. Unfortunately we don't eat pork so the omelets and sausages were out. The waffles were typical hotel waffles...just ok. The potato patties were dreadfully dry. And I stopped eating my fruit salad when I found two short black hairs in it, most likely from the woman overseeing the breakfast nook (because I'm blonde so there's no way it was mine). However this is more selection than I've seen most other places so for that I give it a pretty good rating. If you make your own waffle and eat pre-packaged food you'll be safe. Overall I guess we could go back to the hotel again since we know now what we're getting, but honestly I've had better experiences for cheaper and less hassle.Sooo irritated!  Everything was great until I decided to take a hot bath to hopefully relieve back pain & wind down for the night.  10 pm & instead of a nice smooth tub to sit in they have one of those nasty bath mats with the suction cups on the bottom which I HATE.  Pull it up, you say.  Tried that but wasn't going to sit in the nasty gunk that would have been left behind.  So I get in with the mat & start waiting for the hot water.  I LITERALLY wait 10 min before engaging the drain stopper, thinking its making its trip from hot water heater to the 7th floor.  Oh, no, that IS the hot water.  Lukewarm at best!  To me, the water is not hot until I can't hold my hand under the water for more than a second.  That never got close to happening.  Either their hot water heaters can't keep up or more lileky, they have the temp set WAY too low.  I'm an adult & I want a clean smooth tub & HOT water.  If you, CI & S, want to cater to kids, that's fine, cause I won't EVER be back again! (Worst part:  I have to do it again before surgery tomorrow morning.  Was hoping to be zen but pretty sure I'll just be pissed!). Grrr!To me there are few differences between most Country Inn and Suites, Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn Express, Comfort Inn, and Best Western type hotels. For around $90-110 per night, what I expect to see in hotels like these are fairly roomy rooms, comfortable beds, clean, fairly modern decor, decent pool, breakfast options and a parking lot that I feel good about leaving my car in.This hotel meets all of those requirements and is located in a part of the city that is near a hospital, several restaurant options, shopping and freeway access.The main issue we had was the jets in our jacuzzi tub kept turning off and on when trying to use the tub. My wife and I liked this hotel and would consider staying here in future trips in Oklahoma City. There is a Country Inn and Suites located off the turnpike not far from where this one is located. But as far as things surrounding the locations, this one on the expressway probably offers more.This place was one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at. Nothing in the room worked-including our keys. We had to go down to the front desk at least twice because they kept giving us faulty keys. We even kept them away from our phones and they still would not work. The iron was broken, there weren't enough outlets, and they put us in the room next to the generator that was loud and made it extremely difficult to sleep, even though we had booked our room far in advance. When we asked the front desk what they could do about this, they offered us the room directly next door to our room. How is that going to help the noise? They made no other offer to help. It was our first time in OKC and will probably be the last. When we first walked into the hotel the person working at the front desk was reading something and didn't even acknowledge us until we said something. We asked the people working at the front desk for advice on how to get around and they suggested taxi's instead of renting a car. Taxi's? Have you been to OKC? The place is huge. After wasting a ton of money on taxi's the first 2 days we finally asked someone not affiliated with the hotel who actually gave us helpful advice. The front desk woman also told us the boat ride at Brick Town cost 10 cents. More like $9.00. None of the information they gave us was helpful in the least. They get 1 star for a decent complimentary breakfast, although old eggs are gross and disgusting. Skip this establishment and try the Marriott right next door. It may be pricier but probably well worth it.Front desk help unfriendly and not helpful. Would not honor OKC Marathon agreement for late checkout. Told me it depends on how many guests who check in AFTER me, who request a late check out. Refused to extend our check out by even 30 minutes since it was "against the rules." Not guest oriented. Rude staff member. Shameful. Do not believe he reflects corporate customer service goal.Great experience!  Our room was on the second floor.  It was clean, nicely furnished, and comfortable. We got a really great deal on the room, and for the location and price, you aren't going to be able to beat it!!  Most of the times, they have huge discounts if you book far in advance, so check your sources!Our only minor complaint was that the front desk people were a bit weird;however, we only had to talk to them to check in/out, thank goodness!!!We would stay here again anytime if the prices stay low.I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and it is located close to I-44 NW Expressway which is a couple minutes away from Penn Square Mall and Nichols Hills. I couldn't find a hotel in the area for a descent price and most of the hotels in downtown were full because of the NBA Finals. I rated this hotel on 3 criterias: Location, Service and Rooms.Location 2 / 5: Let's put it that way, you're stuck in your hotel if you don't have a car. There isn't any sidewalk and it is dangerous even to cross the street. So make sure to rent a car first of all if you plan to stay couple days in OKC. The hotel is located close to Penn Square Mall which is the most happening place in OKC for doing shoppings. Beside that, you have a nice steak house 10 minutes away 5-6 miles from the restaurant.Service 3 / 5: You get what you pay for and so I couldn't expect a lot about this hotel but they were nice and they accomodated me for the check-out time. But then again, don't expect full treatments cause it ain't gonna happen.Room 2 / 5: It's a country Inn so let's be real, there's most definitely better hotels than this even in OKC. It seemed that the carpet of the room was dirty but the bed was really comfortable. Beside that, it has everything that a room needs to have. Breakfast is really service minimum with couple toasts, bagels and crackers... Don't count on the breakfast to have a full meal. They didn't have eggs as well. The good thing should I say is the free parking. Definitely a plus.I wouldn't come back to this hotel unless I am in the obligation to go because other hotels are fully booked. I guess it is maybe similar to a Holiday Inn in the quality even I haven't been to a Holiday Inn for 15-18 years now. It all depends what's the budget you want to spend for your holiday.Stayed here one night.  The staff were all very courteous and friendly.  The room was comfortable and they have great amenities.  A 24 hour fitness room, buffet breakfast,  a pool, laundry area and business center.  They have free wireless too.  The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. I booked the room through hotwire dot com so I got a great price.  There are many  nice restaurants in the area.  A Hooters within walking distance, a Starbucks up the street (I'm not a coffee drinker but I know that's important for a lot of people).   Easy access to highways.  I would stay here again.

hotel_name: La Quinta Inn & Suites OKC North - Quail Springs
review_content: Staff was nice & the entry/breakfast area looks impressive, but the rooms are pretty dated. Love the dog friendly aspect but the carpets had a lot of visible stains & there wasn't a lot of available areas to walk your dogs. I know the room was cleaned & refreshed during our 3 night stay, but the staining on the carpet just made you feel dirty. I've stayed at a newly remodeled La Quinta in Midwest City that was much more aesthetically pleasing & didn't leave me feeling icky. The faucet had a burnt hair/salon smell when we used the hot water. Great location to the turnpike & dining.This place has degraded.Recent ice storms causing  Power outages forced us to find shelter. They price gouged us for 144.00... Usually 75 bucks. Tv only plays the porn channels. what used to be a nice place is now deemed a " shithole"Beware! Bedbugs!My husband and I stayed and woke up riddled with bed-bug bites. We contacted the hotel and got a very lackluster and non-committal response, so also contacted the Oklahoma Board of Health. Luckily it doesn't seem like any of the bugs came home with us, but a terrible and gross experience, none-the-less.Nice hotel. Clean room. Helpful staff. I was a little worried at checkin because there was a woman holding a newborn behind the desk. Yep that was the front desk clerk. I think she was expecting another too. Apparently this was a distraction for her because the first room she gave me was dirty and had not had housekeeping after the previous guest. 5 minutes later I was in a new room and it was very clean. She was very nice and apologetic. The staff the next day was very nice too. You just don't expect to see a baby as part of the checkin process. Ha!The room was a king size and a weird floor plan. There were 3 closets. I didn't use any of them. Breakfast was ok. A sign said no eggs due to a recall so I'm guessing they make packaged egg product instead of real eggs. Still there were plenty choices and I was happy. There were also sodas and waters next to the front desk in a glass frig in the hallway. They called it the market but it was really a frig against the wall. Nice enough and it was there. I took a sneaky photo of my checkin team. It was fine just caught me off guard. I'm guessing her sitter was late and made it happen. I checked In at 11pm on the nose do I guess it was the start of her shift or the end perhaps. Anyway, sorry to drift off on that minor issue. Great hotel and a great value. Convenient location too.Never again run for the hills. Disgusting.Comfortable and clean but not up to par to give you that "at home" feeling. Internet is absolutely horrible. Off and on and off and on all day. Finally decided to call the desk and they said "I'll reset it". Came back on and then off and then on and off and on and so on and so forth. Normally not a big deal at all but if I'm spending $100 + a night to get that "at home" level of comfort than I expect that everything should be up and running as such.This place is terrible. I was forced to stay here due to availability. The room was not cleaned very well. I was also treated to a midnight surprise as a pipe burst on my floor and I did not get any sleep. I was not given much of an apology. There are a lot of other options in the area. I suggest using almost anyone else for your stay.Wow. This is the BEST La Quinta I've ever stayed in!They remodeled the rooms - very modern.New carpeting all over.Breakfast area is busy, for a reason! lol They have a hot breakfast: sausage, biscuits, gravy. Healthier options - boiled eggs, yogurt, oatmeal, etc. BIG coffee cups with lids. But... We're from Vegas and there is a Rudy's down the street. So I'm just enjoying the room!I stayed here one night on the way from Nebraska to California.  The staff was helpful and responsive when I couldn't get my TV to work. I was able to get a ground floor room which was helpful as I had my older dog who has trouble with stairs.  The rooms were clean and pleasant.  I would recommend staying here.Stayed two nights at the La Quinta Inn in Oklahoma City. The hotel is a nice mid range budget hotel perfect for business travelers with plenty of restaurants within walking distance. They also offer some themed "fantasy" suites that include a hot tub in the room. The names kind of remind me of the Madonna Inn and San Luis Obispo. Upon my arrival and walking in the place was nice. The decor here is a bit pretentious for my taste reminding me of something I would see in an old upscale manor in New Orleans. I checked in and had no problems with reservations. The room I got was clean and a good size. It had two queen beds along with a desk, microwave, and small frig. The toilet, sink, and shower were all in the same room. Again everything was clean and nice in the room. They do have a decent size TV here along with probably about 40 stations including HBO. For business purposes, they also offer free WiFi which was great for checking in on emails. Breakfast here is quite a treat. They not only offer your standard Continental with all the donuts, muffins, bagels, toast, and apples and oranges for breakfast, they also have scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits and gravy, and a waffle maker. You can make yourself a nice little breakfast here. The cost was about $109 a night. Not too bad and the staff here was friendly. Overall, very good hotel experience and would consider staying here again on my next visit to Oklahoma City. Overall 3 star rating.Bad experience. Lobby ok but the room are shabby. Phone not plugged and Internet doesn't work. I mean doesn't work at all.We were on a road trip from TN to CA, then north up to Canada. I made an online reservation at the Biltmore but left after a few hours because it was so disgusting. I looked around for another dog friendly hotel and chose this one. We were very happily surprised that for $20 more we went from a 1 star hotel to what felt like a 4 star. It was definitely worth the 10 min drive north from I-40. Very pet friendly and lots of amenities close by.Thank God for La Quinta's in general because my partner and I are driving cross-country from LA to Boston. We did this trip in the opposite direction 2.5 years ago but we did not have our dog then.It can be a challenge to find lodging for us with our dog because he's a 60-pound pit bull. As far as I know, all La Quintas are sans breed and size restrictions, which is really, really helpful for us. So, no matter what this place has going for it or doesn't,  I'm just so appreciative that it allows dogs.I pretty much only have pros about this place. The room was pretty big, it was clean, had the basic accommodations and more. Hotels these days barely give you a mini bottle of shampoo, let alone anything else, like coffee. This place had coffee in the room, which was really helpful as we were so sleep-deprived.  The room also had basic but worked well microwave and refrigerator. Since we're traveling across the U.S. we do have some food we're bringing with us in the car and hoping to refrigerate it in the rooms we're staying in each night, so this was really helpful. Breakfast was included and it was actually pretty good (i.e. eggs and sausage). Customer service was good. I really appreciated that since we had a dog, we were on the first floor and right near a side entrance. It includes Wi-Fi, which was really important for us, although most places do that these days. The lobby area was nice and clean.The cons: The area around this location wasn't great for walking our dog. I mean, technically, it was a quiet area with sidewalks, so I shouldn't complain, but we did the majority or our walking in an office park. It would've been nice to be in a more attractive area to walk but at least it was safe (not a lot of cars) and quiet.All in all, this was a great place to stay. Definitely the best La Quinta we stayed in along the way. In fact, better than the other hotel chains we stayed in, too. I highly recommend it.It's so funny how one hotel chain can have such different properties. Literally one night after staying at the shockingly beautiful and modern (while very inexpensive!) La Quinta in Memphis (Primacy Pkwy), I arrived at this spot. And true to form, it met my expectations - I just wished I'd stayed at this one first so that I could go out on a "wow" note.Bottom line: nothing great, nothing bad. The lobby actually leads you to believe the rooms will be nicer than they are - just kinda old school, floral bedding and the such. But it's clean and will allow you to comfortably rest your head, which is what really matters in this class of hotels.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Oklahoma City-Arpt-Meridian Av
review_content: Stayed one night and was very impressed from start to finish. Pleasant check in with front desk staffer Dakota. Hubby said best bed he has slept on in a long time. Room clean and quiet. Breakfast was really good. Loved the egg omelette with cheese. Only wish they would vacuum lobby after breakfast time was over....definitely will stay again when in Oklahoma.The bed was good and the room was decent/average size.  The property appears clean and not dated and the staff was pleasant.The walls are paper thin!  I could hear the guy above me walk across the floor, urinate, flush, and walk back.  I could hear the elevator ding and the cables of the elevator stretch.  If anyone spoke anywhere nearby, I could hear that too as well as loud television sets.  If you are staying for the FAA, your classes probably start at 7AM.  Well, breakfast at the hotel is not until 6:30AM, so you miss it.  I hung out with two other classmates and saw their rooms.  They paid less and one was a much better room, the other similar.  Mine was easily the most expensive.  Shop around, you can do better.I'm perplexed by the bad reviews of this place.  The front desk staff (last night's and this morning's) were awesome.  Room was clean and roomy.  We walked to shop at Shepler's (sp?) and then to dinner.  Cleaning ladies were super sweet.  We didn't have breakfast, but the coffee was yum.  Just an all-around pleasant stay!This place is horrible.  Upon check in I was informed that I was getting a smoking room.  I said absolutely not, I did not book a smoking room.  I was then forced into an accessible room...which I hate and reeked of fragrance covering a smokey smell.  Really enjoyed my wake up call that I did not request.  In a handicap accessible room it is kind of like a warning for a bombing run from WWII. I called the front desk to let them know that I did not request a wake up call and the girl actually said "yeah, that happens."  Really? That happens... Your a hotel...people come here to sleep...FIX IT. All and all some of the worst customer service I have seen in a while, smelly and musty rooms, and just not a place people should stay at.  Hyatt Place down the road is MUCH nicer, better staff and pleasant stays.  I would of stayed there but it was full.Do not stay here! Room Service steals!!First this hotel is old and lots of stuff is broken in the room and at vending. The soda machine took a dollar (which the front desk replaced after I had to fill out paperwork) Then on the second day I returned to my room to find that someone (room service) had stolen my pain medicine!  When I reported it to the manager she was very rude and told me in a threatening tone that if I wanted to do something then call the police. I did have to call the police and report the medicine stolen and now I have to take time off work to go get it refilled. Thanks for violating my confidence in room service and I will let as many people know as possible.This place is great! The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean.Breakfast is also very good.I would definitely stay here again. It's a great price for a great hotel.Worst Holiday Inn I have ever stayed in. The staff obviously does not care about the customer. It started when we got to the hotel. The front desk clerk was not friendly at all. Then, we get to our room and what do you know, someone is already in there. Of course, it wasn't the fault of the staff. They actually blame the person in the room. Who gave them the key then? Another annoyance was when our keys were shut off and we could not get into our room. The clerk seemed irritated at me because the keys didn't work. Update: The clerk that was working when we checked out was the only friendly person I encountered at this hotel.Nice hotel and friendly staff.    One negative, no pool or hot tub.    The rooms are large and lean.     I have stayed here a few times and they have a better than average breakfast and the staff is very friendly.I had no intention of reviewing either this or the Holiday Inn I stayed at in Santa Fe, NM because I figured they were all of the same quality. Both this and the Santa Fe locations were excellent hotels. It's good to see that the chain has done a lot to make their reputation a good one with upgrading their facilities and the customer service they provide, or so I thought.But after staying at the Holiday Inn Express in Springfield, MO, I had to express my appreciation and throw props their way for their hospitality and professionalism with respect to making one feel important and comfortable when they lodge.They have a mini fridge and micro wave in every room and complimentary breakfast. Real breakfast, not continental! Always a complimentary bottle of water upon request. The manager even came to the dining area and said good morning.If I'm ever in Santa Fe or OKC again, you can bet I'm staying at Holiday Inn! It's the best value for the price!The room was very nice, clean, and had a comfy bed. The front desk was incredibly helpful and very friendly as well. Your stay comes with a hot breakfast and there is a small fitness room upstairs. If you are in the area for business, it is a nice place to stay with easy interstate access, free Internet, many restaurants nearby, and just down the road from the airport.Stayed here on business. Seemed to be a very new hotel. I had previously sated at the Holiday Inn down the road on meridian. Have to say i like this one a lot more. A definite for the business traveler, but for families i would recommend the Holiday Inn on meridian.

I travel every week for work and I'm a 'platinum' member with Marriott, so I've stayed at my fair share of Marriott locations. For the last 7 months I have been flying to Oklahoma, and this has become my staple hotel.There is nothing 'fancy' about this place, but it is a clean, affordable, and welcoming place to stay. The staff is *always* available. Any time I call their number I get right through to the front desk (versus being sent to some call center). There have been numerous occasions where I've gone downstairs at 3am; there is always someone *right there* at the counter.The rooms are always consistently clean and functional. The breakfast is free, and not too shabby; the usual eggs, sausage, waffles and cereal. They even have fruit and granola bars out that you can take on the go (useful for my fellow road warriors out there). The hotel is also surrounded by a plethora of restaurants, so there is always something yummy nearby.If you're looking for a reliable, clean, and affordable hotel near Oklahoma City, look no further. This is the place.Great bed, service, plenty of parking and clean. Lots of shops nearby, places to eat, a Starbucks and next to the airport. I knocked off a star because I'm an elite member and they put me next to the stairs (kind of loud) and the breakfast - would be nice to have better eggs, real fruit and bacon - but that's if I had to criticize something! Otherwise, solid stay.Hotel is nice and I enjoyed my upgraded room... but be aware of a really bad situation that happened - I've already posted this on my Facebook account and different travel group sites: ***ALERT***This just happened to me this morning at my Marriott stay here in Oklahoma.  Someone hacked into the phone lines claiming to be the front desk asking for personal check-in information including the credit card used for check-in. He was a very professional sounding smooth talking man.  Thinking about it now it totally sounds like a scam - but how he was talking and sounding (and since I was still partially asleep) - for some reason it really sounded legit. He got me to give him my name and address on file.  Thankfully when he asked for my credit card information I finally woke up more to the situation and said I would get dressed and come downstairs and was not willing to give that information over the phone.  He was still very professional and made me feel like it would be ok if I just gave it to him. When I went downstairs - I found out I was the 3 person that had reported this situation to the front desk.  Unfortunately the other two DID give their info and were filing a police report and calling their credit card companies to alert them. Be careful out there road warriors!!!First impression, the front desk service was outstanding - friendly and helpful. The room was clean and we'll maintained.  You could hear people in the hall when the air wasn't running, but that didn't bother us very much. The hot breakfast was delicious. Everyone in my family has different tastes and they have something for everyone!  The pool is small, but fun. All in all, we would stay here again!Not bad, but nothing special.It was nice, it was clean, the staff were good.  Only complaint I had was the breakfast "sausage" had a rather unpleasant affect on me.  The place is convenient to several eateries, Sonic, Taco Smell and a Golden Corral and close to grocery shopping.  They also weren't particularly harsh with the pool hours and we appreciated that with 20 soccer players and all associated family / siblings.Just Enjoyed a wonderful catered event for the teleflora school evening out. The staff was so nice. The food amazing!!!  I would recommend this hotel for any intimate event.Extremely friendly and welcoming staff. Clean beyond ypur imagination. Great attention to detail. Rooms are very quiet and extremely comfortable!  Location is in the heart of restaurants and shopping!Hotel is newer, and a bargain ($99/nght)....but breakfast buffet is gross and one of my 3 "white" towels was yellowed. House staff completely uncaring and of no help. I came in and tried to sign into the internet for a business meeting. I was presented a choice of "free internet" or "high-speed" access for $5. I chose free only to find I couldnt sign in to my company's VPN...I mean 1990's slow. Now wont let me get back to the page that allows me to choose "high-speed". I called front desk and was told to call their internet provider myself. After waiting on hold 40 minutes and another 30 minutes with the internet tech....I had to give up and go down the road to Starbucks. I called the front desk and was told "Youre the only person in the hotel with this problem", No...Im sorry, no...let me move you to a new room...just a rude reply. I will visit my OKC office 6 times this year and hoped I found a new place to stay....NO WAY! This Marriott/Fairfield's unscrupulous manner of forcing guests to buy internet service ...and then when it doesnt work to do nothing to fix.....unacceptable....BUSINESS TRAVELERS-----STAY AWAY!I stay at lots of Fairfields and other Marriotts, and this one is a little subpar.  Customer service is very casual and slow to help.  The room was okay, but towels looked a little suspicious (not folded right), tub had a few hairs, and the iron was just tossed into the closet.  While not deal-killers, some of these things say something about the culture and the staff.  Also, the first room they gave me had a horrible stench in it.  To change rooms to a King, they wanted to up charge me since by original room type was not available.  I don't want to do that, so I ended up on a smaller, cheaper room (with no refund of the original rate, of course).  Bed was fine, pillows a bit overstuffed and firm, and breakfast was ok if you like meat and eggs.  Only packet oatmeal available.  There are better choices in the area.Great location for where I needed/wanted to be but not very sound-proof which is my biggest complaint.  Could clearly hear guests in the hall and people above.  Rooms themselves are pretty clean but overall a little dingy from use -  the room I had could use a paint job.  Only decaf coffee was left by housekeeping (but they do offer better stuff in the breakfast area) and bathroom amenities seem lacking (although I think all hotels have cut back on that to save money). Bed & pillows very comfortable.  Breakfast buffet was impressive.  Totally smoke free and they had a nice patio.   Overall decent, but I'm not sure if I'd stay here again only because of the noise.

We checked in late at night and the front desk girl was amazing. She even ran out to help me as I shuffled my kids and our luggage inside in some strong winds. Our room was immaculate and the beds were insanely comfortable! The breakfast in the morning was free and perfect. Eggs, waffles, fresh fruit, cereal, breads....and COFFEE. And the morning staff was extremely friendly and quite chipper at 7am! We stayed here with our two younger kids and would definitely stay here again.Very nice hotel, especially for the price.  We decided to skip our original choice of lodgings and try Springhill instead due to the price of the room and I'm very glad we did.  They are currently renovating, but the construction was not an inconvenience to us at all.  The workers were quiet and polite, as were the hotel staff.  The power did go off a couple of times, but only briefly.  The lobby, our room, and the breakfast area were immaculately clean.  My only concern is that the (very attractive) sliding doors in the bathroom are quite heavy and have tiny little handles that would be impossible for anyone with arthritis (or hand lotion) to get a grip on without accidentally flipping the lock.  We were in one of the handicap accessible rooms and it seems an oversight to me.  I know several small, older ladies who could have been trapped in there.I have stayed at several Springhill Suites properties but it is my first time at this location. Upon my arrival, no one was at the front desk. I knocked and called out but no one was there! I surmise that there might be only one person working and he/she must take care of personal business in the restroom. After 7-8 minutes of waiting the front desk person showed up and apologized to me for the wait because he had to help a guest. He was friendly and courteous. He check me in very quickly.The room was spacious enough with usual amenities. The bed was clean and firm. Aside from a little wait, there wasn't anything for me to complain about. Wifi is free and parking is free.Just a note that there are several fast food joints within walking distance. But if you want a restaurant, you have to make a short drive.This is the second time my youth group has stayed here on a mission trip! The staff is absolutely amazing, along with the hotel accommodations. There is plenty of space to gather, and the rooms are soooo nice! We stayed there for 6 days, and hated leaving. The staff is very cooperative. They have free breakfast, which is pretty good. The maid service is great giving us fresh towels every day since we were so dirty from manual labor. Definitely stay here is you are in Moore or OKC, love this place. (Did I mention there is a Braums across the street?!?!)I think this is a nice moderate hotel. It was really clean, and smelled fresh.  Everyone was very friendly.  The only thing was a huge crack in the sink in room 300.  It would just be better to replace it rather than trying to do a cheap repair, and no one was at the desk for check out.  Other than that it was good.I love this hotel. This staff is always polite and the rooms are always clean. I like this style of room. It great for business travelers and families because of the size of the rooms. The only downside is the pool. They should have put in a hot tub.Stayed here in order to take our kids to Frontier City. Nice hotel! Clean rooms. Family friendly. The staff was incredibly nice and helpful! The neighborhood looked a little rough around the edges but we felt very safe at the hotel! Lots of good places to eat nearby which was nice. Pool was a little small but overall was very happy with our stay!We stayed here twice, one week apart, and have decided this is one of our favorite hotels. The room is big enough for five (two adults, two teen boys, and a girl) and all of the beds were comfortable. The room was clean and quiet, towels were clean and fluffy. We didn't have a chance to swim but the pool is on the large end for comparable hotels. The fitness room is next to the pool so you can watch the kids while they swim. The front desk staff was friendly. Breakfast was good - standard offerings. On the first stay we had biscuits and gravy plus eggs. Today it was bacon and eggs. Also available: waffles, fruit, three kinds of cereal, bagels, muffins, and toast. Only cons: the tv is small and oddly placed, and on both visits we only had four towels, despite listing five guests on our reservation. Overall, great experience; everyone was happy (not always easy) with this hotel and we will stay again.My Sister and her husband were recently in a bad motorcycle accident.  To add insult to injury, a pipe burst in their home the day they were released from the hospital.  This is where Springhill Suites in Moore comes in.Since they were unable to stay at home, I got them a room at the Springhill Suites in Moore.  I explained the situation and Marriott even gave me a discounted rate.  My Sister tells me the hotel is very nice and the service is great.  I've been using Marriott for business travel for years, and wherever I go they are consistently better than any other chain I've tried.  Their help in accommodating my family gets them a big thumbs up.We had the worst stay here when we came out in July last year! The staff were so rude to us! We were on a road trip cross country and had our dog with us. We dropped off the dog at my husband's brother's home in Moore before staying at this hotel. But during our stay, the housekeeper yelled at me because she had seen one of the dog's food bowl with our luggage and made an assumption we had brought the dog in the room. Then we got calls from the staff wanting to come do immediate inspections while my 3 year old daughter was napping. I told them to also check the video cameras throughout the hotel to believe us but apparently they didn't want to go through the trouble.We also left my laptop charger there and called several times to see if they would scan the room for us and call us back. They never called us back no matter how many times we called them. I think it's because they never believed us about the dog and felt like they had the right to totally disregard our request.No complaints whatsoever.  Staff was very friendly and the military discount was great especially considering I was just passing through.  Breakfast was good too.  If I ever find myself needing a place to stay in Moore, Oklahoma again, I know where to stop.Hotel is located right off of I-35 in Moore, OK.  Contemporary design and colors are evident within the entire hotel and room.  The rooms are large and can accommodate up to five guests since the rooms come with a seperate living room area that contains a sleeper sofa.  The shower is also seperate from the toilet which is extremely convenient if there are three or more guests in each room.  For those of you on a fast-food budget, there are four fast food restaurants (Taco Bell, KFC, A&W, and Long John Silvers) within walking distance of this hotel.  I also enjoyed the free continental breakfast because they had many hot food selections including, bacon, sausage, and eggs.  They also provided free cookies for a late afternoon snack and 24-hr free coffee and ice water in their lobby.  Currently the entrance to the hotel is undergoing road construction, but I would definitely return to this Springhill Suites hotel even during their triple digit temperatures in the heat of the summer.

The customer service was great, the room is very clean. I would go back again.Rooms are small and old style.  Desk squeezed into corner with back to TV. Shower had last residents bandage on rail.  Toilet overflowed in first flush.  Needs Maintenace and attention to detail when cleaning.  Would probably choose alternative hotel on return visit.  Smokers chased from front door. GOOD.   Smokers sent to pool. DISGUSTING.  So now no children or non smokers can use the pool.  Poor planning!!!!!This it a better Hampton I've stayed at. Staff: The staff is friendly and helpful. I didn't have any rude encounters but a coworker of mine did. Coffee: Horrible. So far every Hampton I've stayed at has had horrible coffee. The water for the tea was also luke warm at best. They need a timer system or something to change the coffee pots/water pot.Decor: The lobby is a little confused decor wise. There is a mix of old and modern that isn't quite working but it's clean and that's what counts most. The hallways are poorly lit. They have lights don't  misinterpret that but they have a yellowish glow to them, at least on the third floor they did. Room decor was like any other Hampton. I did have an awkwardly placed Jacuzzi tub though. It was literally right next to my bed. I can't comment on the tub because I never use tubs in hotels. I don't trust that they have been cleaned considerably between patrons. Fitness Center: Clean and the equipment is newer. I was surprised they had a stretching machine in there. I haven't seen one of those in a Hampton before. Door Key Card: This cold be better. I've stayed at Hamptons with the newer technology ( the ones where you don't have to insert the card you just press it against the receiver pad and it unlocks) but this hotel has the old fashioned - is it still considered old fashioned? - key locks where you insert the card and pull it out. I had trouble up and down and all around with this. I had to get two new cards and neither were working. It was ridiculous.Bed: Pillows and mattress were great. The comforter on the other hand was garbage. It was lumpy and not at all plushy and soft. It wasn't warm anymore and needed to be retired. I asked for a new one and they said they didn't have one they could supply me with. View: Considering this is right off an expressway don't expect a view? Noise isn't too bad though from the expressway. Usually I have a hard time sleeping with expressway noise but I didn't have a problem here.So, was a bit disappointed in my recent stay here in OKC. Location was nice with access to the mall, movies, Starbucks etc close by.  Got in and lady at front desk was busy reading a book and walked up and she was really engorged and did the thing were you are still reading and putting it down and walking toward a customer but not moving to fast and still reading. Yeah, a bit annoying. I am not asking you to just drop a phone call or stop typing if you are working, but, if you are reading or whatever, c'mon, put the book down as there is a customer waiting and acknowledge them.  She was pleasant enough, but did not acknowledge that I was a Gold Member(they are supposed to) did not offer me complimentary water/snack or points, and they had a bunch of cookies out and she gave me a look when I dared to take two.  She was working next morning as well when I left and did not say good-bye, thanks for staying etc, just reading her book...sigh.Am usually very positive about my Hilton visits, please see my next one for HGI in OKC which was super, but this was a miss.  Room fine, etc, but the initial service left allot to be desired.Not sure how this hotel is ranked #10 in OKC hotels on one particular site. There is no view from the room other than a parking lot in most of the rooms. The front desk is not all that friendly or accommodating but then again it is not exactly a Hilton location. The coffee is the worst I have had in a hotel of any kind. They keep it at the front and you would think it would at least taste good?!? I had do not disturb on the door and they were banging on my door at 10am trying to kick me out... Maybe if they did a few things such as duvets on the beds and better coffee it would make the stay better. Great location in NW OKC but a less than basic hotel.Clean and efficient. Very moderately priced and provides the essentials for a short stay. Nothing fancy, just a clean comfortable room and maybe the best free breakfast I have had in a place. Great for families.My first night at this hotel I noticed the AC wasn't quite cool enough.  I asked them the next morning to please check my AC because it wasn't cool.  I came back to a brand new unit, perfectly quiet and cold.That's service!The hallways could use some updating (think jade green carpet) but the rooms are fairly standard fair for Hampton Inns.  Plenty around the hotel as far as eating options go but not too much for fun things to do.  Front desk staff was extremely nice checking in and called to make sure everything was good in the room.Nice soft and hard pillows, good staff, not rude, clean rooms, quiet, and it's very clean..Recently renovated, and still doing some. Friendly staff and easy to find.Nice hotel, great price, very nice friendly staff, sports bar connected to it, clean rooms, awesome place to stay. Will definitely go back. Only thing is no continental breakfast...but that was ok, I wanted to explore the surrounding areas.My favorite place to stay when I come home.Rooms are clean, rates are good. Needs better toiletries but I love Hampton Inn and this one does not disappoint. Ashley the desk clerk was so very nice and helpful.The Hampton Inn is a reliable choice for overnight hotel stays.  This one is located in a business district and not too far of a drive to the Asian district.  The room contains two queen beds, fairly clean, and reasonably priced.  There are plenty of restaurants located nearby and a Target located less than a mile away.  The Hampton also provides a free continental breakfast which begins at 6:00am.  I am always satisfied whenever I stay at the Hampton Inn.

hotel_name: Best Western Plus Broadway Inn & Suites
review_content: Front desk service was great! It's a bit hard to find, but the hotel once you get here doesn't disappoint. For the price you get a clean room with fridge and microwave, cable tv, and good water pressure. Breakfast was good, nothing to write home about, the staff at breakfast is another story, they were rude and dismissive when my husband went to ask for a high chair for our baby. The lady waved him off and said, "yeah yeah I'll get it"...seriously lady? I'm sorry did we interrupt your busy day of SERVING CUSTOMERS?!Really clean room and bathroom. You can tell the staff takes a lot of pride in their cleanliness. The breakfast was good. I really enjoyed my stay. The bed was very comfy. My only concern is that my smoke detector was covered with a plastic bag (maybe the people who were in there before covered it to smoke) .. That weirded me out. But overall I had a good stay for a good price on Priceline. Would stay again.It was okay. The whole experience was decent, nothing particularly great but it wasn't bad. Rooms were alright, comfortable enough.. Breakfast was fine, about as good as you can expect from a 2 star. It was affordable and pet friendly, but probably wont be my first choice next time I'm in town.We got such cheap price for a Saturday night. Room was nice and clean and receptionist was friendly. We had cocktails in the agency bar, at the hotel. Being a mad men fan i loved the bar, as it had mad men quotes all over the walls. We got chatting to a blonde bar lady all night there. She was lovely and made us good strong drinks all night. Breakfast wasn't wow.. But it never is at these 'free' breakfast buffets, but there's always fruit you can grab or some cereal :)Rooms were decent but staff needs help on customer service- basketball teams/ groups  aren't well accommodated.Breakfast nazis is also a problem- with waiting every morning for a breakfast tkt- suggestion:  give a code at check in to use or something (waiting behind people checking out is ridiculous just to get breakfast!)We were almost scared off by the poor reviews but after checking out the exterior and the lobby and finding it well maintained and festive, we decided to stay. (See pictures ) At the AARP discounted price of $68. We got a wonderful room with a free upgrade that included free wifi and a free hot breakfast. The breakfast included fluffy scrambled eggs, sausage, do it yourself Belgian waffles and a lot more. Even the apples were sweet, fresh and crunchy.   Glad we stayed.Hotel should be better rated... service good, room nice and clean, FREE breakfast better than many.  Call hotel direct and get best rate.  I stay at a lot of mid level (cheaper) places and I would come back here.  On the North Central Side but still easy for all access.Room key stopped working after one use. Our dogs were inside the room and barking and we couldn't get to them to calm them. After front desk clerk sent me back three different times to re-try with new keys, she finally sent a maintenance person. 45 minutes later, he finagled the lock with a coat hanger looking thing. I felt awful for annoying the other guests because the dogs were barking like crazy. We bought frozen dinners from the lobby for the kids as they were starving after being in the road all day. Worst 18.00 I've ever spent! The microwave dinners were thawed out by the time we were finally able to get into our room. A sincere apology would have smoothed things over, but instead I felt like I was a bother to the staff.For the price the hotel was great. Rooms were nice, service was great and extremely helpful. Pool was perfect temperature, outdoor probably not heated. Breakfast was pretty good. Only thing the restaurant is not open on the weekends.If you are staying at this motel because you're having surgery make certain to book by phone and ask for the "Hospital Rate"; much cheaper than any online deals. Overall this was a good stay. The only reason I marked cleanliness low is because of the incredibly strong scent of cleaning product in our room. Everything was, however, very clean. The front desk service was excellent. I would stay again just because we were treated so well by the front desk clerk. This is a good stay for the cost, and surprisingly still had smoking rooms. I was really surprised by the bad reviews of this place; we had a pretty good experience.The quality of my room was that of a cheap motel. The pull out couch in the "suite" we stayed in legitimately looked like it was picked up off a curb somewhere. The material was ripping off the corners and the filth was visible. We arrived two hours before the in-hotel diner was supposed to close and the employees appeared to have turned the lights off in the dining area to discourage patrons from entering. We entered, looked around confused, and were not greeted by the bartender. They also do not have normal length pillows on the beds! They are the size of couch cushions. Lights are dim, paint on the walls has touch-ups all over the place. I mean I can care less what color my hotel walls are, but this speaks to the product this hotel believes is acceptable. All around an awful hotel, DO NOT STAY!Three key words: INFESTED WITH COCKROACHES!And no, I don't mean "we saw a cockroach;" rather, we captured and killed a multitude of roaches within a few minutes of seeing the first little one running down the edge of the tub in a well-lit bathroom. I then saw significantly larger one (both are displayed in the posted photo) on the rug next to the work area and another by the radiator, which marked the beginning of a extensive cockroach hunt/investigation, where we discovered more live roaches of varying sizes at the base of the walls, behind and in the sleeper sofa, two more next to the workstation (this one crawled down the wall no more than three feet from where I was sitting), one running up the wall directly next to the bed, and through out HVAC unit. Cockroaches began, literally, coming out of the window pane in droves after we caught and killed the larger ones in the HVAC unit, (it was directly beneath the window). Now this was just outrageous, as roaches are known spreaders of disease (the worker at Best Western denied this was "even that unhealthy" at all, and openly confessed, on recording, to the fact that he didn't consider our situation (re: the right to healthy and sanitary  living/sleeping conditions/a.k.a. THE ONLY THING A MOTEL OR HOTEL IS TRULY FOR!) was " even a serious matter" or "worth calling management for." In sum, while it was deeply obviously this warranted immediate and serious action, the staff were HORRID. In fact, only slightly worse than the quantity of roaches was the attitude and uselessness of the front desk staff. When roach #1 was spotted and killed, I called the front desk, only to be told (verbatim), "You don't even know what a roach looks like," and nothing further was done. I was irritated, but since both my partner and I have lived in New York City and have dealt with our share of cockroaches and assholes, we did not want to get into a massive altercation; we'd been in the car all day and had wanted nothing more than to eat some dinner and relax. That never happened at The Best Western. Instead, I was told by the first clerk that I was "wrong," but by 11pm, when the real roach show began, the second night clerk agreed to come to our room to "deal with the problem." He agreed that what we'd collected was indeed "a lot of roaches, all right," and even had the privilege of watching as I snapped photos of even more of the smaller ones running up the walls. Yes, you read that correctly. ROACHES RAN DOWN THE WALLS AS A WORKER @ BEST WESTERN STOOD IDLY IN OUR ROOM, ULTIMATELY SUGGESTING HE REFUND OUR MONEY IF AND ONLY IF WE AGREED TO LEAVE THE MOTEL IMMEDIATELY (seriously: my partner and I were/are FURIOUS and SHOCKED). In essence, The Best Western punished their customers, who had driven over 10 hours at day, at midnight, in a city we do not know by giving us a room infested with cockroaches, loads of attitude, the complete absence of customer care, and A THREAT TO CALL THE POLICE. In fact, an ARMED GUARD (with his hand on his GUN) watched as I checked out, as my partner put our belongings back into the car, and even as we pulled away.  Would you really want that "complimentary" hot breakfast buffet the next morning after all? Ugh. The atmosphere was not one that made us exceedingly hungry, to put it mildly. Ultimately, we checked in at the Motel 6 down the road (it was almost 1am by this point), where the night manager, which The Best Western claimed "not to have," gave us a King Suite for $56 (including taxes!) because he felt so bad for the hassle we had The Best Western. STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS PLACE! I'd honestly feel guilty withholding this information from potential customers: it truly is THAT bad. So so yourself a massive favor and take your precious time, money, and peace of mind to a better place. No one deserves this.the room stunk horrifically of smoke.  i could have asked to change rooms but i was only there a short time.  the other smell was too much cleaning chemicals.  the place seemed really depressing.  the continental breakfast was mostly hi-glycemic index foods and not very appealing.  staff were not very friendly.  given how much i paid i thought it would have been more decent, but was below average for a "budget motel."

I traveled from Central Florida heading to the Bay area in CA.  I stopped at this hotel and felt like I hit the jackpot.  I was able to freeze the cold packs completely as I continued my journey because it had a good size refrigerator/freezer. The bed was very comfortable after such a long drive. It was everything I hoped it would be.  The rooms were incredibly clean and spacious. The young man at the front desk was helpful and welcoming.  The breakfast the next day had everything I could want including fresh blueberries for the oatmeal.  I would make it a point to stay here again if I am ever in the area. For this price point I think this hotel should be the model for all the others.Wouldn't let us check in because we only had a visa debit card on us. Apparently they require a credit card for a deposit. This is NOT posted anywhere, I have used visa debit for all my hotels in the past, it has never been a problem!It's almost 1:00am, we drove 10 hours, had a reservation, have two small children, and the entire area is booked for the night. We have no where to go.. Thanks ChrisThis is a great hotel for business travel or for those looking for a long term hotel stay. Rooms are arranged as apartments, where they have a kitchen, small living room and then bedroom. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast and dinners for their guests as well as many other amenities in communal areas which is nice if you're tired of being cooped up in a hotel room.If you get sick of the free food, there are also multiple chain restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. Front desk was friendly on check in and out and my brief stay was an all around positive one. The free beer in the lobby during my stay, was no longer available. That's not worth dropping a star but a bummer nonetheless to point out.Food: 4/5Service: 4/5Cleanliness: 4/5Decor & Style: 4/5I love the free dinners they give you. Not only that, but Shiner Bock is on tap and it is self serve! Can't beat that. Food is pretty good compared to most other extended stays and they change it every day. Food selection is large compared to others. The place is big, clean, and has a very homey feeling to it. Definitely recommend this place for an extended stay. I didn't give it a 5 star because it is very hard for me to rate any hotel 5 stars unless its $$$$!Zero stars.  Unbelievable.
