We just arrived after a 10 hour drive and the lobby is full of people because the front desk clerk apparently decided to leave for the day with no forewarning.  We have reservations but cant check in to our rooms.  The maintenance guy just spoke to someone "who will be in, in about 30 minutes".  There are people here who have been waiting 45 minutes.  What a clown show.  Never again.Our family love this hotel. The rooms are spacious and the food is delicious. If you need a night or a week this in the hotel for you.10x better than the last Hilton I was in!! This room is bigger than my last apartment and is great! Everything works the TV actually has reception I wish I would have stayed here the entire 2 weeks I was in OKC here.Stayed here on super bowl weekend for a "girls weekend."  The hotel was clean and spacious. The pool area was relaxing and fun. Loved that there were pool noodles and a large beachball available for all to use! Loved the blue ray disk players in all rooms and movies available at the front desk.   The two best things in my book were the staff and breakfast! Every interaction was friendly and helpful! From the parking attendants to front desk to cooks to the maids and even the maintenance guy. When we were having trouble with a whistling noise constantly going on Caleb came to help us out. When he could see it was a larger problem than he could help out with he and the front desk guy moved us to a larger room with no whistling!  My girlfriends and I don't drink coffee the front desk guy made sure there was plenty of hot water and hot chocolate at the complimentary beverage service . And finally breakfast was really good every morning. It had the usual staples in a hot breakfast service (make your own waffle, pastries, yogurt, cereal and eggs and breakfast meat.) what was so different with this service they changed up the eggs and other main meal items. One morning was your regular hash browns, scrambled eggs, and sausage with fresh blueberry muffins next day it was blintzes, steak and egg scramble, latkes  and Canadian bacon. YUM! Will definitely stay here again!Very nice and helpful staff. Clean and welcoming. Rooms are large and very nice. The bed is amazing!!! The complimentary breakfast was out of this world!Very nice and clean ! Helpful staff and the free Shiner on Tap  was nice . The food is just ok but it was nice to have the option if I didn't feel like going out . The location was far from Bricktown where I was working but I liked it better . It was near shopping and the Disney Store outlet ;) but not crowded like Bricktown . I like the ice they had in the hall it was like sonicBy Oklahoma standards, Homewood Suites may be considered expensive (depending on the person you ask); it is somewhat pricy when compared to other extended stay hotels. I know of places here in the city (and surrounding areas) where you can stay an entire week for $160-180. At Homewood, you're looking at approximately $100 just for one night. But I can't remember any extended stay hotel I have stayed at that had all of the added amenities and benefits that Homewood Suites offers. Sure, you're paying extra for the Hilton brand, but the place itself is definitely a step up from say, Extended Stay America (not to suggest that ESA is terrible or something). With the added expense comes a certain level of comfort that you won't really find at other extended stay hotels (especially the ones that aim for the bare minimum). The patrons are hit-or-miss though. Some are great. Some are normal. Some are... Well, for some, staying at the Homewood Suites is probably the highlight of their trashy lives. Some of the amenities/benefits include: breakfast and dinner (most nights), an exercise facility, swimming pool/jacuzzi, etc. The rooms are nicer than any apartment that I've had the pleasure of living in thus far in my short existence. That might not mean much though because I've lived in some hovels.One of my favorite hotels to stay at while in OKC. #1 - Comfy, Hilton-standard beds.#2 - Clean, spacious rooms. A/C works great. (It gets hot and humid here.)#3 - They feed me breakfast and dinner. (It's a not-so-safe area, especially for a single traveler like myself, why go out at night?)#4 - Near OKC airport and FAA MMC, about 10-15 minutes drive.#5 - Friendly front desk and cooking staff, even in the morning, even in the face of grumpy, insomniacs like me.Dinner (happy hour) meals are served 5 to 7PM, Monday to Thursday, and recently, were pretty decent, considering what they had to cook with. I liked the chicken tortellini alfredo with buttered peas and corn. Entrees changed every day, but one could usually find a basic salad bar and pour-your-own red and white wine and Bud on tap.Not too shabby for under $100, if you can get that price. Reserve a room early.Free internet is not something you get everywhere anymore. This property also has a lovely heated outdoor pool and a delicious Jacuzzi. Homewood Suites in general always impress me with ridiculously large rooms, full kitchens, decent breakfasts and a sort of happy hour with free wine and beer, and last night was taco night with all the fixins. Another reviewer commented on the cheerfulness of the happy hour staff and they are right -- you get a cheerful greeting whether you just grunt at her or reply back. If they could bottle that gal's cheerfulness, I'd buy it at the little convenience shop by the front desk.I love me some Homewood Suites. Best deal around if you like a massive, comfy room, free food and booze, a decent pool and fitness center and a staff that actually enjoys what they do.Love it!Where to begin?  When you arrive at a property one should NOT have to ask to NOT have a handicapped room.  We checked in with a small child who is a 'bather' imagine our surprise to find that the 'suite' we'd booked wasn't that sweet.  In fact, there was a stand up handicapped shower and an overly tall (presumably for handicap access as well) toilet making 'weeing' difficult for said child.   We paid a dear rate (being HH members and memebers of the Hilton family (one of our daughters works with Hilton in ATX) for this suite - as we decided to stop here on our way home from Joplin's Homewood Suites (which ROCKS BTW).  The people who work here are quite nice, lovely in fact, but the reality is this is not a good value.The next thing that really ground up my tired gears was climbing into a bed that FELT LIKE MATTRESS quilting.  With pillows that seriously were made of something scrunchy and not at all soft or firm.  And they smelled weird.  The mattress, however, insured we would NOT get a good sleep.  Since when do you NOT use a proper Hilton style mattress cover when you have MULTIPLE patrons a week, year whatever - I am seriously so grossed out right now, it was a thin nothing of a cover that had come up at every corner exposing naked mattress.  Taking photos - nasty sauce right there.  Combined with the handicapped restroom and the proximity to "Ding" the elevators (across from) this just was the last straw.   I do not want to forget that fact that we had to RUN THE AIR CON all night long. It's 35 degrees outside and we needed the air on because the heat is broken and runs you up to 90 when set to 68.  Honestly people. I booked directly through Hilton's site WITH my HH - so they knew we were coming, we did not use some discount site thus seemingly deserving the cast off room.  And when I enquired about moving... all they had 'left' was smoking rooms or Handicap. Forking riceholes.  I'd skip this property and go on over to the Embassy Suites - the price is about the same but you really do get more for your money, even from discount sites!  Plus the food is way better at ES.  The breakfast was fine here, but I really won't eat eggs someone else peeled or bread others have pawed through.  They do not offer many vegetarian options nor do they seem 'kid' friendly but rather I had to ask them to change the channel from inappropriate sexual content on Dr. Phil to something more friendly... or off altogether (we aren't big tele peeps!) This is just icing mind you of why I wouldn't recommend this to others.  The mattress is the big deal and I am seriously bummed we spent the money and a whole night here.  Damn you sleep.  I wish I no longer needed you.Very disappointed. Stayed at Homewood in Kansas & Iowa last month & were very pleased. Decided to switch from Hampton. This is NOT a suite!! It's just a bigger room with a kitchenette. Vanity sink in front of bed so washing hands during night wakes up husband. Not happy! Won't book a room like this again. May go back to strictly Hampton or Embassy. Feeling ripped off!I am a Hilton Honors member and have stayed at many Hilton's including Homewood Suites.  I do like the breakfasts better at Embassy suites, but this location is not bad.  Desk staff very nice. Room, very clean and nice pillows/bed.  I like the studio style suite layout.  Nice, big lcd HD TV.  I really wanted to comment on the breakfast, the ladies that run it in the morning are really friendly and try and jazz up the standard "continental fare".   Not the greatest food, but well done with what they had.  Plus they are super friendly.Next time I have to visit, I would stay again for sure.Staff is friendly and they provide free breakfast and dinner on weekdays.The lady that provided us breakfast every morning was a true joy.  She always greeted us with a smile and politely told us what was being served that morning.  Her joy and enthusiasm was most appreciated!!I have never had a bad stay at Homewood Suites, and this location didn't disappoint. We arrived about 10 pm after 13 hours of driving. Robert was at the front desk, I had spoken to him about 4 hours earlier to make our reservation. He was friendly, helpful and quick to get us into our room. We got into our room, ready to fall in to bed. The room was super clean, looked newly remodeled or the property is new, but it was perfect. We all slept great, quiet location, and very easy to get to off of I-40. There is a Buffalo Wings restaurant within walking distance, a Shell gas station to refuel across the street and for all the Harley Davidson riders, a large Harley store directly across the street.Thank you Homewood Suites and Robert for making our stay so nice, we may see you on the return trip.I'm a Hilton Honors member and like to stay at Hilton properties when possible.  This hotel came up with a fantastic rate and good location.  I discovered that the Homewood property provides Hot breakfast and dinner, included in the price.  The rooms are nice fitted with  kitchenette, small living room and bedroom.  this is great for people staying on longer trips, or people who like to spread out.Not bad overall.    This is not a "new" hotel but what is in Oklahoma City?   It looks to me that it was built in the 70's or '80 but has been well updated.I was a little bubbly to find that the air conditioning was by one of those large window units below the main window.     It was little humid in there but that dropped it down and I used up enough electricity keeping my room cool as anyone.....   Sigh....    I would have to say that this is one of the best hotels in Oklahoma City.I just wish they would use central air for a more constant overall comfort level and less energy waste.

You know what? I absolutely adored this hotel. So, stop looking, and book a room. We stayed in a king bed suite over Valentine's weekend, and it was perfect. The layout of the room was impeccable. We walked in to a small raised countertop area to our left with a key caddy for phones and small items, with the kitchen right there as well, hooks to our right for jackets, a desk and chair in front of us with the living room set up nicely behind it. The kitchen was fully equipped and left nothing to be desired for us. The bonus of a two person eat-in dining area with table and chairs was also great. Beyond the living room, was the bedroom to the left, and off of it a nice counter area and closet, with the toilet and shower in a separate room. Everything was super clean, bright, and welcoming. Oh, and tons of storage everywhere. In the morning the breakfast buffet included hot breakfast items such as eggs, potatoes, sausage, and oatmeal. There was also a great selection of fresh fruit, yogurt, breads, bagels, and muffins, and a full waffle station. Items changed daily which was a nice surprise for variety, especially if you stay there for awhile. The layout and impeccable use of space in our suite, as well as location and amenities offered makes this the only place I'd ever want to stay in OKC. You will feel completely at home, in the heart of a bustling area. Couldn't ask for more!Very nice place to stay when in the OKC area. It's close to everything fun in BrickTown.The next time we're in town I'm sure this will be on top of the list of places to stay.It's so pretty and super functional! The hallway is a little tacky, but what do you expect? I've seen worse halls in Vegas.The staff are really nice and you get free continental breakfast. The hotel is walking distance from some nice eateries, (although their prices are a little jacked up), and about 1 block from the movies.It bothered me that of all the reviews, there wasn't one pic of a room. I added mine and now I feel way better.The manager here is horrible. Latta Miller blatantly hit on my wife to the point where it was borderline harassment. The other manager, Matthew something was nice and very helpful. For the most part the rest of the front desk staff was OK. But I can't believe Marriott would hire a creep like that. Will not stay here again until he's gone.Excellent service! The hospitality was great, morning breakfast was very good and the management could not have been friendlier. I would definitely recommend this location again! They went above and beyond to accommodate the large group I was with which made a long journey a little easier. Thank you! I will be back if I return to OKC.It is ok if you are not in the back of buildings 1,2 &3. There is a night club back there that had very loud music on Wednesdays, Fridays & Saturdays. It does not shut down til 2:00 am .Complimentary breakfast in the morning!  Residence Inns are very nice to stay at.  Rooms are always spacious and have a kitchenette attached.  At this location, make sure that the front desk gives you a parking pass, because you may get towed.The location is in walking distance of many restaurants.  The staff is very friendly.  They also have this touch screen kiosk, where you can look for things around the city.  You can print the directions from there too, very convenient.Guess what? I'm in the United States Navy and I got to pay to take a cold shower tonight! Forget bootcamp hot showers. I'd love to pay for a nice cold shower in the winter! Hooyah!Liking this place.  Great rooms, great location, very reasonable parking. At $6 a night its by far the best around the downtown area. The rooms are very well maintained and very spacious, and the kitchen is better stocked than other residence inns as far as cooking goes.  As a frequent business traveler I have to say the gym is pretty lacking though. Elliptical is poorly maintained and nothing more than a set of free weights and one bench.  Could do much better especially in an area with so many long term consultants visiting for Devon and other downtown firms.I use Mid-American gym on Broadway in case you're curious.  Very reasonable daily, weekly, and monthly rates there.  A bit of a shame I have to run a couple of miles to lift weights, but in the end it only makes the workout more rounded right?This is the nicest Residence Inn I have experienced.  Very updated and extremely clean.  I brought my dog and thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful pathways and water features behind the hotel.  The location was excellent close to restaurants, movies, etc.  Staff was fabulous and even gave me a complimentary deodorant when I forgot to pack mine.  Rooms were quiet.  Breakfast was good and all staff were working hard.  Could not have asked for a better experience.clean place, great location, and good for families. Brand new hotel, and great location with lots of places to eat, drink and be merry. I would encourage going to the minor league ball game as its across the street, and mickey mantles steak house (see review). Hotel staff is courteous, hotel is clean and very comfortable. The pool isnt great and needs to be cleaned more frequently but the hotel is great.The Residence Inn in Bricktown is a commendable hotel to choose if you're looking for a well-kept hotel in the downtown Oklahoma City area. The rooms are roomy and comfortable. The complimentary hot breakfast has some great items (ham slices, eggs, potatoes, yogurt, and your general continental breakfast items). Also, the evening reception that's available during most of the weekdays is a pretty sweet deal that comes along with your stay.I would give the hotel 5-stars, but I have two nuances from the times that I've stayed here:1. I stayed at this hotel on two separate occasions during the same month, only to find that the one elliptical machine in the hotel gym still had the same "broken" sign weeks later. For a hotel of this size and given the fact that there was only one elliptical machine, I expected it to be fixed during my second stay. Also, compared to other hotels of the same caliber around the area, the gym lacks in the amount and type of equipment. The room can feel a bit confining if there's more than 3-4 individuals trying to burn those darn calories.2. The walls appeared to be somewhat thin. I could sometimes hear the people next door, but luckily it was still tolerable during my stay.Overall, I still would stay at this Residence Inn for it's convenient location to restaurants in the downtown area, the friendly employees, the cleanliness of the rooms, and the complimentary hot breakfast. Hopefully I'll see improvements with the gym the next time I'm around the area.I really liked this hotel. Clean spacious rooms, staff very knowledgeable and friendly, and who can beat free breakfast and dinner!  It's amazing how good food can taste when it's free!!!  lolMy only recommendation would be to get a room away from the freeway, especially if you are a light sleeper!Love this hotel. The employees are so nice. Rooms are beautiful!A beautiful clean hotel, with pleasant staff and a plentiful breakfast. The room has a full sized kitchen, desk an sofabed in the living room, beds and bathroom in the other room. I'm not sure if this is a new hotel or not, but everything was well maintained. My favorite part of the staff was upon check-in was when they were asking discovery questions (I was moving and had a trailer with all my worldly goods in it) so they put me in a room with a window view of my truck and assured me about the security they have walking the premises at night. Big plus. I would love to stop here again and stay for an extended period instead of just one night. :)Overall it's a good hotel, front desk staff is friendly & good location. My only issue was with the house keeping staff. I was there for several weeks and I don't think I saw one house-keeping person smile or be friendly...I would actually go so far as saying they just look downright pissed. Its understandable some people don't like their work, but a simple "good morning" goes a long way and expected. The highlight was when they were delivering my dry-cleaning but decided NOT to knock on the door as I stood in my underwear in the middle of the room.Again, the positives out-weighted the negative. I would return again..just wanted to vent..Stayed there 2 nights, family and dog.  Great hotel, management and staff.  Awesome location by Bricktown and the ballpark.Stayed for 8 nights and absolutely loved our stay!  Free hot buffet breakfast and Mon, Tues, and Wednesday hot dinners buffet couldn't be beat = 11 free meals!  Situated in the new Bricktown recreation/party area of Oklahoma City, you have everything fun at your backdoor...movies, 30+ restaurants/bars, minor league ballpark, right on the canal with wonderful walkways.  There is even a "water taxi" to deliver you to your desired location!Our 2-BR suite was very roomy - each BR had a master bath - full kitchen - 3 flat-screen TVs.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat!Great place! Love the location (Bricktown). You can actually walk to a ton of different places (restaurants, minor league ballpark, pubs, etc). It is by their little river. Only downside is that you hear the freeway if you are facing the river. Didn't bother me at all since I am not someone who needs 100% silence to fall asleep. I was not looking forward to Oklahoma City at all, but the Bricktown area is actually pretty darn nice :-)Very helpful and friendly staff. Very comfortable beds. Also, if you are a smoker (guilty), they do have some rooms with balconies. There aren't many, but it never hurts to ask. I was in 306 my first week there and it had a balcony. My second week I was in 206, which didn't. If you are looking for a walkable laid back place with tons of draft beer choices, I recommend walking over to TapWerks.As Residence Inn goes, this place is perfect. They allow dogs, but are organized about it enough where you feel like other people's dogs who can't behave won't ruin your stay (of course my dog is perfect,so I love that he can be here with me lol). Our room is cheaper than the one in Memphis was, yet it's actually 2 rooms, not just a studio feeling. I wish I could move into this room, for real. Totally helpful staff. Walking distance to anything in Bricktown (right outside OK City). Canal out back, awesome for walking dog. Basketball court, big pool. Thrilled. Altho minus a star for us having to take our own luggage cart out to our car to haul all our sh*t in by ourselves. Not cool, not cool.

Overall the hotel has a pretty great location with places to eat and shop well within walking distance. The room rates were about average for the OKC area. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms seemed a bit odd with how they are layed out (which is just an asthetic thing and an opinion) but still functional and fairly spacious. The decor was typical of hotel room, nothing to fancy, just the typical cookie-cutter furniture. The room overall was nice, mini-fridge, wet-bar area, nice little writing desk with lamp, iHome clock radio and an Ethernet connection. The bed was not the best by any means (typical hotel bed), but the pillows were were absolutely awesome!! The bathroom was spacious, full sized shower only (no tub though) and the actual toilet and shower were separated with a door so they could be isolated from the vanity area and the rest of the room.The breakfast I had was absolutely delicious, some of the best in-hotel breakfast that I have ever had actually. The lobby was clean and definitly had more of a modern and contemporary feel to it than the rest of the hotel. The exercise room housed the typical spread of treadmills, elliptical machines and weight machines, but wasn't huge and seemed the appropriate size for hotel. The indoor pool was nice, clean and seemed well maintained (Although the pool was pretty shallow). The sitting area just off of the pool was nice and seemed inviting. Let's talk about the hot tub. The hot-tub is also located indoors by the pool. The water was hot yes, a very appropriate temperature likely around 102 (perfect hot-tub temp imo). The "jets" for the hot-tub were/are in need of some servicing. Half of them did not work at all and the ones that did were simply holes in the side with air bubbling out of them. There was no actual "jet" action at all which is disappointing. (After all, what's the point of soaking in a public bathtub if there are no jets!!)... Anywho, overall the hotel is great, the staff was very friendly and the actual accommodations are nice. The location is good, and you don't actually hear the noise from the interstate that is a couple hundred feet from the building. All in all a 9.5 out of 10 in my book!!Stayed here many times. Service is great.  Nightly managers receptions are a nice touch.The lobby was recently remodeled. The room I was in was getting a little rough though. Front desk attendant said they were in the process of remodeling the rooms as well.I was surprised to find out that this Marriott has been opened since 2008. All I can say is this place is, clean, clean, clean!! They do a great job in maintaining the property and grounds here.The staff here is not only wonderful, but AWESOME! I felt comfortable right from the get go. The rooms are clean and spacious. The beds are comfortable and I was able to relax and catch up on my work and watch some TV in the evening to wind down. I think I got a little too comfortable, some workout guru on TV almost convinced me to buy his DVD "Brazilian Butt Lift" so I can tone my rear end from the privacy of my own home, but I digress ::))Housekeeping does a great job in tidying up your room after you make a mess. In the morning the staff lays out a delicious assortment of breakfast options. They offer a nice selection for the health conscious guest, for that I salute you! They also brew some mighty tasty java.In this particular location they also run a happy hour on Mon-Thu from 5:30-7:00PM offering up alcoholic beverages of beer and wine, and serving varieties of simple comfort foods that changed daily and ranged from items like pulled pork, egg rolls, lasagna and pot roast. If you're a frugal guest, you just scored! but only on Mon-Thu :) The gym and pool is typical Marriott and like I said earlier, clean and well maintained. The parking lot is big and one of the big pluses in staying here are the many different restaurants right outside your hotel lobby and a few blocks away, not to mention you are close to Will Rogers airport and Interstate I-40 is only a block away.I almost forgot to mention, this place is pet friendly.  I found myself riding the elevator with a "Maltese" one day and a "Labradoodle" the next, cool!Definitely my New go to Marriott when I'm back in town next time!Incredible stay! The room we stayed in was huge! I'm pretty sure it was bigger than our first apartment! The staff is lovely! The continental breakfast was perfection! Eggs, potatoes, fruit, croissants, to-go cups for coffee and juice! Wow! I'm super impressed. Best part; they're dog friendly! Thank you Springhill for giving us the rest we needed as we traveled across country. We'll be back on our return trip!Very nicely appointed.  Happy hour in the afternoon with complimentary wine, beer and soft drinks.  Snacks.  Very nice complimentary breakfast in the morning.  Had a little issue with a pull out bed.  Help was there in 3 or 4 minutes.  Nice!  Clean and updated.  Workout room and indoor pool were nice.  Reasonable price.Great place, comfy bed. I had a problem with my room frig & they simply swapped it out right away. Spacious suite. Great shower.  It's true that most dog owners don't seem to pick up after their dogs -- maybe mgmt could offer bags & trash receptacles as encouragement.  When I made my reservation by phone, the man speaking with me kept calling me 'honey' or 'sweetheart' or other endearments. Maybe this is a Southern thing, but especially when I'm booking a hotel room, I don't want that sort of familiarity. It's a little creepy. Still, a fine night's stay. Much better than average breakfast, with veggie sausage & spinach! And there's a Starbucks across the street.I stay here every few weeks when I come see my kids. I love it because the people are so nice and the rooms allow us to relax. The location and good services are just right.Stay there regularly for business.  Nice place for the price.  Good sized rooms, basic fitness room, surprisingly good happy hour w appetizers, breakfast ok, staff and manager always friendly and helpful.I'll be very honest. This hotel is satisfactory at best and I'm a Marriott rewards member who has stayed at every different type of chain Marriott offers.The only saving grace is that the staff is very friendly and don't hesitate to assist with any issues and also the fact that it's in a great area surrounded by basically EVERYTHING food and shopping wise. It's only 10 minutes from the OKC airport.The rooms are adequate but the hot water had a mind of its own. My first two nights were fine. Third night, the hot water proved to be very difficult. The breakfast is OK but the waffle maker is only available on the weekends which sucks. That was basically the highlight of the breakfast for me.Great staff and GM. They make you feel at home. Great rooms and convenient location near a lot to do and eat. The staff takes pride in the property and are always courteous. I will return as often as I can.Doug from Wichita KansasSolid 3 stars, I guess. Staff was very friendly and helpful. But I find the rooms and the lay out typical of SpringHill - poorly designed. The TV is NEVER positioned in the room so that you can see it from the bed. And the bathroom shower is such that you literally have to get in the shower to turn it on - so you are blasted with hot or cold water - either way, amateur hour. The bed was  little bowed - like it needed to be replaced. But overall the property was clean and inviting. We did not partake of the breakfast. We got a great deal, so all in all, it was okay but not my first choice next time.Stayed here last week to catch a plane the next morning and now we're back from our Maui trip. We landing early morning from flying since 3pm the previous day so needless to say we were Tiiirrred! We went in about 9am knowing it was way early to check in but they said to check back about 11:30.. so we grabbed some breakfast and went back. They are very friendly and eager to help. We were able to check in at 12:00 and catch up on some lost sleep. I will from now on stay here if ever Im in the okc area. Clean, comfortable, spacious and super nice staff.I moved over here from the Oklahoma City Marriott.  Man what a difference on so many levels!  Excellent hotel!  From the always good Marriott bed to the attentiveness of the staff as they go out of their way to assist you. The breakfast in the morning is very good with several choices and the Manager's Reception in the evening with the beer and wine is a nice added touch.  As a business traveler, I like to look for hotels just like this.  its all good.  I  have a couple of more weeks to spend in the OKC area and I already have my reservations for this hotel.Very clean hotel. Decent rates for a suite and full breakfast in the morning. Convenient to the Interstates too. Friendly staff.Excellent brand new hotel, with mini-suites complete with microwave and refrigerator. The customer service shines.  One of the few Springhill Suites that offers a free mini-dinner with free wine/beer, and the complimentary breakfast exceeds most Springhill Suite locations.  The location is convenient to shopping (Wal-mart, Best Buy, OfficeMax, etc) and a number of fast food restauants, but the surrounding atmosphere is "parking lot" without a hint of green. Convenient to downtown and the airport. I knocked it down one star, however, because they don't provide an airport shuttle until 6am. I was forced to take a cab ($14+tip).  I counted over 35 flights before 7AM - they have no business being an airport hotel without shuttle service early in the AM.Very awesome hotel! Very clean! Very nice staff! I would recommend this hotel to everybody!Had a group of 16 stay here for 14 days and the guest services were above and beyond what you would expect.  Although it wasn't five star accommodations we were all treated as though we were. They made us feel at home and were very personal. Spoke to us using our first names. Definitely would stay here again.

Definitely one of the nicest motel 6's we've stayed in. The rooms clean, the staffs friendly - what more could we ask for! Only gripe is a burn hole in the top blanket - but se la vie. Would stay again!Also they have a nifty room service option!We went to get a room and 1st of all their internet is down. Okay. So we decide to take the room anyway since we are exhausted. As I sign in, Patrick the front desk clerk says he needs my disabled husband's ID. Okay, back out to the truck in the rain. Hubby for some reason had put it in the suitcase which was under everything else. I tell clerk, I have a pic of it on my phone. NOPE. Wont work.So we just decided to leave and go somewhere else where there is internet. Unfortunately (or fortunately) the hotels/motels in the area was pretty much booked because of a big event in the area (and we have a pet with us so it limited our choices). By accident, we found STUDIO 6 (a division of the same corporation), almost same price with free internet) and only $10 for pet. Overall the cost was about $5 diff when you figure in the cost at Motel 6 for internet.  and they had 2 rooms left!!!! (so we got our King size bed on the bottom floor!)STUDIO 6 is nice, clean, updated furnishsings, kitchen, fridge etc. So over all thanks Patrick the front desk clerk at MOTEL 6 on S, Meridian for being so unbelievably rude and unhelpful! With out you, we would never have found STUDIO 6!This is the nicest motel 6 we ever checked into. The room is very clean, modern with a flat screen and have hard wood floor. Front desk lady was nice. We been driving for 400 miles so it's nice to get to relax in a nice room for once.Ok so mixed reviews about this motel 6. It looks very clean and actually smelled good. The rooms have laminate flooring instead of carpet, which is nice. Front office staff was friendly. Decent shower water pressure/ temperature. Heating/air conditioner worked well. Flat screen TV.  However, my husband was checking the room over and found a used syringe and some kind powdery substance residue tucked behind the television... If not for that, would have given 5 starsNope is all I have to say about this place. Shady area, shady people all around. Ro smelled of smoke, pinesol and pet urine, AC was touching the right side of the bed. On the plus side it was only $50 to have sheets that you could not tell if they were dirty or permanently stained. I have seen worse but not a great experience for my first night in OK.Checked in today. Pounding on walls til 5pm. Kids running along sidewalk yelling. Hooker walking the parking lot trying to get my attention. 1980s decor with one Queen bed. No ice bucket, plastic cups or coffee maker. Trash left out and blowing in front of room. Tv is snowy..We arrived around 11 pm, staff was nice, our car was full of things, they had security walking around (made us feel comfortable that no one was going to break into our car)... Room was good, clean and I look for the strength of water pressure coming out of the shower head to hit my body and wash away the sweat after 12 hrs of driving, was awesome water pressure !!! I've been to rich hotels were water flows like someone's pissing softly on you... The reason I give this place 3 stars; fucking jackass construction and painters began to work at 7 am !!!!!!!!!! Are u fucking kidding me !?!? The rep at the desk should not had placed us in a room knowing that work was going to be done in other rooms around us !!! Erica saw how ticked off and sleepy we (as a family were), and was able to help us out with a refund for the night ! Erica and I both agreed that noise in OKC is allowed from 9 am to 9 pm... These jackasses seemed not to care.Pros:*Old guy at front desk was friendly and helpful. When the first two keys for my room did not work, he gave me the room right next door.*Pets stay free*Cops were there handcuffing some negro, which is ALWAYS amusing Cons:*expensive for a motel 6. A dump like this should not cost $50.*The 1990s called and want their CRT television back*Channel lineup was worse than rabbit ears*No shampoo, toothbrush, or toothpaste available without paying $2.50*Creepy guy from room next door asked me if I had any drugs when I stepped out for my cooler. It seemed like he'd already had plenty of drugs in past decades. Apparently because my license plates are registered in the same state that he once lived in, we must be friends and I must be his new dealer.*Don't bother with a blacklight on the bed unless you feel like checking out early and filing a chargebackThis was the second motel six I stayed at on my 2,300 mile journey. It will also be my last, as I do not intend to travel with cats again(They hate it)BAD! BAD! BAD! At LEAST upgrade to super-eight.So bad, I didn't sleep all night. Nasty tiny room, with no water pressure; I could barely brush my teeth. People hanging out all over made me wonder whether my car would still be there in the morning. People screaming and yelling at all hours of the night. The shower would not drain! Ripped pillow cases and cigar smoke lingering. How many ways can I spell disturbing?! I should have slept in my car!Ick! Loud place, no water pressure, no wifi, concave bed, lawn made of thorns that plyers can't remove from shoes. Overall dirtyWish there was a zero star.  This place really needs to be updated.  I wish I would have looked at the room before hand.  The grounds of the property are disgusting once you get away from the office, especially the stairs.... disgusting.  I'm disappointed in the motel 6 brand at this location. Giving one star only because the guy that comes on at 11 in the office was very friendly.  The guy before that,  not so much. ... had an attitude.Clean room, clean pool, friendly staff, NO MILITARY DISCOUNT.Well, grubby sheets, two people getting arrested outside the door. To top it all off, a gerbil in the room, a gerbil! A feral gerbil at that which looked like something out of a animal vampire movie, otherwise, awesome.

hotel_name: La Quinta Inn Oklahoma City Airport
review_content: VERY run down & filthy.  I only stayed here as I got stuck in the middle of a ice storm while traveling.  Most pet friendly hotels in a 25 mile radius were booked, I should have known when I was able to get a room here right away.The room's carpet was very dirty, the bathroom floor was filthy and the desk chair & microwave had pieces of tape holding them together (seriously).  Rooms are exterior & was loud as it bordered some type of outdoor amusement center (my room faced the batting cages) and they played top 40 music over a outdoor speaker system.  Bed was VERY comfortable.  I went down for breakfast but the food area was inundated with linemen that were staying there working on the ice storm issues in the area, I elected to skip the free breakfast.*12/10/2015 - I was contacted by La Quinta staff regarding my review left on a survey that was emailed to me regarding this stay. The tape that was on chair & microwave had no functional purpose. It in fact was not holding either 'together', it was placed on each for no apparent reason & staff was not aware it was there. Apologies were made & I was informed that LQ location is scheduled for renovation.Was fortunate enough to have my company put our team in this ShitHole...First impressions are generally right.Worn out and thick with smell of heavy detergents to mask problems.OMG!!!!!!  If I could give negative stars to a hotel, this would be the first!!!!!  This hotel should be condemned.  I checked in and I was given a room with what I think was mold in the vents (Room 143)..  The second room appears to have the same (Room 209).Breakfast was cream beef served from a crock pot with no eggs.......I would give this zero stars if I could. This is probably the worst hotel I have stayed at. My two colleagues and myself stayed here on a week night because of a day long meeting in OKC.The hotel is incredibly run down from the outside. And as a female, exterior entrances don't feel the safest to me. However, my male colleague was in the room directly next to me which made me feel a little bit more comfortable.There's a large amount of exterior noise -- whether it's from the nearby highway or the mini golf park. As for the room -- I was incredibly frustrated with the quality of the room. I was allegedly booked in a smoke free room but it reeked of cigarette smoke. There were no mini fridges or complimentary toiletry items. The room did not appear very clean, I was concerned about walking around barefoot and wish I had brought flip flops to wear in the shower. My colleague reported that when she walked into her room there were no working lightbulbs in any of the lights. When she called the front desk, they only brought two replacements for her entire room. The bed was uncomfortable. The toilet plumbing ran every 60 - 90 minutes when regularly woke me up.The breakfast hardly qualified as basic. No protein options -- not even hardboiled eggs.We were supposed to stay for two more nights but checked out the next morning to find better arrangements.This hotel is DISGUSTING. The room reek of cigarette, floor is sticky, it's in the absolute ghetto.. No fridge, outdated furnishing, the whole building looks like a CHEAP brothel. On top of that, the pool my princess waited ALL day for is CLOSED!!  Never LEFT a hotel after checking in but we're going to this time. Ugh. *vomit* can't run away from this place fast enough!!Had a great stay for the evening I was there.  The hotel room came with a kingsize bed, desk, chair, microwave and fridge.   Vending machines were stocked and not overpriced.Bedding was clean as well as the bathroom.  The continental breakfast was enjoyable and the business desk let me print my boarding passes before my flight.Front desk staff upon check-in and checkout were very helpful.  Everyone seemed eager to help guests even with the smallest requests.Shuttle wasn't running on Saturday but the front desk called a taxi at no cost to the guest.I just walked it with my two kids and I'm Scared... This place is the shit of shits. STAY AWAY!!!I wish I could give zero stars! I found a French fry (old and moldy) in the tissue box, a cockroach near the computer chair, and we got cussed out by the night shift front desk when we filed a noise compliant. AVOID!!Roach Motel!!Don't stay here.  Aside from it taking a half an hour to check in in the middle of the night, there were black smudges on our sheets and garbage on our floors!  When we walked in, the room smelled like a bug bomb... And rightly so!  There were dead roaches on our floors!  After picking up the first three, I was grossed out and couldn't pick up the remaining six.  If it wasn't so late and we didn't have a dog with us, I would have stayed somewhere else.  Again, don't even bother with this place.  If I could have given a half a star, I would have.  When I called to complain, I couldn't get anyone to speak to.  I also took pictures of the roaches on the floor, but there is no one at La Quinta corporate willing to take my complaint.  Go somewhere else.Outside, you hear the freeway 24/7. The TV had a 2/4th burned out. The toilet was clogged. Otherwise, very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was nice selection. Staff friendly.No, this isn't a luxury hotel, but it's one of my favorite places to go with my dog Oreo. They have a large courtyard surrounded by hotel rooms that is perfect for walking your dog. Most dog-friendly hotels have very little grass for your dog. The internet is slow at night but it is free. My room had always been clean and smoke free. And the price is $76 for a king with desk. Free breakfast. Standard fare. It's also close to the outlet malls !!During a cross country road trip, my dad and I decided to stay here... BIG mistake! We had stayed at La Quintas for the whole trip, since they're pet friendly, but this was definitely the SKETCHIEST one!First of all, we had been driving for over 8 hours and were very tired. We were driving up to the hotel and all of the sudden a man jumped out of the center median in front of our car! It was the middle of the night and he was wearing all black clothes! My dad had to slam on the brakes to avoid hitting him. Not La Quinta's fault, but just the beginning of a creepy evening.So we check in and while the employee had initially seemed a little rude, she warmed up and was actually really friendly (it was late at night, so she was probably just tired). On the way up to the room, other visitors were hanging out on the balconies, smoking and talking across the hallway. I had to take my dog out a couple of times to relieve himself and on the way back to the room, I noticed that in the parking lot next to the hotel, a man was being arrested. The lights were flashing and you could hear, "Put you hands on your head and walk backwards towards the vehicle." Again, not La Quinta's fault, but an indication of the type of area it's in.The room was the most outdated room we had stayed in during our 5-night trip. We could hear every noise out side our door, which woke up our dog every hour of the night. They did have a security guard on patrol, which did make me feel a little bit better, but overall it was the worst La Quinta we had ever been to. Sorry!Honestly one of the worst experiences I've ever had at a hotel.  While the staff (especially Miss Sarah Jane) was very nice, the overall appearance and upkeep of the facility was beyond lacking.  The also accept pets with no additional charge which was a huge plus for us as we were traveling with our dog.Upon arrival the presence of an insect issue was very apparent.  Once in the room, the carpets were soaking wet (as a result of clean up after pest treatment) and about 20+ dead crickets, roaches and other undetermined bugs were strewn about the room.  Never mind the fact that the window on the facility appear to have been installed sometime in the early 50's.  Single paned and not very secure.  There was an older gentleman patrolling the property, but he really didn't make me feel like he would be a deterrent if something were to go down.I contacted the front desk to share my frustration with the room.  I told Miss Sarah Jane that I was far too tired to switch rooms, but felt she should know of the lack of attention to cleanliness in the room.  She seemed to be aware of an existing issue and offered to comp the room and have the staff relocate our belongings to another, interior, room.  Thanks to her quick attention to my concerns I was able to get a few short hours of rest in before having to hit the road the following day.I have not yet received the credit against my account for the comp'd room... but called and the staff that was there today acknowledged the comp on my account.  I am confident it will come through.Lesson learned here: USE YELP WHEN BOOKING ROOMS!!!Wish we had read reviews ..we were tired after long drive. This was the filthiest room we have ever encountered. Not only filthy, but outlets not working, internet spotty and therefore not usable, TV needed new remote.  Rug icky, no way I would walk bear footed on it...gives La Quinta a bad name. AVOID At all costs!I had never been to Oklahoma before and booked a room here during my cross country drive. As soon as I saw the hotel I was scared to death. They gave us a key and we headed over and realized it was outdoors like a motel! We immediately went to ask for a room inside the hotel. They changed us to a second floor room which was no better. There was no elevator and the hotel was totally run down. I knew there would be no way I could sleep there so we asked to switch to a different la quinta. The woman working at the desk was rude and unwelcoming as well. Do not stay here!!This place is a joke. I dealt with 2 people trying to check in. I booked the trip in advance and gave them a credit card which they wouldn't accept because it was new and didn't have a name on it since it had been stolen.  The woman I dealt with was pleasant but the guy was rude.Worst ever.  Affordable but wow.... if both beds sink in the middle they need to changed... Obviously these beds have many, many, many miles on them.....Damn... must have been a hell of a time.No thank you!  Went down the street to another hotel.La Quinta I believe is Spanish for smoke infused bedsheets. This place sucks as bad as any hotel I have ever been in.Stayed here one night on Sept. 2. Room entrance opened to the outside. When I approached it for the first time there were people sitting in chairs drinking beer just down the way, lending an unsavory feeling to it.Room clean but very basic. Attached there is a saloon which serves lunch and dinner. If you're not familiar with Oklahoma, smoking in establishments like this is still allowed, and this place ranked about the highest in terms of smoke.I ordered a hamburger and it was very good.The room I was in allowed some noise to come in. The hotel is on a busy avenue near US Rt 40 and there is a good deal of steady rumbling.Shower was okay.Breakfast was a very sparse affair. Just basic cereal, coffee and coice of apple or banana. Parking was easy. I was able to park right outside my room.We tried this hotel because we had never stayed at one before. Surprisingly good for the monies.  The room was clean, with wi fi.  The breakfast was tremenduous - waffle, hot dog, bagels, cup cakes, eggs, coffee, tea, juices, etc.  We did get our monies worth. Definitely will try to stay at this chain for our travel.
review_content_20: Poor customer service and dead bugs in the room. Really gross we ended up ditching the place.So, I have never stayed at a La Quinta but I wanted to give it a try. Didn't know anything about the chain, but I was impressed with most of it. The front desk staff was VERY friendly and helpful. The room was clean, with a nice tv and free wifi. The continental breakfast was ok...not the best, but not the worst. It's better than a Days Inn, but not as good as a Holiday Inn. The only downfall is when they first gave us room keys, it was to a room where the beds were completely stripped, and not made, so they had to put us in another room.The worst La Quinta we stayed in yet. We have stayed in 20 La Quinta's in the last 60 days and the worst one to date. Roach in the shower, toilet seat was dirty, shower didn't drain, hot water ran out, and the "non smoking room" want non smoking. Stay at any other La Quinta's but not here.We checked in late due to a late flight arrival, we were greeted by friendly staff, our room was upgraded. The breakfast was very good. The free shuttle service was great, the drivers friendly, they take you to several places around the hotel. For the price we were very pleased with our stay and will definitely return if ever in OKC again.I have stayed in this hotel many times due to work.The staff here is very friendly and all of the rooms are very nice and clean. i have also read the reviews about roaches in the tubs and etc. however I have not experienced this. Also there is a quaint little bar with a country home feeling to it where everyone is friendly. All in all this is a great place to stay and I highly recommend this hotel to everyone.Not up to the standards of other LaQuintas. Room was clean but really needs major remodel.This place is disgusting. My husband and I had pulled a long day driving in from Amarillo and were eager to get to our room and relax. We got to La Quinta around 7pm and checked into our room. I was waiting in the car with our kids and dogs when my husband went into the room, only to find that it was still dirty. He went back to the front desk and complained and we were downgraded from a king to a double full and they offered to take $15 off our bill. No thanks, we'd made these reservations almost a month in advance. We cancelled our reservations and stayed at another La Quinta in the area that got us into a room without issue and was probably the nicest we have stayed in. After talking to locals in the area, they said this is a pretty sketchy location anyway. Glad we didn't stay!!4/19/2012 Just for the record, I never did receive the twice-promised free night coupon. Everything about this property speaks poorly of the La Quinta brand.The room was disgusting. If my wife and I didn't arrive at midnight after 17 hours of driving, I would have demanded a refund. Dead cockroaches everywhere, and the bathroom hadn't been cleaned from the last guest. You have been warned.We are totally loyal to La Quintas! They are clean, the service is friendly and offer more perks than other reasonably priced hotels.dirty dirtyStayed here for 10 days while working the fair. They forgot towels..we told them...next day no.pillow cases...we told them...next day found hair.all.over the floor...we told them. Last day our keys didn't work and the room wasn't cleaned at all. Worst hotel have stayed in. Oh and the day before last security gaurd was talking so loud outside the room we woke up at 4 in the morning. I'd rather have mentally disabled people work bc they would do a better job. Thanks la quinta. DONT EVER COME HERE!!!!!!We stayed in this La Quinta last night in Oklahoma City. Our son found an empty Coke bottle, a tennis ball, and a poker chip under the beds. The bathroom floor and shower curtain were dirty, there was no hot water in the morning at 6:30 am, and there were cockroaches in the bathroom. We also needed help opening the door because the door handle needed to be adjusted. It required slamming it down quickly in order for the door to  open. I told the desk clerk about it and she said that yes, they were having boiler issues, followed with a smile. I tried sending La Quinta my concerns but couldn't get past their online form.The hotel was fine - we weren't looking for anything fancy.  We stayed one night, were planning to stay the following night downtown to catch a concert, and then return to this hotel for our last night.  When we checked out, we wanted to walk down the street to get some lunch before heading downtown.  Having been traveling for the holidays, we had quite a bit of luggage to carry all around to find a spot to eat so we asked the woman at the front desk if she could hold our bags for about an hour while we got lunch.  It seemed like her favorite phrase of the moment was "I can't do that" or "We don't do that" because she said it to us and to the next two people coming over with questions.  I've traveled around the world and have never been told by any hotel/hostel/bungalow/campsite staff "We can't do that" without being offered a secondary option.  To me, that is terrible service and it makes me want to cancel our second night's reservations.  In short, the staff (except for the shuttle drivers) is exceptionally unfriendly and I wouldn't stay here again.

hotel_name: SpringHill Suites Oklahoma City Quail Springs
review_content: Off the main interstate (40) and it was a lot less expensive !Staff was very friendly and casual, gave me the AAA discountVery nice place, great room very clean and comfy, trendy !. Breakfast in the morning, it was great.We love Spring Hill Suites...Terrible experience!!! The first room had a broken shower. The second room has wallpaper falling off. The front lobby has huge box fans everywhere because the AC is broken. I haven't seen a repair man all weekend. The front desk is rude. I've never experienced such a terrible hotel. @Marriott this is a major brand detractor!!!As a follow up, I worked with corporate @Marriott and I was told they would stand by their hotel and the management. I partnered with upper management at the hotel and they did nothing to satisfy us - they didn't even offer a solution. As consumers, we vote with our dollar. I will never stay nor recommend this property to anyone!!!Complaint to let you know about the service given today at the Marriott located at 3201 W. Memorial Road, Oklahoma City, OK. 1.  My daughter XXXXX XXXXXXX  reserved a room for two nights at this location.  When she arrived she was told her room was cancelled.  She advised the staff she had not cancelled the room.  After long deliberation the staff person stated no Underwood had called and cancelled the room.  This lends me to believe someone on the staff made an error.  They would not fix the issue and even went as far as to be rude and condescending to her.  This was in my presence.  I will go on to mention my daughter is in the latter stages of pregnancy and had driven 10 hours to get to this location.  2.  When I made an attempt to obtain the email address of someone I could complain to the staff member, male, not manager became confrontational/ rude with me and did not handle the situation in a professional manner.  Once again this is unacceptable.  This happened just moments ago.First off their a/c was down or something in the lobby making it uncomfortably hot! Second, when I tried to check in I was told that the room I booked (double 2 room suite) was unavailable so we (2 adults 3 kids) were booked into 2 separate king rooms on each side of the elevators. I'll admit it wasn't as noisy as I thought it would be but still we were separated.Third, once we got to our rooms I noticed that the door handle in our room made it difficult to open the door. Idk how to explain it other than you had to force the handle down hard. Also our toilet kept running and that was kind of annoying. Oh and wifi, slow!Fourth, their breakfast kind of sucked. I'm a person whose kind of ok with boxed food but come on, no one likes watery scrambled eggs. Also don't forget, their a/c wasn't on/working in the lobby making the breakfast area pretty warm.Good reviews of the hotel. Parking wasn't bad and the pool area also not bad.I've stayed at the Springhill Suited at the Moore location. We enjoyed our stay at that location and and was really looking forward to another stay at Springhill. Sadly our stay at the Springhill memorial location was not that great!Nice clean hotel but.  If they give you a room by the elevators , ask for another room further away, will keep you up all night.  They must do better on their breakfast, absolutely horrible. Almost went next door to the Holiday Inn to eat instead. On my last day  they only had scrambled eggs and nothing else hot.  Room windows need to be able to block out the lights at night, the shear  curtains just don't do the trick.  this will be my last stay at that particular hotelThis is a nice hotel. I was very impressed. The rooms are nice and very clean. The service is good. The breakfast was okay. The wifi is free. We were really impressed with one aspect of the service. They have a discount for people who are there because family is at a nearby hospital. They asked why we were in town and when I told them for my mother at the hospital, they gave a big discount even though we did know about it or ask for it.Aww - sad that this is the first review for this hotel.  Without too much further delay:Location: 3 out of 5This place isn't ultra convenient if you're flying into OKC, but if you have friends and family that live to the north, it's in a pretty convenient location.  Be aware that Memorial is not a toll road, but instead it runs parallel to it.  Depending on where you're coming from, you may have to cross the toll road, and take a left, as either side of Memorial are 1 way at this point.  Honestly though, it isn't that tough to figure out.Amenities: 4 out of 5Nothing to complain about here.  The suite we had contained everything that we needed and then some.  The added bonuses I guess are the microwave and the mini fridge.  It's not complete "suite-esque" as there was no full kitchenette and no dividing walls or doors in the living area, but no real complaints.  There is a "living room" feel with a couch and one wing chair in the suite.Please do check out the daily hot breakfast, though.  By no means is it gourmet, but along with the traditional continental breakfast items there are breakfast patties, eggs with cheese in them, oatmeal, and waffles.  Of course, there is also yogurt, milk, cereal, etc.  There is outdoor parking on premises at no charge.Service: 4 out of 5No complaints here - everyone was friendly and kind, and the breakfast staff was quick to refill items that had dwindled down in numbers.  Pricing: 5 out of 5I PL'ed the price, so I can't really complain.  Not sure what full retail rates are, but for ~50 bucks a night, I was very satisfied with the experience.Overall: 4 out of 5Very satisfied with my stay: rooms were spacious, hotel was clean, people were friendly, there was free parking, the breakfast bar was good, etc. etc.  I would definitely stay here again if I was in the area.I stayed here last week for a business trip, and I found my stay to be very comfortable.  Upon check in, I immediately found the staff to be extremely courteous and helpful.  I can honesty say I received some of the best customer service I've received in quite awhile, including the manager personally taking me to the local mall when the hotel shuttle was already out on a run. The room (#612) was large and well appointed, including a microwave, small fridge, and coffee maker (though I never used it since they offer fresh coffee in the lobby all day). The sheets were nice, and they changed my towels everyday. Breakfast was delicious, consisting of scrambled eggs, a meat dish (changed every day I was there - sausage and potato dish, sausage links, and bacon), oatmeal with standard accompaniments, a variety of bread options, fresh fruit (apples, bananas, cut fruit, strawberries), hard boiled eggs, cheese and deli meat, yogurt, a variety of juices, and coffee/tea. I loved the spread. A co-worker said she saw a waffle iron, but I didn't see it myself since I'm not much of a waffle person. In sum, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Springhill Suites in Quail Springs. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because the rooms could use some updating. I would definitely stay here again if my travels bring me back to OKC.The next day we had the breakfast. It was absolutely disgusting. The eggs were instant but chewy!!! Only items were eggs, sausage, cereal and bread! Worse breakfast ever! I will not plan on visiting after the smells and breakfast!Needed a place to stay for a couple of nights and thought this place would do the trick. Checked in quickly, then up to the room. Once we entered, the smell of mold over took us and noticed mold growing on one wall. The front desk quickly gave use another room, upon entering room it just didnt feel very clean and again noticed more mold in the bathroom. We went back to the front desk and just asked to not be charged for the room, because we were leaving. The place looks nice but its a dumpClean rooms, friendly staff and one of the best breakfast in town. They also have a social happy hour every Wednesday with free drinks and snacks. If you are staying at this hotel, you have free access to Golds Gym down, a few blocks down.Marriott, I just left your Arkansas location to check in to this OKC location. I left a horrible review for the AR one and had lost some faith in Marriott BUT the OKC location definitely restored my love for Marriott once again. First of all, this one is immaculately clean. I loved my room - you added small special touches that made it really feel homely. I loved the Wednesday social hour - that was definitely a plus. It was nice to come back at the end of the day for some food and wine/beer compliment of Marriott. The breakfast is warm and yummy. The staff here is awesome but I would like to especially mention the lady that attends to the food area. I spoke with her every morning and realize now that I never asked for her name. Anyways, she was so warm and so nice and it was my pleasure to have a small conversation with her to start the day. She would always ask how I'm doing and to make sure I have a wonderful day - she'll say don't try! One morning, I overheard a guest that was so excited and happy to run into her again that I was amazed to hear a guest feel about staff that way. Nonetheless, she is an asset at this Marriott - Marriott, you need to pay special attention to this lady!!Springhill suites is a very pleasant place to stay.  Rooms are clean, modern, and comfortable, typical of a Marriott property.  The springhill edition has small kitchenettes, minus a stove top.  If you can microwave everything you eat, you'll be just fine.Place is clean, the staff is friendly.  Breakfast is standard hotel fare, nothing outstanding, but a good variety.  Rooms are decent and accommodating to the business traveler.We stayed here for two nights for Easter 2010.  It was a QUIET clean hotel and the service was great in all areas.  It is in a nice location (growing suburban region) close to our destination but finding your way back to the hotel when traveling eastbound took some work (not the hotels fault....just wanted to alert a potential visitor!).  Also, depending on the road you take to the hotel, there may be small toll to pay.....don't depend on the change machines at the toll booth to provide change either!  It only takes $1 & $5 and certainely doesn't always work.

This place is a very good value. I thought this was a very nice room. There's lots of space with an alcove for a desk, table and chairs, refrigerator and microwave. There's also a seating area with a sofa and coffee table and a nice armchair in front of the TV. The king size bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was was nice.The Wi-Fi is a little slow by contemporary standards. The location is quite noisy. The door shut out a lot of the noise, but if you're a light sleeper you'll want to get a room in the back. Housekeeping and maintenance are not top notch, but perfectly adequate.There is a nearby On the Border restaurant, at McDonalds, Denny's, Circle K. You are very handy to the airportWell back in the area again! Just for the day this time, thankfully they let us check in very very early. Still the same pleasant staff. I believe all the rooms are now all renovated, we got a room we stayed in before and wow the change is very nice! Bed is comfortable and firm, large roomy bathroom, room is clean.5 stars for value. On a cross-country road trip with my fiance and our two dogs, we stayed in mostly Red Roof Inns. Traveling with pets, they were *hands down* the best option for us. Although Red Roofs cost a bit more than other budget motel chains, we found the comfort adequate and the locations very convenient. This particular location in Oklahoma was the best Red Roof we stayed in. We paid around $55 for a Superior King Room and the value was excellent. The room itself was roomy and the bed very comfortable.If we're crazy enough to do the drive again, we'll definitely return here.Have stayed here the last few yrs that we travel to OKC, very pet friendly, love the premium room, very roomy. My pets love stay there also.This hotel was horrible. Stay away from this area. Police everywhere because is a really dangerous area. The guy in the front desk was extremely rude, and then start asking me personal question, gave me a room in the back that faced a small street where you could hear people passing by. I left 5 minutes after even that the hotel was already payed.Not the best Red Roof we've been to... We only had one towel, the room smelled weird and it didn't seem to be in the safest area. It was, however, staffed by friendly people and had a huge comfortable bed.Hotel equals bed, bathroom and roof, period. A no hassle, no thrills type of establishment. We stayed two nights and at least the a/c worked great. The rooms were dingy and humid. The sheets actually felt damp the first night we got in. I was surprised to find a microwave and fridge in the room which was a plus. Not a bad place to stay for the price, $53/night.Quick update: After calling booking.com and complaining to their customer service, the situation has been handled. The woman I spoke to assured me that the hotel always has the ability to cancel a reservation made with a third party site, and to refund charges. The booking.com rep emailed two other managers, explaining the situation, and got me the refund I deserved. So, thank you to booking.com for handling the situation quickly and professionally, and to the manager of Red Roof Inn who finally gave in and decided to refund my money.Room was clean, but it's all down hill from here. Got woken up very early by construction right out side the room, and the room above (it sounded like a battle going on upstairs). Also by 9:30 in the morning, we are already being rushed to check out.I stayed here last week during the freezing cold with my toddler, they gave us an upstairs room..had to climb up the stairs with a toddler and lots of bags so that was kind of annoying. I was relieved that its next to a dennys which is nice. The bed was not comfortable but I tolerated it, I did not like how the bathroom had glass door..definitely not safe with a running toddler. The toilet made a loud squealing noise when flushed, very annoying when you're trying to not wake a child. The TV worked well and got a few channels. The chairs in the room were a nice addition except one of them was broken. Other than that it was clean and was near the freeway. I wouldn't stay there again though.The room was just plain dirty -- the carpets had debris on them, the desk was smeared with yellow sticky stuff. The bedding had a cigarette burn,and the curtains had holes. Not enough working electrical outlets. If we hadn't been so road-weary, we would have checked out. To the motel's credit, they gave us a discount on our one night, noting that they were attempting a rehab. A much needed rehab. Avoid this place until it is improved.Clean, roomy. Cheerfully honored a coupon, so a very good value. ($44 inc tax). Would stay there again.stayed here during our drive from cali~virginia...w/2 dogs.. not a bad place at all..very impressed w/the cleanliness & courtesy of the desk clerks..also, they give a military discount on top of their already cheap prices!! & there's a yummy chinese place that delivers to ya (the menu is in the room).. they have a fridge in the room w/freezer (for your snacks/drinks), a fan in the bathroom-always a plus ;) hot coffee in the lobby (they have coffee maker in your hotel rm, but it's not too tasty!) overall, if you have pets, & need a clean, comfy room in a pinch~stay here. would stay again for sure, but i don't foresee another trip like that in my future... but good job RED ROOF :) oh, and they sell bottled water in the lobby for i think $2 and was a pretty good size too.. cheaper than the gas stations!! wooo hooooooI stay at Red Roof all the time because they are pet friendly without a deposit, and you earn points for your stays. The room was clean, with all the required amenities. I stayed in a business king which was very spacious for me and my dog. The room had a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The bed was o.k. and the t.v. was big and received many of the local cable channels. You are within walking distance to Denny's McDonald's and Shorty Smalls is right next door. The staff was friendly and helpful. They had coupons for Shorty Smalls. You also get free wi-fi. Be sure to ask for the log-in info at the front desk. I say for the $55 I paid (with my AAA discount) the room was a good deal.

This review is written as a thank you to the lady at the front desk that gave me a ride to the hotel i was **supposed** to be at. I got dropped off by a co-worker, and she happened to drop me off at the wrong hotel!! Whoops, but the lady at the front (and I'm sorry I forgot your name) offered to give me a ride to the correct hotel. I was somewhat disappointed because the hotel was beautiful, and I really wanted to stay there:) Thank you!!! Your dedicated to customer service shows, and it made my day.This is a very beautiful hotel on the inside and my room for two was HUGE. Separate bathroom/bedroom/living room. It could of comfortably slept 6. Everything was super clean and the beds were unbelievably soft. Like sleeping on a cloud. The only thing that I didn't like was the wifi never worked on my phone and the location wasn't as close as I thought but still pretty close! PLUS they have complimentary drinks from 5:30-7:30! I got 2 sangrias and 2 vodka cranberries before it closed down. TALK ABOUT CUSTOMER SERVICE. DEFINITELY recommend coming here if you're in the okc area!  (If wifi isn't for you it'd be an easy 5 star)Excellent staff and beautiful property about 15-20 min from airport and 3 min from university. They have lots of conference space. I was impressed with the hotel suite/room, as it included a fridge, microwave, countertop, mini sink, a beautiful big dining table, two flat screen televisions (1 in family room and 1 in bedroom), and a pull out sofa. The decor was modern retro and looked clean. They offer complimentary made-to-order breakfast (which I wish was available for room service much earlier than 11am) and a complementary happy hour each evening. I'd definitely stay here again.Fantastic hotel!  Free breakfast has everything you could want including made to order items!  Rooms are spacious  and clean, very modern decor. Lobby is beautiful.  I'm assuming it must be a newer hotel. A king size room with hhonors runs about $120. If you work for a large company ask if they have a discounted rate for that company.  We paid $105. And it's dog friendly! !!Well color me happy, there's an amazing new hotel, with easy access to all best parts of OKC, a perfect place for me to put my friends and family when they come to town! Seriously, it's gorgeous. Modern and sleek, with wonderful, wide corridors and beautiful details all around. I haven't stayed in a guest room yet, though I plan to sometime soon. I was here for a meeting in one of the spacious and well-appointed board-style meeting rooms. It was perfect for our meeting, and while we were there we also ordered a wonderful lunch. We had a great server who took really good care of us, and I would absolutely host a meeting here again sometime. I am so glad there's such a nice place to stay. Especially for families in town for medical concerns, it's nice to think that at least they would have such a nice place to relax so close to the medical center.What a surprise. This place exceeded expectations in every way. The staff were all beyond friendly-from the cleaning staff to cooks to front desk staff. Found myself happily having conversations with all them. When I told the bell hop about what a great stay we had, he said something like "I'm glad you liked it as much as I do. They are great people to work for." How awesome is that?! Places that treat their employees we'll always impress me so much. Also there was an Unbelievable and unexpected free (!) evening cocktail and snack hour, which was so awesome. I needed a margarita after a long afternoon in the minivan. And they have the best free hotel breakfast I've ever had. Omelettes and flap jacks to order. Fresh fruit. And about a hundred other things. There is also a Super nice pool and fitness room (no hot tub though).All that and I haven't even gotten to the room yet, which was new, clean, and spacious. We have two kids under 5 so we took advantage of the frig and microwave in the room. Honestly we will be looking for excuses to get back to okc to stay here again. Just so nice to see a business putting so much attention into guest experience and customer service. We felted like staying there was a real treat. Plus it's in a great location. Took us just ten minutes to get to the zoo and horseraces. And when we left we zipped right back on the highway in less than five. We travel a lot. A lot. And this was by far the best hotel experience I can remember. Wish I could give them a few more stars.Excellent hotel! For such a reasonable price, I was amazed at the rooms and amenities. The beds are great, the rooms are modern and spotless, the complimentary breakfast is awesome, and the staff is very helpful! Will def be back:)One of the best hotels with a full breakfast menu & made to order omelets.  Worth the cost & value.  Oh, & this place is new, just built.Great spot near entertainment and restaurants. Very modern, awesome breakfast and cocktail hour, and great service. Wouldn't choose anything else.Beautiful modern hotel, shuttle service to and from brick town, staff friendly and helpful, room service quick and great coconut cream pie!! Thank YouAmazing and new hotel. Evening reception is great. Thank you for having warm water in the pool. In the past we had inside hotel pools with cold water. Couldn't even swim in it. Will definitely stay here again. We didn't want to go home.Hotel is nice and very new.  I am leaving a poor review due to leaving a phone charger in the room that was missing after the room was cleaned.  Inquired with the front desk twice about the missing charger and received no help.Stayed here for a business trip. The hotel was clean and the service was fantastic. Everyone really went above and beyond to make our trip enjoyable. Highly recommend!New hotel with a great location close to town.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Two in particular: Mike (maintenance engineer) and Ellis (waiter) were helpful and very personable.  The free breakfast buffet was amazing and bountiful, sometimes forcing us to skip lunch.  Room was spacious and quite comfortable.

The room...no complaints. The staff....well....disappointing. I got stuck there during the latest snow storm over Christmas break. I paid for 3 nights because I anticipated that the hotel would get overbooked due to the impending storm. I was right. Well, that didn't stop the front desk team from in activating my room keys EVERY SINGLE DAY "just in case" I had left without telling them. I mean, I prepaid...?Also, buffet breakfast is only offered during sat and sun. However they have a bar! And are right across from a decent restaurant.We ended up here as part of a wedding block. The proximity to the airport was great, but overall, the area was worn down, as was the hotel.At first I was very happy with this hotel. Then came breakfast. The sales manager was taking "breakfast tickets" which they gave us at check in the night before. My husband and sons were there about 15 minutes ahead of us and when we have her our tickets she looked at the sign in sheet and said you should only have 4 breakfasts. I told her they gave us 5 when we checked in. Honestly we didn't even have to ask the desk clerk just handed me one for each of us. She said well I'll let you have the extra breakfast today, which didn't go well for me because we're staying for multiple days. After breakfast I went to the front desk to clarify and it turns out she's the sales manager. During the conversation her story changed from your room (a suite by the way) usually gets 4 tickets to your room usually gets 2 tickets. Why would a room advertised as accommodating 5 people come with 4 much less 2 breakfasts? We found out from the desk clerk that additional breakfasts are only $5. Why would a sales manager make such a big deal about that. Her demeanor was bad the whole time she never smiled even when we first approached her, and honestly should have been able to fix such a small issue with minimal effort. The breakfast was very standard nothing you don't get at any other hotel.I booked this room through hotwire for a one night stay. As I was pulling into the parking lot, I noticed that there were ALOT of cars, and I do mean ALOT. I walked inside the hotel and immediately noticed that there were a TON of kids, which made me a little annoyed to be honest. I was greeted by a nice lady in which she took me through the check in process.
