While I was checking in, I asked the lady why there were so many kids at the hotel in which she replied that there was a cheerleading competition going on. I then asked the lady if I could be as far away as possible from the kids due to the fact that I did not wanna hear kids running and screaming in the hallway all night. She agreed to put me in a room far away in which I was grateful.NOTE: Please be advised that this particular hotel is near the airport and surrounded by other hotels, HOWEVER, the area appears to be a little sketchy, so please be a little alert if arriving in the evening or late night. NOW ON TO THE ROOM:The room was......a little disappointing to be honest. I booked a 3.5 star hotel and would think that hotel would have been a lot better than I expected. Now when I stay at hotels, I become super paranoid, due to the fact that I'm so afraid that I'm gonna get eaten alive by bed bugs, come across bodily fluids, etc., so as SOON as I opened the door, I sat my suitcase on the luggage rack and IMMEDATELY stripped the sheets off of the bed to check for bed bugs. I found no bed bugs which was a huge relief for me. Next, I checked the bathroom. The bathroom was tiny and dark which made me a little uneasy. It kinda reminded me of a bathroom out of a horror movie. Also, the bathroom door was starting to dry rot.As I'm looking around the room I notice that there was a gap between the carpet and the baseboards; you can see the concrete beneath. Looks like the room had a bad carpet job. So at the end of the day, the room was okay, nothing special. Would I PERSONALLY stay at this hotel again? No, but again, this is my own personal opinion.I stayed at this hotel on December 21st, I picked this place because it had a deal on hotels.com . We were greeted by a nice man whenever we walked in. I continued to give him my first & last name since I booked the hotel online before we arrived. He gave us our room key and on we went. We get to our room to see that it was connected to another hotel room! We could hear them perfectly and I would have been more annoyed but we left to go have a bite at Chilis by the hotel. Whenever we got back I called the front desk and asked about the time breakfast was served in the morning & he responded 6-10. The next morning we woke up & went downstairs for breakfast & they asked for our 'breakfast ticket' what!? I talked to a employee not once but twice and was never told about this & whenever I asked the front desk it was because I didn't spend enough on my hotel room. Wow! I spent $75 on my hotel room you would think that would be included. I left extremely annoyed and I will never be back!Check in was terrible. I waited for several minutes while two people helped one group. Finally, I was asked what they could help me with, only to be interrupted by another guest wanting to move his car to a more "well lit" area due to a run in with someone earlier. The manager denied his request, stating that it would not be an issue for him. We are in the middle of some terrible weather in Oklahoma, so I was going to give a bit of benefit of the doubt. After reading the other reviews, I see this is not isolated. The hotel layout is terrible, and the room numbering is not intuitive. This is very frustrating when you are lugging a heavy luggage cart in the evening. Which you will be doing alone as none of the front desk people can help you. Lovely. This is an airport area hotel, and the area is very sketchy. There is absolutely no way I would ever stay in this hotel again.The pits. Dirty depressing. Rude. Food like in the army. This is a mid-century modern hotel from the 5-60's. Would be amazing if restored. Carpets filthy. Room over-scented with air freshener. I was 15 minutes late for breakfast - when I asked the waitress if my card was still goos she grabbed out of my hand.Signage for non-intuitive room numbering is nonexistent. You think they'd tell you that '300' rooms are on 2 when you get a key, and that the elevator is hidden in a back hallway.We had 9 rooms, so you'd think they'd at least be gracious. Even at $99.00 it's a bummer.Got the blind deal.Probably the best hotel on the strip.Area looked sketchy. There was some sort of car event happening so there were cops pulling over people EVERYWHERE - it looked like an episode of CopsStaff was wonderful.Room was nicer than the building/area made it seem it could be.Pillows were surprising small but surprisingly comfortable (bed was comfortable also).Nice bang for the buck.I tried to like it!When we drove up it is an ok looking hotel, nothing really eye-appealing or detouring. I went to check in, the two ladies behind desk stopped what they where doing to jump and help me. The lady was friendly and got me all checked. I confirmed a room with two queen beds, which she said yes. The hotel was clean and looked very nice. A nice surprise to what you think when you drive up. As stated in other reviews the layout is not your typical hotel, but pretty common with Wyngate. Just takes a second to get your bearings. This is pretty much the end of the positive experience.We get to the room and see it is a king bed and sofa sleeper. Ok 5 ppl (2 adults/3 kids) we have slept in smaller. Not that big a deal even though it was confirmed two queens. Son plugs in iPad by sofa-sleeper and finds a dirty shirt. Again I'm staying positive, things happen. I start setting sofa sleeper and pull out extra pillow to find hair all over blanket and pillow case. Still some people think they being helpful and put stuff away before checking out...accidents happen. I take the shirt to the front desk and a lady asks if I need help. I hand her the shirt and explain the pillow/blanket issue. I get an "ok what room". I tell her my room and move on. When I see her hand the shirt to another lady who gives me a dirty look as she walks it into a room behind the desk. Ok I'm still trying to like the hotel but it's getting harder. Finally a lady shows up with a blanket and no pillow case. I ask her to bring me a pillow case too please. She does after a couple minutes. So from here I can still say , yea it's ok hotel.In morning I walk to front desk to ask about breakfast. An older bellman reading the paper barely looks up and suggests McDonalds. Caught off guard I said, well I'm not from around here, and not really looking fast food. How about a good breakfast for a family? Still not really looking up, he points out door and says "waffle house"That did it. Nice hotel from the first impression. Staff, service and closer look killed this stay.Coming in the door we weren't sure what to expect from the smoke smell but upon entering the room it was inviting with a cute color scheme! The beds were incredibly comfortable and the mirror an awesome size. The curve shower curtain was the real dealBeen to OKC a couple of times for NAIA national championships. Meridian offers a convenient location but some sub par accommodations. Wyndham Garden offers the best spot on the Meridian Strip.Had some issues upon check in but manager came through an made the changes.Not the Ritz but the best you'll find in this area.In an agri-industrial area of the city, this hotel stands out among its peers. Mostly due to the wonderful service I receive here. I always book with the reservation coordinator , Cindy, and she goes well out of her way to make my stay enjoyable. For example, the travel package I get here provides a rental car with the room. On the one occasion the car was not immediately available, Cindy made certain to notify me when it was, and ensured I was aware of alternate transportation. I really appreciate her helpfulness and choose this hotel when in Oklahoma City almost exclusively because of it. The building itself is old, but the rooms have been updated. The facility sprawls, laid out with a few wings. All the appliances are new, and I had a microwave and fridge in my room. Clean as any comparable hotel. Lots of available parking. And an onsite bar and restaurant. The fitness center has two treadmills, both of which are in good working shape. There's an indoor pool and billiards table. Wi-Fi is a little slow, but complementary, so I can't complain. Oh, and a convenient airport shuttle. Again, so far as the hotel itself goes: it's pretty average, with no one negative aspect that I can think of. But the service is excellent, and makes this the choice for me when I am in the area.Here for an FAA conferenceRegarding the room . . .It's your typical hotel. If motel 6/red roof inn were rated 1/5and double tree or hilton 5/5this would be 3/5PROS:Showers were hotrooms had a fridge and microwave CONS:Most people at the conference said they had difficulty sleeping, either the bed or the pillowsSome channels on TV did not workNo safe in the roomTook more than 55 minutes for lunch!! UNACCEPTABLE!!Special of the day: brisket sandwich for $12, sounds like a deal right? Not really, it was the same price on the menu, and you can order it any day LOLLecture ended at 1205, break for lunch until 1300It was raining outside some of us decided to eat at the hotel. We sat at the table, and the waitress was visually overwhelmed because she had about 6 tables at once. (any where from 1-4 people per table). She went out of her way to let us know she was overwhelmed. Funny, because it seemed like she WENT SLOWER because there were more people there.We got our order in at about 1220, by 1255, the food was not yet out, so I told her to void the order and left to get back to lecture. Most of the other tables had to quickly box their lunchesThis place is supposed to be 3.5 star hotel. But it should rly be 1 star hotel. Room is very damp and smells bad and the building is very old. Their bed is good but smells bad. Avoid this place.I booked Wyndham Garden OKC by "naming my own price" on Priceline, which is essentially like hotel roulette. I got a fantastic deal on the room and, frankly, I got what I paid for.The room was a decent size, and looked nice, but there were a few issues:1) The bottom sheet barely fit on the bed. We actually had them bring us another sheet and tried putting it on ourselves to no avail. It constantly came off in the night and we weren't all that "active" ifyouknowwhatimean. This wasn't a huge deal, but a bit annoying. Also: Bring a pillow or 4 unless you like sleeping flat on your back.2) The bathroom is... weird. First off, it's tiny. To open and close the door, you actually had to stand behind the toilet. Secondly, the shower doesn't have a door... it just has half a pane of glass nearest the shower head and the rear is left open, meaning you will get water on the floor and get a bit chilly if you back up too far. The water pressure was nice and stout, but actually getting the temperature right required you to stand under the freezing spray. Again, not a huge deal, but annoying.3) The "free" breakfast buffet is only free if they give you a little ticket when you check in. Otherwise, it's $10+. While the quality is really good, it's very limited (waffle maker, cereal, eggs, biscuits, bacon, and oatmeal).The staff was really fantastic, from the front desk to the dining area and housekeeping. Really exemplary work. The room LOOKS very nice and not at all unseemly. I would book WG again at that price without hesitation.Great hotel, friendly staff and very comfortable beds, I got a great nights sleep.A nicely remodeled holiday inn. Quiet, convenient, comfortable. Nice pool, plenty of parking etc etc. Found it economical as well. Helpful staff. Dinner there was good, breakfast no very good-but free. Lots of restaurants nearby, but a bit out of the way for evdrything else. Would stay there again on a heartbeat.Sometimes I have to be in Oklahoma City for extended periods (weeks) of time. I've been pretty loyal to the hotels I stay at, however this was last minute and I had to switch up places to stay. The employees at the Wyndham Garden really came through for me. I had been in there when a friend stayed before, but never stayed there myself. The rooms are in great shape and have up to date furniture and TV's. A 42" plasma TV in this size room is way more than enough. I can hook up my XBOX through HDMI and play away. The wireless internet is open and is good enough for games both on PC and XBOX. It is a little restrictive though so you might have trouble connecting to your buddies.For guests they have a managers reception (free food) every Tuesday. They used to have fantastic buffalo wings, but I think that chef took his recipe with him when he left. Now it's mostly baked potatoes and tacos. But hey, it's free food. The workout room has one good treadmill and one that will only let you run for 10 minutes. I don't know what the deal with that is, but they have a bunch of other equipment too. The beds are very comfortable and the whole place just seems professional and clean. All the tops in my room are marble too. I do miss having a bathtub, but the walk in shower is pretty classy.This is one of the best hotel experiences I've had. I'll definitely come back here next time I'm in OKC. The sales lady even bakes cookies for FAA employees and hand delivers them!Everything was great, except the TV in our room was really snowy.

Disclaimer: My 5 stars are for Nancy only and the customer service that she provided when I called into the hotel and when I actually arrived. I made a reservation for the 20th, but I was delayed and didn't arrive until the 21st (today). I was afraid that nothing would be done, so I tried to get another room and had a HORRIFIC experience (Read my other hotel review from today), one that I didn't share with Nancy. Even though Nancy knew nothing of my stressful situation that had just happened, she was very kind and empathetic. She went above and beyond for me and I say this because I know that she DIDN'T HAVE TO DO ANYTHING FOR ME. She moved my reservation to today without penalty or extra cost. I was able to check in early....it was just nice. And it reminded me that "At the end of the day people won't remember what you said or did, they will remember how you made them feel." Maya Angelou......It made me feel good that I didn't have to put forth any effort for her to help me....she just saw a human being and helped....I want to say this, performing the duties on your job description is doing the job that you're being paid to do, but doing something that is not expected of you OR required of you, but helps the "customer" and doesn't hurt the company....to me that's CUSTOMER SERVICE. AND it becomes the foundation for retaining repeat customers. Thank you from us!This place.... Where do I even begin!?The rooms are 90's chic, which means carpeted everything (I'll call it vintage, because it was clearly original). It was clean, but was not at all what I expected from a Hilton.The breakfast was sub par, with watery eggs, pre-cooked, questionable looking sausage, and room temperature yogurt (and cash price is $9, aka outrageous). The staff was nice, but always assumed you were paying in cash as opposed to the coupons you're given at check in.But I think the biggest issue I have is with the front desk staff- they were rude and I had several problems during my stay.Starting from check in- they didn't have me down for the right number of days (my confirmation said 3 nights, they had me down for 2). When I checked in they couldn't find my reservation, and proceeded to argue with me through the entire process.It was ultimately decided that I should speak to the manager in the morning about the additional day. When I did, I was told that they didn't have any rooms available, because they had a large group booked. After much more arguing, they decided they did find a room,but that I would have to move. The entire fiasco was blamed on a faulty computer system (which still doesn't account for the rude interactions).They offered to move my stuff for me, and give me extra points for the inconvenience (still to be received).I'm disappointed because I'm a frequent Hilton flyer, and have never been treated as such an inconvenience before.They won't be getting my business again, and I recommend you do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.This is a nice hotel located less than ten minutes from the airport. There is a restaurant and full bar inside that stays open till ten if you don't want to venture out beyond the front doors. Otherwise there's plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The rooms are spacious with plenty of room for two people. The double rooms have two queen size beds in them with a desk and small sitting area. The bathrooms are a bit small but not horribly tight. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again if in the area.This HGI, is okay, not great. I wouldn't choose to stay for more than one night and even with that I think that there are better options not too far. It is clean and the staff is friendly, but you can tell that it's an older property with moderate updates. Thin walls, noisy AC unit.Great hotel, clean rooms and easy access to  dining options and the airport.  The staff is great And willing to help you with whatever you need.Not bad at all.  It was clean, and the front desk was friendly.  They do not offer free breakfast.If I can't get into the nearby Homewood Suites, my second choice would be this Hilton Garden Inn when staying in town. (I'm a Hilton Family chain user and usually stick to only Hilton hotels when traveling.)It's easy to find from the airport, located north of the airport, on the same street. Also, I like their comfy, Sleep Number beds and their buffet breakfast (free for HHonors Gold and Diamond members.) The staff have been welcoming and very accomodating these past few visits as well. Extra perk: they offer free rides to and from the airport.Room was clean and ready. Hotel overall is nice and I feel the price was really good for what I got. The front desk girl did the basics and nothing more. She seemed like all she would do is provide average customer service. The evening cookies were hard as rocks and tasted nasty. If the front desk reception would have been better I'd given them 4 stars.The hotel was the best I've stayed in, in ages! It was immaculately clean and the front desk staff was so kind. My room wasn't ready when I arrived a bit early, so they upgraded me free of charge to a suite. The suite was wonderful-spacious with a door on the bedroom, away from restroom & living room. There are microwaves & refrigerators in the rooms, which makes utilizing their 24 hr snack bar convenient. Upon leaving, the front desk let me keep an item there for another person to pick up the next day. The single downside was that on a weekend day, the pool was closed for reconditioning. I highly suggest staying here!!This hotel had the most amazingly accommodating staff EVER! They all went above and beyond to create a perfect weekend for a group of friends that all stayed there for a wedding. A+ service from beginning to end. I highly reccomend this   Hotel for anyone in the area looking to stay! Top notch Hilton Garden Inn crew!!Very quiet!  Nice accommodations, amenities are the best.  Great location, close to airport, I-40, and Oklahoma City.  Restaurants are near by, we has a great dinner last night.  Room was terrific.  Very friendly folks, helpful and quality service.Very comfortable and clean room. Great staff that were very helpful and a solid dinner. Laundry facilities were also spotless and the pool was well needed at this point on the book tour. Would come back here in an instant.Not impressed. The TV reception is junk, as it the channel navigation setup. My shower head is broken and won't stay in place. I'm charged the same rate for a handicap double as my coworkers who have kings. The breakfast is $10! We had rooms for 2 weeks but we're changing hotels after this week is overI'm currently sitting in the lobby as we speak. I have never met sweeter workers in my life. The dark haired young woman behind the front desk is so sweet. The younger lady working as the waitress is also one of the sweetest people. Its almost 11pm and I have not felt pressure once that I needed to leave. In fact she told me I can stay as long as I need. Originally had a room at the howard johnson down the street. After being terrified to even get out of my car over there I came and got a room here last minute. Well worth the extra money! STAY HERE!I stay at a lot of Garden Inns across the country, but this is the first time I've felt compelled to say anything about one. They are so consistent (and I stay at so many of them) it hardly bears writing a review in most cases.Except this one. I have to say, while overall the hotel is just like any other Garden Inn, the staff here has been without exception among the best of any I've stayed at (many). Despite being a bit overwhelmed with stranded travelers, the staff really did a great job keeping up, staying positive and, I think, keeping everyone happy. Kudos to the OK City staff.I am a big Hilton fan and stay with them most of the time on the road.  This Hilton Garden Inn is very nice.  They have recently upgraded the rooms with flat screens, new Sleep number ( Type) mattress.   Even while I was here they updated the Thermostat to a Digital unit.  The staff is top notch and I will stay here again.

hotel_name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Oklahoma City - NW Expwy
review_content: Stayed here on a recent visit to OKC despite reading the reviews in prior to making the reservation.  Unfortunately the reviews were accurate as the interior was stoic reliving a look and feel from the 1990's.  My room was initially on the 6th floor but I switched after discovering my window lock was broken and the AC was slow to turn on.The front desk staff was hospitable during check-in, room switch, and check-out.  The continental breakfast was better than average as hot biscuits and gravy was served along with the typical offerings.  Overall I'd rate La Quinta 2.5 stars (1 star = interior, 3 star = customer service and food).One of the worst hotel breakfast I've ever had. If they can't afford decent quality, why even bother?I was most disappointed by the biscuits and gravy. The biscuits were very stale and dry. They must have been around for at least several days. The room was updated and clean, but my favorite morning hotel ritual was a huge letdown.My name is Nic I stay with La Quinta about 300 nights a year. I always book a two room suit..  currently I'm staying at 4829 NW expressway.  I stay here only for the convenience of business.   This last year I have spent over $26,000 with La Quinta..  I have earned 32 nights free this last year!!      This Last month I have had Fraud twice..   I checked in for a five night stay on NW expressway.  When I checked in this last time I used points to check in for the first night.  When I checked in I told the front desk clerk about the problem.  He said that paying on Monday would not be a problem sense they know me, and my elite status!!  I was so thankful for the understanding!!  I assured him I would be down before noon on Monday to pay my stay in full!!    While waiting in line to check in!  I use the restroom in the lobby by the breakfast room!!  It had not been cleaned in a week or two as you can see in the picture!! There was piss and pubic hair caked on all the urinals and toilets!  I then Presided to my room to unload!!  When I got into the room it was NOT clean!  The toilet was nasty!!  The sheet rock above the tub was falling had holes in it!!        The second day into my stay!  Reann one of the managers of the hotel started calling asking for payment or they are going to call the police  of the managers of the hotel..   I let her know when I checked into the hotel I let the front desk clerk know what was going on and he said there would be no problem due to being elite members to let us finalize payment of our bill Monday morning before noon..  She proceeded to say if there was a payment made within the next 10 minutes they would be calling the police for trespassing!  Asking to speak to Amanda the general manager.  She was off for a few days for Thanksgiving she called us back and was even ruder then her employees.    She also said we must be out within 30 minutes...  So I called a Business partner of mine to come and put his credit card on file so we was not thrown out like dogs.  Later that evening our keys  was not working to the room.    I went down to the desk to get keys reprogrammed!!  That was a major deal the hotel clerk looked at the screen funny and then walked away.  A manager then walked up and read and said you were not paid we cannot reprint keys!  I proceeded to say yes we are paid for our stay!  Then they said oh I see it here now you are paid!  then ask for my ID and asked who I was!! They then re-keyed my room for me! Every time I stayed at this location I question the cleanliness, disorganization of the hotel!!  The only reason I stay at this location is because of location !!  They are always very hard to get on the phone for questions or to book a room!!  "I like to book through the hotel directly so I am sure I get the two room suite I always get"  I do once in a while partake in the breakfast!  While eating breakfast you can see all the disorganization that goes on during breakfast and at the front desk!!  The few times I've ate breakfast the front desk manager and or clerk is running between breakfast room and the front desk trying to take care of both areas!!  Impossible to do efficiently!!  It causes either people waiting in line at the front desk to check out, The phone ringing off the hook, and breakfast to not be stocked/kept up.  They do serve a biscuit and gravy that a lot of LaQuinta's do not!  The gravies normally made fresh however the biscuits are left above the gravy on a open tray!  They are not pre heated and they are dried out which flights on them most of the time!!  A lot of the time the hallways stink of cigarette smoke or piss!!  "Dog piss"  The sixth  floor at this hotel is supposed to be a smoking floor!!  However you can smell it on most floors and a lot of marijuana smells!  I am not sure if they have a lot of drug problems or prostitution problems at this location!!  However it does strongly seem like it the way they treat their guests as if they're used to dealing with that kind of people..  I have noticed in the back parking lot a lot of times there are people sitting in their cars looking very suspicious.I am not sure why it took so long for me to realize that I should not stay at this hotel!  I guess the main reason is I stay with La Quinta in every city that it's available and for Oklahoma City this is by far the best location!   I was trying to look past the end cleaning us and the condition of the hotel along with everything else because of location! This last stay is my Will be my last!  I do hope whoever owns this hotel does realize there is major issues and find new management to clean up the mess!  Being a businessman myself! General managers are always The result of how good or bad A pacific location of business is ran!  Amanda was more worried about talking to her family more than the guest she was on the phone with!  As she kept talking to other people while telling me to pay now, or get out! She has a disorganized hotel & filthy !!!I stayed here for two night December 3rd & 4th in room 416.   When I checked out I showed the front desk the bed bug bites I had on my arm.  I further told them to take the room out of service.  Send me proof of treatment and I would not write a negative review.   After a couple of days I sent an email to corporate.  I received basically the same response. That they had had the room inspected and there were no bed bugs.  Lol. I suggested maybe they get better inspectors and sent them pictures of the bites.  The response was they were sorry I had "challenges" during my stay.   Hopefully I will be able to attach pictures so you can be the judge.   Overall the hotel was clean.   Another guest could have brought them in.  All I wanted was for them to fix the problem. Their solution was to deny it existed and to not do anything to make it right.I stayed at a lot of la quinta hotels when I was traveling across the country. They allow pets which made the decision for me. This was one of the cleaner looking ones. The room was smaller than other rooms I had stayed in but it didn't bother me too much. I felt safe on the first floor. The lobby was okay looking and they provided free breakfast. The buffet was not the best though. Other hotels I stayed at stunk highly of cleaners but this one wasn't too bad.I give this property 4 stars based on other La Quinta Inns. This is one of the nicest I've stayed at and I've stayed at a lot while traveling across the country. It's in a convenient location and is very clean and safe. It is also nice if you are traveling with pets as they don't charge. If you are traveling through OKC, consider stopping here.Stayed here for 3 weeks and I was very impressed. The beds are comfy ! The room service is on the ball! The location is great because your by a lot of restaurants and stores and for me I was happy there was a petco and petsmart right down the street considering I had my 2 dogs. One of the main reasons why I like to stay at La Quinta is because of their pet policy. I was able to have my 2 dogs with me and did not have to pay a deposit . They keep it very clean here and there is lots of parking ! The staff is very helpful.  My only complaint is the breakfast though , they can broaden it more. Ive been to other locations of this hotel that serves sausage and cereal. After a while I got sick of the waffle machine and store bought muffins but other than that I was really happy ......after all I did stay a whole 3 weeks haha.Clean room, comfy bed and great service. Hotel is a little old, but maintained. For a nights stay it is a good deal!Staff was friendly but unfortunately not informed or informative about parking, location of room, check out time, breakfast hours, etc. Room was spacious but lacked attention to detail; shower curtain was inside out (they have words in them and having stayed at a nicer La Quinta I knew it was hung wrong, which also caused some flooding), tub was dirty/slippery, and a few other random things. Not bad, just a weird experience.Not one of the best :-/Because of my job I was able to stay at this hotel for an entire month. Please keep in mind that I did not pick the hotel, it was selected for me. The staff is friendly. The rooms are clean for the most part. I had to write a note for housekeeping to change my dirty duvet cover after taking it off and putting it in the floor didn't work. I will be the first to say that I like pet friendly hotels (I have two dogs that I sometimes travel with), but now after being kept awake by barking on two different nights it would be nice if a floor were reserved for no pets. Along those lines, if smoking rooms are offered please make sure your ventilation is appropriate. I'm supposed to be two floors down from smoking, but had to call for room deodorization at one point. The bed is very comfortable with a selection of pillows. Free WiFi. Good room temperature control. This is a clean and comfortable place to stay for a night if you don't have a barking dog next to you. I will not likely stay here again.Excellent and very clean.  Dog friendly hotels are hard to find.  After staying at the La Quinta Airport location for years this place is 100% better. It lacks a business center so bring your laptop.Your dog will like it !Okay, I didn't actually stay here. But I encountered really useless customer service that I think is a fair reflection of the place. Allow me to explain:I mistakenly showed up at this property instead of the La Quinta 6 miles down the road that I was actually booked at. It was about 7:30 in the evening. My husband and I had been driving for 500 miles on day four of a cross-country road trip, and we just wanted to rest.I walked up to the desk clerk and gave her my name to check in. She said, "There's nothing here under that name." She asked me to spell it (a 5-letter last name) about 10 times. When I shared my confirmation number with her, she was stone-faced. "I don't have anything here." I was so confused, so I just kept repeating the number. I mean, someone GAVE me this number - I obviously wasn't making it up. I repeated the address to confirm I was at the right hotel. Still, no help. Finally, I gave her the phone number I had. Saying nothing to me, she picked up the phone and called what I soon learned was another La Quinta hotel. It became apparent I was booked at that one.So I asked what you might expect - if we could just stay at her hotel since they are the same chain and we were already there. Without so much as a hesitation to consider whether or not that would be possible, she shot back, "No, it's after 6:00. And I can't cancel you after 6:00. If you stayed here, you'd have to pay for both rooms." Wow - way to problem-solve, lady. And thank you for that.I don't know how the mistake was made - if it was me or the booking agent - it doesn't even matter. But she clearly just didn't care to help me out at all. Again, I don't know what the rooms are like - the hotel overall looked nice enough - but shame on them for that service.The hotel itself is ok at best. The only upside is outdoor pool and great service.I write this review using the free wifi in my room at the La Quinta. :-) What is there to say? It's a nice room, clean. The beds were made. The furnishings are not exactly modern but they aren't bad, either. The room was warm and the thermostat said 72 so that's inaccurate. Still, when I cranked it down to 65 it came on the room is nice now. The shower is a bit low on the ol' flow but the water was hot and I am clean so no complaints. I have to say that the girl behind the counter was efficient at checking us in but not exactly helpful in finding us a good restaurant. She recommended a national pizza chain. Uh, no. She couldn't direct us to a cigar bar, either but offered to look it up for us. Again, not helpful as I could do that faster myself. But, she did offer. All in all, it's been an OK experience. OK, as in...Oklahoma.

hotel_name: Ambassador Hotel Oklahoma City, Autograph Collection
review_content: I feel like I'm staying at a showroom for Restoration Hardware. Not that I've seen these exact pieces there but it has that feel. Super cozy bed, amazingly comfortable and a great night rest. I stay in a lot of hotels, this place is really a step above. Great staff, beautiful rooms and amazingly quiet. I'll definitely stay here again.Yay! I'm a fan.This is a lovely little hotel.My room was awesome. Everything was chic, clean, and had really nice touches. I was here for work and I felt a little odd, like I should be here for a sexy weekend getaway with a boyfriend.Don't bother with valet, there is free street parking to the south of the building.The gym is disconnected in an office building, which was a little odd. Not many of the guests go to the gym (probably there for a sexy vacation getting in other forms of exercise ;) ), so I was almost always alone and there were people randomly walking by the window, occasionally looking in.Oh, and don't go to the restaurant nor bar in this hotel. They're both quite bad.The Ambassador is a great find in OKC.  In a trendy, up-and-coming part of town this hotel is trendy, funky and surely a cornerstone of the growth this section of town is experiencing.The building is relatively non-description, almost bland in external appearance.  Pull up in front on Walker and a bellman/valet will greet your arrival.  The lobby is cozy and comfortable, and check in is efficient.  Upgraded to a corner suite was a benefit of a recent visit! The rooms are well appointed, clean and functional.  It has all the things you'd expect at an Autograph Collection property.  Beds are comfortable and bathrooms are glass and granite and cool tile.I found only two issues.  One is that the bathroom door is a sliding barn-door style design that does not provide much privacy.  The other is that the street outside can be noisy, and sound deadening is not a strong point in the hotel's design.The Viceroy restaurant located off of the lobby is very good for dinner, specializing in creative, fresh dishes.  It is a bit pricey, though, for those of you on expense accounts.  It's also open for breakfast.The Ambassador's staff is pleasant and efficient.  I definitely recommend The Ambassador as a top shelf hotel pick in OKC.If you enjoy noisy hotels and are an early riser, this may be the spot for you.  I just spent three nights at this hotel and my favorite part of the experience was checking out.  The street noise at this hotel is rivaled only by the slamming door noise that is present any time a guest enters or leaves their room.  At first I thought we just had inconsiderate people staying on our floor but after trying to quietly close my own room door I realized that it is impossible.  The doors cannot be closed quietly.  Additionally, the elevator "ding" can be clearly heard.  We originally stayed in Room 606, but requested a room change around midnight on the second night of our stay.  The noise from a Harley motorcycle which kept riding past our hotel was unbearable.  Additionally, this hotel attracts quite a crowd to the "O" bar on Fridays and Saturdays and the festive (read: drunk) revelers who were streaming in could also be easily heard from our room.  The hotel staff didn't seem to care too much about our feedback and weren't super helpful in coordinating our room move.  When we asked for a quieter location, they asked us how we felt about elevator noise.  Apparently, no room is free from some sort of noise, though Room 606 seems to suffer from all kinds.  While the interior and exterior noise was annoying, my biggest issue was the phone call we received at 7:10 am on Saturday morning.  Someone rang and then hung up before I could reach the phone.  While this may have simply been a wrong number, I happen to think that it was the front desk calling to follow-up on our midnight call regarding the room change and that the person calling didn't notice the early hour.  Regardless, I didn't have to be awake at that time on Saturday and due to the previous nights noise, I was hoping to sleep late (or at least until 8am).  In summary, I'd suggest staying at a different hotel.  Aside from the noise, there weren't too many amenities at this hotel - the gym was tiny, dated and had little to no equipment and the pool was closed so we didn't use that.  There isn't too much to do near this hotel and our friends who stayed in hotels closer to Bricktown seemed to have more options to walk to.  One insider tip if you do stay at the Ambassador - the front desk has ear plugs available, even though they claim not to be aware of the noise issues we encountered.The Ambassador is very nicely done. The furnishings are tasteful, the beds are comfortable and it is a quiet place. The 7th floor bar offers great views of the city and the bartenders are attentive. They offer the standard cocktails and they do some originals with local ingredients. They do not carry any NA beers though they did offer to run out and buy some (nice touch, first class). The Viceroy Grille has a solid menu featuring locally sourced ingredients. The bathroom doors are the roll across type that look really cool but they do not seal. It has about the same effect as pulling a loose shower curtain across the bathroom door. Just know that anything going on in the bathroom is going to be heard loud and clear throughout the entire room. I don't get it, sacrificing privacy for coolness is not a desirable trait as it relates to bathrooms. The rooms have white plantation shutters that go well with the neutral walls however, the shutters do not seal out much light. If you're trying to sleep in, best bring something to cover your eyes. The valet is iffy. We left our car out front, locked it and wound up handing the keys to the valet as we entered the hotel at least twice. I don't know where they valet the cars but it is outdoors. It rained the night we were there and our car was dirty when they brought it around at checkout. All in all a nice hotel, great concept and pretty well executed.We stayed at the Ambassador this weekend and overall I was very impressed. The hotel was easy to find and located in a cool part of town near Downtown Oklahoma City. It reminded me a lot of the Power and Light District in Kansas City. The hotel was very clean, well maintained, and beautifully decorated. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful.The price for a night was a little higher than the other hotels ($205 ish) in the area, but for a few extra dollars you are getting a huge upgrade in terms of finishings. Also, it either wasn't mentioned in our booking or it was somewhere in the fine print, but parking is not free unless you can find a spot on the street outside the hotel (we never did). Just to park your own car in the hotel lot was $16 per night, and to have Valet park for you, it was an extra $3 plus tip. I really think those kinds of prices for parking are a little ridiculous, especially considering we stayed on a Thursday night when the hotel was not very busy. The main problem that I had with the Ambassador, and the reason I am not giving the hotel a 5 Star rating, is the noise level. We went to a concert and did not get back to our room until 1:30 am. We crawled into bed ready to sleep in the next morning but we were unable to do so. I don't know if the windows are incredibly cheap or old, but I could literally hear everything going on outside on the street below. A bus or something big rumbled by a little after 6 am and it sounded like they were going to park inside our room. It never really got quiet again after that. All morning busses, garbage trucks, and other loud vehicles could be heard going down the street. Also, once people started to leave for the morning we could hear the word for word conversations they were having standing down on the street while waiting for the Valet. We were up on the fifth floor which just seems crazy that it could have been so loud. It was literally like there were no windows at all and every sound was amplified into our room. It was not a pleasant sleeping experience, especially after getting to bed so late. In our booking, we requested the quietest room they had knowing we were going to be sleeping in later the next day. I hate to think if that actually was the quietest room they had.Somehow I lucked up and my company discount was cheaper here than other standard hotels in the Marriott chain (Springhill, Courtyard, etc)...so I decided to try the rest of my week out here after 1 night at the Renaissance downtown.My expectations were exceeded from the building itself, to the interior decor, to the room, and service.Only negative is that I was told (by valet attendent) that valet was X amount, parking in their lot was X amount, and to self park on the street was free. Since it seemed light and I wanted quick access to my vehicle, I chose to self park. When my invoice was emailed to me, I noticed I was charge each night for parking in their lot.It was certainly the best hotel I've stayed at in OKC, hands down. Also has great restaurants across the street and within a quick skip down the street.Arrived at valet. Walked in the big doors and was greeted promptly by the front desk. They were quick about checking me in, friendly, and courteous and smiling. Their tone and energy we're inviting and welcoming. I came up to my room and smiled when I opened the door. The decor and detail to the little things made me immediately relaxed. The bed is very comfy. The bathroom and shower are great. Love the area the hotel is in and the bar on the rooftop is lovely. As a local who had a stay-cation here, I will absolutely recommend this hotel to colleagues and to friends and other locals. Love this place.Met friends at the restaurant in the hotel. We had the best dinner. My pork roast melted in my mouth. So tender, excellent taste. Calamari was excellent. Staff were professional and described the meal options so elegantly, I wanted to try all of them. Atmosphere was quiet, tables were at enough distance we could speak without being over heard. I highly recommend this restaurant!!!Upon arrival  (at check-in time) no one was at the valet so we just parked on the street. No big deal. We walk in to the door being opened, nice. I walk to the front desk and say hello and provide my last name. She says, "give me a minute". After a few minutes she asks me my name again. I tell her we parked in the street as no one was at valet and she says, "I don't make him stand out there". There's really not a place to park for valet so that's a bit confusing. Again, not a big deal but service was disappointing at check-in. A week prior I had use the automated form on the website to inquire about massage services in the room and no response. If I cared to much I would have called but a response would be nice. Room is very nice and awesome view of OKC skyline. Large space. Very comfortable bed.Restaurant was good. Breakfast was especially great! Bar was nice but small outdoor area.Stunning hotel. Very clean and the staff was amazing. Felt extremely modern and well done.Great hotel in midtown. The revival is happening and this hotel is in the perfect location. You have a ton of quality restaurants within walking distance, access to spoakie bike sharing, a dog park, a community garden and so much more! The Ambassador does everything right, they just need more of a presence at the front desk. And they should serve drinks and food poolside.The Ambassador is situated in a very busy hub! It's right in the heart of midtown within walking distance to some great local eateries. I took the grand tour last week with Jesse Krewall and am very excited to share the news.This building was originally used for medical offices, but you could hardly tell. The interior smells brand spanking new with beautifully painted walls, carpet and chic interior. It's considered a "boutique" hotel because it's petite with only 54 rooms and 7 floors. On the first floor you'll find their restaurant Viceroy Grill. Towards the back of the hotel  (still on the first floor) you'll find the mini pool. Believe me, it's quite small and more suited for dipping verses swimming.  The top level houses their rooftop bar O. The rooftop boasts gorgeous views of DT and is mainly indoors. They have a small balcony as well. Last but not least, they have two conference rooms. One maxes out at about 50 people and the smaller room probably could hold 15 people comfortably for a board room meeting. There are plenty of windows in both rooms and can be rented out with a minimum catering order of 20 people.Great little place for out of town guests! BONUS perk is that they have a complementary Escalade available for guests to take around the DT area. If you need to go any further, be Yelpy and use Uber. Check this place out :)Found myself in OKC for a work trip and ended up at the Ambassador.  Overall, it is a decent spot.  I liked the clean, updated inside of the hotel and rooms specifically.  Everyone at the hotel is very nice.  But some spots were lacking.  Gym is located outdoors in the building next door and is teeny tiny, one of the smallest I've seen in lots of travel.  Surrounding area has a few restaurants but overall this doesn't appear to be a lively part of town, not necessarily an area to walk around much.  Service is a bit slow.  I had to wait 10 minutes past when the downstairs restaurant was scheduled to be open for someone to open the restaurant and greet me.  Same for valet--multiple instances where it took quite awhile to get my car.  Okay spot, just set expectations appropriately.Now that I know where the other three hotels are, I'll not hesitate to book in other cities. This hotel is immaculate, trendy and comfortable. The staff is above average and extremely hospitable. It's also pet friendly and extremely quiet.The rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. Oversized shower and bathroom! Every nook and cranny are spotless. Will book again when in OKC.While in town for business, my co-workers and I stayed here several weeks this summer.  It quickly felt like a home away from home!  It is newly renovated and very swanky.  After several stays, here are my pros and cons:Pros: very nice, comfy beds, cozy robes, large rooms, amazing shower, in room Keurig machine, friendly staff that knew our names after our first week, rooftop bar with great view!Cons: thin walls - often I was awoken by the sound of people being loud outside, or the wind howling in the corridor, workout room is not connected and pretty sparse, no loyalty program, parking lot is a far walkOverall this was a great hotel! I felt very comfortable here and it makes other hotel chains feel like sleezy motels!Best hotel in OKC, better than the Skirvin, leaps and bounds better than everybody else.  The entire staff is excellent and actually cares and wants to make your stay the best possible. Karina, Gary, Janet at the front desk at the best. Michael and the bar staff are fun folks to chat with over a drink, and Steven, Nick, David, and Bill are awesome - I chat when them when I take the shuttle to spots around town and they are great folks. Solid crew, would never take my money elsewhere in OKC. And forgot to mention that the hotel is well decorated, spacious rooms, excellent bathroom amenities including Scope mouthwash and great shampoo/conditioner.  I could say more, just a great place and excellent staff. I stay here 4 nights/week on business.Great little hotel just outside of downtown.  Spacious room with giant shower, great for tall people such as myself.  Staff is super friendly and accommodating.  Upscale restaurant just off the lobby, the lamb special was ridiculously good.  The bar upstairs is fully stocked, and the bartenders know their shit.  Highly recommend.  Totally worth the price.I flew into OKC for a meeting with clients this past week and decided to stay through the weekend. I invited a few friends that I have in town, and their wives/girlfriends, out to dinner and a few drinks afterwards. After dinner we walked over to the hotel to check out their 'sky bar'. When we walked into the hotel we were greeted very nicely and were told what floor the bar was in. As soon as we walked up to the bar's door the 'door man' said "it is way too crowded in there, you guys may be better off at another bar like Louie's or Fassler Hall". Keep in mind, we were just coming from Dinner so we were dressed appropriately for this place. Door man said it would be a few minutes before we could walk in followed by him saying "you can poke your head in there if you'd like to see the place". As if he were "granting" us a view of what we were not going to be allowed to walk into. We waited a few minutes and we saw people come in and out of this place and still the door man said "it is just too crowded, maybe another nearby place is better for you guys.". After waiting 15 minutes and people coming in and out we realized that we were not going to get in because we were NOT the "right people" for this place. Though we were all dressed business casual and the wives and girlfriends had on nice alfits/dresses, it was clearly obvious that we were being denied entry to this bar because of who were were and nothing else. (Except for one of my friends who was wearing a hat, because he is self conscious about going bald, we were all acceptable.). I hate to say it and I hate to play this card but there was really no other conclusion. (Racial Profiling). There, i feel terrible about having to use that, but it was obvious. As people were walking in and out and as we waited in that hallway we decided to leave after 15 mins with only the "poke in the head" view that some of us did as a reminder of where we would never be "allowed" in.  As we walked past the front desk in the lobby, one of the representatives said "you guys are leaving already? To which we replied "They did not let us in". He grunted and had a look of disbelief. Not sure if the bar is managed by same staff as hotel is. I hope not. Because maybe I will not be able to stay at this hotel when I am in town again on business. Maybe they will allow me to "poke my head in the room" before allowing other people to go in.Beautiful Boutique hotel. All restaurants around it: excellent & w/i walking distance, staff friendly & welcoming! Love it!
review_content_20: I absolutely love the Ambassador Hotel in Midtown Oklahoma.fYI Oprah Winfrey stayed here in this hotel when she was here in Oklahoma for funeral a friend of hers had died. but that's not the reason for my review ,my review is about this hotel.It is so super #dope, chic. The decor is fabulous I love this hotel. I decided to try brunch Sunday brunch because is super super busy on the weekend they are maxed to compacity.You will need a reservation. On the 7th floor features a rooftop, that's ultra sexy. Which is gonna be great for the summer time or just for hanging out. For Sunday brunch I was surprised they didn't have mimosa specials.The brunch menu was really simple. I tried the shrimp and grits. They did a really good job with the seasoning the grits, the grits actually had a chicken stock.I had about 4 shrimp, but because they were a butterfly it took away from the quality of the shrimp I didn't like that. They were grilled perfectly. It wasn't ENOUGH shrimp to complement the whole dish of grits. I do plan to go back with friends on another Sunday brunch to try something else on the menu.my 2 highlights were meeting a couple that were foodies just as I was & travel all over the United States to eat. We sat and talked for 2 hours pass brunch. The husband Shamir was Olympic track star for the United States of America from theJapan Olympics. I ran into Steven Adams from Oklahoma City Thunder during brunch as well.Our office staff decided to go to Ambassador for 10 Year Anniversary for cocktails and dinner,we went to the bar and enjoyed the OKC skyline,proceeded to dinner where our waiter Everett was waiting ,He makes the best dirty martini ever!!Our dinner and the service was excellent,I will go back with my husband soon!!I'm reviewing the restaurant at this hotel. Viceroy. First off we had made reservations for Mother's Day on open table for 1:00. They called and asked us to be there at 12:15 because the online booking "overbooked" them. Well I told them we will try but let's make the reservation set to 12:30. Well we got there at 12:15 and they didn't seat up until 12:30. The host was a great man. Very friendly and talkative. Menu has a great variety. 3 of us had corned beef hash with sunny side up eggs Waldorf salad and eggs with asparagus. Only complaint was all three hash and eggs came with one sunny side up egg and one broken cooked egg. Mimosas were the best I've ever had. Service was great and quick especially for a packed restaurant. Now here's why it ended up with three and not 4/5... We were waiting for out bill when the manager came up and said I hate to be the bearer of bad news but we have a booked restaurant and each table is allowed an hour... REALLY?! First off if we had the check and were sitting chatting that's one thing but we didn't even have the check! Not to mention there were 4 tables empty! Bad management in his part even if we had paid and were sitting its Mother's Day! Your kicking out my mother and grandmother to turn tables?! As he was saying this the waitress's arrived with the check and he still proceeded to tell us that they need the table instead of stopping and shutting up! So after we paid the waitress came and apologized so many times when it was not her fault! The food is great the restaurant is beautiful! Management needs to be changed!Perfect place to stay in Okc, Beautiful hotel, restaurants all around it, great rooftop bar, staff was great, room was perfect, bed was comfy, Perfect all around...5 stars!!!Loved this hotel in Oklahoma City! I called as we were driving in late to OC, the front desk clerk, Phillip, was so pleasant and accommodating! He explained the room rates and what was available and, yes, pet friendly too-thank you!!! I called back after chatting quickly with my husband and booked it within 30 minutes of arriving. Phillip was amazing, knew exactly who I was when I walked in saying-I think we may have arrived in under 30 min, he chuckled and after filling out just a little check in information he offered us advice on free parking and assured us that in 5 hours he would have some strong coffee for us ready for us when we left. Yes, we were only here for a short 5 hours but it was well worth it and, yes, he did have that hot strong coffee ready for us downstairs as we were checking out. Thank you, thank you, thank you!!! We will definitely be trying to stop here on our way back to Texas from North Dakota next week and are looking forward to it-hopefully we can at least stay for 8 hours this next time! I give it 5 stars for customer service, cleanliness, comfort of the bed and atmosphere. Really nicely upgraded finishes, loved the floors!! Also wasn't able to go out on the town in walking distance but it looked to be in a great location to quite a few bars and restaurants-would probably be a fun place to spend a weekend if I was from somewhere closer.

review_content: Decent hotel (great for what was paid... $45 a night on hotwire for 2 nights in September) and it is about 17 minutes from the main airport. The room is spacious and clean. (And has your basic amenities.)  Complimentary tea and coffee in the room too.Didn't spend much time in the hotel so I don't even know what else it offers. The weekend I was in town there was a convention in the lobby/meeting center with locals; super cool/neat. Got me some local spices. And everyone was really nice that I encountered.The customer service (of the evening crew) was fantastic. Smiles, and great information---however, the amenities and the room were horrible. When we walked into our room, it felt like we had walked into a sauna. And the bathroom smelled like BO (I think it had to do with the heat, and all the smells coming out). We quickly adjusted the temperature believing it would make a difference. At 2:40am, we couldn't sleep, we were sweating like crazy though the thermostat read 60 degrees. We called the front desk and they sent someone up to fix it. It was either that, or we had to change rooms. We had a ton of bags and things so we didn't want to move rooms.At 3am someone came and took apart the AC by unscrewing and entire wall unit in our room. It took about 30 minutes. He really did fix it, and he was very nice, but it did take a while and it was kind of an inconvenience. Nobody apologized for our broken AC. Unfortunate! In the morning, the front desk lady was not as nice as the evening staff.The Tower Hotel looked like a glammed up ghetto Days Inn. It was probably somewhat nice 20 years ago; but now it's just falling apart and the amenities below mediocre. The service is what saves it, and gives my review the 2 stars. There is free parking but no free wifi in the rooms (only in the lobby). The elevators are dark and old. But the worst were the rooms. The strong scent of BO in the bathroom was persistent, like it had been cooking for days. We were on the 12th floor, which (I think) was supposed to have "fancier" rooms as they had little plaques on the doors. Our rooms were so ghetto that I don't even want to wonder what the "less fancier" rooms are like. If you can help it, stay somewhere else.This place is a dump. Rooms are shabby, the place looks like it was closed for a decade before someone reopened it and did nothing to improve it. While we got a great rate on Hotwire, they charge for the wifi that they say is free (only free in the lobby, what is this, 1999?) and they charge your credit card with a $50 fee per room for 10 days. Shady, I've never had a hotel do that. Don't stay here!Gross on top of gross. Hotwire is so warped when it comes to what a 3.5 star hotel that's like Hilton or Sheraton should be, it's insane. Uncovered, free parking, but it's terrifying because there are constantly people in the parking lot who definitely aren't staying at the hotel. The lobby is really nice...that is the only positive thing I will say about this hotel. It is like an older Motel 6 on the inside, the crap ones back in the day before they got revamped. Dingy, wet carpets with dark grey staining all the way through the walkways. I had to throw out my socks when I got home. The plumbing is jacked. Whenever somebody uses the toilet or shower, water gurgles and shoots up from the bathroom sink...yes, like a scene out of a horror movie...and I felt the same way when I saw it. Thank god my tooth brush hadn't made it out of my carrying case. I do not recommend staying here, if you can avoid it.It's not the greatest place to stay meaning no real main attractions- but it is good enough to refresh your mental capacity. There is no bar from what I could see nor did the attendant express any benefits that the hotel offers like breakfast, dinner or anything along those lines. So my experience thus far is like this place is a good pit stop. The view is great though!!  I'm on the 6th floor and can see clear across the state of Oklahoma. Great place with great people inside of the building! Robyn is the best!!This review is for their banquet room and dinner service.DO NOT host any events at this place!!!  Where do I begin....We had issues with this place from the beginning, but stuck with it thinking we were getting a good deal.  We even tolerated the fact that they double-booked our space and left us with only half the area.  Turns out....they are untrustworthy and did not stick to the contract and did not deliver so many things we agreed on.  It starts from the top.  Their sales manager has no integrity and no customer service skills.  He should get out of the hospitality business.  We showed up to our wedding reception to find out that there were no plated salad, there were 2 bars instead of 3 and they were in the wrong area.  The food was nothing like it was at the tasting and they did not bring out enough so guests had to stand their and wait.  They did not regulate traffic even though we directly asked them to a week prior.  So people from another party were coming over to take advantage of our open bar.  And that's just part of the problems.  When we talked to the manager afterwards, he tried to direct blame elsewhere and said that it was a large event and they worked their butts off.  Well it takes a lot of work to put on a reception and they do not have what it takes.  They were rude to us and our wedding planner before and after.  Again, they need to get the heck out of this business!!!This hotel has the potential to be very nice, however the rooms are very dirty, the linens on the bed where not clean and a blood spill by the pool unattended  will not bring us back.MAJOR SECURITY VIOLATIONI got a copy of my room key without they verifying me and my identification!!I won't go into the story so that no one else uses it but i was shocked!Also i requested a wake up call at 5am...................no call!Luckily i set my cell phone alarm clock.It was great experience.  Made full use of amenities.  Joseph was friendly, inviting and informative. I would definitely stay there againRoom and bathroom were clean.Nice balcony over looking the cityBooked using hotel tonight and price was great!Thanks for a wonderful timeI stayed at the Tower Hotel because it was recommended to me by a friend. They had stayed there when it was ran by Marriot. You can still see the Marriot sign on the side of the building, it looks like its just been covered up with brown paper bags. It looks pretty bad. I'm surprised Marriot hasn't taken it down. When I went to check into the room I was asked to come back in an hour or so. I couldn't check in because of an issue with the plumbing and water wasn't running in the rooms. I went back a second time and checked in without a problem. There is nothing really wrong with this hotel except for it being old and run down. You can easily see that at one time, it was a very nice place but that was awhile ago. I'd skip the  $10 breakfast buffet as it is nothing I'd pay ten bucks for ever again. Beverly's Pancake house is right across the street and that place was great. I will say the best part of the stay was the guy who made the omelets at the buffet. He was hilarious. He was very friendly and had a great personality and he stood out among fellow employees who provided a level of service that wasn't really bad... but wasn't all that great or memorable either. We were going to check out the hot tub but it wasn't working. The pool was super cold and overrun with kids so we skipped that too. If you want to use the internet, they charge by the day. It's only $5, which wouldn't have been bad if my internet stayed connected. All in all my experience at the Tower was meh. I had heard great things about it but my experience was disappointing.After a mix up at a hotel in Dallas, we were left without a room. We had a reservation for the next night at this hotel in Oklahoma city, so I called and told them our situation and asked if we could get an early check in if we went ahead and drove. And by early I meant 6 a.m. Joseph, the night clerk, was incredibly understanding and accommodating. He told me to drive safely and he would have a room ready for us when we got here. As soon as we walked in he handed us our key. We basically stayed 2 nights for the price of one. Not only that, it is a very nice hotel. Yes the lobby it is a little dated, but our room was updated and clean. The bed was Incredibly comfortable. And for the price of $69 you can't beat it. But honestly, the best part of this hotel was Joseph. He treated us with concern and care. If I come back to Oklahoma City I will stay here again without a doubt!I reserved this hotel through a Hotwire Deal and it was decent.  The room was nice enough, and the staff was helpful.  The wifi is only free for an hour, but I think it was free for me until I left the room and had to come back and reconnect...I was definitely connected for more than an hour.The hotel was close to a lot of necessary things and not very far from many of the tourist-y things that I wanted to do.  Parking is free and you can get a decent spot.The only issue for me was that the hotel smells slightly musty.  It wasn't just the room we had, the slight smell was all over the hotel.  I think they probably need to pull their carpets.Overall, I don't think I'd pay full price for this hotel, but it serves the purpose of a decent place to sleep if you get it via Hotwire or Priceline.p.s. Priceline lists this place as a 3 star, but Hotwire lists it as a 3.5 star.  I think it's more of a 2.75, thb. Better than Best Western, but not quite Marriott.Decent hotel for the price ($58/night booked the day of our stay through hotel tonight app).  Desk staff was not extremely during mix-up at check-in, which was slightly frustrating.  Comfy beds, nice lobby decor.  When the shower was running, water would bubble up into the sink, but I'm sure they can fix that.  I would stay again if I were passing through OKCThis is one the best hotels I ever stayed in. The customer service is extremely perfect! Everybody here made me feel really comfortable and felt like I knew them for years. This hotel should be ranked higher then it is. I am a contractor and I travel a lot and finding a decent priced hotel is extremely hard for me but they worked out a deal with me that really made my life easier. Every time I come back to Oklahoma I will definitely stay at this hotel. Joseph really helped me when I first arrived and he was really patient as well. Liam which is director of sales as incredibly polite and professional and treated me with respect. Cami is awesome! And many more of them. I have nothing other than good things to say about this hotel. This is the hotel you want to be in!!!Overall this was a decent hotel because I was in a pinch and needed a room at 10 o'clock at night. However, if I actually was going on vacation and was going to be staying in this hotel for the weekend I would definitely not recommend it. Although the rooms were decently clean they were definitely not clean. They had one little vent in the entire room to provide air-conditioning, which let me tell you, was not sufficient. They do not provide complementary breakfast in the morning which is fine but if you pay the original price than it is definitely not worth it. Additionally, Internet is not provided either and instead you have to pay for it each day which is billed to your room. The staff was very friendly and the hotel itself is very unique I believe it had a total of 15 floors which was kind of cool because you felt like you were in a old time hotel. Once again if I had to stay somewhere in a pinch this would definitely suffice however I would not stay in it for luxury or vacation.We booked this hotel through Hotwire while relocating cross country.  For the price we got (under $60 with taxes) it can't be beat.  However, that's pretty much where it ends with this place.The hotel is an old Marriott.  This is blatantly clear from the minute you drive up (the sign atop the building has been covered with a drop cloth, or something of that nature).  The lobby is clean, albeit dated.  It really is just screaming to be made over.  We had a room on the 3rd floor.  Thankfully the elevator ride was fine.  However, the minute we walked into the room, we were smacked in the face with a horrible, dank, damp smell.  It honestly smelled like the room hadn't been used in months.  We promptly ran the AC, which helped, but it lingered for the rest of the stay there (which was thankfully only one night).  The bathroom was dark-ish, dated, and the sink and vanity were completely separate from the toilet-shower (odd, and again, dated).  The room looked dark in comparison to the pictures shown here.  We had NO view at all of any part of the city; I feel like we were purposely put in some back room since we booked through hotwire.  I wish I had taken pictures of the gross dark film that was on the complementary bottles of shampoo, etc., but we were so disgusted that we immediately threw them in the trash.  The bed was comfortable, and after driving for 12 hours, I was grateful for that, but the room just kind of skeeved me out.  Again, after going out for dinner, we returned to the same damp smell the minute we entered the room.  In hindsight, we should've complained and asked to be moved, but again, we were exhausted, and honestly just wanted to sleep.We quickly left early the next morning, and to be honest, would not be returning, even if we did ever end up back in OKC.  Then again, unless they do a major overhaul, I really don't see this place being around for much longer.My wife and have stayed at this hotel for the past 15 years when visiting our grandkids in OKC. Our LAST 3 stays have been less than pleasant. Formally a Marriott property this place has really gone downhill. If you have a choice don't stay at this hotel. Management really sucks.Ahhhh, OKC you hold such surprises! One being this hotel, but more so, Price! Not the cost, which is very affordable but Price the bartender, give this guy a raise!! We found the hotel on priceline and got nice 12th floor king rooms for $70 a piece!! Nice staff, rip off breakfast prices but all in all a great experience. Thank you again Price for putting on the game, staying open for us and in general being an nice, fun guy. DOOO IIIIIITTTTT!!!!  GO DUCKS!!!Hotwire win. Super friendly staff and nice hotel, especially for the price. Bar had great lemon drop martinis.  Great location and free parking. Would stay again and be happy for another win via Hotwire hereRoom was good, could have been better but bed was comfortable and clean.  carpet seemed new.  this could be turned into a 4 or 5 star hotel very quickly, just get some bellhops and a concierge and valet parking.  room service delivered the best angus burger EVER.  staff was friendly and helpful.  at less than $100 a night its a bargain.  stayed in a corner king suite on the third floor.
review_content_20: We stayed here for the Oklahoma Dance Rush competition, so we received a reduced rate. Overall, it wasn't a bad stay, although it would have been nice if the restaurant was open later, rather than sending us into the lounge. The room was more spacious than I'd expect at the rate we paid, and I like that the sink was just outside of the bathroom/toilet, rather than crammed into the bathroom. A mini-fridge/microwave would have been nice for a longer stay, but for only two nights, I dint ask if they were available.I used a Groupon for an $88 (taxes included) two double bed room. The Tower Hotel is an old Marriott. I thought for sure that my Groupon room would be next to the elevator, but it was not. We were given a spacious corner room with a fantastic view of the city. My measure of a good room, clean bathrooms and bedding, earned the Tower Hotel five stars! On my way downstairs, for breakfast in the restaurant that was included in the price.Stayed here because they had very reasonable prices.  However, tub was dirty with stained streaks down the side- and a few of the towels smelled very musty.  Bed was very comfortable, sheets were nice and clean.This one star is only because the hotel employees seem excited that you are in the hotel.  Everyone we encountered was friendly.  When you walk into the rooms. there is an old, musty smell (I used rooms plural because we had to change rooms and both smelled the same way.  This hotel is in a state of disrepair.  I understand it was an old Marriot and it seems the owners are trying to revive it but it is just not working.  The walls and the rugs are dirty and spotted, the blanket on the bed was stained and the mattresses are so old and pressed down that the mattress covers sag on them.  We were most annoyed that the plumbing backs up and does not drain.  In our first room both the tub and the sink held the water form bathing and brushing our teeth for about an hour.  We asked to change rooms and when we showered the next night, this bathtub was worse.  I have been waiting two hours for my husband to shower and it has still not drained.  This in addition to the peeling wallpaper and marginal A/C system, we have had enough.  We would change rooms again but we are out of here tomorrow and will never come back - even if we are in OKC.Anything nice about this place is remaining from it's prior Marriott ownership. I stayed three nights.  The ONLY redeeming quality is that the service is nice... Not necessarily competent, or having a clue about service level, but yes - nice.  Red wine stains on room wall, the glass windows on my floor coming off the elevator were covered in grimy sticky hand prints and smears - for three days. TV was patchy service - weird internet "disk full" errors preventing watching. When I clicked on "HBO" I was routed to FOX news over and over again. Uh, no. No, no, and no. The restaurant is dark, old, mostly not even open, and depressing. Closest place to walk to for a drink is Hooters. And next door is 7-11 for 3% sh1ty watery "beer". The hotel did roving fire alarm testing one day with no warning to guests. When it rolled around to my room someone knocked and without enough time for me to get off the bed and answer the door, a man actually ENTERED MY ROOM. WTF?!?! Get the F OUT OF HERE! Asked me, "is the fire alarm going off?" Uh, are fkin deaf?? No apology for entering my room without warning or permission. Ignorant hick idiots.Hard to find since there isn't any proper signage (being converted from a Marriott). The rooms are nice and big. The staff is extremely helpful/ friendly.

hotel_name: Hilton Garden Inn Oklahoma City North
review_content: We spent one night at this hotel. The hotel staff is very nice  friendly and the amenities are very nice - business center, fitness room, pool etc. The staff is very friendly and welcoming.The hotel is close to the I-40 Turnpike and within a short walking distance to many restaurants so after a long trip you can just park your car and walk to have a bite to eat.The rooms have microwaves and refrigerators and the a/c unit worked well.Am giving them 5 stars because of the great way they handled a maintenance issue that we did not complain about until we were leaving. They apologized profusely, told us we definitely should have mentioned it (we did not want plumbers in our room late at night) and then after we filled out the customer survey they gave us 5000 points as a thank you for letting them know and how we treated them - nicely done all around!We could have dinged them a star because of the maintenance issue but you know stuff breaks. It is how it is handled that matters. Would definitely return.Gotta say that I love this place. I'm in hotels about 50% of the time while I travel on business.  Was so pleased to find a fun and energetic crew at the front desk when I checked in. They made a long day in meetings and driving in the car feel like a distant memory.  These things matter...But the one item that won me over? It was the free wifi with legitimate speeds.  Tonight I'm watching Orange is the new Black on my iPad in HD.  I'm a happy camper.  The Internet is free and fast here (for a hotel).Confirmed download speeds over 5 MBPSWonderful stay here! Very clean and very nice staff!! Would definitely stay here again!Very clean and quiet rooms.  Great amenities, good rest.  Had to leave before breakfast, but early coffees and tea was available.  Breakfast is 06-1000 Mon-Sun.After our pleasant last stay here, we were happy to stay again. We love the hotel, the cleanliness, the great staff, and the price is the same as others. We usually stay at a nearby Hyatt, but they almost always have a soccer or softball team staying there and it is noisy all night. Noise has not been a problem at this Hilton GI. Once you figure out some of the street shortcuts in the neighborhood, it is a pleasant place to stay with good access to the City. Having said all of those nice things, I now find out they no longer have complimentary breakfast. Last time, we had cold cereal, coffee, etc that was comp, but now they want $9.95 per person for a breakfast. We don't eat much breakfast and will not spend that amount of money for a bowl of cereal. I guess we'll be looking for a different hotel for future stays.I love this hotel and the wonderful staff, especially the breakfast crew!  Rooms are nice size (I always get a junior suite) and parking is good.BUT, the swimming pool is absolutely wonderful and a good reason for staying her by itself!  Overall an excellent value for a good solid quality hotel.  FEE wifi also with a microwave and refrigerator in each suite!Our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn could have been better. The air conditioner did not keep our room very cool and it was difficult to get a good nights sleep. The pillows were not very comfortable. Breakfast was also just ok. I did like the waffles quite a bit. The staff was aces, all nice folks. The room was nice, we enjoyed the pool and the hot tub. I would stay here again, but I might bring my own pillow next time.This hotel was great.
