My hubby & I were in town for a wedding and this was the hotel the couple had reserved for guests to stay at (a group rate of 89 plus tax-which included a breakfast buffet for two). We checked in Saturday at 4pm(although check in starts at 3pm) and we were given the room we requested, one kind bed. It was clean and quiet-just what we like. We didn't spend too much time at the hotel but it was nice while we were there. The beds are really comfy. They have a dial on either side of them to where you can adjust it to be softer or more firm(that was nice!) We both slept really great and before heading home we enjoyed our breakfast buffet for two. The buffet was included in our room rate but typically it's an additional 9.95 per person. I don't know if we would have purchased it if it wasn't included(we typically are not big breakfast eaters) but none the less, it was good. They will make you omelets(made to order, your way) & they also have a waffle maker, biscuits & gravy, oatmeal, fruit, bacon, sausage, eggs, cereal, coffee, orange juice, water, etc to choose from. It was quite the breakfast buffet spread. The only downside to this hotel is that they don't have an outdoor pool. Since the wedding was a 7:30pm start time, I wanted to lay out by the pool for a bit after we arrived. I got dressed and headed downstairs only to find a indoor pool. I imagine that's good for families in the winter time,  but it would have been nice to lay out/swim outside & enjoy the warm summer weather. It wasn't a big deal and wouldn't detour me from staying here again but just a small inconvenience. Overall, a great hotel. I would definitely stay here again!Always love hilton. Fresh cookies and water at arrival. Great fitness area. Very clean!The service and accommodations were really great.  With as much as I travel, I want consistency and value.  I can count on another location to add to my list on where I will be staying.Excellent staff, friendly and helpful. Adequate rooms with comfortabel beds and desk chairs. Food is adequate!  Good accomodations for the price and locations.New, clean, inexpensive and good service. 5 stars for me.Love the evolution beds and their chairs.  This hotel never fails!  Everyone of these hotels I have been to have a hot tub, pool, and an exercise room that consists of more than just cardio, they have some weights.  They seem to have pretty decent prices, usually can get a room for less than 120/night.This place is bad.The staff is nice, but useless, they are apologetic for all the errors they can't do anything about.(Vending machines not filled, no change for the toll roads, no cleaners for the gym, you're not allowed to sit on this side of the lobby because they're going to vacuum in the next hour (???) etc.)I'm here on business and my team got back from a dinner late around 12:30, we went up to my room and were talking and we got multiple noise complaints.  This might indicate that we were really loud, but I was awoken the night before by an overly sneezy man.  Long story short, there is NO sound baffling.The exercise room has no exhaust so is utterly uncomfortable if there is more than one person in it.If you travel for a living do yourself a favor and avoid this place.Me and my family were staying for a week and on the last night we were sleeping, the lights in the bathroom turned off twice and somebody or something tapped my foot twice when we were sleeping. But other than that the hotel was great specially the jacuzzi.

Booked on hotwire.  When we rolled up, we were immediately apprehensive.  It's in a shady part of town... NOT Bricktown.  I think they must've mispelled Brixton.  It probably wasn't really all that unsafe.  We were mostly worried about our car getting broken into or stolen overnight.  The manager was VERY polite and generous in contacting hotwire and authorizing our cancellation and refund.I could give this place no stars I would. This hotel wasn't even rentable in my opinion. It was under construction and honestly looked like nobody was even working, let alone staying there. It was like a scene out of The Walking Dead. As I walked down the dark corridor of stained carpet, paint peeled doors, and exit signs hanging by their wires, I was thinking I should just cut my losses. When I finally got to the room, it wasn't horrible inside, but I definitely didn't have a good feeling about it. There was an old aluminum sliding glass door to the outside courtyard that looked more like a prison yard. The sliding the door didn't even lock. I called the front desk and they told me there was a bar I could put across it. I did that, but the bar didn't work either and it still left a 8 inch opening that anyone could slip through. To make it worse I cut my finger on aluminum bar. I went to the bathroom to wash my finger and I saw bedbugs on the ground by the door.At that point I just called the cab dropped me off and went straight back to the airport and booked the Quality Inn for $69. It was quiet and clean, very nice. They only charged me for one night stay even though I stayed for two because I told him the story about the previous hotel.I didn't even bother complaining to the Bricktown Hotel. It wouldn't of done me any good night and even pay for the room, a client paid for it, that's another epic story.It's a bad sign when your cab drops you off at your hotel and you think, "So where is the hotel?" and an even worse sign when you walk into the hotel and think "So where is the check-in desk?" So the adventure began...What initially drew me to the hotel was the shuttle service. The hotel offers a shuttle to take you to and from anywhere in the downtown OKC/Bricktown area. On the weekends, the shuttle runs 24 hours. I also read that the biscuits and gravy included in the complimentary breakfast was pretty tasty, which I found to be true. I give one star for the shuttle service and biscuits and gravy.  Now, the drawbacks:Like I mentioned earlier, the hotel layout is beyond strange. The vibe is weird and the convention center that the hotel is combined with seems like it hosts only low-end about-to-go-out-of-business businesses. Every time I walked to and from my hotel room and through the convention center, it felt eerily empty and a little unsettling. I actually video recorded the walk from the hotel entrance to my room to send to my husband because I couldn't really explain to him in words what the whole experience was like. When I opened the door to my hotel room, the room smelled like cigarette smoke, even though it was a non-smoking room. I asked the front desk to double-check that my room had not been smoked in. One of the supervisors walked with me to my room, smelled inside, and said "Oh, that's the smell of the new carpet and furniture we just put in this room". So, not wanting to be difficult, I accepted the smell and stayed in the room. Taking a shower was unpleasant. The shower was warm but not hot. I always thought hotels' hot water supply was abundant, but apparently not. At least I got a warm shower. My friend staying in another room took a shower a few hours later and said that his water was ice cold. The next day, I removed the "Do Not Disturb" sign from my door at 11am. When I came back to my room at 6pm, my room wasn't cleaned. In my opinion, that is plenty of time for a room to be cleaned. Another minor issue was that only one of my lamps worked. I could have called the front desk and considering that the staff was very friendly, I am sure they would have sent someone to change the bulbs. It's more principle than anything. It would have been nice if they checked to make sure all the bulbs worked before putting me in that room. I don't plan on ever staying here again nor recommending this place to any of my friends or family. My advice is to spend a little more money (my friends paid $10 more per night to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn) and stay at a nicer place that is ACTUALLY in Bricktown (not 2 miles from it).Needs to be shut down!!!!!!!!!!I left! Dont stay here!!!! Scary place!!!!!!!!Hallways were trashed, walls were dusty, carpets are nothing you would ever want to step on, bed had metal bars sticking out hidden under the bedspread which I hit my leg on. There are no maids  just men who look like druggies fixing toilets etc. The downstairs bathroom was broken and the lights didn't work and they were having a large show. This is a very very scary building in which no one cares about and should be shut down. Do not say here!!!! Man at the front desk was a saint and works under horrible circumstances.We were very displeased with our stay at Bricktown Hotel & Convention center. Positives - The staff was friendly. They accommodated our large group well. The shuttle service was great and took us anywhere we wanted to go. They had no fitness center but the shuttle service could take you to a center and work out  for free. We were one of 5 families to stay Fourth of July weekend. Negatives - The location seemed less than safe. We drove up to see boarded up windows which were supposedly due to renovations. The carpet was gross. The bed was super uncomfortable. The pool wasn't open the first day we arrived. There were gnats everywhere. The shower had little pressure and I found it hard getting hot water for a shower, instead it was semi-hot. Breakfast was subpar, even though they had lots of options. Amenities were not good options. Even though they were doing renovations they haven't bothered to replace a window that looks like it had been shot. Bottom line is we would never suggest this hotel to any friend or family member.OMG I still can't believe I stayed here...All I can remember is that Musty smell! I guess looking at the price would tell you it's not going to be the best hotel. Stayed here for New Years with friends (all the other hotels were booked or overpriced) and right when I walked in I thought I was going to pass out. Our heater wasn't working but they came to fix that right away. The workers here were great, which is why this got 2 stars.Complimentary Breakfast: Meh, again you get what you pay for. Good amount of choices, don't expect anything fresh. Shuttles were convenient, especially if you want to have a good time at the bars!Overall I wouldn't stay here again but if you want a cheap hotel and don't mind the smell this could be what you want. It did have a good sized room and bathroom, but don't expect the best quality, this hotel has been here for a while and you can tell, old school!I try to save money for the non-profit I run but do have some standards: I've told my assistant to look places that have "no roaches and no hookers." I didn't see either at this place. The staff was friendly and helpful. The problem: the place is just creepy. Like really, really creepy. Like thinking an axe murderer is going to pop out. On a Thursday evening, there appeared to be fewer than ten guests in the place. Many windows were boarded up. There's lots of litter (cigarette buts and vapor canisters) around.  There were bikers too. Anyway, I guess it's cheap. Otherwise, I just wouldn't reccomend.When you near this place, you really should listen to the voice in your head that says: Just keep moving, no need to stop here.  Perhaps it once had a heyday, perhaps it once flourished with guests.  But now from its exterior, all one can see is a sad building with boarded up windows (I counted over a dozen!) and a shabby parking lot.  It does offer a shuttle service to downtown and its employees are pleasant, but it does not offer the visitor an appearance of safety.  For that reason alone we switched to another hotel in the heart of Oklahoma City.  Thankfully, they willingly cancelled our reservation.  A little paint, some plants, and fixed windows might restore some dignity to this establishment.Marginal at best. Literally being refurbished while guests still there. No guy should bring his woman there. Legitimately scary. Siding was being torn down while i stayed there. Remodeling is half way done. They are trying to squeeze more cash from it while it is a dump. Locals were surprised i would stay in such a dangerous area. Nice breakfast service and front desk staff.I really wish I could rate this zero stars. I don't ever say that either. This place is a dump. Going through renovation or not. Hairs on the sheets, yellow stains, nasty smells. Not cool. I booked 3 nights here and left 10 minutes after I arrived. I told the front desk about my issues and he didnt even seem to care. I even felt that he was used to hearing what i had to say and was prepared to hear it. Please, PLEASE avoid this place.This was a very nice stay for myself and my bf. The room was well appointed and the finishing touches were beautiful. They really did up the room with faux rose petals and had a lot of faux flowers in the room, which may seem tacky but it wasn't. It really was well thought up. There was a lovely jacuzzi tub in the living room area of the hotel suite we had and a nice love seat with a coffee table and tv. The bedroom had a huge California king bed and flat screen tv. We didn't have their free breakfast buffet so I can't comment on that. Noise level was average during the evening and somewhat loud in the afternoon.Downsides: The outside hot tub and pool were very dirty and in no way inviting.The lamp in the bedroom was broken (as in the actual glass) which could have posed a real hazard and it was pretty evident that they already were aware of this as there was tape on part of it and it was strategically placed so that you couldn't tell right away. That was tacky! Just replace the lamps people. The bathroom was a bit on the small side but still was nice. No fan though so that was a bit odd. I think with some minor upgrades this could be a easy 5 star updated review but for now 4 stars. I may return in the near future. It was a nice stay and the bed was really comfortable.Not very pleased with my stay at the Bricktown Hotel.  The staff was very friendly on check in.  But, when I arrived at my room, the wheels fell off.  First of all, there was no luggage rack in my room.  This is maybe a first for me, I can't recall being in a hotel before without a place for your luggage.  The shower was one of the worst I've had at a hotel.  The water was either freezing or scalding, I tried about every permutation of the hot/cold levels and couldn't get it to stay on warm.  So, what was intended to be a relaxing shower turned into a strategy session on trying to catch the water for the 5 seconds when it was a proper temperature before it returned to either skin blistering hot or incredibly cold.I will say the air conditioner worked very well, the room got cold, which I prefer.  Also, the bed was comfortable enough, it wasn't the best hotel bed I've slept on, but I've definitely had a lot worse.  The property as a whole isn't fancy, and it's a little dated, but I found it to be clean.  A lot of yelpers mention the 24/7 shuttle to Bricktown.  I didn't need it, but it's my understanding that's a great draw for this place.  I will say I saw the shuttles used quite a bit.I will not stay here again....ever.  rooms are about same but...city moved greyound bus stTion across the street.  Now degenerates and hookers seem to frequent the area.  My husband and I were in the lobby waiting on a pizza delivery when a skinny mostly undressed woman wandered in with her blue jean shorts unbuttoned , walked past the front desk and right to the bathroom in the hall. Not one person  said a word to her.  She was in the bathroom for a few minutes, came out and then walked back across the street to a truck stop.  No I don't know for sure she was a prostitute but if it walks like a duck, quacks like a duck, ..etc...A great value for the money. The shuttle service is every bit as good as it sounds. Friendly staff, clean rooms. Decor is dated, but you're not staying here for the decor. Continental breakfast was sparse -- could use at least some hard-boiled eggs to bump up the protein. But it's free!Bed was hard as a rock. That's the ONLY negative. It is dated but in a clean and charming way. The courtyard is beautiful. The pool area looks great (it was raining so we didn't get to go in) a little 1 foot deep pool for the little ones. The staff is stellar. The front desk directed me calmly and clearly when I got lost by my map app. The breakfast attendants were charming and made conversation with one of the long term guests. I overheard two families talking about their babies in the NICU. you know it has to be good for them to stay for weeks right?Nothing fancy but the beds were comfy, the showers were hot with great pressure. No bed bugs, very clean rooms. What more do you want for $70?. Plus they are pet friendly. The breakfast wasn't anything special but it worked.This was a great place to stay while my boyfriend and I were visiting from Hawaii.The rooms were simple and practical for our stay, and we never had any problems.  We had never been to Oklahoma before so the fact that they had free shuttle service which ran 24/7 was very helpful.  We caught a OKC Thunder game and parking would have been a nightmare, the shuttle service was a life saver!  The drivers were really friendly and gave us great suggestions of where to go and where to eat in the city.  Complimentary breakfast was minimal, but then again, it is simply that, complimentary!  The place also had a cute little bar, which is only open on the weekends.  Would be nice to get that thing running more days in the week, but luckily, we were there a Saturday night, so we were able to stop by for a quick drink.  Overall, was definitely please with my stay here and would recommend this place to others!do not stay here, bed bugs everywhere, really awful.  no one cares.  friend got really sick and had to go to er.  awful, awful.save your money, do not stay here.This was kind of a dump. The staff was friendly when checking in but the rest of this 'hotel' was kinda sketchy. It's essentially a motel with a convention center. Room was kinda dirty, there were some weird people sleeping in their car outside and we saw several animals in our room. Wasn't really a good night's rest and we'll never be back again.I've stayed here twice. The first time was terrible! I was on the first floor and it was during cricket season. There were dead crickets in the light fixtures, crickets in my room and when I got home, I discovered a dead cricket in my suit case. They just crawled right under my door. This year was different. I requested a room on the second floor and NO CRICKETS!!! The towels are very crunchy and there's a big stain on my mattress and sheets. However, the room has a great little kitchen and the staff is very friendly.
review_content_20: So I get FINALLY get a response a YEAR LATER saying that my review could not have possible be true to the treatment I received because of the reception's name! Ha. Well, that might not have been the person's name, but that's the name they gave me. Horrible customer service STILL! Who takes a year to remedy something customer service related anyhow?Ya know, I had many names for that front desk clerk, but I chose to use the one she gave me.My employer still avoids booking this place for any business stays.Terrible experience never ends!Staff was awesome. Rooms are clean but not much to look at. Fairly priced considering the close proximity to bricktown. Shuttle service gets 5 stars. Front desk was awesome. Had a very expensive camera and the shuttle let us drop it off and they put it in my room for me! Hallways are super dark with very low lights. Looks sketchy on the sides of hotel but still a decent place. Will definitely return, love love the shuttle for safe return after party night!We stayed at Bricktown Hotel when I was moving across the country from Chicago to the Bay Area. We looked up hotels on bringfido.com since I was moving with my dog and found this hotel. I spoke with Mary to make the reservation and she was extremely friendly both on the phone and in person. The hotel has a nice big courtyard for dogs to do their business and to sniff around. We ended up walking around the whole courtyard about 10 times for exercise. The room was big and clean, although the sliding glass door to the courtyard seemed like it could have been more secure, but maybe that's just me. Breakfast was good and had a lot of options- there was a lady making waffles and they had oatmeal! which is not something every hotel breakfast offers. I would definitely recommend this hotel to someone not looking for a lot of frills, traveling through with a dog. Again, I have to mention how great Mary was.Great deal in ok. On our way to Austin. Close to freeway and free 24 hour shuttle to bricktown. Free breakfast. Clean rooms Had to deal with prom teenagers at 2amClean but VERY old! This is a huge place but I wonder how many people actually stay here?? Close to the downtown area with shuttle service [although I didn't use it]. Service was nice and friendly. Our room was decent- a chair had a broken leg and you couldn't sit in it without tipping. The room looks super old and with random pieces of furniture. It's like they try to update a piece but the overall look is not the best. It was clean and we felt safe overall.Nice pool area.Continental breakfast in the morning was ok.Pretty nice place to stay around the downtown Oklahoma City area. We were passing by the area and stayed the night here ($90 with tax and fees). Everything was nice and clean. Our room had a king bed, mini fridge, TV, desk, mirror and free wifi. Also it was nice that the AC was already on and working when we came in because it was hot outside. If you're looking to go downtown to Bricktown, they have a free shuttle service that takes you there and back. Good place for a decent price.Ths place is beyond good. Clean , friendly n surprisinfly cheap. It was 80 bucks! You will not find anything safer and better. They have regular shuttles to the bars.This hotel has everything I needed. The free shuttle was great for my cou rsins wedding. Yes, they are in the middle of a renovation. The neighborhood is not as bad as the other reviewers have said. There is a waffle house across the street and a diner/truck stop as well. The rooms are clean and the staff was polite and always available. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It's off the freeway, but that makes it easier to find your way around. I would stay here again.My friends and I went to OKC for a friend's wedding, and we found Bricktown Hotel through hotels.com. We decided on Bricktown Hotel for their competitive pricing; it was just half the price of the hotels in the main downtown/bricktown area. Plus it was only a hop and a skip away from downtown, where the wedding took place. When we first saw the hotel from the street view, it looked ghetto and nothing like the pictures we saw online. Thankfully, ghetto it was not, and it only looked drab from the side street view. In fact, the interior is pleasant and I really liked Bricktown Hotel. All the hotel employees were really nice and helpful, and our room was clean. Our double queen room had all the amenities you'd expect (desk, coffee machine, microwave, mini fridge, TV, closet space with hangers, iron and ironing board, full-length mirror, hair dryer, shampoo/conditioner/soap/lotion, and towels). There was also free wifi and free bottled water. The beds were softer than I like, but generally pretty comfortable. yelp.com/biz_photos/oqmG...One of the best features of Bricktown Hotel is their free shuttle service. It runs 24 hrs and did I mention it's free?! There's even a VIP hummer if you want to feel special. yelp.com/biz_photos/oqmG... Since the main downtown OKC area is about 2 miles from the hotel, we took advantage of the free shuttle service. It's especially convenient if you plan on partying downtown at night. The drivers that we encountered were all really friendly. It's not required but don't forget to tip the drivers! They also have shuttle service running to and from the airport every 3 hours for $15. My advice is to take the shuttle service to the airport unless you have at least 3 people to split a cab. If you have 3 or 4 people to split a cab, it'll be cheaper than $15/person. Another great thing about Bricktown Hotel is their complimentary continental breakfast. They have all the basics like cereal and milk, bagels, yogurt, instant oatmeal, juice, coffee and tea. They also make fresh waffles upon order, and they have fresh biscuits and gravy. The breakfast ends at 10AM so make sure you get there before then if you plan on eating breakfast at the hotel. But never fear! There's a Waffle House across the street if you don't make it to breakfast (or if you get the late night munchies).I was also impressed that the hotel had it's own fully stocked bar and a clean outdoor pool. We didn't have time to take advantage of either but both were unexpected and a great addition to the hotel. If I visit OKC again, I'll definitely be staying at Bricktown Hotel. It's really a great deal: friendly, convenient, and affordable.4 words..... DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!! If you're asking for details then go ahead and waste your money.Went there during the St. Paddy's day weekend. The place does not look that appealing from the outside but it's a lot nicer on the interior and the free shuttle is the best reason to stay there. Even had the owner drive the shuttle once on Paddy's day, says something about him right there. It did turn into a bit of a party hotel on Paddy's day night but that can either be a good, bad, or don't care thing. The price wasn't too bad either plus they had a breakfast in the morning. And they allow pets. My only beef with the hotel is that the free wifi was completely useless. The signal was so poor it wouldn't even connect.I recently stayed at this hotel this past weekend for a business convention and I can honestly say, by far this is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in!!! I used my CLC Lodging card to get a discounted rate, only to find out that when they tried to process it the day before check out, it wouldn't process. Rather than calling me and letting me know there was a problem, our room keys were de-activated and we weren't allowed to get back into our room. Tom, the owner, was by far the rudest, most obnoxious person I've ever met!!! He treated my roommates and I like we were criminals! The transaction issue was just a simple credit card info update. The only thing that saves Tom and keeps his hotel running is his friendly staff. They were very nice and patient with us, however, I will NEVER stay at this hotel again and neither will my business team!!! Tom just lost a ton of customers!I was at a sporting event that had a deal on rooms with this hotel. OK - appearance. First, this is at least a mile from Bricktown - not sure how they got the name. This is an OLD motel. Cleanliness is so-so. The beds looked saggy and the tile in the bathroom wasn't something you want to put your feet on - moldy tile in the bath / shower. Topper...no hot shower. We could get hot water from the tub spout but it was ICE cold in the shower. Secondly, sleep. Got none. I had my kids with me and there were parties all around us and above us. At 3:30am, my kids were scared to death when people were pounding on the walls from the party as well a woman screaming HEATHER done the hall for at least 10 minutes. The party upstairs was obviously a large amount of people. And, you could here them in the bathroom - I won't say anything more. Called the desk at least three times about the parties and yes security guards came to find HEATHER but couldn't seem to figure out the huge party upstairs from us. So we were awake much of the night. So...to sum it up, this is the party headquarters. Probably great for those that don't want sleep, don't need a clean room and need a ride to the party at Bricktown. Otherwise, this is not a hotel for family or anyone needing a nights sleep.This hotel is very clean and the staff is very kind. The shuttle service was excellent and was very convienent.This was a pretty nice hotel to stay at. They're in the middle of renovating and we got one of their older rooms but they weren't too bad considering. I can only imagine that the newer rooms must be pretty nice. The biggest selling feature of this hotel is its proximity to downtown OKC. They had a very convenient 24-hour shuttle that would bring you to and from downtown. This alone makes the hotel worth staying at since you can drink when you get there and not worry about getting a DUI, or have to drive around endlessly for a parking spot and/or pay for parking.With that said, the shuttle drivers need a little work with being a little aggressive in their driving. They should drive a little more defensively and not take corners so quickly. It seemed like it was just a job for them. Not that we're royalty but a little more cheeriness would work wonders. As I said, the rooms themselves were pretty okay. But the bed was a little too firm for our liking (some people like them firm and if so, you'll have no problems).We didn't utilize them but there's a continental breakfast from 6-10 am and an outdoor pool. They have free WiFi and two wired computers to use in the lobby as well as a fully stocked bar (we didn't go the bar but I think he closes shop if there's a long run of no customers at night). Would recommend staying here.This hotel is a Diamond in the Rough! I've stayed here on a few occasions and have always had a good experience. When you first pull up to the hotel you might be a little bit apprehensive to stay. They aren't in a great area of Bricktown/Downtown (it's more industrial) but they do have security for their guests parking vehicles and added security on the weekends. They aren't in the heart of bricktown either.... they are located just a mile east off of the main road that goes into Bricktown (Reno). Because of this they have FREE 24 hr shuttle service to and from the heart of Bricktown AND to a lot of other attractions in Okc. You can use the shuttles as often as you like and not have to worry about paying for parking in Bricktown or getting lost if you're unfamiliar with the city. When I stayed here the shuttle drivers were pretty funny and friendly and seemed to be speedy. I tipped em a couple bucks and they kept me happy. I didn't get to use it, but the hotel has a pool that looked crystal clear and actually has a deep end. There is also a small 1ft deep baby pool. The pools are in a very large grassy courtyard in the middle of the hotel property. It's a nice spot to sit and get fresh air without having to go "outside" of the hotel....and if you have kids there's enough room for them to throw a ball around and keep occupied. The most important thing to note about this hotel is the room. It was very clean and nice. The hotel is in close proximity to I-40 so you would think the highway would be loud but it wasn't a problem. I think Reno separates the hotel from the highway, creating a small buffer for noise. I have slept well everytime. The beds are pretty comfy too! When you wake up there is a complimentary breakfast with Waffles, Biscuits and gravy, cereal, yogurt, juice, coffee etc. That alone made the price of the room worth it for me. Breakfast is the most important meal of the day! All in all...it's worth it to stay here and you will be satisfied. Orrr you can check prices for a hotel closer into Bricktown but they all were around 100 bucks more per night when I looked. I will definitely be back!

review_content: Why the bad reviews? Our experience was great. Large, clean, updated room. Friendly staff, dog friendly and only charges $25 pet fee for two dogs. Free breakfast, great location, great price.This place looks like an older hotel that they updated. The log cabin motif is cute. It's a three story place with room doors facing out towards the parking lots, which may turn off some. Located right off of I-40, it's not close to the downtown area. It's geared towards people like myself who are just passing through. Our room was decent, if a little musty. It was spacious and had it's own safe and mini-fridge. Beds were fairly firm, with plenty of thick, soft pillows.There's plenty of parking around the hotel, which was great since we had a big 27 foot rental truck we were driving. There's an outdoor pool that I didn't get to check out because we arrived late. Somewhere in the building there was a fitness room too. The hotel restaurant was closed on the Sunday we arrived. But there are several places within a quarter mile, mostly chain restaurants and fast food joints. There's also a strip club within walking distance. Giddyup.Plus Stars are given for the fact that they did have a room when we called ahead for late check in and the guy at the desk was nice. I personally think since this is advertised as a conference center that the desk clerk must've gone to some serious Nina training on how to stay positive in a dismal situation.The bed was comfortable which is great. I turned the fan on and it was really loud, but that ended up being a bonus to help drown out the sound from the big trucks rolling by on I-40.The pictures listed on others comments are accurate, but they can't convey the strong musty "I've got to cover up something with fabreeze so no one knows" type of odor. It is strong!!One reviewer described the square uncomfortable pillows. True. The parking lot of this "six acre facility" (which is how the desk clerk sold his spin) was  absolutely full. Had to park on the fringes of this ponderosa and darn if I didn't forget something in the car and had to go back!All in all I love staying in Best Western Hotels, but this one steer clear of if you Yelp before you book."Meh.. there have to be better options nearby!"Customer Service: 0 starsI called ahead to notify the hotel we'd be arriving late and after being placed on a long hold I was simply told that they would hold the room and asked when I would be arriving. Being on a long road trip, we didn't know exactly WHEN we'd be arriving. Once we finally arrived in the wee hours of the morning - exhausted from our travels - the person at the front desk explained that he'd already run the audit so he couldn't check us in but he saved the room - as if he was doing us a favor?! I had already prepaid for the room and called ahead to confirm a late check-in so I did not appreciate the front desk person making it sound like I was inconveniencing him. Room: 1 starOne star given for what appeared to be at least a clean bed. Nothing special. The room did have a flat screen tv, microwave, and mini fridge but I didn't need any of these additional amenities. All I wanted was a nice, hot shower. Bathroom: 0 starsThe shower head was broken and pointed at the floor of the tub, unable to be directed upward without holding it. No points scored for customer service here either in that the front desk staff seemed unconcerned about the shower situation. Noise Level: 0 starsThe walls seem to be incredibly thin based on the fact we could hear the traffic buzzing by. So much for a quality night of rest!I will come stay at this hotel every time I come to OKC. The staff have been amazing. I ordered room service when I got back from work. Chocolate cake, burger whatever you get will be great from the restaurant. The front desk staff was very friendly and even helped me fix my glasses after they broke. Clean rooms, near highway but not noisy though I'm a hard sleeper. Check it out. It will defiantly be worth it. I'd give 5 stars but the doors aren't enclosed in the building, though I was able to get from my car to my room quick. Totally worth it. Oh!!! They have a good free breakfast too!Ignore all the old reviews! This hotel has recently had a complete brand new remodel! A conference hotel with tons of amenities, it has the coolest cowboy theme throughout complete with saddles for bar stools at the hotel bar! YeeHaw! Cowboy Cool! My hubby & I recently relocated here to OKC. Before our arrival, we researched all the OKC hotels online, then, upon arrival, walked into a few we decided not to stay at and the only two we would stay at, was this place and the Skirvin downtown, which is double in price but has the same amenities. Except Saddleback has a sauna!!!This hotel is a gem! Like I said, I think it's one of the top two places to stay in OKC for many reasons.   First of all the rooms are giant & the beds are super comfy. Its close to downtown, the airport, tons of restaurants, has free parking & wifi. The staff is super friendly from the front desk to the housekeeping.  The outdoor pool is lovely, at night it changes colors which is cool if you got a room facing the pool or happen to be in the restaurant that overlooks it.  The restaurant is Cowboy romantic cool looking with all these twinkly lights & has a breakfast bar in the mornings with better than average breakfast items. Eggs, bacon, biscuits & gravy, hash browns, fresh cut up fruit, strawberries, all kinds of YUM!  Same thing with the lunch and dinner buffets.  The salad bar is great!  We got all moved into our new flat & we are still goin back to the salad bar to have their super fresh salad fixings and homemade soups! It opens everyday for dinner at 5pm & its $6.99! You better get there quick too bc the yummy homemade chicken noodle soup the ladies there make goes quick! I was there one day by 5:30pm and it was all gone! :((  the potato soup they make is killer as well! YUM! :)'Turns out we are not the only ones that thinks this place rocks! The bar/restaurant has a ton of local followers! I was hanging at the hotel bar, Rustlers, sitting on the saddle, waiting on hubby coming cross town talking to all the regulars, turns out b4 it was remodeled it used to be a karaoke bar every night of the week, now it's a karaoke bar just on the weekends.  They even open up a small dance floor just for us singing & dancing queens! LOL They have trivia you can play at the bar & they play a killer mix of classic country music!!! There is also a giant flat screen to watch the games ;) They make this drink called the lotus punch. Turns out it has 5 liquors in it! Take my advice, do not drink 3 of those while sitting on the saddle! The only time I ever fell off my horse! Gives "Getty up" a whole new meaning, more like, Getty up off the floor please! LOL  Happy hour starts everyday at 5:30pm to 7pm with $150 drafts and free Hors d'oeuvres! Every day there is something different. One day they had these little mini chili burritos OMG omygawd, OMG they were so YUMMY! I have been asking for them every time I go now! "Please put these on the appetizer MENU Saddleback executive chef so I will stop driving your hotel staff crazy about them!!" LOL Several regulars at the bar were also having the quesadillas, they were all raving about them even though I have not had one yet! ;) They even have room service! And they don't have a 20% upcharge for bringing the food to your room like other hotels! WOW! :))The hot tub area is badass! It is a really cool space with a Sauna!!!! The sauna rocks! You go in there after a full day on your feet hit the hot tub after! Talk about sleep like a baby! YeeHaw is right! Awesome! :)) The executive gym is small but it has everything you need to get a good workout. It's the cutest little room with two giant flat screens & a fireplace!  For a giant room, killer breakfast, salad bar, themed country bar with fun locals and great music, killer bar food & fun drinks, free room service, awesome pool, hot tub, sauna, gym, free parking & wifi, friendly service with a smile around $100 bucks a night, you just can't beat it with a stick! lol I highly recommend this hotel for overall quality, value/price, location, service & amenities.When my friends come to town this is where I am putting them! "Thanks for having us, we truly enjoyed our couple days stay at the Saddleback. Wish I would have discovered you sooner!"We will be back in the near future (happy hour) so please don't forget to put those super delish mini chili burritos on the appetizer menu for us hungry singing & dancing Saddleback cowboys & cowgirls!" YeeHaw! Happy trails to you until we meet again! ;)Pretty clean room but old. Some Beds have a cup to them. Changed their pillows to little squares & they're awful. Need to update their breakfast bar - had same stuff on it for 5+ years! Good place to take dogs.The highlights of the hotel include an awesome breakfast buffet, clean beds, spacious vanity area, new tv, mini fridge and microwave. Rooms are accessed from the parking lot, and I usually prefer to stay in hotels that require you to enter through the lobby, but that's a personal preference. The hotel is a little dated from the outside and the parking lot was extremely full when we got in. We had to park rather far away from our door. Didn't get a chance to use the pool.Was perfect for small vacation with a bunch of teenagers.  Everyone liked their rooms.  Nice decor, newer decor.  Perfect location, highway didn't bother anyone.  Other guest sure enjoyed the pool.  Good price.This hotel does not have the free wifi they advertise. I was able to use it for 20 minutes before it quit working. I tried reconnecting and, turning my devices wifi on an off, and had no luck for over 20 minutes before calling the front desk. I was told their wifi at the front desk was working fine and if I just wait it should kick back on. My questioning was blocked and I was told "it was the area" and there was nothing they could do about it. When I finally was told the manager is the only one who could do something possibly, she said she'd tell the manager... When he comes back Monday morning, a day after my stay was going to end. If you can't provide wifi, don't advertise it and then treat me like an idiot for inquiring about it. It doesn't smell particularly pristine if you're sensitive to that and the outer perimeter room I have can hear all street noise as well as my neighbors.Travelling across the country with my pregnant wife, our dog and our cat.  This place was affordable, clean, roomy and perfect.  The complimentary breakfast buffet was nothing crazy, but was just what you want/need to fuel yourself up for a day filled with driving.I took a dip in the pool and relaxed in the spa/sauna at night.  Everything was well kept, neat and clean.  It's a good place for family and also great if you have pets.  Its probably one of the better places we've stayed with our pets, and the fact that it wasn't that expensive makes it even better.I noticed the Karaoke and I do remember walking past the bar thinking that it was pretty busy for a tuesday night, so the good things others here have posted about that seem to be accurate.Disgusting. Not worthy of even the BW name. Try ANYTHING else in town. Room Not updated. A dying cockroach on floor. Room smelled like it was smoked in for a decade.Lost a star for price......even though I loved this place it was still reeeally pricey.  I'll probably book elsewhere next year when I'm in town but this can be a backup because they have a great and really affordable restaurant, karaoke bar, nice pool, clean rooms....and queen beds! ..which even the Sheraton skimps out with fulls or doubles at best.  They also offer free shuttle to places within 3 miles so that was helpful for my quick trips to Walmart or the airport pick up/drop off.  If I weren't paying $120/night to he so far from downtown this would be top on my list!!  I'd rather just pay $150ish to be right downtown.Avoid at ALL costs!1) Beds - ours was almost as soft as a plywood pallet.2) Hot Breakfast - No, not really.  The scurrying roaches under the clean plates really sealed the deal.3) We did like the location - but this was (By Far) the WORST Best Western we ever stayed at.JimbolaLess than helpful front desk, beautiful landscape but spiders in our bed! Spiders in our bed!! And if the internet stops working don't expect their clueless "tech support" to be able to fix anything! That pretty much sums up our stay at this Motel! Yes, if you can drive up to your room it is not a hotel, which disappointed me as well! Will not be staying here again. There has to be better for the price!Good: Friendly staff, free warm breakfast, mini fridge and microwave in room, nice fitness center...... Bad: Motel style (all doors open to the outside which means you hear everything going on outside and get quite a draft in the winter), if you're room is right outside the bar doors everyone will stand right outside your room and smoke, room service food was disgusting, there were spiders in my room.....I woke up with bug bites all over my legs! Overall, there is a Holiday Inn down the road for only about $10 more a night and it's well worth it. I would rather give this place two stars, but the whole bug bite thing really creeped me out and wasted a lot of my time. I spent a whole day switching hotels and washing/steaming all my stuff just in case it was bed bugs.It is probably a fine place for a short stay or overnight stop, but if you're stuck there for a week or more I would recommend finding another place.We've stayed at a LOT of hotels, both great and not so great.  I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place.  Our room was nice and big, clean and comfy.  We didn't eat in the restaurant but ordered our dinner delivered to the lounge.  (Yes, it was a long day).  Dinner was pretty good.  The breakfast was better than the usual hotel breakfast fare.  (It's a breakfast bar with plenty of good and healthy choices.)  Service at the front desk was a-ok.  Friendly and efficient.  I can't really think of any negatives.  if you're looking for 5+ hotel you'll be disappointed.  But if you're looking for clean, friendly, reasonably priced .... you can't beat this place.  I recommend it.One of the best (Best western Hotel we have ever stead at)the first time we stead we had a suit it was very nice and the breakfast  buffet was nice and I am not a breakfast buffet fan but this one is good,we enjoyed our stay and have been back.it is a fun place for family and friends and they have a nice Bar with Karaoke night ,we set out by the pool and laughed at some of the singing going on. the hotle is close to I-40 and it is pretty eazy getting to the hotel, but it is a little harder getting out and back on I-40 and the area is ok, a little cheeze at night restaurants,Bars,shopping, a water park ..Nice clean rooms, pretty much what you would expect from a Best Western.  Added bonus of fridge and micro in each room.  I didn't have any problems with stains, men hammering, or dogs like a previous poster.  Although the thermostat for my AC was a bit wonky.What you wouldn't expect is the caliber of the b-fast.  Buffet style with pretty much whatever you want.  And it's actually a decent spread in regards to food quality.  You also wouldn't expect 3 free beers during happy hour just for booking a room mon-thurs.The front desk people were a bit out of it. We rented 2 rooms weeks in advance for the world show.  They lost one booking and totally messed up the other.  They did fix it however, and it ended up ok.  A couple of the front desk employees are not very friendly.I got a good laugh when I walked through the lobby and could hear some weird sounds coming from the bar.  Intrigued, I went in for a bevy.  What followed were the most drunken cowboys singing karaoke ever.  Quite a funny sight.  The best is when some dood tried to sing/talk that song that goes "One Bourbon, One Scotch, and One Beeeer"  I never realized that the whole song is just plain talking besides the chorus.  I should have recorded it because no doubt it would be #1 on youtube today.The pros:Compliments abound from the delightful front desk staff.  "You don't LOOOOK thirty!!!"  I thought this was hilarious but then thought that this young woman's mom is probably still in her thirties.  This is not a slam, I'm just thinkin' that things happen faster here.  Full breakfast included in hotel stay.  Mini fridge in each room.  Room was clean!AC unit blasting when we got into our room. Nice!Why is the carpet soaking wet?  The AC unit.Why is there a giant stain on the ceiling?  The upstairs AC unit?Woke up at 8:00am because the dog next door was barking it's fucking head off.It was barking it's fucking head off because of the man hammering on the roof.Why was the man hammering on the roof?The AC unit?

hotel_name: Sheraton Midwest City Hotel at the Reed Conference Center
review_content: What a pleasant surprise this hotel turned out to be! We were taking a road trip to New Mexico from Chicago and after crunching the hours for the day, I saw that Oklahoma City would be a good resting point. Since we were bringing our dog along for the trip, we needed to stay somewhere where pets were allowed. Many of the hotels I found wanted to charge a non-refundable deposit: $100, $50, $25, on top of the hotel price. No thanks.I was becoming worried that I would either have to cough up the money, or stay at a sketchy Days Inn. Then I found the Sheraton, about 10 minutes from OKC. Perfectly fine with me. My goal was just to be in a well-populated area near the highway and not some random ghost town. They allow you to bring your pets FOR FREE! That's awesome! All you have to do is sign a pet waiver and you're good to go.The price was great. I booked through their website and checked out the special offers they were running (there's a tab for this on their page). They had a holiday special where you could get a room with a king sized bed for $69. Fantastic. I recently stayed in a craphole in Milwaukee for $119, so this was a steal. And it looked modern and updated from the pictures on the website. I hoped it would be the same when we arrived and it totally was.They have a parking garage next to the hotel as well as a huge lot. Check-in was easy. We stayed here twice: once on the way to NM and once on the way back. The second time we checked in, they were going to put us in a room with double beds, even though I had requested a king. I told the concierge this and he checked his computer and snagged us a king room. Phew. Both rooms on both nights looked relatively the same. Huge bed, nice bathroom, a desk area since this is mostly for conference/business people, flat screen TV on the wall, complementary coffee and water in the room, and free wifi. The first room we stayed in had a fridge, yet strangely enough, the second night, when we stayed on the "preferred floor" there was no fridge. Weird. We made do, though.The hotel has a restaurant on the main floor and a big conference center next door. Unfortunately, they do not have continental breakfast. If you want breakfast, it'll cost you $12. That was a bummer. We just ended up getting breakfast bars at the gas station. It would have been nice to be able to put something in my stomach before a long trip. However, they do have free Starbucks coffee, which is a nice perk. They have a bunch of syrups too, that you can add. They also have free cucumber water near the door.Overall, this was a great stay. I'm so glad I was able to get such a nice hotel at a reasonable price. Happy to have stayed here for two nights and that I didn't have to scramble to find a hotel the second stay if the first stay sucked. If I'm ever in the area again, I'll definitely be staying here.This hotel depresses me. It's just kind of sad and dreary inside. Not a terrible place to stay at though unless you already have a case of the blues. Parking is easy and free. The beds are comfortable. The staff was even nice enough to give me a room on the 1st floor and it was very quiet. There is a waffle house super close by...yum. But the melancholy mood of this place bothers me.You can hear the people in the next room so clearly, you might think they were in the same room as you. Don't stay here.The room was nice and clean. Free wifi and parking as well. I was just passing through but I would stay here again.Sadly this hotel does not meet up to Sheraton's standards. When I stay in a Sheraton I expect the room to be clean and to be up kept well. Our room however was not.  Bathroom doors and handles were dirty, bathroom tiles around the toilet area were dirty and broken, pillow cases had stains, carpets needed a good cleaning, as well as all tables in the room needed a good wipe down.  I expect this maybe from a 1 or 2 star hotel but never from a 3 star.  That is why I pay a little more for a hotel, you are supposed to get better.  I am very disappointed in Sheraton right now.Very disorganized. Ordered guest service and it never came. Cleaning staff was so so kind but other workers were not very friendly.I stayed at this hotel for the Oklahoma Association of Realtors convention. I stayed 2 nights.The room was adequate. The beds were comfortable.The only constructive criticism I would give is more closet space. The room was supplied with a wardrobe instead of a closet and the bar ran from front to back, instead of side to side. This made it difficult to hang multiple articles of clothing.Now that I got that out of the way, I must say that I have never experienced such amazing customer service as I did during this stay.Everyone from the front desk to the house keepers would take the time to ask me how my stay was going and if there was anything they could do for me.This definitely made a lasting impression on me.Thank you Sheraton!Let me start by saying this hotel could easily have been a 5 star experience. Very easily. The reason it wasn't is because it was filthy. The towels were gross, pretty much every surface in the room looked dirty and there were huge cobwebs covering the AC unit. If someone went through and cleaned it properly and maybe took care of the carpet tears and stains, this place would be fantastic.Nice folk.  Good rates.  Loved the pillows.  Way too many places only have those fluffy pillows that your head sinks into.  These guys have got firm pillows that support your head.  I assume they are foam.  The barkeep was friendly and gave me some night-life pointers that worked out well.  My only gripe ... the woman in the club floor lounge was rude.  I have my suspicions why but I'm not willing to put them in print.We were passing through Oklahoma City and stopped here for the night because it was too windy to continue a long drive. This was one of the few hotels right off the I-40 that allows pets. Krystal, at the front desk, was a little rude and uninformative. She did not seem like she wanted to be working here, not once did she smile. I had no reservations and she rolled her eyes when I mentioned that. She handed me some papers and said "sign this" and didn't tell me what it was. It was the pet waiver, 3 pages. She was annoyed that I was actually reading it before signing it. When I handed her the papers she handed me the room keys and told me the elevators were across the lobby. She didn't tell me how much the room was, where it was located, or the size. From previous experiences, front desk usually gives you this information before sending you away, whether or not you booked in advance. There is no pet fee, so that was a plus. The room was clean. It was a little awkward for the bathroom light to be outside the bathroom and right next to the front door. Room service was nice. We got the spicy chicken quesadilla and warm apple pie. Both tasted surprisingly good for hotel food. However, the quesadilla was not spicy at all. There was a key drop basket for easy check-out. I would stay here again if I had my dog. But if I was not traveling with my pet, I would find somewhere else with nicer people at the front desk.Terrible visit. Arrived at hotel at 3:50pm & stood in line for 1+ hours just to check-in. Then we were told that there are no clean rooms. We had reserved 2 rooms. At 6:20 pm, we were finally assigned a room - but only after going to the desk over & over and asking status. Never once were we updated. Complained to front desk twice that we had roaches in our room. Our room was never cleaned the entire stay. (stayed 3 nights). First day - I caught the girl in the hall & asked for clean towels because it was past 5pm & we needed to clean up - she had me sign that I received the towels.  The next day - we never saw anyone - no towels, no cleaning the room, etc.  Terrible stay - Will not stay here again - maybe never again at a Sheraton. Told front desk - they reduced the room rate by $30 - but never an apology - also, called down to restaurant for food delivery & was told no one was there - call returned 40 minutes later. Teribble!!!!  The room was 205 - Check-in was 9/17 and left 9/20.We stayed here when we were traveling from Virginia to California. We had a Penske truck with a car carrier and we were easily able to find free parking as there was a huge parking lot next to the hotel.The service is great. We got there at midnight and the staff was very helpful. The room we got was nice and clean. The bathroom had french doors which was cute. There was a laundry room round the corner where they also kept the ice machine and the microwave. My husband used the gym in the morning before we left and we did get complimentary newspaper and coffee in the morning as well.My teenage son and I stayed here last week while he was attending a football Elite QB Camp in nearby Shawnee, OK.  It's a great location; close to freeway, outside the mayhem of a typical downtown hotel, but a short 10 minute drive to Bricktown, free parking, unexpected robust & free wi-fi, etc., and a short 20 minute drive to our Shawnee destination.  The front desk staff was supportive and attentive, but that's the extent of the positive comments I can make about this place.The housekeeping staff singularly ruined our stay here.  I should have taken the hint when I found hairs on my bed upon arrival, but I was excited for my son, and wanted to stay upbeat.  Housekeeping left our wet towels where they hung after the first day, took them and didn't replace them after the second day, and left my room door wide open on the third day (while they were nowhere to be found - we returned home for the day to find our room door open!).  There were few to no towels in the pool area regularly, the pool and pool area felt filthy, and it took them far too long (~20 - 30 minutes) to bring us towels and a replacement iron after I called the front desk with my request(s).  Front desk staff seemed concerned when I mentioned these events, and that's the only reason that this review merits a second star.  Hope to attend the same QB camp next year, but will not likely stay here.PROS:- Pet friendly- Free wi-fi- Gorgeous lobby- Free parking in a garage just across the street from the hotel- Grassy areas near the hotel, which were well lit at night- The room was immaculate, it came with a microwave and refrigerator, and it was extremely comfortable and quiet- Very helpful staff- Easy to find from the freeway, and far enough away from Oklahoma City that prices were reasonableCONS:- None come to mindGreat location and great staff - highly recommended - SPG is upping their game that is for sure...and they are usually better priced than divey Hampton Inn around the way. Watch your ass, HHonors! SPG is coming for YOU!Carpet in halls clean, lobby nice...however...room dusty, carpet in room filthy, furniture scratched, and bathroom looks like Motel 6.  They should have spent the same money on improving the rooms as was obviously spent on refreshing the public inside areas and outside face of the building!Nice but small.  Pros -Comfy beds and a huge work station.  Upgrade to Club level for free drinks and light dinner and a better than expected breakfast.  Cons - Small borning indoor pool.

Very friendly and helpful staff from the front desk, bar and concierge lounge. Food in restaurant was a 3 of 5 stars. I could hear the TV in the room next door.This property upgraded to a Renaissance two weeks ago, and I am very impressed with the face lift!  Additionally, they served bacon wrapped scallops tonight at the Club House on the 9th floor. They were delicious!  I love that the rooms are now modern, and the snacks offered to reward members are way better than before! I'm definitely staying here next time I'm in town!Very nice hotel. Newly remodeled, nice decor, spacious clean rooms. Very comfortable bed, nice staff. Down side if you want the heat off in your room or the air on you have to call to have a engineer to come to your room and get in the closet and adjust it. I had to call twice before he showed up. This was after 1a in the morn.Horrible renovation and makeover.  Definitely not the service you would expect.  Called and asked for q-tips and I was told I may be able to find some in the basement vending machine. Lighting poor. I had to go buy a make-up mirror with a light in it. No valet. No bellman. Waiters cell phone went off during service and he was unknowledgeable about the pronunciation of alcohol. He was friendly and eager to please, just poorly trained. I will never ever stay here again, although I have been a frequent guest over the last 20 years.I have a feeling this place used to be in a lot better shape years ago, but at my stay it was definitely showing its age.  The reason for 3 stars and not 2 was the fantastic service.  I checked into the Waterford on a Friday afternoon.  The lobby is small, and there was no one out front to handle valet parking.  But, someone at the front desk called a valet and he arrived within a couple of minutes.  Check in was quick.There was a sign near the front desk informing guests that floors are being renovated, so construction would be going on during the day.  This places needs a face lift, so good on Marriott for investing.  Additionally, during my short time at the Waterford, I wasn't bothered by any construction.My room had not been renovated.  The decor was dated, although it was most certainly clean.  The mattress was not comfortable, and the drapes wouldn't close all the way.  This was incredibly annoying as light came into the room as soon as the sun came up.  It was impossible to get the room completely dark, which shouldn't be the case in a hotel room.  Additionally, the bed was situated so that your head was toward the door and you had to lean on your side to watch TV.  I've only been in a couple of rooms with a configuration like this, and I really don't care for it.I didn't check out the restaurant or bar.  Every employee I came in contact with was very friendly.  I actually forgot an item, so I had to go back to the Waterford the day after my stay.  The item was retrieved very quickly, I don't think I was waiting a full minute at the front desk.  I think were I to stay here after the renovations are complete I would update my review and give the Waterford 4 stars.  But, as it stands now, the price of the hotel is not commensurate with its quality or its location.Very nice hotel!!!!! My first stay here....and I've been told that they've undergone a renovation so the rooms are much more updated. Front desk is very attentive, room service was on time. I'm not very familiar with the area as it was my first time in OKC but I was pleased with my stay.Marriott has really 'mailed it in' at this location. Its average on a good day because the lobby is nice enough.  However. The rooms are outdated and need some TLC.  Something in the closet is making a horrible noise... See photo, it's part of the ac behind the air filter. Classy.The rest of the room is a bit below what you generally see in other Marriott properties, old dorm fridge sitting on the floor, nasty grout on the shower tile, old decor.On the positive side.. The towels were really soft.We were fortunate enough to have our wedding here in 2012. All staff that was involved was excellent, and we still send people here to check it out for their wedding!The room was ok (although the wifi was spotty at best and the air conditioning remained on full blast regardless of what temperature it was set at). Room service on the other hand....Awful. My pre-ordered room service breakfast never came and I got so tired of holding that I didn't even bother ordering dinner. I could almost understand if this was a huge property but it isn't. Not that the "restaurant" was much better...If you stay here...I suggest eating your meals at the Cheesecake Factory down the road.A real disappointment for a Marriott loyalist.Clean friendly establishment, easy location to shopping and some corporate locations, service is slow in the restaurant for both breakfast and dinner, the HVAC system is very outdated and requires a technician to come just for the heat or AC by adjusting a manual damper. The thermostat is very outdated as seen in the pic attached. The beds are somewhat comfortable and standard for the type of room but you can tell it's much older hotel that they're trying to maintain a look for its design. The infrastructure definitely needs to be updated. I'm staying here on business & I'm not sure if I could never stay here again. I would request to stay at a newer Marriott location although this is more convenient for my destination on business.I stay with the Waterford pretty frequently (several days a week). I've stayed in all kinds of different rooms, on different floors, on different sides of the hotel. Here's what I learned:1) There are lights of prison-break brightness levels pointed at the front of the hotel. The blackout curtains work, but if you want to see outside AND not be cornea-raped, don't get a room facing the front of the building. 2) Vacuuming MUST happen at some point, but I'm basing that assumption on the craziness that it wouldn't happen. A lot of floor debris/dust stays in the same place from week to week.3) The kitchen knows their stuff. Food arrives fast, hot, and tasty.4) Beds are comfy. If you're prone to overheating, request a regular (non-down) blanket.Enjoy!Comparing this to other Marriott properties I have been to throughout the US this property is in dire need of a refreshing. Things just seem overall aged. Watch out Elite Gold Rewards members they charge $10 extra a night for concierge lounge access. Compared to other Marriotts this is only 2 stars. Hope the elevator gets fixed or you will waiting awhile on busy days to get up or down to the 8th floor. Also be aware that the paper thin walls will let you hear the plumbing of your neighboring hotel guests.Save your money for better food and don't eat at the hotel restaurant either. Mediocre hotel breakfast.The only redeeming factor is the staff we nice.This Marriott is in a great part of town and offered lower rates than any of the other properties in the city. The lobby and the bar area were very nice but I found the rooms to be lacking slightly. Our room was a bit dusty and was a little out dated. Nothing that would stop me from returning, but for a building as nice as this one, I'd expect updates to come soon.I had a pleasant stay at the Waterford Marriott. However, I did expect more from a four star hotel.I checked in late on a Friday night and noticed the lounge was packed with patrons. The sound leaked over to the check-in desk making it hard to hear the staff. I had the usual small talk comparing Oklahoma's weather to Texas. Hmmm.. Not sure why the lady asked if I reserved the room using Orbit, but anywho I was looking forward to getting a great nights rest.The room was clean, but looked a bit "dated". I also thought their blue office chair looked a bit funny. The restroom was smaller than I had expected and overall the room resembled more like a 3-star hotel room.Breakfast was expensive with small portions and slow/late-service. Next time, I would just head to the lobby, grab a free cup of Starbucks, and head out for breakfast elsewhere.Overall, the staff was nice and apologetic for their shortcomings and my stay was pleasant. To-date, this has been the nicest hotel I have stayed in, but there is room for much needed improvement.Oh! I would definitely recommend everyone to "shop around" and look for their best rates.I had the pleasure of staying at the Waterford Marriott for the first time last week When I booked my reservation, I was a bit hesitant based on some of the reviews I had read on Yelp, and I wasn't sure of what to expect To say I was pleasantly surprised would be an understatement. My boyfriend and I had a flawless experience from the moment we checked in. We were greeted warmly on arrival, and our room was immaculate. The bed was so comfortable and cozy, the bathroom was spotless, and we had a lovely balcony from which we watched the snow fall. The hotel has complimentary Starbucks coffee in the lobby all the time, as well as warm cookies, tea and flavored water in the afternoon. There is ample complimentary parking. The hotel itself is quite charming. Coming from Los Angeles, my expectations are pretty high in terms of service and setting, and I must admit, I'm a bit of a hotel snob. The Waterford exceeded all of my expectations!I must mention the person who truly made our stay exceptional. Bert, the front desk manager, is an incredibly warm, gracious, and caring woman. She was attentive to all of our needs, and offered wonderful suggestions about places to visit in Oklahoma. She was spot on about everything, and I truly enjoyed learning more about the city from her. In fact, we so enjoyed our experience at the hotel, due mostly to Bert's hospitality, that we returned to the hotel for an extra night.Special thanks to Randy as well for helping to make our stay so wonderful. Truly, every staff member we encountered was friendly, inviting, and professional.I cannot wait to visit Oklahoma City again, and I look forward to staying at the Waterford Marriott. I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.  :  )And it keeps getting worse....went out for the day and came back to our room and it was just as we left it! No housekeeping even came by to leave fresh towels...much less refresh the toiletries or empty the trash. Also, our room keys have malfunctioned every night requiring us to trudge back to the desk each night!Based on a pleasant experience a decade, or so ago, I recently steered some out-of-town guests to the Waterford. When I fished for response as to how they liked their room, I was shocked to hear that they were not pleased. According to them, the room was very average, not expertly cleaned, had no concierge on duty and no hint of luxury. When they booked the room they had requested a room with a refrigerator. After nearly 24 hours, someone on staff finally robbed one of the other rooms to provide one. I was embarrassed for having recommended the Waterford and will not do so again. One of the other reviewers described it as a "hotel with faded glory". I suspect the statement may be correct.You become a loyal Marriott customer. Join their rewards program. Use your reward points to stay "free" and at check-in they swipe your card for "incidentals" to get pre-authorization. I would assume incidentals would mean $20-30. Nope. Try $90 per night. $50 per night if you are a paying customer. Not once during check-in was it explained to me how much money they were charging to my account. I just called and spoke to a front desk employee to express my annoyance. He said there is a sign at the front desk saying the bank card will be charged. I said the sign does not say they will charge my account $90 per day. It can take a week to 10 days for a persons bank to release the funds back. Obviously if you are staying at a hotel you are most likely traveling so the money is kinda needed. Long story short, I am tearing up my Marriott rewards card. This didn't feel like loyalty service to me.I'm actually kind of surprised that Waterford has such a poor overall rating. That's not to say that the other reviewers are wrong. Based on their reviews, most of them are justified in giving the ratings they did. However, I had a great experience at Waterford Marriott. But I am also easily impressed so that should be taken into account.Of particular note:- Service was fairly impressive. Everyone I dealt with was cordial, and their assistance/service went well beyond anything that was required of them. And they kept calling me sir. I'm a sucker for stuff like that.- The food was delicious. Honestly, I was surprised that it was as well-made as it was considering some of the issues that others had about the place. Genuinely well made dishes, and that was pretty much for everything that I had: Brisket (decent), Chicken (amazing), Salmon (lacking salt but otherwise good), Sides (yum, particularly the mashed 'taters and green beans), Desserts (yum raised to the power of 3. Yum cubed).- Decent aesthetics that one comes to expect and associate with boutique hotels. Sure, the prices are a touch on the high side, especially for a small town like Oklahoma City, but my experience was pleasant enough that I have to give Waterford its due. 3.75. Rounded up because the desserts were so amazing.First of all I have to thank the kindest Marriott employee "Tiffany"- if it wasn't for her this review would have been 1 star and we would have found a completely different hotel the night we checked in. She was over and above friendly and accommodating ....... Deserving of five stars!!! But the real problem was the first room we checked into smelled horrible, like sewage, it was disgusting. The carpet was dirty and had lots of hair stuck to it and there was a pile of hair behind the door in the bathroom. Also, as listed in another review, the air filter was uncovered in the closet and making or horrible banging noise. So after checking in and lugging all of our bags and newborn up to that room - we had to change rooms or hotels all together. As mentioned Tiffany got us another room- upgraded to a suite. It was nicer, smelled a little bit better and no banging noise. But it was still dingy. There was coffee or some brown stain on the bathroom vanity. This hotel is old and it shows, still no excuse for poor housekeeping- yuck!
review_content_20: We stayed here a full week and had a pleasant stay.  Pretty rooms, comfy beds, good parking, nice lobby.  My only complaints was the cleanliness of the room and they were pretty minor.  I've seen worse!We left a tip every day for housekeeping and they dutifully changed our towels and made the beds.  However, the room was dusty when we checked in and remained so.  We ran out of TP and had to ask for some.  They never changed out the glass cups in the bathroom or refilled the disposable coffee bar over the course of the week (six nights, seven days).  I found a toenail clipping with blue nail polish on it in the bathroom (NOT MINE!) and a hair in the bed.  I asked for the bed linens to be changed and they weren't.  (there were two large stains on the top bedspread corner and they were still there after supposedly being changed out).All in all, I'd stay here again.  I would definitely ask for a room with a window that opens next time (too stuffy!).On my trip cross country with my sister we stayed one night at this property.  Of all the Marriott in all the towns we stayed, we liked this one the best.   The lobby is lovely, really beautiful.  Felt like the kind of place you where you could have a nice wedding reception or bar mitzvah.   We are Elite Gold Members and we were offered access to the concierge lounge, where they not only had the regular crackers and cheese, but some really great dumplings and soy sauce, which we could not get enough of after our long drive through Arkansas.  The room was extremely comfortable and we had a great night's sleep.  There was also lots of extra space for the two of us.  Finally, before we left we had a complimentary breakfast buffet.  THAT was truly the highlight.  Some of the Marriotts we had stayed in over the course of our trip only offered cereal and muffins and the like for breakfast.  This place had eggs, sausage, waffles, french toast, BISCUITS AND GRAVY, which was really the kicker and something we needed on such a cold morning.  All in all, I would stay here again.  The only criticism I have is that it's not really in the city proper, but it was close enough to Bricktown, where we hung out for the evening, to be convenient.I usually stay at Hilton's for work but decided to give this Marriott Waterford a try, something I really regret.First off this hotel is really out of place, it's stuck RIGHT inside a community, their backyards back right up to the pool, just a weird location.  Not a deal breaker.  Parking was limited for such a large property, maybe there was underground parking  somewhere.First night I tried the bar, asked a few questions about the wings like what exactly was the special hot sauce named after the place, he had no idea. OK not a deal breaker.Headed up to the room, 6th floor.  First warning sign stepping out of the elevator was a sign that said to be quiet.  That's odd, this is OKC not Las Vegas.  Didn't really think much of it.Then when I went to lay down I found out why I hated staying here, PAPER - THIN - WALLS.  Really, you can do everything bad at a hotel, as long as you have a place to lay your head and sleep you are ok, this hotel is NOT it.  I could hear someone mixing a drink next door like they were in my bathroom, some obnoxious stories from a grandmother about how her little one "was born form a Caterpillar" and I could even hear a guy dropping his pen on his desk like I was in the room with him.  FORGET trying to sleep.  Two guys talking in the hall at midnight woke me right up.  Your best bet is to turn your TV up and try to sleep, that's what I did, my neighbor and I played TV wars until early morning.  Better TV noise than neighbor noises.The last night of 4 was much better, all the neighbors checked out and I finally got some peace and quiet.Another side effect of the poor wall construction is the temperature.  If you are too cold cranking up the heat only helps if you have neighbors doing the same thing.  If you are too hot its likely because your neighbors are heating so you have no control of the temperature. My advice is if you must stay here ask to be put on a floor with few others.  Positives were the gym has great quality machines.  Linens are nice, tea and coffee machine good, and alarm clock is the best I've used.Lots of other nagging little annoyances, like the rotating door was locked at 6am so had to walk to the parking lot outside in the cold instead of being in the heated walkway.  The TV is locked out and you can't use any of the important features on the remote like the SLEEP button, sure would be nice if the TV shut itself off after you fall asleep for everyone's pleasure.Stayed here again for some meetings. We had a much better experience than last time. Probably the main reason it improved was that we went next door to Bellini's to eat since our last meal at the Waterford was such a disaster. Our group was still talking about the "last supper" more than a year later.I still think this hotel is a bit over hyped and is more on scale with an exceptional Hampton or Hilton Garden Inn. The building is old enough that the rooms are noisy, plumbing resounds throughout the floor, and neighbors can be easily heard (if you catch my drift).Mrs Eva and I don't mind staying here when someone else foots the bill, but I would never personally pay this much money for this room.Not a very good stay at all. Me fiance is a platinum member and he called customer service for his card and we booked a room here for the night. When we got to the hotel it looked very nice.
