At the desk we were told that we would be getting a handicap room because they were all booked up. We had asked for a king suit while on the phone with customer service. We prob would have gone to the Marriott up the street if we had known.  Also the girl who checked us in made some off handed comment about the type of people who stay at there hotel. We were given breakfast vouchers to there restaurant and there breakfast was very good. They also had a complimentary cheese plate and small bottle of wine delivered to the room. We had also asked for a playpen for our son and they didn't have that ready either. It was very hard taking a shower in the morning because the shower head was so low. My fiance did call Marriott and let them know about the experience and they refunded us the points we used to book the room along with some additional point.Have stayed several times.  The staff has always been helpful, and rooms clean.The could probably use an update but not bad.  Like the location.I will start by saying that the room was nice and the staff was friendly, no disappointments there. Other than that this was a very disappointing stay. I booked this hotel for a date night with my 4 year old daughter so this was supposed to be a fun special night together. We ate at the hotel restaurant, I won't review that here but let's say it wouldn't have added any stars to this review. The one thing my daughter wanted to do was go swimming so it was a good thing they had a heated pool, right? Wrong. I called the day of the stay about the pool and was told that it was heated (it is October). My daughter and I get ready for a fun night of splashing and try to get in but the water was COLD! We couldn't even stay in 5 minutes. She was so disappointed, so we headed to the hot tub which is in the gym. At least it was warm. The jets didn't work and we left when a bandaid floated by. We went straight to the desk to complain about the temperature of the pool. They sent someone to check and they said that the water was almost 70 degrees and was that good enough. No, that is too cold for water. The average temp of a heated pool is between 77 and 82 degrees. That is a big difference when it comes to water temp for swimming. I was then told that they would have the heat turned up and it would be ready by morning. The next morning my daughter and I stroll down to the pool only to be disappointed again. There was no change in temp and we couldn't swim at all. Now back to the hot tub, but wait, it's out of order. On our way out of the hotel I complained again only to find out that the hot tub was closed all week (gross, we sat in a "closed" unclean hot tub). I received no real apology, no manager was contacted, no manager call after the fact and no compensation for this debacle. At least I got to spend some time with my daughter but I wish she could have enjoyed the one thing she wanted to do, swim.The Waterford is a hotel with faded glory.  Staff has been wonderful, which is the ony reason I am rating it as high as I am .  Also parking is free and it is always clean etc.  One reason I don't stay here often is that it is unbelievable that they actually charge for the internet here!!!!!  Not only that, but they charge PER DEVICE!!! Be careful or you'll pay more than your room charge!I use my Hot Spot here, but it really isn't as good as the free internet I get at Hampton Inn.  Also, for a lot less at the Hampton Inn/Fairfield/Hilton Garden Inn etc., I get a refrigerator and microwave and frequently a suite.  I ask for a refrigerator at the Waterford (it says they are available), but never get one.  Parking is good, even if it is a long walk if you don't get to park on the west side parking lot.  However, Valet parking is only $12 per day (less than the internet charge!).Coffee (Starbucks brand) and newspapers in the lobby in the morning are nice, but I get that at other hotels also.It appears that Marriott is just maintaining the Waterford, without any plans for improvement.  I am sure the facility is inefficient to operate in today's world.  The location is hardly a hot location anymore with Downtown and the Quail Springs area the leading area.A faded rose that is still enjoyable to stay at but hardly worth the money.  We stay when special rates are available, but still grit our teeth in anger at the ripoff internet charges.  I avoid Marriott's (or any hotel) that charge extra for the internet. Anymore that is like charging for bathrooms.  Since I stay about 70 nights a year in hotels, Marriott could make more money by not charging for the Internet.Marriott needs to pull itself into the real world.Everyone knows your name here! Their remodeled rooms are fantastic and cozy.... will definitely be back!For weekend leisure guests, the Waterford might be a decent option given the abundance of special rates. However, for business travelers, I would recommend Oklahoma City Marriott over the Waterford. Here's why.Waterford is quite overrated. It positions itseld as a "boutique" hotel, although there's nothing "boutique" about it: austere if spacious rooms devoid of decoration; very slow TVs (as it, takes forever to flip through the channels), staff not very cordial or happy to see you. Even their corporate rates are too high compared to other hotels in the area, and they do not even offer free Internet service! In this day and age, I find it hard to justify paying $25 per day for a connection, yet Waterford is penny-pinching its guests. And my room did not even have a shampoo!Exercise room is decent; however, the jaccuzzi is right outside the exercise machines through the glass door, offering no privacy whatsoever. I must note that Waterfords's bang for the buck used to be better in 2010, but has inexplicably decreased this year. So much so that I, as a regular business traveler, see no reason to stay here as opposed to a friendlier, more helpful and more reasonably-priced Oklahoma City Marriott just up the street.Food is terrible here.  I live nearby and have stopped in several times and really the service isn't great and could only be considered good by 1980s standards.  The hotel needs a total overhaul and is really only on par with 2-star or possibly 3-star hotels.Pricey by the standards of OKC. Room was nice, clean and the hotel has decent facilities. Breakfast was bland - even by the standards of a 3 star hotel. Service was attentive and competent at every level.Really pleasant. Staff and service were tremendously accomodating. I'd definitley stay there in the furueThis a boutique Marriott but it has everything you would want. Room service, lobby bar, swimming pool, conference rooms and facilities, and a small store as well.Great service - very nice associates. The room was comfortable, parking seemed well lit and secure, and we didn't really need too much during our stay. Location is near a mall, lots of shopping and restaurants, but the hotel is within a small office park area bordered by neighborhoods. Very quiet and nice!I travel a lot for business and stay at many different hotels but I  have to say that this hotel is the WORST place I have ever stayed in.  The attendant at the front door is too busy texting and does not care to open the door for you as you are entering the hotel with your baggage. Go to your room to find that it was not vacuumed as you step on nuts left behind from someone's snack. Then try to have a restful morning as housekeeping keeps knocking on the door wanting to make up your room at 8am.... And then again at 10am even though now at 10 am your tv is on and the shower is running as you are obviously in the room!!!DO NOT DARE to go to the gym in the basement unless you like looking at filthy mirrors that look like some did not have tissues after blowing there nose across the room.....  Unless you like hair and sticky stuff on the space between the petals on the elliptical cycle STAY AWAY!As if all of this was not enough....  Try getting a cab?  No cabs at all at check-out time! Waited 25 minutes before the one that I had the front desk call for arrived....  I almost missed my flight! If you want to be treated this way, save money and stay at a Roadside motel.  You actually might have a better experience. Save yourself ....... find a different hotel!!A decent hotel, but not really a "boutique." The whole stay got off to a bad start when I had to search the entire bottom floor to find someone to check me in. I know that I showed up late (midnight) but I shouldn't have to go into the kitchen to find someone to check me in. The rooms were large enough but they had an older, musty feel to them. Not, by any means unfashionable, you could just tell it had been there for a while. The second real issue that I have is that I could not believe I had to pay for Internet with the room rate that was paid. It is in a good location for what I needed to do but the bottom line is this, Go elsewhere.We spent some time there recently and had a great time.  Among the details that made it pleasant:  -When I called them from Bricktown they had no trouble directing us to the hotel, They upgraded us to a suite since they were out of rooms with 2 beds,  the pool was open until 11.... all things that made my trip just a bit more fun!  They don't have free wi-fi but I didn't even ask about the cost b/c we didn't need to access the web during a weekend of relaxation.  :-)Our party made reservations for two rooms for this evening.  We get to the hotel and the tiny parking lot is completely full.  We pull around to the main entrance and go inside to check in.  The desk clerk informed us that our reservations had been cancelled and they had no rooms for us.  Absolutely ridiculous, as the room had already been secured with a credit card. The desk clerk made no effort to help get a room at another Marriott establishment in Oklahoma City, and simply stated to try the one down the road.This seems more like a little boutique hotel than a Marriott flag.  Very nice yet not terribly fancy, either.  The room was clean, bed comfy and had a nice decor.  I was treated to wine & cheese on my first night there, plus breakfast coupons.   The breakfast buffet was impressive, but I must say, the scrambled eggs were strange (and strange tasting) and the gravy for the biscuits was overwhelmingly, excessively salty.   A brisk, gum-chomping front desk clerk and a lackadaisical bartender ran counter to its ambience but most employees were great.  I was a little surprised that there wasn't a gift shop, only a sundries shop and I wasn't sure if it was complimentary or honor system.  Overall, I really enjoyed my stay, will probably come again and found it to be a great value.

review_content: Nice and clean. The staff was very friendly. Hotel was very quiet. Definitely recommend.Upsides: This hotel feels clean and modern. The staff is invariably warm and polite. There is a wide variety of hot and cold food choices at breakfast. There is a shuttle to the OKC airport every half hour. The TVs in the bedroom are large.Downsides: I was underwhelmed by many of the choices at breakfast: Red Delicious apples, scrambled eggs under a hot lamp, thick bread-y donuts, sugary-sweet yogurt. The mini-fridges in the two rooms I've stayed in were noticeably loud, as were the AC units. On my first stay (a cold night in January), our AC unit only produced cold air; after shivering for an hour, we realized the room wasn't warming up and were moved into a new room down the hall. On my second stay, I forgot my contact lens kit; the front desk did not have any cases, but offered to sell me a tiny bottle of solution for $6.50. The staff was polite, and maybe that's a standard policy at all hotels, but I felt like I was being fleeced, not helped (I slept in my contacts).This hotel was a great find, right off the freeway, and we enjoyed our stay here. Plus, they accept dogs (but with a pretty steep fee). The room was large and very nicely decorated. The breakfast left a little to be desired and wasn't that great (although it was nicely presented). I would stay here again though.We stayed a night at this hotel before flying back home recently. I wanted to stay close to the airport and after reading Yelp reviews of hotels, we chose this one.  What a fantastic experience.  The front desk staff was quite pleasant and the room was really nice.  I wish I could have recorded the reaction of my kids when opening the door because I am sure Hyatt would play it in their commercials.  They couldn't believe the size of the room.  It was spacious to say the least.  The bathroom is set up a little odd with a very small area for shower/toilet but we didn't feel that was a huge issue at all.  The hotel is convenient to not only the airport but also quite a few dining options within walking distance.  The breakfast is better than most hotel breakfast, with some hot sandwiches plus the options offered at most. The only issue we had was finding the turn in to the hotel.  Meridian is pretty cluttered so just look for the sign and you'll see where to turn in but there didn't appear to be more than one way in or out.  So, don't try to go in a "back way" like I did :)  For the price point, you cannot beat this hotel.  I can guarantee if we find ourselves needing to stay in OKC again in the future, this hotel will be at the top of our list.  I can't say enough good things.Really enjoyed my stay here. Came to OKC on business for a few days. Immediately greeted by front desk staff. Both reps were fantastic. I like how they walk around the desk to hand you your room keys. Room was clean and big. No complaints here.Breakfast was also great. Definitely try the egg sandwich and the oatmeal. I highly recommend this hotel. Free airport shuttle tops it off!This is our second stay at the Hyatt Place. Always a pleasure, great oversized room which is exceptionally clean! Comfortable beds and pillows. In room fridge and safe come in handy. Large vanity to get ready in the morning. Great breakfast is included we and they have a 24/7 made 2 order cafe to include coffees, pastries, cocktails and quick food. This will always be our choice when we stay in OKC.Excellent hotel for the price point and part of a quality chain.  Service has inmproved in terms of recognizing Platinum and Diamond Status, which is a plus for us frequent travellers.  The breakfast smetimes strays from the Hyatt artisan sandwiches which is a good thing and nice change of pace.   Workout room is clean, with 3 types of cardio and dumbells and all equipments has been fully functional for each of my stays.  Location is convenient to the airport and freewayxs into the city if that is where you are headed.  Since I do most of my work by the airport, this works really well.  There are a  dozen restaurants that are walkable, including one in the parking lot for a varity of fare from Fast Food, Itaian, Barbeque, Asian, Mexican and Tex Mex.  Staff is always professional and very friendly.And here's an odd thing I noticed during my last trip that I like; the bds are on platforms meaning nothing gets tossed under, lost or forgotten beneath the bed and it is one less place to find surprises from previous guests.For a name brand hotel that is within government per diem, you really can't beat it!The Hyatt Place exceeded all of our expectations.  A great room at a great price.  Christina at the front desk was quick, efficient, and very nice.  She even showed us to the elevator and opened the door for us.  Guests receive at 10% discount at several local restaurants.  This place is a must stay.  We would definitely stay here again.Stayed at this hotel overnight and had a great experience.  At this price point, there's NO beating a Hyatt Place.  VERY clean rooms, friendly staff, good location, VERY clean outdoor swimming pool, and free parking.  For $100/night what else can you ask for?We are Hyatt Place rewards members because all of the locations are consistent in offering a spotless room at a reasonable price.*This location has been updated with new carpet & furniture.Great place to stay. Great breakfast, clean rooms and good access to wifi and tv channels.I was seriously stunned at how excellent this place was from the minute I walked through the door.We booked on Priceline, I'm always wary about price-lining a hotel, some places give 'lesser' service when they see you're a price line user, some have special floors they put you on, most give you a double bed and nothing bigger.  We're the bottom of the pecking order as Priceline users.  It SUCKS.  Just cause we get a good deal for our buck, doesn't mean we're not a customer or should be treated 'less than' (rant over!)From the minute we walked in to check in this place was great, the guy at the front desk asked us what floor we wanted, he asked if we wanted a King size bed (heck yes!) and when we got to the room, it was way bigger than I expected.  The kitchenette was handy, though no microwave, the fridge was useful and the TV was large (and modern).  Bathroom was a little small, though the shower was excellent (shower-fussy husband!!), the air conditioner unit was strong enough to cool my hot-water-bottle-husband down without freezing me into an icicle.The hotel was quiet, the walls aren't paper-thin like in a lot of them and the bed, although it sounded like it was going to fall apart, was very comfy and we both slept well.Free breakfast, free parking, free internet, all very important and the 24 hour shop/room service is a nice touch also, though we didn't use it other than to buy a milky way after a hockey game as we went up to our room.I'd not only happily stay here again, but I doubt I'd stay anywhere else if we were passing through the area.  The staff were friendly and accommodating, the cleaners treated my lion cub well (that's always a test for me, who puts my teddy bear lion cub back on the bed after they make it - yes I'm aware this makes me sound 12!), just an all round great hotel, we both loved it!My first time staying at a Hyatt Place. I was there for 3 days and will be returning again in a week. My stay was very comfortable and the room was clean. This hotel is reletivly new and very well maintained. I did not give 5 starts for one reason. I enjoy some protiens with my morning breakfast. Sausage, bacon and ham are all good with me. Unfortunatly I do not eat eggs and the only way to get some ham or sausage was to get it on a roll with eggs and cheese. I asked about getting just sausage and bacon and was told by a manager I should ask and they will make it for me. When I asked the next morning, I was told what I see is what they have. The worker also told me they only have sausage and ham seperate on weekends. Last, the breakfast set up is very attractive...they have electric range with skillits that the workers put the food on. Unfortunatly the skills are warm at the most (my food was so cold i braved touching the skillet and that is how i know the temp of the skillet). Both the french toast and pancakes were cold. I am hoping that when i return, this review will help some change..Very nice room, modern and comfortable. Close to the airport. Only thing that was annoying was getting the 2 dark brown pubic hairs out of the shower from the last people. It would really suck to be a housekeeper :(.Front desk staff reasonably polite. Complimentary airport shuttle supposedly starts at 5 am but may not push off til 5:30 if demand is low. Hot breakfast starts 6:30 but cold goods were available at 5: granola, yogurt, cottage cheese, fruit, baked goods. Deadline to check in is midnight, a good 6-9 hours after the other options along this stretch cut off (which also charge a nominal fee for their shuttles). Bathroom's cramped but a king suite can comfortably sleep 3-4 with the extra blanket by the couch. Basic channel list includes decent options. Plush pillows. Water took a bit to warm up and the range on the TV remote is fussy from the bed. Hairdryer and coffeemaker worked fine, though I'd recommend against the chunky powdered creamer. Free wi-fi. Unfortunately I was too tired to check out the fitness center. A bit pricey given limited options on short notice but I'd stay here again.Great hotel, great rate! "Select service", meaning they only give you the few items most travelers business travelers demand. Not a replacement for either high end, tip for everything luxury hotels or an extended stay hotel such a home2, Element, Residence Inn or Homewood Suites. It's more like a DIY (do your own bags if you want, park yourself, etc.) semi luxury hotel, and it's great! I don't like people touching my stuff, anyway, but I sure do like at least a touch of luxury, and that's what Hyatt Places have. :)At the time of this writing, you can earn extended checkout status faster with Hyatt than most chains -- meaning 2pm, even 4m at some properties, is easily within reach. This particular Hyatt Place is one of the few places in Oklahoma that is modern looking (for a moderate price), and generally speaking, much cheaper than similar Hilton's and Marriotts. They also give you The Wall Street Journal instead of the fear mongering USA Today that many other hotels provide. This is classier to me, and actually makes me feel better in a tangible way. I'd rather pick a paper and learn something useful, than be driven to excessive anxiety and an early grave!I simply love the format of Hyatt Places for quick stays. Easy in, easy out, large room, enormous LG TV, late night and sometimes 24 hour (as this hotel) restaurants. Perfect for business people, although I even take my family -- as the king bed and queen size sleeper is big enough for all. Hyatt's also seem to clean and keep things new looking better than many brands. Hyatt is more like a more business and family Starwood, than a run of the mill Marriott or Hilton. Good stuff for practical stays.Good price. Love the layout of the spacious rooms when traveling. Good local restaurants.Wow. This place was terrible. No idea how it has any good reviews. The service was fine, but the rooms are terrible. Stained carpet, peeling wallpaper in the bathrooms, brown stains all over the bathtub and shower area, EXTREMELY loud AC unit on the window that constantly woke up my baby all night...I just don't know how this place gets any good reviews! And it's expensive for how horrible the rooms are. Never staying here again.Wonderful experience! The room was super clean and smelled great, the price was amazing too!  HUGE flat screen tv, 24/7 room service, easy in/out, classy place!My only complaint: it was too hot in the indoor pool room~ 110 outside and it felt like 130 inside that room, I couldn't breathe!  Other than that the staff was super kind and helpful.  We'll be staying there again!I've stayed at many hotels across the country over the past seven years for work. I typically enjoy staying at Hyatt Place hotels, they are very business friendly. Unfortunately this specific Hyatt Place has been disappointing. I can't put my finger on it, it just seems cheaper and more run down than some of their other properties. The one thing I can specifically talk about us the lack of a guest laundry, what? I travel Monday thru Friday and instead of packing dirty clothes for my trip home, I like to wash them while on the road. This hotel has no guest laundry, I'll called the front desk and the receptionist said they send out guest laundry. Some people prefer the option to wash their own clothes! Especially when you don't have time to have your laundry sent out.I have stayed at this location 3 times.  Each time the staff has been very pleasant and helpful with my questions.  One thing you notice off the bat is someone is always cleaning in the lobby.  Cleanliness is great!  The rooms are very modern, and have all the amenities a room should have.  I have never used the Internet at this location, so I can't comment on that.  As you can see in the pictures you have a staging area and bedroom.  When I travel I'm always alone so a room with this setup works.  If I were with a group of people it might be different.  The sinks are basically in the middle of the bedroom with no door.  While the shower and toilet are located in a separate room, the sinks are not.  Basically it would be very hard for someone to get ready and another person to sleep.  Free breakfast in the morning with a great assortment of hot sandwiches.  I had a smoked gouda/bacon/cheese sandwich that hit the spot.  One of the best complimentary breakfast's I have ever had.  Keep up the good work!
review_content_20: Excellent service, good clean rooms, complimentary breakfast, worth it in any city, check them out!  We look for this place and are able to find them in most cities, and they always seem to be very much the same. That's something to count on!We stayed here last night on our road trip and it was not our favorite place. The bathroom is really small and had difficulties with the shower settings. It was a tub/bath and we prefer a larger standing shower only with a glass door. The bed was not too comfortable either.The TV was big and the room was clean, but we didn't like the layout and struggled to relax. The wifi was really slow too. We really enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn though in Albuquerque!Extremely nice Hotel, room was very nice, clean. The desk staff welcomed me when I arrived- which was after 2:30am! They knew I was arriving late due to flight delays, held the room with no problem. The next morning the staff got me breakfast after they had closed the buffet. I would definately stay here again.Stayed at this location on a cross-country trip back on December 26, 2012 and I had the pleasure to meet the GM, David Lamb, at breakfast. He introduced himself and asked how the stay was. I let him know I am in the travel business and stay in about 45-50 hotels a year. I ran down a whole list of positive experiences we had during our stay...easy check-in, clean and well-appointed room, wake-up call on-time, well-stocked breakfast in a clean eating area, and a seamless check-out. We couldn't have been more pleased, and the only thing I regret is not writing this soon, as I assured him I would.This place took the Hilton Garden Inn concept and did it even better.  Hyatt took their former Amerisuites and turned them into the gem that is Hyatt Place.Found a wonderful deal at an online price negotiator website.  Check-in was a breeze with their self-service terminal, but I can see that being frustrating for some travelers.The room was spacious, modern and clean.  Everything was in working order and I was delighted to find a big screen TV with HD channels and free wireless internet.One negative was that the bathroom fan was just too darn loud, and the self-service nature of check-in seems to make staff not want to deal with guests.I didn't partake in any of their food offerings, but I understand they have quite an extensive breakfast.I found this location to be conveniently located between the airport and I-40, with plenty of fast food and casual dining restaurants in the immediate area.This was my first time ever staying at a Hyatt Hotel (Hyatt Place to be specific). Due to the project I was on, this was the recommended hotel.Overall, I thought it was a decent hotel.  I love the design of the rooms and the flat screen televisions.  However the internet sucks.But what did it for me at this particular location was one of the staff.  When a staff member makes comments (every time he sees you) makes it a bit uncomfortable to stay there.  I did not need to hear from the staff member that he liked my shoes so much that he was willing to beat me up for them.  Not alone, if he beat me up, take me to my room and drop me off.  Also, my workout pants (2 separate occasions) disappeared from my room. Coincidence, I think not!!! Scary and very unacceptable.  When I noticed myself going in through the back entrance to avoid this person, I know it was time to stay at another hotel. Unfortunately, I did not complain to the hotel manager.  I just decided to leave the hotel entirely.Like some other reviews of seen of this place I found (after staying) the Internet service to be horrible. At times completely unusable. Worse yet you'll get different stories from different front desk staff and the General Manager if you start complaining. I have always had good luck at Hyatt Place in other locations including Tulsa so I didn't check reviews. Now that I have, I can find complaints going way back about the internet service here as well as the staff. You lose points not because you have an issue but via how you deal, or don't deal, with it. The staff here is definitely not up to Hyatt standards - or any decent hotel for that matter. I would never stay at this location again. Far too many better choices (even within walking distance).This was a really nice surprise. I chose it based on Yelp reviews. THe rooms are roomy and comfortable with massive TV screens. Not your average hotel room lay-out so that made it interesting. They have really gone the mile for a design oriented mass hotel and it feels successful. Nice breakfast buffet and overall atmosphere. Even the workers outfits are well thought out and modern. I will return to a Hyatt Place for sure.This was my first time in OKC..  I was at the Hyatt for about 2 3 weeks...THe staff here is great. Mike , who works Fri nghts only.. Jessy Rob and Steve and Patrick are all great people..The rooms however are not good at all.. I had gnats in my room which is very disappointing. The breakfast is just ok.. nothing special.. not enough variety.. almost no whole grains. On my last night there a cockroach crawled out of the blow dryer ground prong plug as I was pulling it out .. It was the most disgusting thing I had ever seen.. THere is probably a whole bunch of them between those wires coming out one by one.The pool is super small more like a kids pool only. Again lots of cockroaches there as well.The place looks clean adn one of the best places that you can get in OKC specially if you need to be close to the airport. There is one staff member with a pakistani accent who works at night. He seems not to be so helpful. I asked many times for a real person calling me to wake me up in the morning and he wouldn't call and the machine would. I got sick and asked for a bottle of water adn he refused to bring it up for me. Mike Rob Jessy Steve and Patrick are GREAT .. If it wasn't for their service I would probably report this hotel .Very nice place.  I did not even realize it was a Hyatt, it is very upscale and wonderful rooms.  Good little breakfast too!This hotel recently became a Hyatt Place, which is Hyatt's new, hip, fun brand. I joked that I had my very own lounge, which I totally did because the rooms are like mini-suites with a separate area that has an over-sized sectional sleeper sofa, desk, sink/bar area, and a view of the swiveling 42-inch flat screen. The decor was fun, the bed was comfy, the staff was totally friendly, and breakfast was free. I'm kind of a hotel snob, and I was totally happy here..

review_content: Sometimes last minute decisions really do work out. We had originally planned to make our 3rd stop on our roadtrip to a low cost hotel about a mile east of Bricktown. As is often my habit before a day's journey, I google-mapped the locale, and realized a change in plans was not only desirable, but necessary. I figured that we might as well stay in an area within walking distance of Bricktown's attractions, (i.e. restaurants, ballparks), and couldn't help notice that the Hampton was quite literally behind the outfield of Chickasaw Bricktown Ballpark, home of the Dodgers' AAA affiliate. So, if we planned things out correctly, we could check in and then go to the 6:05PM start for the Sunday night ballgame.Well, given that we didn't arrive until 6:30PM, and were rather tired by that point, we elected to not purchase tickets to the game. Note that I wrote "not purchase tickets". That is not the same as "saw the game", as it turns out we had a rather decent view of the outfield, straight from our room on the 5th level!I think this hotel would rank highly solely based on the ballpark view, but that would be a bit unfair. The cashier welcomed us with a smile, had her collective act together, and was very explicit in what both the hotel and area had to offer, even relaxing us by saying that getting into the parking garage wasn't as difficult as it might seem.The area itself is outside the scope of a hotel review, but I'll just suggest that this place to stay is more than strategically located. I think the most remarkable aspect of this franchise is the lack of noise - even though the hotel seemed to be full, with plenty of enthusiastically-yelling children, we didn't notice that from our room. Perhaps this is because the pool area was more than large enough to contain a small army, but more likely it spoke to a well-constructed and insulated building. The included breakfast was well set-up, with the ingredients in a separate room from the seating area, and plenty of free newspapers to read while filling our bellies.But the final piece of evidence for this rating? We boarded the elevator at about 9AM of the morning we were going to leave, along with a bunch of the maids. All were chattering away in Spanish, but it was clear they were happy - no bitching about their jobs here.This is a decent hotel in Bricktown, but I think it's far too pricey for what you get.  To begin, you have to check in before you can park.  This is incredibly annoying, and it seems like they should be able to resolve this issue.  The driveway is very small, so if you check it at a busy time (like I did), you probably won't have room.  I circled the block then basically forced myself in after calling the front desk and being told you have to check in before you can park.  The reason is that Hampton Inn shares the garage just to the west of it, and in order to get in, you need a red key card to swipe.  And, it's $12 a day.  So, I had a bad taste in my mouth when I checked in.Check in was quick and the employees were very friendly.  The lobby is fine, it's not spectacular, but it's certainly not dumpy or dirty either.  No bar, you have to go to the Hilton, which adjoins the Hampton Inn, for that.  My room was on the 3rd floor, and I noticed a lot of carpet stains.  My room was very clean, however, and after seeing the exterior carpet, I gave the room a good inspection.  The rooms have a nice view of the ballpark, although mine was on a lower floor and was obstructed by the scoreboard.  The bathroom has a shower stall only, and if you are over 6 feet tall, you'll need to duck.  I nearly scalped myself the first time I got in that thing.  Standard sink, toilet, and toiletries.  The bed has outlets easily accessible on either side, which I like.  That being said, it wasn't very comfortable.  It wasn't bad, but it certainly wasn't a great night's sleep.  I didn't use the pool, but checked it out.  It's for kids, there are a ton of toys, a basketball hoop, and other stuff for them to do.  If you're looking to swim laps in the morning it'd be tough.For what I paid ($175 for a Friday night with an OU home game the next day) I would rather stay at the Colcord or Skirvin just a mile or so away.  Even if you are going to an event in Bricktown, you could walk the distance, take a cab or Uber, and I think it would still be worth staying further away given Hampton's price.  If Hampton was 40% less I'd give it 4 stars, but my stay wasn't worth the price charged.  I'll keep it in mind and would stay here again, but only if the price is much lower.Stopped here during a road trip, and was pleasantly surprised by the surrounding area!On the other hand, the beds were not as comfortable as other hotels. I have a bad back, so it would have helped if they have good mattresses. The rooms were clean, and NO bedbugs!For the price premium, I'm not sure if it's worth the uncomfortable bed.This is a great Bricktown location! We were in town to see a musical (The Book of Mormon), and we were able to walk to the civic center and almost all downtown and Bricktown locations! It was so nice to not have to fuss with parking.The staff at the hotel were all wonderful! Big shout out to Gerry at the front desk who was so warm and welcoming and truly embodied all that it means to be hospitable. The woman who ran breakfast each day was also amazing! Speaking of breakfast...it was wonderful! Complimentary breakfast every day from 6-10. This was a hot breakfast buffet (don't worry, there is a waffle maker), and the selections switched up every day. They had these things called "bagel toppers" that were round egg patties with cheese and bacon. Yum! As an avid egg lover I was happy to see that there were either bagel toppers or omelets every day. Like I mentioned before, the woman who was working breakfast was so pleasant and patient. She even walked around on Saturday morning with little extra snacks and treats for the kids in the breakfast area. Very sweet.The rooms were clean and comfortable. The shower was gigantic! The housekeeping staff was very on top of things. We left the room late in the afternoon and it was clean when we returned that evening!This was a very pleasant stay experience, and I would definitely come back here next time I'm in OKC!Great hampton inn! I've spent any nightstand hampton inns and this is one of the better ones I have visited. There was even a rubber ducky in the bathroom. So cute. Also a bunny towel sculpture. Along with all the other typical hampton amenities. It is in an excellent location for dining etc. The view from the upper levels onto the ball field is really neat. Parking is an extra $12 a day but worth it. In other cities the cost is double or triple this amount for such good proximity to attractions. Clean, larger than normal gym area - also a plus. Indoor pool etc. I will definitely be back here.Location Location Location! This was easy to get to despite some road construction that was blocking an entire street. The hotel is far enough from the major bricktown spots to keep it fairly quiet, but close enough to walk to everything. We even walked as far as the art museum with no issues (except nasty cold weather).The staff were a bit overwhelmed when we arrived, probably recovering from New Years Eve. Our hotel room was clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was fresh and options rotated daily. The breakfast cleanup staff was especially nice!Great hotel this experience, staff very cordial and helpful, the breakfast was excellent with an omelet as a new twist. I would recommend this hotel. A bit dated showers needed some work but it is a busy hotel staff was excellent.Hampton Inn Bricktown. Where to begin! My husband and I spent 5 nights at this Hampton Inn in the early part of July during our first visit to OKC. I have to say the hotel gets high marks because of the location. Bricktown... Some rooms (& parking garage) have a great view of the OKC Dodgers Ballpark. Walking distance of many great restaurants, Bricktown Riverwalk, bars/pubs, Bass Pro Shop. The second best part of this hotel is the staff. Very friendly and welcoming every time we walked back in to the lobby. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. Coffee & tea were available all day long. Something important to a coffee lover like me. The only down side was the breakfast selections when you stay more than a couple of days. Tend to repeat it self but the food was warm.  It was a pleasure to stay here.This hotel was clean, the rooms were big, and we enjoyed our time in this hotel. You can't really stay at a better location in OKC either. The breakfast buffet was great, with lots of options, and we slept really well during our stay in the comfy and large beds. I have to especially complement the staff working here, everyone was fantastic. I think the morale here is great, and they were happy to be at work and also to help/interact with my family. This is something I especially appreciate. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The only reason I am giving the hotel 4 stars, is that the pool had way too much chlorine in it. After swimming, my nephew, sister and I had red eyes that burned from the water. Other children playing in the pool had red eyes and complained of burning. Also, the rest of my family had irritated eyes from simply sitting in the pool area. This is a very easy fix however. Great job Hampton Inn.This is a great place to stay in Bricktown. The bf and I had a great room overlooking left field at the ballpark, so we got to watch the game from our hotel room window :)The pool is really nice here. If you have kids, this is definitely the place to stay. They have fountains and slides and tons of water toys. We would have preferred a quieter swim experience, but we did enjoy sitting in the hot tub.The continental breakfast is delicious; omelets, oatmeal, sausage, cinnabons, toast & bagels, cereal, fruit, etc. It's good.The only downside: it's in Bricktown. Parking is $12/night on top of your room rate, and the noise level is high. The ball game didn't get over until about 11:30, and then the music and noise started up again at 8am the next morning when workers were setting up for the daytime baseball game. Unless you're a heavy sleeper, don't expect to sleep in. But, hey, you're in Bricktown, so it is what it is.I gave this place four stars due to the inconvenience of having to park in the garage then take the elevator to the lobby and then another elevator to your room. Other then that it offers great service and clean rooms well done!!!!This hotel is great.  The location is great.  The staff is great.  It's clean.  It's comfortable.  I don't have to go into a lot of detail except to say that if you're looking for a basic hotel (as opposed to the Ritz or Four Seasons), then this place is a winner.The only strike against it (and why it only gets 4 stars), is the breakfast.  It's not just this hotel--it's ALL Hampton Inns.  Hampton Inn breakfasts are some of the worst free hot breakfasts around.  The food service and dining areas are clean and comfortable, so there's nothing particularly WRONG with it--but there's nothing really RIGHT with it, either.  Unless you eat exclusively oatmeal, you're going to be eating a lot of really unhealthy processed meats, sugary pastries, or flavorless machine-made omelets.Still, I plan on going back to this place next time I'm in OKC.I've stayed at this Hampton Inn twice and have plans to stay here again. Walking distance from restaurants and activities in Bricktown and with a view of the ballpark, this Hampton Inn offers both convenience and value.Like other Hamptons, they provide free internet and a free breakfast. You do have to pay for parking, but since you're smack dab in the best part of in town, that's not surprising. While the hotel has no restaurant, you can easily walk to Nonna's or Mickey Mantle's for a great dinner.Customer service at this Hampton seemed a notch better than at other Hamptons. While you won't find a concierge or an executive lounge like at the big Hiltons or Doubletrees, the friendly employees here offer great dining suggestions, provide directions, and generally make sure your needs are met.If you're lucky, you might get a room facing the ballpark.  Enjoy the view!The Hampton Inn is oddly a great choice for both bar hoppers and families alike.  The location is prime - super easy walking distance for brick town's baseball, bars, and the riverwalk, even in the heat when walking a block feels like a 1/2 a mile.  The rooms are complete little living spaces, almost a studio apartment with decent furnishings and a comfy bed!  Now.  If you are a family, you will love the complete hot breakfast (free!) and a very kid friendly pool that includes a cool looking slide, water basketball, those floaty noodle things, and beach balls.  If you are a couple who have been a little heavy on the adult beverages the night before, the bright and busy breakfast may not be in your comfort zone, and you won't find the pool to be very relaxing. All things considered, I would definitely go back on a weekend trip.I stayed here with my family recently while visiting OKC. It's in the Bricktown area of downtown which is going through some gentrification/revitalization. It's right up against the baseball stadium and is within a short walking distance to the canals/riverwalk and a bunch of shops and restaurants as well as a big movie theater.First and foremost, if you have kids that like to play in water and/or swim, this hotel is great. They feature a fairly large indoor water area that has several water features for the little ones to play and frolic in. The rooms were nice and quiet and the beds were comfortable. Although I HATE, HATE, HATE the pillows (the down feather ones) that this and other hotels are using lately that simply refuse to hold any amount of weight on them or any shape whatsoever so that when you rest your head on them they simply let your head drop down the middle and rise up on the sides to smother you as you try to sleep. This sounds ridiculous but if you can, take your own pillows from home and you will sleep soooooooo much better.They offer free wifi and a "hot breakfast" but seriously the breakfast was a huge disappointment. You're better off skipping it and finding breakfast at one of the area restaurants. They do charge you for parking at the attached parking garage. I think it was $8/day.All in all my little boys loved playing at the pool area during our stay and the service was fine so I give it four stars. If they had firmer pillows that held their shape and had a better breakfast I would gladly give them five stars.The facility its self was nice. However, the night scene is ridiculous. The hotel is right smack in center of the bars and clubs. You can hear all of their music! This went on till about 3am, we got no sleep that night. Perhaps staying on the south side of the building would be better.I was really surprised by this hotel. To be honest I don't often stay at these types of chain hotels, but I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Customer service was average, but I didn't have the highest of expectations.  The beds were comfortable, it was clean, they had a surprisingly nice fitness center and it was fun being right next to the baseball stadium.  The breakfast was terrible, but then again, it's a Hampton Inn not a bnb.  Overall, I would definitely stay here again. For the price and location it was a bargain!This ended up being a great, standard hotel. The room was especially clean, the bed was comfy, and the location is perfect. It was just 10 minutes from my client but right downtown. There are many restaurants just down the street to enjoy, all of which are great. What really sets this hotel apart is the staff. I have stayed at numerous hotels all across the country on business and I have never, ever had the pleasure of meeting a nicer hotel staff. They really go above and beyond to make you feel welcome. Also, I loved the breakfast to go bags.I had to go to OKC on business and my company put me up here for the night. Damn do I like my company!!! The staff was great and very friendly. The clerk even suggested some places to visit while I was there. My room was on the 7th floor and overlooked the minor league baseball stadium. My wife and I chilled for little bit and watched batting practice. The room was extremely clean and very spacious. The bed very very comfortable. Location is everything and this hotel is within walking distance of lots of restaurants and Bricktown's riverwalk. Even better, it's within stumbling distance of lots of bars. I've never been to Bricktown before and was really surprised. It's like a little hidden gem in OK. I'm sure I'll be back up here on business and when I do I'm headed straight back to Bricktown.My wife and I took a random road trip up from Dallas last weekend to spend a little weekend getaway in OKC(Bricktown).  Our Saturday night rate was $159 for the night which is a little pricey for a Hampton Inn, but it ended up being well worth it.  This location is great for both families and those wanting to party in Bricktown.The Hampton Inn is located adjacent to the Redhawks ballpark which is great if you plan on catching a Minor League baseball game.It's located basically right in the middle of Bricktown and is in easy walking distance to anywhere in Bricktown.The room was very and large.  Everything was clean and contemporary.  The bed was very comfortable.  The room rate includes a pretty good breakfast as well.The Pool: The pool looked really great......only if you have kids.  It's an indoor pool with lots for kids to do.  If you are going with your significant other and planning on relaxing by the pool you can forget it.Overall this hotel is the best choice if you plan on spending time in the Bricktown area.
review_content_20: Excellent location (convenient to most everything, including major highways) and the staff is amazing.  We were there for the softball World Series and so experienced the tornado outbreak.  The staff were very knowledgable and kept everyone calm and safe.Rooms are clean and hotel is very nice.  The only knock is the construction next door starts early.  I didn't reduce the number of stars though as it should get better.  Other than that, the hotel was quiet, a definite bonus.This place is in the perfect location right in Brick town and right next to all the action (clubs, bars, restaurants)  I stopped in on my way across country and was pleasantly surprised how nice the hotel was and how great the location was.  I had never been to OKC before but for sure now I will be back.  I had nothing that I didn't enjoy of this hotel and they even serve complimentary breakfast that wasn't just cereal and milk.  They had a nice pool for the kids if you have any and a parking garage to keep your car safe while staying with them.I had never been to Oklahoma City before, so had no idea what to expect when we pulled into the Hampton Inn in Bricktown. Bricktown itself is interesting part of town - very quaint. It seems as they have built it to be a sustainable little neighborhood. For tourists, of course. But it was very cute nonetheless. The lobby itself was very standard, nothing special. The guy at the front desk checked us in and gave us our room key. Again, nothing special. What one would expect from a hotel chain.What was special was our room - it looked out onto a huge baseball field! We had absolutely no idea that's what we signed up for! The BF is a HUGE baseball fan and basically parked himself at the window seat for the next few hours. It reminded me of an indoor cat watching the birds at a bird feeder :)The rest of the room was great too. Comfy bed, mini fridge and decent toiletries. I forgot contact lens solution and the concierge brought some up to our room as well. There are a few drawback to having your room face a minor league baseball field. #1- the lights are kept on until midnight. And they are bright. #2 - the hotel doesn't give you a schedule so it can be a little alarming to have game noise wake you up in the morning. #3 - although you can see pretty much everything from your room, it's not the same as being at a game.Besides that, we very much enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn in OKC. The room was affordable and offered a unforgettable experience. Would absolutely go back if ever in town.Stayed there one night (Saturday) and the Bricktown area is lots of fun.  Lots of bar's, clubs and restaurants, most of which were family friendly up till around 9pm.  The hotel overlooked the ballpark which was great, there was a high school game going on so we sat in our room and watched a couple innings.  The only downside I have on the hotel was the parking lot was closed but it wasn't their fault.  They don't own it and the owner had some work done the weekend we were there.  The hotel made up for it having shuttles to the parking lot they were using thought it was only a block and a half away and the shuttle wasn't needed.  It was a nice walk.Highlights for the hotel were:- Room cleanliness- Pool (great pool for kids look at the pictures)- Customer service.At about 2am a bachlorette party came stumbling, and I mean stumbling back to their room, you could hear them from the moment they got off the elevator till they got in their room.  Their room happened to be right next to ours.  The soundproofing on the rooms was good, but nothing was going to block the noise these ladies made.  Within five minuts of a call to the front desk there was someone at their door making sure they kept the volume down and the ladies did.  Great hotel and we will be back.This hotel has a great location. You are walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. When I stayed in town, the Miami Heat was also there causing a lot of hotels to be fully booked and rates were rather high. The breakfast was delicious and the place was really clean, just a tad pricey!Great location with the type of room you should expect from a Hampton Inn. They don't have the welcome home happy hour that most Hamptons have which sucks. Also no fresh baked cookies in the evening but that's a good thing since I don't have the temptation of them!This hotel is Great - I travel a lot and I have never been more satisfied with a Hotel and it's staff.  The Staff as others have yelped are -- "The Best"..  I can't find one thing to compain about with this hotel..  Clean, Comfortable, Safe, in a good part of town, friendly, convenient to Downtown.  Many Restaurants around.  it's Awesome...If you do not have children...avoid this place. I am Hilton diamond and I can never get an upgrade at this hotel. There are children running up and down the hall at all hours of the day and night and don't even dream about having breakfast in the lobby! The room was clean and in order.My spouse and I booked a room here for an overnight stay while en route from Omaha to San Antonio.  I liked the property because it was easy to access from the interstate and I had read that it was very recently built.  Arriving, I immediately saw the family-friendly, resort-style swimming pool inside the hotel.  I am sorry that we could not use it, as we were too tired and it was packed with people.  The front desk agent upgraded us to a studio suite (room 828), which overlooked Sheridan Street.  Self-parking was an additional charge ($8/night), but was in a controlled-access parking structure connected to the property.  Our room was very large, and had very nice and new soft goods, as well as a large LCD TV.  The bath area was also nice, as was the wet bar.  Facing Sheridan Street on a Friday night, I thought that we would be disturbed by all the noise, but it was hardly noticeable, and went away completely after 11pm or so (I probably was fast asleep and unable to hear anything by then).  We enjoyed the complimentary continental-style breakfast the next morning, and hit the road not too much later.  I would definitely go back to this property so that I can experience it again, as well as take in some of Bricktown.Trusted the Yelpers and wasn't disappointed.Workout facility is one of the best I've seen for this price point.  Free weights, mats, rollers, disposable headphones, water cooler and towels were all available.  24/7 access is great too.Adjacent parking structure is secure with keycard access to leave as well as go down the 'guests only' elevator.  When there's a stadium event, things can get hairy around the turns, though.Tea and coffee station by the front desk was always stocked day and night.  Really nice touch to the already chill lobby space.Wifi and spacious rooms, plus and plus!Only 4 stars for sorta tight registration parking & *meh* hot breakfast (included with rate).Awesome place to stay, convenient location, excellent staff.This is an outstanding property -- by far the best Hampton Inn I've ever stayed in. The hotel is brand new (opened in late winter 2009) and it shows--everything was in perfect condition.The beds were exceptionally comfortable and the staff friendly and efficient. Breakfast was Hampton Inn standard -- very decent for the price (free).Like the other reviewer, my room overlooked the baseball stadium. The team was at an away game when I was there, but it was still a nice view--better than you get from most hotels of this type.This hotel is significantly better than most properties from other higher-end brands. On a previous trip to OKC, I stayed in the Skirvin Hilton. It was perfectly nice, but I think I prefer the Hampton Inn.Me and my sister were in town for the Kings of Leon concert at the Ford Center and wanted to stay in Brick Town so we could walk and be around night life.   Check-in was a breeze and the staff was extremely friendly and conversational. The room was great and very clean. Big fluffy king size bed that can just engulf you. Late night the snack store was open and they let us use the microwave. The only slight down was the room temperature. We could not seem to get it situated where it wasn't hot or too cold. We had it turned down to 68 at one point and yet we were both sweating..that could have been error by operator...but it cooled wayyy down and was fine in the morning. Check out was equally as quick and easy. I will definitely stay there if I go to OKC again!Wonderful location! Great restaurants you can walk to (check out Mantel's and Sage), big, clean rooms, super comfy bed. The staff was very helpful. And complimentary breakfast!after a 13hr drive on day 2 of a road trip from california to atlanta georgia, this place sure beat staying in a motel. the bed was comfortable & though they give you 2 different types of pillows, i still found that neither provided the proper support needed. though for the price you pay, glad to have the various amenities - pool, gym, wifi, breakfast. sure, it's not a typical place to stay when you plan to be there just for a little less that 6hrs... but like i said, it beats staying in a motel.

review_content: This place was rated 3 1/2 stars but I think that is an overstatement.  In my room I had trouble with the outlet for the coffeemaker.  Got that fixed.  Then, the TV didn't work.  Took them until the 2nd call the 2nd day to get it fixed.  The best part was the breakfast buffet downstairs ... it was awesome for the price paid.I must've sounded like one of those crazy hotel guests when I was staying here but it really was one of my worst hotel stays ever. This hotel is so poorly run at night and I don't know what kind of guests they have staying here, but they need to review the kind of market they're trying to keep if they wanna keep the contract with the company I'm with. We came in late at night and needed a fridge. No avail. They had nobody to carry one to our rooms. Bummer, oh well. Atleast their elevators fit all three of us. Yup... three average sized people it fits.I got a lovely wakeup call from my drunk and confused neighbor next door banging on my door to "Open up! Get out of bed!". I didn't know him. He then started banging on his hotel room door and told his roommate or whatever to "Hurry up and clean this damn room. Check out is at 11am, MAKE SURE THERE'S NO SMOKE". Ring ring, I called the front desk and they were out of there. So why two stars? Because the shuttle driver was nice enough to take us around in a 3mile radius and somebody eventually did bring up a mini-fridge and a microwave. I'm spoiled..Later that night...they put a baby next to me. I know.. you can't stop the baby from crying HOWEVER can somebody please explain to mommy and daddy how slamming a door continuously is going to help? Slamming door + screaming baby = Crystal reading the contract the company made with the hotel about quiet rooms etc. Yeah. I was not happy. There are plenty of other hotels in the area. Do yourself a favor.My family stayed here and the service was amazing! The rooms were super clean and the staff really stepped up. My mom was in the hospital passing away and one employee went out of her way to make us as comfortable as possible! Jenni, thank you so much for your caring and compassion. She was truly a top notch professional. We will definitely stay here again! Awesome job!This place is a JOKE! I reserved my room online with CitiDeal and paid in advance.  The bathroom seems like it has not been clean for weeks; there is no fan in  the bath room. I can't even take a shower. The breakfast was taste gross, the elevator broke.  Check out the next day and found out they charge me another $85 on my credit card.  Called back and explained to them the situation, they promised the charge would be removed within 48 hours and it has not. Called back again, this time, they told me the manager will call me back.  Will see.This is my first time, and would be my last.DO NOT BOOK HERE!!AWFUL HOTELWe checked into the honeymoon suite, when we got into the room, the room had a awful nursing home smell, the leather couch was worn out with holes in the leather, couch looked like they found at a 1970's garage sale. The private pool attached to the suite was filthy dirty, and then when my wife wanted to take a hot bath in the jacuzzi tub, NO HOT WATER!!!! WTF? Shower had no hot water either. We called front desk to complain and stated that if the hotel expects people to pay $180/night, these issues should not occur. Their response was that if we feel we should not pay than please leave our hotel now and we will refund your money, it was 1am. So that's exactly what we did, we left immediately and next day room was still charged to my debit card. Called the manager the next morning and she was just as rude and said we kicked u out and do not come back. Really!! That's their story. Ok gotcha. That is not customer service. Never will I ever stay at another Crowne Plaza, first & last time. Stay away from this place!!!I was kinda freaked out when my boyfriend told me he booked a room here for us to stay in at the 4th of July. But to my surprise it was totally updated. Rooms looked pretty good. Pool was on point and they staff was ultra friendly. Close to everything.. just wishing the breakfast was included. Oh well.... a girl can dream :)In town for weekend getaway. What a gem.  Great rooms, service and hospitality. I highly recommend getting the up-charge for the breakfast buffet. Hot breakfast full service for $6. Definitely worth it. The beds are comfy and the room is very comfortable. We only stayed one night and felt like moving in. The water pressure was a bit weak but we were on the 8th floor so the view was nice. The amenities are all there with even a Keurig in the room. $95 a night...well worth it!!Pretty clean, easy parking... Not many food options after midnight. We settled for whataburger. The hotel was quiet and the staff was polite. Kenneth was super helpful and eased the stress at check-in. Our toilet didn't work but the good out weighed the bad so we didn't complain. I would recommend this to ppl traveling north of the Red River.The breakfast buffet is one if the worst i have ever seen. No menu only old eggs, runny sausage, and rude service. Way over priced. This is a hotel that is there with no heart. Go elsewhere.This is my second time staying at this Crowne Plaza and the first stay was horrid, but this was even worse.  When I checked in I told the desk manager about my experience last time, when I presented and the audio was terrible and nothing was done about it.  She called the banquet manager, who is useless, and we went down to the room and I pointed out some water stained tiles, which she replied "I don't think they're that bad."  This should have been my first sign that trouble was brewing.  The next day I head downstairs to eat, which the first time was terrible because the waitress ignored me because she was flirting with some construction guys, but I let that go knowing everyone needs love right.  Well, this time the server (a different one) was straight up rude.  She only filled my coffee cup once, it wasn't busy but she just kept walking into the other dining area.  The buffet is gross.  The eggs are runny, the sausage looked like they were swimming in a pool of grease, and the oatmeal had this crusty film on it.  They only have the buffet for $15.00.  I paid that much for coffee and two little boxes of cereal.  I will never go back.  I had to track her down to pay and then she took the pay sleeve and just kept walking around.  I had to stop her and say "Could you run it, so I can leave please."  The she ran and shot me a dirty look.  Also, they tout that they have Starbucks in the lobby.  BTW, it is never filled and was empty each time I checked.  Ridiculous how this property is run.During my presentation, there is NO audio.  Not bad audio, but NO audio.  Fortunately, my coordinator contacted the banquet manager, same one from yesterday, she told the coordinator, "I guess I should have listened to him yesterday when he said he had problems."  She called the a/v people, which are off-site, and an hour-and-a-half later the audio was working.  My presentations represent me and this hotel is not worth anyone's business, let alone looking like you represent a substandard product.  Go elsewhere.  Go to a hotel that listens to its customers and cares about quality and professional presentation.Secured the room via Priceline.  Have never stayed at a Crowne Plaza hotel before so my wife and I were excited to have the opportunity. While checking in the girl was very nice.  She asked if we would like a room with two queen beds or a king size bed.  I told her a king size be would be great.  Again, she was very polite.  During the process the guy at the kiosk next to hear came and looked at her screen, pointed to it and quietly said something too her.  He left and when I was handed my key I was told that they only had a room with two queen beds.  No biggie as it was already 11:30 at night.   We arrived at the room to find it was located next to the elevator.  Every time, and I mean EVERY TIME, the elevator went up or down it sounded like a 747 taking off.  My wife called the front desk to ask if we could change rooms.  The guy who had said something to the individual checking us in answered the phone.  He was extremely rude and said they were sold out there was nothing he could do.  My wife was upset as we had been on the road for 8 hours and she needed to get a good nights rest for the following day.  Not believing the individual and his comments I called the 800 number for Crowne Plaza and was told there were plenty of rooms available.  I called back and our buddy once again answered the phone.  He was very curt with me and said there was nothing they could do.  Being it was so late we went ahead an just dealt with the noise.  If it would have been a little earlier, we would have checked out and left for another hotel.Crowne Plaza...you should respect your Priceline customers and use it as an opportunity to introduce them to the level of customer service one would expect from a quality hotel.  Don't treat them like garbage and through them to the wayside.  You missed out on making a good first impression on us.  At the very least the type of first impression that would get us to come back.As the saying goes.....ONE AND DONE.I enjoyed my stay here!! I didn't have much interaction with the staff but the room was clean and confortable. The pillows used on the bed was worth the stay alone. Only issue is i think the rooms are over priced for what you are getting. For over $100 per night i was just expecting something nicer. But it had a sm fridge in it which i like and they said if asked we could of had a microwave tho there was no way to know that. Thought about doing breakfast but there is a breakfast dinner up the street called Beverly's which was excellect and cheaper than get breakfast at the hotel. Giving 3stars b/c of the pillows :)Is there a rating lower than one??  Check in is major problem, bar is a mess.  I  lying in bed and a huge cricket is walking across the floor.  I will NEVER stay here again.  Holy crap!!!!!!!!The hotel is fine.  The rooms are semi well appointed  but the restaurant is horrible. The worst.  We literally had to get up and leave because service took so long.  The staff is super friendly but there is no excuse for the lack of food quality and poor training and equipment. The server literally had to deliver our huge party's drinks individually because they have no service trays!  Our big party agreed we won't go back.Overall I have been exceptionally pleased with both the service and the quality at this hotel. Everything has been clean and the front desk staff have gone out of their way to make me feel welcome. The main reason I rated a 4 star instead of 5 is both the room and the food were just a little above average, but the service should get a 5 star review.  I will certainly add Crowne Plaza on my list as a hotel to return to. I think the outstanding customer service is some of the best I have encountered.I was originally going to give two stars for the sole purpose of not trying to look vindictive, but ultimately decided it really is only worth one-star. Check-in is unnecessarily slow and annoying. Was assigned to wrong room (someone else was already in there). Was told I'd get breakfast vouchers for myself and my husband for the inconvenience; didn't have them the next morning, but after asking about them to the manager (who explained there was nothing she could do), received them the day after. Housekeeping was lame. They didn't bother to make the bed, give us more coffee (after two days) or give us fresh glasses - all they did was take the dirty towels off the bathroom floor. Got locked out of our room on the third day, yet another inconvenience. Stayed on the "Club" level - NOT worth it. The club lounge is like 7 different couches that look like they all came from Craigslist all spread out a large room with a TV in it. That's it; that's what you pay $30/nt. extra for. Room is nothing more than standard. Your typical bed, chair, desk and dresser w/ TV. Bathroom is very cramped and bathtub was not clean. We didn't pay for breakfast since we had the vouchers, so it's hard to complain about free breakfast. They definitely had quite a selection for free (pancakes, eggs, meats, potatoes, biscuits and gravy, fruits, oatmeal, breads, cereals) but for $9.95 I don't think it would have been worth it, go next door to Beverly's instead.And lastly, and most importantly, the customer service was absolutely horrible with regard to every single employee we encountered. They weren't necessarily rude, but they weren't friendly either, especially when being asked for things that were caused by their own screw-ups.*** Needs management overhaul! ***Not amazing by any stretch. The lobby is very modern with bright colors and a bar. The business center is also located here.Check in was fine. I came for business and we arrived well before check in time. Room was ready for me.  The room I booked was a 2 double bed room; my co-worker booked the same room and was asked if he wanted a king! I never got that option.  I did have a little rest and relax spa aromatherapy product sample on my bed and the sleep spray really worked. My co-worker did not have such samples provided.There was no clock in my room. i thought that was weird, but maybe they were being modern? Room was a standard room. Hairdryer in the room but the bathroom outlet did not work so I had to use the one for the TV.Beds are kinda comfortable but not really. I didn't sleep all that well. I was also across from the ice machine (which was in a really uninsulated room) so I had those sounds waking me up regularly.Free Wi-fi but it broke up here and there. Decent selection of TV channels; no complaints.Bathroom amenities were nice. I liked the temple spa branded items.If you are a Priority Club member you get free Starbucks. Nice perk. Finding a place to walk to for food was hard as there are no sidewalks in the area. Note: If you need help with directions, the front desk was not the place to ask. We wanted to visit the Memorial but the front desk member was unable to help  us with cab info or get us a shuttle ride. We ended up calling a cab ourselves...cost was $25Cost to hotel from Airport: $35. I probably won't stay here again if I was visiting the area.Very disappointing experience. We come for Memorial weekend to get away, relax poolside, and enjoy the weekend. When we first checked in, Tommy did a great job of looking for adjoining rooms and welcoming us. Later that evening we called to find out how late the pool was open and they indicated it closed at 10 but would open the next morning at 10. We go to the pool the next day and it's closed for what we found out - the entire weekend. The front desk said they would credit $10 per night and upon checkout that is not on our reservation. Crooks!The room was great! Updated, clean and comfortable!Free WiFi!Downside - No free breakfast and the food was VERY overprised! I was there on the companies dime and still didn't want to spend their money on meals here.Logan was great when we checked in, friendly and personable. That's where the good ended. The hotel need updating. The halls look old and dirty. The room has some updated features but still felt dirty. In the morning, you could see down to the pool from my room and you could tell it hasn't been cleaned in a while. The shower floor has something gross stuck to it and there were so many dead bugs in the overhead light it covered half the light. The icing on the cake was not having ANY hot water to shower in the morning. At check out time, I complained to the front desk girl, I believe her name was Tamika, and her only response was "several people had to take cold showers so you weren't the only one."  Great way to empathize with my situation. As a frequent traveler, I spend more time in hotels then I do home, this was by far the worse experience I've ever had at a hotel. Not something a Priority Club member wants to associate with.I think this place is going through some kind of improvement initiative.  The first thing we noticed upon check-in was a nice man (dressed in a suit) at the door who greeted us and was eager to assist us.  He was there at check-out too the next morning.  There were two very nice people at the front desk who helped us check in.We found the room to be well appointed.  Beds were comfy, wi-fi was reliable, and everything was clean.  No noise problems and free parking.The location left much to be desired in terms of dining options within walking distance, but it didn't really matter to us since we only stayed one night.
review_content_20: Friendly, nice staff. Run down and dreary looking property. There's a brand new hotel across the street I'll try next time. Hope the redecorate this place soon.Worst customer service ever! Needed to leave town and the hotel would not work with my reservation. This is the hospitality industry and this is a dishonest hotel. They told me one thing and then did something else. Will never stay at this hotel again!!!Where to begin?! We stayed at the the Crowne Plaza the first weekend of October and will never stay there again. The only positive feedback I can give is that the hotel is aesthetically pleasing.  Once the front desk clerk determined we had booked through Priceline, we were put in a room near the stairwell. The look of the room was fine. It was clean and well decorated. We unpacked and went to hang-up our clothes, but there was no closet. There were hangers hanging from the towel bar...yep that was the closet. The first morning we had no shower pressure. He called the front desk to have it checked out. When the repair person came that evening he said "OH! I didn't know we even had these shower heads in the building anymore. We got rid of these." Again, I think this was reserved for the people who book on Priceline or another low cost site. When we returned to the property the afternoon of our first day, we learned that both elevators were out of service and had been for hours. There was no timeline available. So, we packed up our baby and all of her gear and hiked up the 3 flights of stairs. Thank goodness we weren't on the top floor! When we got to our room we also saw that housekeeping hadn't visited....it was 5 oclock pm. So, we again called the front desk and asked if we could get a visit from housekeeping or at a bare minimum get fresh towels. The towels never came. So, we called again. Finally at 9 pm, a stack of towels (no washcloths) were delivered to our door. The elevator issues continued throughout our stay. After the outage, only 1 of the 4-person elevators got going again. Neither my husband, baby or I got sleep any of the nights on our trip, especially after the elevator went out. People were going up and down the metal stairwell (right next to our room) at all hours of the night and you could smell cigarette smoke seeping into our room. I have NEVER been happier to check out of a hotel before!I am not sure I stayed  at the same hotel as some of these reviewers.  I thought the hotel was clean, quiet, the carpet looked fine to me.  The bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in.   The only thing I thought was pretty lame was paying for the Starbucks in the lobby.  I have stayed at other hotels that offer Starbucks coffee in the room or in the lobby at no charge.  I would most certainly stay here again.it's a nice hotel, however, it does need a total make over compared to other Crowne Plaza i've stayed at. Other than that, very friendly helpful staffs. i Can't really complain because the van driver is so nice, he will drop you off and pick you up anywhere within a 5 miles radiusI was matched to this hotel through a discount travel website. I booked two rooms for one night to accommodate my group of girlfriends and our two kids for our friend's bachelorette party. I arrived to the hotel early before all of the other guests. At check-in, the woman at the front desk informed me that this was going to be a very busy weekend and that she had placed our party in two king size rooms. I was immediately alarmed and responded that based on the number in our party (6 adults and two children), I had thought we would have had two rooms both with double beds. The woman at the front desk said that she didn't have any other rooms available as the hotel was already overbooked. I explained that the booking was for a bachelorette party. The woman then said that she had put our rooms on the same floor as the flight attendants and pilots that they typically host, so could we please keep our noise down. I told her that noise wouldn't be a problem (although I don't really think I owed her that), but also that did she honestly think that we could fit three adults and one child in a king size bed? She responded by saying, "Well, are all of your friends your size?" I responded by saying that our size wasn't really the issue but I was unsure as to what to do give that I had so many guests coming in from out of town and they needed places to sleep. To problem solve the issue at the moment, I took the keys and then went to the room. The room I checked in was fine, but at this point I did not have any intention of staying in this hotel unless they changed our rooms (all of the rollaway beds were also checked out). I called the website through which I had made the original reservation and explained the problem. They first tried to resolve it by calling the front desk.
