The representative informed me that based on the number in our party the booking should have automatically included double beds in each room. They cancelled the reservation with no problem and rebooked us in a different hotel. I have used this website numerous times for hotels, have stayed in many many different kinds of hotels across the country, but have never had the rude and ineffective service like I encountered at this hotel. I think it was inappropriate that the woman at the front desk inquire about the size of our guests, or that she make the assumption that because we were there for a bachelorette party, we would be so raucous as to disturb other guests (two of us had our kids with us, so it wasn't as though we were planning on going bananas anyway). They didn't reserve our rooms correctly to start, and if they can't handle the volume from partnering with discount travel websites , then that is clearly a managerial issue and should NOT be passed down as a problem to the hotel guest to manage. The whole transaction left me with a very bad taste in my mouth. I live in Oklahoma City and can't see recommending anyone to stay at this hotel in the future.Grace was very professional on the phone and found a reasonable rate for me. Rooms need updated.Average Hotel, absolutely nothing special...The location of this hotel is pretty descent, for a 6 dollar cab ride you can get over to the mall, that has plenty of restaurants and shops.  For some reason this Hotel's van doesn't run to the airports on the weekends so a cab is needed.  The fitness center is located is a spot only accessible by going outside into the pool area.  The equipment was good and was surprised to find actual weight machines.  The elevators were kinda weird, in that you can only fit about three people.  The staff was pleasent and rooms were clean with a good view.This hotel needs a massive update to its infrastructure, which given this economy isn't likely to happen soon. Many of the rooms have broken or ailing air conditioning, there are water stains and badly patched areas in the walls and ceilings. The hotel has a general musty smell. A fire alarm went off at 4am and myself and several other guests were left standing outside until one of us went in to inquire what the situation was and finally the night manager came out and told us it was a false alarm. The only up side was the staff was generally friendly. There are plenty of other hotels in the area. Avoid this one until they do the right thing and close it and completely remodel it. I've stayed at other Crowne Plazas in the chain, and the only thing they have in common is the name.

review_content: It feels bizarre to feel slighted by a full service Marriott. This is a great location which offers free parking. I was fortunate to be selected as the guest of the day. The special gift was in the room. While I had no idea what to expect, I was still excited. When I arrived to the16th floor, I wanted to kiss the carpet because I was happy to get off the elevator with a pulse. This elevator is literally two rides from shutting down. It rattles, shakes and sounds like a service lift in a scrap metal yard. And I really wonder what inspector passed it. The person who gave a certificate either stays here free or received a big check.... That alone was a reason to check out but I couldn't bring myself to ride the elevator again so soon. Plus I wanted the gift in my room. The room offers standard Marriott bedding and toiletries. I love the soap, lotion & mouthwash. It is better than most full service hotels. The TV was a flat screen & there was a refrigerator in the room. So needless to say, I easily settled in hoping to ride a different elevator the next day.While things in the room were as expected, the rooms are in desperate need of updates. The place looks old. The bathroom showed the most evidence of poor upkeep & the hotel's age. The check in desk agent was cordial and all but I was not at all impressed with his behavior. He placed my identification and credit card on the counter and slid it to me. If you are going to slide it really close,  wouldn't it be easier to just hand them to me. What was that about? Admittedly, the gift of crap (Merlot, chips & candy) helped me to overlook the agent's bad showing.Is it worth $150 a night? I'd say no... Especially if there are newer places in the area for the same price.Time for the new owners to spend some money on new TV's, pillows, updating the bar out of the 80's, getting some better beverage options....Good solid Marriott with comfortable beds, good location, absolutely GREAT staff.$189 rack rate is nuts though, I would be upset if I was paying close to that - especially with much newer places within 2 miles at 60% the priceI thought this Marriott was okay until the day I was leaving here (I'll explain later).  The rate was about $112 a night including tax but I'm not sure what it usually was because I was here on a business trip so my company arranged something with the hotel (I think).The staff were friendly and I think the manager (maybe not) asked me if everything was okay.  My room was on the 15th floor because I decided to start that rewards thing.  The TV was probably more than 20 years old. lol  I felt like the water in the shower could not go any hotter than it did but that's okay.During our stay, one of the guys on our team for our business trip got stuck in the elevator for 10 minutes because the door wouldn't open.  I heard a bunch of strange noises coming from the two elevators on one side.  The single elevator opposite of them was okay.  One thing to note about these elevators was the fact that the doors close almost immediately after they open.  It was a lot shorter than the normal time for an elevator to stay open.Bistro 44 was their "restaurant" and that's where I had my complementary breakfast buffet.  Of course, I had that because my company took out a block of rooms for us to stay in and it included breakfast.  Normally, the price for the breakfast buffet was $12.99 for weekdays and $13.99 (or was it $14.99?) for weekends.  The food was not bad but it also wasn't great.  It's something you would eat with little portions and go on with your day just to have something in your stomach.  They can also make omelettes or waffles but I'm not sure how much that would be normally.Now on to what happened on the morning... I woke up and went to the bathroom area.  I noticed something on my wall and when I turned on the light to look at what it was, it scurried behind the mirror.  It was a roach and I didn't want to see that.  I was paranoid that it got in my luggage since I left my luggage opened one night.  I called the front desk to tell them about what I saw.  They told me that they would refund me one night's stay for the inconvenience and they did.  I gave them one more star because of that; otherwise, this would be 1 star because of that roach.Spent 2 nights here over Thanksgiving 2013. At $76/night it was an excellent value. Good bed, however the pillows were just OK. My star rating is low for these reasons. 1: no free wifi, unacceptable in these times. 2:the restaurant is terrible. Horrible service, mediocre food and worst of all, they don't seem to care. 3: the whole hotel has this sort of musty thick air. It's hard to put a finger on what it was but it had everyone's allergies going nuts. The place needs to be renovated in the worst way. It seemed like a hotel on its last leg and the employees know it.Glad to see that they removed the Marriott name from this hotel. It was a pretty bad one. The service was great, but my room was dated and drafty. Freezing might be a better word.. And musty. I stayed here in Dec 2013 for a few nights and am glad I went to a different one after that.Front desk was very nice.  Internet is rip off--not free.  and as a business traveler, this is extremely inconvenient for me.  Breakfast not free--even though my coworkers have always gotten breakfast the last 4 years in a row.Coffee in the lobby is good, not that fake creamer stuff other hotels often put out.Room was kinda dirty, got put into a king room that was EXTREMELY loud.  I sleep really hard and was up all night with just hotel noises:  footsteps, doors, ice machine, sex in the next room-you know the regular stuff.....then the weird stuff that started happening:  beeping from inside my room without a source, toilet running loudly in the middle of night for no reason, pounding and scratching from walls.  Just saying I didn't get any sleep my first two nights but front desk graciously moved me to another room and all was quiet in the night.Housekeeping seems inconsistent--first room dirty, second room was fine.  they threw out my co-worker's personal bar of soap that was his hypo-allergenic stuff.  I would have been pissed if that were me.  Good thing is the starbucks and panera close by, can go sit over there and use internet if needed.I just checked In and I was planning to get some work ready for Monday morning and found out that they do not have free wireless OR any free Internet! I normally look at a variety of things when I rate hotels but this one thing is enough for me to give them one star. I can not understand how a freaking hotel cannot offer free Internet. They have it for free at the Starbucks and panera across the street! Hotels are supposed to be a home away from home! I have Internet at home! When I pay for a hotel I expect the Internet to come for free!I just can't even fully process this. It just doesn't make sense to me at all. I would post this now but I can't. You can only post from a computer. No phones. I am going to make this known to my company which lists this hotel as a preferred hotel.Also, they did not empty the water out the ice bucket from the last customer and instead just thre wa fresh bag in to bucket. And they did not turn the alarm off on the radio from the last person.I probably will choose another Marriott next time I'm in Oklahoma City.  This one just didn't make the cut. Pros: - The location is good, right on Northwest Expressway with a lot of amenities and services nearby.  - The beds are very comfortable, as (thankfully) mandated by Marriott. - We requested a rollaway bed at the last minute and had one sent to our room, for free. This was very nice. - Fast wifi. Cons: - The service was lacking.  From the check-in desk guy who asked if we were very sure we wanted one king-sized bed (as a same-sex couple), to NEVER being waited on during breakfast -- literally never -- the hotel needs to step it up. - The room had a funny smell to it. Not quite cigarette smoke, but maybe a formerly smoking room that needs new paint or something. - It needs a refresh badly, just as a general matter. The carpet and furniture are just old and need updating. Meh. Just meh. I'll try the Renaissance downtown or the Colcord next time.This place used to be a Marriott and it still has a few of the same friendly staff that were here before, but the hotel went into receivership and now its been rebranded. All the amenities are gone, including getting loyalty points with Marriott. They still have a few copies of the morning paper available, but none of the other perqs, such as the concierge lounge, exist anymore. The hotel actually feels a little haunted now, as its largely empty. On the plus side, it's a lot easier to get a cheap room.Very old and rundown. I had to look twice to be sure this actually was a Marriott! The really cheap rate should have warned me ... Plus no airport shuttle ( or shuttle of ANY kind..).The toilet loudly burping and bubbling all night long kept me awake...Awful AWFUL place....Parked out back with our trailer locked to our truck. Well lit with security guard walking around. Trailer was stolen over night!Pros:1. Friendly staff, Nice environment, Good location, Good size TVCons:1. Dirty house keeping. (We found a pair of sun glass lying under the bed)2. Horrible sound blocking.Awesome staff, crap old hotel. I expect more from a Marriott. My wash cloth had a brown stain, nice. The TV was a CRT model from 1989. The pillows had a faint odor. The carpet looked 50 years old. But the people were nice. Close this place down, remodel and update, increase your prices 50% and reopen.This is my first Yelp review, but I couldn't resist. This property is NO LONGER affiliated with Marriott. It is bank owned and in horrible condition. I stayed here for 2 nights. The first night, there was no internet throughout the hotel. From guest rooms to the restaurants, no internet. So, it was a "cash only" night. The second night (tonight) a water main line broke and water was pouring into the lobby, nearly flooding the place. I genuinely feel bad for the employees they all seem dedicated to doing a great job, but are bound by no Corporate leadership or help. As much as I liked them, I won't ever stay here again.This Marriott needs some serious updates. My first room had fleas in the bed, my second room was the tiniest awkwardly angled corner room. The toilet ran all night, concierge breakfast was terrible and included hair in my food, and even the restaurant was no good. Ordered dinner two nights thinking the first bad night was just a fluke... nope just as bad the second night too. Parking is awful! The elevator might break at anytime. Shall I go on? I will say the gym is nice and spacious! Lots of machines for a hotel. Think twice before you stay here. Not worth the money they charge for rooms!This hotel has one of the most helpful, polite and friendly personnel I've ever encountered in my business travels. They would truly go the extra mile to help you out, and sort out any inconveniences promptly and with apologies. I like their cozy rooms (try to get a corner one), views from the top floors, gym/jaccuzzi and accessibility of the consierge lounge. The only drawback is that this is a fairly old facility. I don't personally mind old TVs since they change channels much faster than the newer flat-screen ones, and the bathroom facilities are pretty good, too, but the overall feel is kind of 1970s. Still, a gread deal of a hotel for a business traveller overall.Its a Marriott, so it's not going to be horrible....however, this is not one of the best properties I've stayed in.  I have a few things that drive me crazy.......gross grout in the shower, not enough plugs (phone, laptop, kindle, GPS....) and a bad iron.  This one was OK on all....not great, but OK.  Paid 128 a night, so the price was good.A little update would be good, but I know that has to be costly, so I'm OK with this place at 128!!!I was really disappointed in my stay here. I was in OKC for a week and a half - and not once during my stay did I feel like I was coming back to a clean room. The bathroom floor consistently had stuff left on it, and I don't think my sheets were ever changed. And to add to it, the air conditioner never seemed to actually cool off the room - and for a girl who thinks 80 degrees is hot, this was a bad, bad thing.To add to my misery, the walls of the hotel were thinner than paper - I could clearly hear EVERY SINGLE phone conversation of the person in the room next to me...and at 10 p.m, when I need to get up at 5 the next morning, I wasn't too happy about it. The room service options were kind of crappy, but the service was good - the gentleman who delivered my food was incredibly friendly (I think his name was James), and the front desk even called to make sure I enjoyed my meal. I was certainly impressed by that.Sadly, a clean room is top of my list  - and that just wasn't happening during my stay in OKC.I can imagine this is a good hotel for OKC standards. However after visiting hundreds of Marriott nationwide (for business), this one stands below the average. The staff is very nice which is always appreciated but this place needs a STRONG refreshment. It feels like the hotel is stuck in the 80's with old carpet, wood furnitures, small TV, etc... The hotel bar feels like a karaoke dive bar..... The room are decent but again needs to be revamped with new equipment. The morning buffet is good (smoked salmon??!!).Oklahoma sucks! But the hotel was nice. I got a last minute check-in and they treated me like a VIP. Nice spacious rooms, quiet and comfortable.The gym is well appointed and the staff was very friendly. The price was ok. They could have gouged me since I just walked in to reserve a room but the lady at the front desk took really good care of me.
review_content_20: This Marriott was the high light of my stay in Oklahoma City, The rooms are clean.  Tip; Ask for the northern side of the hotel.  You will thank me.  Russell's is a great sports bar loads of TV's, perfect for bowl games.  Good prices.  Only 15 minutes from Airport.  The prices were great.  The Brunch was awesome. Great pool area.

review_content: I loved my stay here, and hope to return again. It had the PERFECT location for me. Right down town. You walk out the door and you're downtown with unlimited options of things to explore. The rooftop was AMAZING. Super comfortable, and the views were breathtaking. Stayed numerous hours up there, and the best part is they serve drinks! Parking was $15- valet or self park. The pool was closed even though it was 85 degrees.Super friendly staff. Very nice and helpful. Very cool bar in the first floor, however I could here the music in the early morning & I had to call to complain so I could sleep. I recommend staying here! But not on the second floor due to the loud music you can hear from the 1st floor!I keep telling myself to stop trusting Yelp reviews. I thought for sure this would be a great hotel for us to spend Valentine's Day weekend. I was very wrong. First off, this hotel is downtown but  definitely not in Bricktown. My boyfriend booked this hotel thinking we would be able to walk outside and be in the heart of Bricktown, which isn't true. The hotel itself is okay, but definitely not worth the nearly $200 we paid for one night. The room is very modern. Too modern. The furniture is clunky and not comfortable at all. It has a very Euro vibe to it, which in this case isn't a good thing. But the kicker, the reason I will NEVER return to this hotel or any Aloft hotel for that matter is the noise. The walls are so poorly insulated that I can literally hear EVERYTHING going on in the next room. Seriously. I can hear them talking, using the restroom, running water, closing drawers. It's insane. Yes, I'm in the room right now wishing I was at a Holiday Inn. Yes, I'd rather be at a Holiday Inn. I just pray I don't hear anyone having sex...fingers crossed. Save yourself the headache and choose another hotel.Well, it's the next morning, and I have literally gotten maybe 3 hours of sleep. The noise level of this hotel is unreal. Out of all the hotels I've been in - Vegas strip, Times Square, downtown of big cities, this one takes the cake. There were literally people yelling in the hallway, running down the hallway, slamming doors, just being loud and obnoxious ALL night long. This is by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. Unless you're coming here to party all night long, DO NOT stay here.You wanna experience luxurious lodging at its finest, come book a suite at Aloft in downtown Bricktown. Everything about this place is stunning; from the convenient location with dozens of restaurants and stores within walking distance, to the contemporary design of the rooms and lobby. They also feature valet parking for a mere $15 fee (which I didn't use). That may seem steep to some. But when you see the area you're staying in, you quickly realize that attempting to drive and park anywhere else in Bricktown is either expensive, inconvenient, or both. Pretty much...there is no such thing as free parking in Bricktown. Besides, you wouldn't want to drive anywhere anyway, unless you plan on heading to some other part of OKC.This hotel has a fully stocked bar. I absolutely love the design of this bar. It also has a kitchen. Although, to be honest, there's not much there. The menu is small. So if you're looking for something more elaborate than, say...a burger or sandwich, just take a walk into Bricktown (but for gosh sake AVOID Mickey Mantel Steakhouse!).The rooms are where it's at! Spacey, huge shower, contemporary design throughout. Now I can't speak for the other suites, but the single king size bedroom has no bath tub. Not a big deal really, just a small caveat.Ultimately, I may find myself returning to this very same hotel if I ever decide to make another impromptu get-away to OKC. The location is convenient as ever! Easy access to the highway, dozens of restaurants in the area, and a great view. If you're wondering where you should stay in or around Bricktown, this place is what's up!We stayed here after four nights staying along Route 66 driving from California to Missouri. I was beyond elated to in a nice hotel rather than a quaint or iconic motel. Staff was friendly and helpful. Parking was $20 whether it's valet or self park in the garage. The room was the most spacious I've been in when it has been a regular room and not a suite. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was immaculate and very modern. Bliss products are in the room and also in the shower. There's a dispenser for body wash and shampoo/conditioner.  The bottle of water in the room is free! No mega charge for a cheap bottle of water. I would stay here again without hesitation.I chose this for our one night stay in Oklahoma City, primarily because it was a good rate, was Starwood and was in the Bricktown area. I've stayed at Aloft's before and this was consistent with my expectations based on those stays. The hotel certainly had a younger, hipper vibe --- was staying with my family including three children (16, 13 & 10). The room was clean and spacious with a king bed with a very large bathroom (turned out to be wheelchair accessible). We had been on the road for three weeks and were glad to see a washer/dryer on the floor. Even though they were pay machines, they came in handy as we were able to do laundry. Even though the hotel had a young crowd, it was not excessively noisy and our floor was quite quiet. The hotel is a short walk to all the bars and restaurants along with the OKC Dodgers stadium so is perfectly situated. We had a short 10 minute walk to grab dinner and enjoyed the chance to at least see a bit of OKC. Even though we didn't use the pool, it looked clean and only two other families were using it so wasn't crowded at all.The only problem we had with our room was that at 5AM, the blinds, controlled by an electric switch, started malfunctioning. There was simply no way to shut it off or disable it and basically prevented us from getting any good sleep for the next 3 hours. Upon check out, my wife mentioned it to the staff and they graciously refunded our parking ($15) and gave us free bottled drinks and snacks for our drive to Memphis.Overall, I'd recommend this location although if you are looking for something a bit less modern and "hip", you'd best find another place.This place was awesome. The concierge's where rude, young and inexperienced. Doesn't make the hotel bad but just needs a tune up on their staff.Really great boutique hotel. Has everything you need in a well designed space. It's very pet friendly and there's a dog park located next to the hotel.Love this place. Look no further when making hotel reservations. The Aloft Hotel is #Awesome!I checked into the aloft for a 29 day stay. The first 15 were fantastic. The bar staff was always first rate.  The issue came about trying to use the go green points earned. There was misunderstanding among the employees as to where they can be used. No problem really it was figured out. No harm no foul.  I had a couple of discussion with a woman at the front desk about different services offered. I.e. Keyless entry as well as vouchers owed. Each time I was left without any resolution. The final discussion we had, where I knew that she was not reporting the correct information I snapped and told her that she was being restarted. I know this was uncalled for and inappropriate. So when I returned to the hotel later that night I apologized for my lack of understanding. I was told that it was no problem. I apologized again and went to my room. The next day after work I arrived and gave the valet a lottery scratcher. I also gave one to the woman I had offended the previous night. I went to my room. I had a question about a door hanger so I went back down stairs. I spoke to the manager on duty and got my question answered. I again gave the valet another scratcher lotto ticket because she was good at her job. I also tossed one to the front desk woman and went to my room.  45 minutes later I was asked to leave the hotel by the manager and bar manager. For being hostile to hotel employees. They would not here what transpired and I was given 15 minutes to vacate. Oh well there are other hotels in OKC. But, on my way out I was met by the bar manager and told to exit the side door. Where my car would be waiting. I did as requested. Finally I was in my car trying to secure another room is this wonderful town when both managers came out and informed me that the parking lot was still SPG property.    I'm now at the Hyatt. I'm saddened that a simple misunderstanding turned out so wrong. I'm glad that SPG will be purchased in June. Best of luck aloft OKC. Never again.I am giving this hotel 5 starts because it is in a great location, clean, professional, modern and because the staff is excellent. Especially the vallet, Jace, she is super attentive and accomdating, not to mention very friendly! The price you pay is excellent for the type of room you get, including all of the extras like the beautiful patio view on the 6th floor and the 24  fitness center. It is also a great place to stay also for young professionals and people who want to treat themselves to a relaxing, enjoyable stay. In addition to this, accomodations can be made for handicap people even if the hallways are longer, the staff will make sure you are comfortable and can get to your room with ease.I booked a suite here last weekend for my friends Bachelorette party. I was really disappointed overall. When we arrived at 3pm the room was not ready. The woman at the desk kindly gave us 2 complimentary breakfast tickets for the inconvenience. We waited in the bar, went back to the desk after 20 min and was told it is taking even longer than expected and we can't put our bags in our room. She gave us two complimentary drinks for our extended wait.Later in the night we went to the bar, sat at a table and waited 30 minutes at a table without any service. We even went to the bar and asked for help. We ended up leaving without any drinks and going to another bar.In the morning when we went to redeem our breakfast we quickly realized it's about the same as a McDonald's value menu only without the value. It took 40 minutes for us to get our meat, egg, and cheese sandwiches from the kitchen. It was not worth the wait, even for a free breakfast. Many others were frustrated with the wait time.Great view from our room, neat design features, but poorly executed services.Decent hotel for okc. Seemed like the euro hotels small and shower only. The shampoo dispenser was broken so they left a plastic cup of communal shampoo which I thought was gross. The rest of the room and hotel were good but definitely would pick another hotel for $200.I wish there was a sixth star so I could give it to this hotel. As a long time Aloft fan, this bricktown location was my first stop when searching for a hotel to host my sisters bachelorette party. Not only did the hotel have the space, but the booking agent helped me find the right room for the party. We booked the King suite, which had a perfectly sized extra living space for the party and a beautiful balcony with an amazing view of downtown OKC. We forgot multiple items, like tape, and every ask was met with excited staff here to help! The room was spotless, chic and really impressed party guests. It was a four minute walk to the heart of bricktown for a night out on the town. Location couldn't be better! My ONLY negative would be that the hotel should include valet if you are already spending $400 on a room. Can't wait to stay again!Awesome hotel! My Wife and I travel ALOT so we have seen our fair share of hotels in the States as well as overseas and this one is at the top of the pack for the price.Very modern layout with plenty of space in the room, fantastic onsite bar and food options, fairly adequate gym space considering its in a hotel, and outstanding staff. It's located within a 10-15 min walk of plenty of bars, restaurants, museums, and sports venues. Rarely do you walk through a downtown area at midnight and feel completely safe, but the Bricktown area is an extremely well maintained part of town. It is a very well-lit, safe environment for families, single travelers, couples, or parties with just women. I would have very little worries letting my wife walk around here on her on.I also recommend that the hotel add an info binder in each room. That way the customer can accessibly have: room service menus, room service hours, locations to the hotels laundry, gym, business center, local attractions, history on the area of the city, ice and vending locations, etc.All in All, we will stay here again when we pass back through OK City.My husband and I have stayed in numerous Aloft hotels over the years and we were excited to see them come to OKC.  The location is perfect and the ambiance fits in with everything in the Deep Deuce area.  Given how busy both the hotel and bars (upstairs on the roof and in the hotel itself) are seemingly all the time, it is evident that it filled a void in OKC.  I love the feel of the lobby: trendy but accessible and it always smells good (same across all the ones I have stayed at, so it is a familiar scent).  The re:Fresh bar allows you to grab a snack (healthy or otherwise) and it is all very affordable when compared to most hotel grab and go options.  Check-in was fast and friendly, and he gave us options for parking if we wanted to skip the $15 valet.  Each time we moved the car, we were able to find street parking, but had we planned on hoofing it around the area (which we very easily could have if we had planned our evening better), I would've been happy to pay to be in the garage.Our room was lovely and what I expect of Aloft: not a spacious room but an excellent use of space.  The perks are what makes these rooms such a great deal: a fridge comes standard in every room, as does a coffee maker, bottled water and Bliss toiletries.  One complaint about the floor (4th): it was super stinky in the halls. Like held my nose on the way to the elevator.  While I love that they are pet friendly and have utilized that option many times elsewhere, the hall smelled like a big wet dog and I couldn't get over it.  Maybe they can spray some of the goodness from the lobby and improve that?! Every employee we encountered was friendly and personable and you can tell they like working there and enjoy working with one another: that is a rarity in customer service!  Again, I wish we had planned our evening differently and spent more time at the bar, but that just means we need to go back soon.  Dear husband, if you are reading, go ahead and book us another staycation here ASAP!Great hotel!  Very clean and modern.  Great location with several restaurants in close walking distance, Micky mantle, KDs, a few bars.  Has all the basics.  Mike the Manager runs a tight ship and provides excellent service.  I had the worst trip starting with a delta  flight delay, making miss my connection and needing to stay over night in salt lake.  Finally arrived to aloft to find my hotel room was given away and the hotel was full.  Mike was able to fully comb through availability and made sure I could finally get my room and a good night rest ( FINALLY).  Huge thank you to a management team that cares about their loyal customersWe went to Oklahoma City recently when one of our family members was hospitalized nearby. The staff was so welcoming and helped us in every way possible. When we arrived late in the evening from the airport, the gentleman in charge of the cafe; (which was closing in a few minutes) came over to us when he heard we were asking about a place nearby to get some food. He gave us a menu to look at as we were registering and offered to bring up the food we ordered; so we could get settled in our room.  Wow, what a nice thing to do for us. We had a four year old who was hungry and tired.  Each day the staff checked on our son's progress and always wanted to know how they could help us. Patricia Alva, the manager, gave us the lowest rate to help us since we were staying for an extended period of time. I'm sorry I cannot remember everyone's name, I wrote them down so I could include all the names, but when I got home, I must have misplaced the paper. All I can say is that everyone, from the housekeeping staff, the cafe staff, to the valets and all the staff at the registration desk, could not have been more helpful throughout our stay. The room was always clean and well attended to. The hotel has a very nice rooftop lounge overlooking the city, which was very relaxing after our busy days. It is in a very nice location, easy walking distance to other venues in the area and some good restaurants nearby. We felt very safe there. There is a very nice little market across the street which came in handy for any of our needs.  Considering the unexpected circumstances that brought us to OKC, we were very pleased  to have found the Aloft Hotel. We would highly recommend staying there. Thank you to all the staff that helped us during our stay.Teresa and ErinGreat stay here in downtown OKC.  The valet system is phenomenal.  You text the number when you're ready for your car and bam! They text you when you can come downstairs.   The hotel bar was kicking on a Saturday night with a DJ.  Valet staff knew we wanted to take a cab to Bricktown and nooo they drove us in our own car and dropped us off.  Super sweet.  We will definitely stay here again.Fun fun fun! - outskirts of downtown but close enough to be in the action. Typical aloft hotel decor; beautiful modern and hip.Gold members get 4 pm checkout w complimentary gift at market...anything. Excercise room at 2nd floor is spacious w large screens and internet connection. 6th floor outdoor area for fabulous views!OK, though I had heard about and seen the place before elsewhere, this was my first Aloft experience, and quite honestly, the location and price point were the hook-line-sinker for me.They had an internet deal for pre-paying your stay at roughly 119.00/night or so, tax included, which was pretty good for something centrally-located and VERY walkable to Bricktown (a few blocks away) and downtown. I can see that they go for a really specific demographic niche market everywhere else if you're not in Los Angeles - which is the vibe they are going for.i.e. modern, trendy, hip, sleek...!this shows in their design and architecture, and the rooms really show this off with indirect lighting, vibrant colors, etc. At the same time, they don't sacrifice function with ample bed, storage, and workspace; and they also have amenities such as wiFi, fitness, pool, etc.The bathroom, and most esp with the translucent panel, to bring in natural light from the bedroom, was super cool.They also had a super cool/hip lounge with a mezznine level and floor to ceiling windows; a secondary lounge on the rooftop; and space for pool and board games in the lobby, so they are definitely targeting a 20-30-something crowd (and willing to spend more money than a motel 6) here...Unfortunately, though, I don't fit their demographic! I'm middle-aged...What I really was missing here was either a free breakfast, or at the very minimum free fruit, or if not FREE, maybe a restaurant that is convenient to the hotel, if I didn't want to travel out.Yes, they had a lounge, but no restaurant, or tangible food service.They also had a glorified vending machine = everything that is normally in a vending machine or 7-11 but laid out on the counter and costing $1-2. Next to these vending countertops was a breakfast window at which you can order eggs and bacon, etc. but this was only for breakfast, and there's nowhere official to sit (except the lobby, and going to your room). Sorry, not worth the money, but I'd rather sit in a restaurant where you pay to have someone cater to me!Other than this, though, which I am sure is the case with all the other Alofts, everything was pretty decent.
review_content_20: Let me first state that I did not stay the night here, nor try the restaurant. Room:  Some girls and I booked a room for a bachelorette party. The room was pricey, in my opinion.  And very, very small. All the hype about this place had me expecting more. When I walked in I didn't feel any sort of "wow" factor. Just a small room, wouldn't want to stay in it very long. Pool: Lady friends and I then hit up the swimming pool. I just, I can't even explain how terribly located this pool was placed. While laying out, surround on three sides by the hotel itself, you get a beautiful view of the PARKING GARAGE. I mean, It's directly next to the pool. I can't think of a worse spot for a hotel pool.  Maybe in the garage? Why this bothers me so much is because this hotel was built from the ground up.  It wasn't renovated, and that was the only location for a pool. It was designed like that!! Huh???  With as many hot days as we have in OKC, I would expect them to design an awesome pool environment. Hotel:  The hotel itself was nice.  Folks that worked there seemed nice enough, but seemed to think their facility was a bigger deal than I did.  It also felt very small. As an OKC resident, if I were going to have a little "stay-cation", I wouldn't stay at this hotel. I don't understand who their customer is. Or who they think their customer is.Loved this hotel and it was great for traveling with a dog--they brought us a bed, toys, treats and bowls for her. Plus it was decorated very well and had comfortable beds!I was sent on a last minute business trip to do some work in Oklahoma City and a small town 2 hours north, called Enid. I have never stayed at an Aloft Hotel prior to this trip, but my boss booked the room for me and swore by it. Needless to say, I was very pleased with the staff and the King Suite. Although I was traveling alone, the suite was a perfect size, and would have been the perfect size for a couple traveling as well. My room also had a lovely view of the hip, yet beautiful Oklahoma City. I was extremely comfortable and felt a warm welcome from every staff member. Whoever gets a chance to travel to The Sooner State, be sure to check out OKC and try to stay at this lovely, modern style hotel.Fun, sophisticated vibe in a location close to destination amenities. A nice change of pace from the usual chain decor. Everything was top-notch and clean. Top floor terrace was a fun place to enjoy a beverage and watch the sun set behind downtown skyline. Well worth the price in my opinion.My experience with this hotel was decent, but I was highly annoyed to find a $15 charge on my company credit card days later. I understand paying for parking, but when I turned down valet service I would have hoped to be told either them or by the front desk that there is a charge to stay at the hotel you are paying that much for. Having to file a second expense report because I was never informed of this charge is definitely irritating. Also, fruit flies at the bar swarming my wine weren't exactly a positive aspect of this particular stay.If you need a professional and accommodating corporate meeting space I highly recommend the Aloft and their wonderful event staff. Professional and pleasant with great communication!  I don't have to worry when I leave my meetings in the capable hands of Lauren!Great hotel, we checked in friday afternoon and checked out Sunday morning with a total of $330.00. One problem I did find with this particular Aloft location was the parking garage was not accessible for guest unless we paid a $15.00 or $9.00 valet fee. Which is completely bogus to me, since I'm already dishing out a chunk of money to stay there. We were told we could park on the side street (if there was a parking spot) and if not, "just look around for one". Very silly.Before we called the Aloft phone service, we had found a much cheaper price through Orbitz or Hotels (any of those discount websites would work in this case) but wanted to double check the price and see if those websites were accurate. Come to found out, that $20-40 discount really only harms you, considering your not going to get what you actually see offered on the websites. We decided to pay the $145.00 a night and have the security of a legitimate standard king size room. The rooms are smaller, but worth it. The shower was great, the bed was great, and the staff was great. We didn't use the WXYZ lounge or the side-bar services at all but still really enjoyed the hotel.We also brought our two pups with no extra charge and they did great. I will be staying at the Aloft when I travel more, the experience was pretty pleasant.Terrible hotel!! Much better choices in Bricktown and OKC.  Assuming everyone coming in after a night in Bricktown has been drinking or is drunk I was followed and harassed by security and spoke to in a manor that a dog should not be spoken to. Was made to go to bed with the threat of being thrown out if I didn't. Clearly it doesn't stop there for Yelp removed my first review because they wanted details which u would assume was brought to their attention by the poor Management that didn't bother to access a situation and relied solely on the interpretation of "Barney Fife's"!  I repeat DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL, very rude staff and incompetent management!!!!My boyfriend and I stayed here from 7/8/14 to 7/10/14 (a Tuesday to a Thursday). Overall, our time at this Aloft was really pleasant.Our first impression, however, was initially not all that pleasant. Upon attempting to check in, the snotty front desk lady tried to tell my boyfriend and I that we would not be able to check in because we were not 21. Now, I understand that although 18 is the universal age most hotel chains allow people to stay without an older adult, some chains have their own policies. That being said, I had checked the Aloft website, and it had said that one must only be 18 to stay alone. My boyfriend and I were a bit put off, as we are independent college students and had planned/paid for this trip independent of our parents. We felt as if she was implying we were not fit to stay at the hotel because of our age, which is outrageous. So, the nice gentleman at the desk with the snotty young lady (she was probably not 21 herself), just looked at the the woman with disapproval before taking our ID's from her and promptly checking us in, with a smile.The miscommunication at check-in was the only negative aspect to our stay. And that's the only reason I deducted a star.The rooms, although not very spacious, we're very nice. The king size bed was HUGE and extremely comfortable. The AC was able to be turned down quite a bit, which I personally appreciate. The wifi was a bit hit or miss, but that's not that big of a deal.The bathrooms were nice, especially the shower. It was made out of stone tile and was pretty large. I also liked how the mirror doubled as the sliding door to the toilet and shower itself. The sink was modern looking, as well.The location was also nice. My boyfriend and I walked to bricktown twice for dinner, and it wasn't far at all.Overall, the hotel was nice, as was the decor in the rooms. If I ever find myself in OKC again, I would definitely stay here!Stayed here for 2 nights. New hotel, clean and modern style. Easy walking distance to bars, restaurants, and OKC Dodgers stadium. Fast valet. Military discount includes free breakfast (made to order breakfast sandwiches, burritos, cappuccinos, etc.) Will definitely stay here again!Average for A Loft, the rooms are just like any other in the chain yet the valet only parking is a big ding. They have a large attached garage and could easily split out some self parking... That and always being out of coffee in the lobby makes this A Loft sub-standard.My wife and I stayed here over the weekend and thought it was fantastic. We travel a quite a bit and always try to stay in Starwood Hotels of which Aloft is a part of. Due to the amount of nights a year we stay with Starwood Hotels they have given us the ability to book a standard room but confirm into a suite before arrival. We chose to upgrade to the Celebrity Suite. Apparently we were the first people to stay in the Celebrity Suite. Blake, one of the managers was the true definition of friendly. He escorted me to the room, gave me a tour of the room, showed me how everything worked, and told me to contact him if I needed anything. Top notch employee they have with Blake. I came into contact with no less than 8 other employees while there and each of them asked me how my stay was and how I liked the hotel. They all seem genuinely excited to be there and showed what appeared to be genuine interest in my opinion and my stay. We have stayed at many Alofts and none have employees like we encountered here. Later, on our way up the elevator, we met Brad the general manager. He noticed and made mention of the fact we had both of our dogs with us. Within minutes two hotel employees showed up with huge overstuffed doggy beds, a bag of dog treats, a couple of dog toys, and a couple dog bowls. Our dogs loved the beds. We couldn't get them out of them. That was a very kind gesture on the hotels part and very appreciated. The room was great. It is 2,000 sq ft. and two stories with the second story being open to below. It has two living rooms with the most functional being on the second floor. We invited over a few friends for dinner and the second floor dining room table was plenty big to accommodate all of us. The second floor AC unit was not working and with the floor to ceiling windows it became quite hot up there. The hotel made 4 separate attempts to fix it to no avail. Not a huge deal. It's a new hotel and they made a genuine effort to fix it. This particular Aloft is very unique and different from any other Aloft we have stayed at. There is a full service restaurant that is open for lunch and dinner. No Aloft we have stayed at has had a restaurant. Usually Alofts are limited service hotels. This one is closer to full service. Keep in mind however room service is not offered. Also, this Aloft has a rooftop outdoor lounge area with couches, chairs, etc. A very relaxing space open to the public. As far as the neighborhood goes it is a great area with multiple restaurants in walking distance and bricktown about a 3-4 minute walk away. There is also a small specialty grocer right across the street. I give this place an unhesitant 5 stars.My boyfriend, myself, and two friends bought tickets for $80 a piece for unlimited drinks and a 5 star buffet for New Years. Let me just say it was a massive disappoint and I will never be going to this establishment again. As a vegetarian this 5 star buffet had just cheese and fruit for me to eat. As for drinking, you had to wait in a 20 minute line which I figured we'd end up doing for an event. After midnight they decided even though we everyone paid $80 a piece for "ultra VIP" they would charge us $10 a drink. We all feel completely ripped off and I would never recommend anyone going to this place.My boyfriend and I are moving across the country and we opted for this hotel because of the location and reviews and it was a great selection! The hotel itself is very fun and the staff was very nice. You do have to pay for vallet but that should be expected at an upscale hotel. They are dog friendly and had a nice little patch of grass in the front for the pups. We had also booked this room online with no issues. When we arrived their computer system had unfortunately just gone down but instead of making us wait they simply walked us to our room and manually unlocked the door for us so we could settle in while they waited for the system to reboot and make our keys. The room was small but it's a hotel! Lol. the bed was amazing! So comfortable. There were actually lights in the rooms not just lamps and the bathroom was great! Big roomy shower with awesome soaps and shampoo. Downstairs they have a nice bar and restaurant. We didn't eat there but we did get drinks. The bartender was very friendly. We were able to take our drinks into the front room where we played free pool. They also had a variety of other games. This was a great hotel. We definitely enjoyed our stay.Stayed here on a recent business trip for two nights. They have a very friendly staff and the unique hotel is very modern, clean and inviting. I would stay here again.Wow, just wow. Wow...in a bad way. If I could give a restaurant/bar a 0, I would. This place is so not worth it. Save your money and go somewhere else, seriously anywhere else. First of all, the "restaurant" here looks like a cheaper version of the cafeteria at ikea. The bar has a bad layout and people are leaning over you while you eat to order a drink. Speaking of drinking - don't come here expecting to drink anything more complicated than a jack and coke because the bartenders simply cannot make it. I asked for a chocolate martini and was told that "they don't do those here." The wait staff was not welcoming at all. We were not greeted and people just seemed to be running around with big frowns on their faces.This is my 2nd stay at this hotel as I travel from Houston for business. Both stays have been for several days and both have been very enjoyable. The food at the bar was surprisingly awesome (I got the crab tacos and bacon wrapped salmon with sweet potatoes). The bed was very comfortable and the location is walking distance to brick town activities and restaurants. I will be back!We stayed over thanksgiving weekend. Location was very convenient, both to Bricktown and the major highways. First impressions were positive with very friendly staff and a modern decor. The room was a good size and had a great view of downtown however upon closer inspection the upkeep and maintenance of the room was poor. It was clean but things were broken or damaged including a tear in the window blind, a broken toilet seat and floorboards coming away from the wall. Nevertheless the bed was comfortable and the hotel amenities such as the pool table and the bar made it a fun stay. I just expected more given price.If your like me and you enjoy a modern hotel, clean, huge spacious rooms in the heart of downtown the you will love this hotel. I didn't even know this hotel existed. When I googled hotels to stay at in Oklahoma City it didn't even pop up. Due to a crazy turn of events (Lakers playing Oklahoma) my original hotel was overbooked and the manager of the Colcord (Clara) graciously booked us at the A loft. So if your searching for a place to stay and like all the above benefits. aloft is the place for you. They even had a great bar downstairs with a few TV's showing different sporting events going on. The hotel staff has been awesome and even allowed us a late checkout because I move slow and needed to eat lunch.  My only improvement would be if there was something in the rooms that said whether they serve food or gave an idea of surrounding areas or benefits the hotel has to offer. But that's just me nitpickingStayed at this location twice... Better than aloft of Rancho Cucamonga and aloft in downtown Dallas and north Dallas when it comes to customer service, location, and amenities. This location is much newer than most and the two story bar area is very nice as well. For such an inexpensive price, this hotel rivals that of hotels three times the price.
review_content_40: Location is great! They have a small pool, although is next to the parking lot and it doesn't offer a lot of privacy. The gym is on the second floor and it's quite modern with top of the line equipment. They have decent food on the menu and loads of hang out areas in the lobby. Most of all the internet is great and at no extra cost!Had drinks and watched the live band here. The band was good and the drinks were decent but a bit pricey.BS service...simple asks that a Rodeway Inn could accomplish this Aloft can't seem to handle. I called the front desk at 5pm on 5.25.14 to get something as simple as a toothbrush to be brought to my room.Waited until 5:30pm and called again and asked if they could add two towels to my toothbrush ask since it still had not been brought upstairs, I got a "uhhh what?" by the front desk gentleman so I asked again to have two towels and let him know I was still waiting on my toothbrush, he said he'd check on it for me.At 6:15pm I had to go down to the front desk to ask for the manager. The gentleman at the desk said she was on her way in and I could leave my information and he would have her call me. At 7pm I had to go back down to the desk again to ask for my toothbrush and towels as they were never delivered from my 5pm request, not to mention the manager was still not in. The gentleman at the front desk called the managers cell phone and she said she'd be in within 5 minutes. It is now 9pm and no one has even tried to help me out at this point....I rarely leave feedback on anything, but what does it take to get something so simple accomplished at a hotel that prides itself on service, definitely wont be asking for anything else in the hotel....there's a good chance I'll have to wait until I check out to get it...Booked a room here for a staycation in Bricktown. This place is within walking distance of nearly EVERYTHING in Bricktown/downtown OKC and the price was reasonable compared to other hotels in the area.The rooms had charging stations for everything! Beds were very comfortable and the shower was a rainfall type affair.Free coffee downstairs along with a quick snack bar for midnite ice cream urges, and a short order cook for something hot (not free lol.)The swimming pool was small but adequate.The exercise room was also small but for the size had a good selection of machines and even some weightlifting items.I peeked into the rooftop bar, looked very nice and would like to come back without the teenagers and check out the drink selection.The setup of the hotel was nice also, colorful without being in a circus and the only drawback is the elevators take FOREVER to come! The man at the checkout station said they were trying to fix that.There is also a quick checkout kiosk where you use a touch screen to check out- I thought that would be nice for people on business.Overall I was happy with my stay and Aloft met expectations. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Bricktown.

hotel_name: Renaissance Oklahoma City Convention Center Hotel
review_content: This is my 4th stay at this hotel. I stay here once a year for the National Tornado Summit which is held at the Cox Convention Center.I have been pleased with each of my stays here so far. The rooms are clean & nicely decorated. There is generous space in the bathrooms. WiFi is available, but it costs about $12 per day. Restaurant, bar, & a sandwich/gift shop are located downstairs. There is also a walkway connecting the hotel to the Cox Convention Center.They used to provide a shuttle service to/from the airport. This service was discontinued in 2015. A taxi from the airport may range from $30-$40. I just grab a rental car & park in the Santa Fe parking garage for $10 per day.The hotel is within walking distance to the OKC Bombing Memorial, OKC Museum of Art, & Bricktown.I was pretty disappointed in my stay at the Renaissance okc. Although the lobby and general areas are very nice and updated, the rooms are subpar. They are outdated and borderline unclean.Things I was disappointed in: 1. The walls were a pale yellow so I could see stains. 2. The tub in my shower was so concave that I felt like I was standing in a storm gutter. Plus, my shower curtain was stained. 3. Since the hotel is so open, you can hear everything from the lobby and general areas. 4. Wifi is not free in your room unless you're a rewards member. 5. Breakfast is only for rewards members on a certain tier and the breakfast options suck. Things I liked: great location.I will stay at the Hampton inn or the aloft next time for sure.A-okay.I've spent many a night in this hotel. It's typical, some things better than normal, others not.Staff was very nice. I didn't have a negative experience once with the probably 20-30 employees I encountered over the weeks.Many of the rooms I stayed in had dingy carpeting. Flat-out unappetizing carpet that made me wear my shoes in the room. Everything else was clean. One of my colleagues stayed here once and refused to come back because of the state of the carpet. My next stay had a wet spot in the carpet; I cringed, washed my feet in the tub, and wore my flip-flops to the bed.Frequently, the curtains were broken in a way that I could not get the blackout portion to slightly overlap so I had the sun peeking through while I hissed like a vampire in the morning. "Ah! I'm melting!"If your room is on the East side of the hotel, you may hear the bands of Bricktown while trying to go to sleep. Dial 0 to get earplugs and ask for Maintenance if the operator tells you they don't have them.The entry area, bar, check-in, pool, and little shop are all very nice and open. The gym had everything I needed.Room Service was slow and I only did it once. As an apology for taking over an hour to deliver a salad, they brought a slice of pie after I specifically said "No, please don't bring me a dessert" over the phone while I was checking on said order. The pie was yummy, btw... pre-workout meal of champions of course.They do offer the 500 Marriott points program for skipping a day of housekeeping. If you travel for work and have become point-obsessed, this is nice. I mean, it's not like I view my point statements and mutter "my precious" in a Smeagol voice or anything like that.This does beat the Sheraton across the street. I've also spent too much time in that place. My Sheraton colleagues came over to the Renaissance one time and said things like "omg, it's like you're in a real hotel.... with a real bar!" when they walked in.If you enjoy waiting for service items that will never show (such as as towels and toilet paper) and having to clean your own hotel room, this place is for you!As a Platinum Rewards member who stays in Marriotts 70 night per year, I have been a Marriott loyalist; however, my experience at the Renaissance OKC may have me switching brands. Most of our friends we traveled with stayed at and highly recommended the Hilton Garden Inn. Next time we are in town, I won't be coming here We did not get maid service despite requesting it. When I called back down, the front desk said it was too late as housekeeping went home. I asked for 5 towels and some toilet paper- they never brought it.  I went to the front desk and asked for 5 towels, sheets, toilet paper and toiletries and only some of it was brought up.  I had to take out three bags of garbage and change sheets on the beds.   We were still short 2 towels and no toilet paper.  I called again for 2 towels and toilet paper.  Nothing was brought up.  About 9pm, I went downstairs again requesting 2 towels and toilet paper.  Still nothing . . . .In addition to the our housekeeping woes, the restaurant was excessively slow and our food was overcooked- a dry, tasteless burger, tough, dry chicken and burnt grilled cheese.   The walls are paper thin so we heard many conversations and the trains woke me up constantly.  My frustration was the utter lack of professionalism and customer service from anyone on staff   I gave them numerous opportunities to make things right and they never did.  Also concierge was not open on the weekends. Morning cannot come soon enough.  I want to go home.   I'm mad I wasted so many of my points redemption in this terrible experience!!!  I am shocked at the amount of ineptitude of the staff- it was 100% across the board.  Sometimes you have one bad one in a bunch, but everyone I interacted with was of no help to us.  The only positives were the location to the Cox Center for our gym meet and the kids liked the glass elevators and koi pond in lobby.   Should we compete in this meet again, I won't be staying here.I'm basing this review on a comparison to other Marriott and specifically other Renaissance properties.Check-in: There was no line and the check-in process was fast and easy. I did check-in online beforehand so that probably helped.Lobby: The lobby area is beautiful. There's a koi pond!Room: Now this is where the 2 star rating comes into play. The rooms seemed very outdated. Bright yellow striped wallpaper, yellow/orange striped carpet, those horrible fabric shower curtains that always get stained and likely never washed! The beds themselves were very uncomfortable and not the typical comfy Renaissance feel. The walls were so thin that I could hear the man in the next room having a normal conversation over the TV...he wasn't yelling at all.Breakfast Buffet: Here's another reason for the 2 star. The breakfast buffet was a typical breakfast buffet...not remarkable. We went early so we were one of the first people there and only one of two parties in the entire restaurant. Despite that, it took my husband a good 10 minutes to get an omelet (no one in front of him). I had eggs and biscuits and gravy. The biscuits definitely weren't fresh because they were hard and dry. The pastries looked like they were weeks old and my kids had to eat cereal in a cup because there weren't any bowls out. Not a horrible thing, but who doesn't have bowls for cereal? Luckily the waitress noticed that none of us ate much so she only charged us for one buffet ($18). Definitely a bright spot!Coffee shop: There's a coffee shop within the hotel that claims to sell Starbucks coffee. Don't expect to get Starbucks quality though. When I first walked in there was no one behind the counter and the man in front of me asked if we were supposed to make the coffee ourselves. A woman finally came in and fairly quickly made me a skinny hazelnut latte (just like I always order at Starbucks). It wasn't drinkable. The latte tasted like chemicals and I couldn't drink more than 2 sips. Valet: Now if I could rate only the valet, it would be 10 stars! They were amazing. I've never had a valet not only help load the car (typical) but also assist my kids in getting in their car seats!Overall I just didn't feel like the hotel lived up to the Renaissance reputation. I've stayed in many Renaissance hotels (Dallas and DC mostly), and this one didn't come close. The Residence Inn not far from here was a much better experience and I'll likely try to stay there again.From someone who stays in a lot of hotels and primarily Marriott properties, I don't understand the 3 star rating.From the Valet service, the front desk staff, room service and everyone we came in contact with were really prompt, friendly and competent.  The rooms have always been everything they need to be with comfortable beds and good work area.  Well decorated and inviting.  Great location and easy to get to.  What am I missing people?I called the hotel a day prior to my stay and asked for a specific room, understanding that an NCAA event would be in town and the hotel would be swamped due to it's proximity to the convention center and arena.  They were very pleasant on the phone and I was delighted to find my room was assigned as requested.At check-in they were quick and friendly.  They even offered bottle water as the concierge lounge was closed at the late hour I arrived.  I thought that was a real nice touch and an easy way to personalize check-in and show they care.The room was decent.  Certainly not the best room ever, but it's been renovated and it was generally clean.   The room faced the convention center with a decent view of the nearby Devon Energy Center and tower which dominates the OKC skyline.I found the bedding and pillows to be very comfortable.  I was disappointed that the power plug in the lamp next to the bed was very loose and unusable. I ended up having to run my extension cord to behind the TV.  Otherwise there's lot of power plugs on this nifty multi outlet they had on the desk.Thoroughly unimpressive was the fact that the room lacked a mini fridge. I called to have housekeeping deliver one, but the one they gave me was more like a mini freezer.  As it turned all my beverages to slushies.  Sadly, the little knob to control the temperature was busted off.  The room also lacked a in-room safe. The bathroom was ok, but they seriously skimped on towels.  I mean just two towels...how do they expect a couple to function? Or a solo business traveler that likes to carpet the floor with bath towels? Or a yoga enthusiast that likes to use them for a make shift mat?  Worse yet in the bathroom was long hairs in the tub.  If you've seen my profile pic, you can pretty much deduce that they weren't from me, and the bathtub wasn't thoroughly scoured prior to me arrival. I was upset that housekeeping wouldn't replace toiletries like soap and shampoo-seemed skimpy. Also, had to ask for more laundry bags when it became apparent they wouldn't be replaced. The hotel stepped up their game when it came to laundry service which was very good & very affordable for a hotel. As they should, they delivered the finished laundry right to my room.Now room service left a lot more to be desired.  First night I called they said it would take 30-45mins.  Second night they said it would be over an hour. I feel that's unacceptable for a club sandwich, side & drink.  If that were my operation, I'd take on more staff, or cross train folks in other departments to assist with service.  Let's be honest, there's not much to eat late at night in OKC without going under the railroad tracks for a ten minute walk. The Renaissance had a great shuttle service with a very friendly driver, but the valets were always unwilling to summons her for a lift.  You'd ask where they go and they give you the radius, but then they suggest you just walk...what gives.  Cab service in this town was abysmal.  Suggest Uber (UberX cars only) or a limo service.Renaissance's 15th floor concierge lounge was nice.  Stocked with beverages and light snacks. Only wish was that they refrigerated their yogurt instead of placing it in ice and having it melt for long hours.Overall a decent stay, if they tweaked a few service issues it's be great.Hotel decor is dated, no fridge in room, a little pricey. Check in staff was not friendly at all. Breakfast buffet was good but again pricey. Not super impressed and I generally like Marriott hotels. Wish I would've stayed somewhere else.Pleasant employees but service is very slow.  Check in.  Valet. Housekeeping.  Not consistent with other Renaissance locations.  Decor dated.Room service is a joke. I ordered dinner and it took 2 hours before I saw it. They comped me and I figured it was a busy night. On my last day I ordered breakfast only coffee and an English muffin. That took over an hour.Frequent traveler.Staff - front desk / other - MehTop floor status area - amazing, so polite and friendlyGreat breakfast buffet for those with the option.Rooms are good size and offer a quality desk and chair which is important as I'm someone who often leaves the client and continues to work.Very nice decor upon entry with a waterfall touch, didn't get to check out the gym due to lack of time.Valet parking w/ neat text ahead of time option.Would certainly recommend it.This place used to be the bomb...but mother time has had its way.  Excellent service but just an old property.  Most folks don't know what I'm talking about but they will bitch about the rate.  I paid $269 for a 2 room suite (and have many times here) and that's a fair deal.  Clean, good service, attentive staff!Now the BAD...train goes thru at 6:30 am blowing its horn...wth, most cities havebanned that in their downtowns...OKC???Next my suite just has to above the next door Sheraton Hotel service entrance...6:30 am..trucks backing up...beep,beeep,beeep,beeep, !   Then here comes the 7:00 crew, car door, horns, loud pipes...aye aye aye...I'm up 2 hours early!!Probably no more!Beautiful hotel lovely facilities pool area was very clean and very nice had a Manny Petty at the spa and really enjoyed it very great service in concierge room loved our stay thereThis is my 2nd time staying at this hotel.  First time was when I was visiting my sister in Lawton and we came up for a spa day.  That stay was okay - but nothing to write home about - but certainly nothing bad.  (about 6 months ago).This time, I was in town a couple of days for business and decided to stay here again.  Hotel staff is friendly and polite (at least to me) - which is a plus.   Concierge lounge had good supply of drinks (coffee was NOT good) and breakfast was good.  Closing at noon on Friday was not cool - as I wanted to get some water since there is no fridge in my room.  Went downstairs and they wanted 3.20 for a diet dr pepper!  What?  No thanks.Valet is expensive - but colleague had the car this time and was at a different hotel (I prefer full service to a Fairfield). Room cleanliness was not up to Marriott standards.  My coffee pot was in the bathroom (a pet peeve) and there was loose sugar in the box.  There was no room service menu - of which I had to call down for the 2nd night.  My room was not cleaned properly for the 2nd night-  where I had no shampoo and conditioner - had took the used ones from the morning - and put them in a spot where I could still use them but expected fresh.  The maid took the used amenities and put them where fresh ones were to be.  What???  I didn't realize this until I was ready to shower or I would have called down.  I have no cream for the 2nd morning - and the sugar is still loose there.  Room service was fast and reasonable.  Bar downstairs is way overpriced!  Spa is a joke (went both times I was here - but won't go again).  I wrote a separate review of that.I travel quite frequently and love my Marriott brand - but this is average at best.  Too many choices in OKC for an average stay.I have multiple complaints about this complex. The "Bar" in this hotel, is both overpriced and a joke. I was ignored for quite a long while when I came to the bar, then I ask for simple drinks that the joke of a bartender "never heard of". WOW. SO, they hired him just to be a snooty scumbag to women and out of town types who know more about hs line of work than he does??? I was "yelled at" (warned harshly) as well as my boyfriend to "cover up" while WALKING and TAKING THE ELEVATOR to the pool. I couldn't believe that!! I understand this is a "nice", "classy" place, but do you know what isn't "classy"??Being sexist and ageist (discriminating based on age). This place definitely has the "old conservative white man" power hungry control freak standards going on at this establishment. I wasn't wearing a G-string. I had a conservative 1 piece bathing suit on. My boyfriend simply didn't have a shirt on. Apparently, this is enough for a warning. We happened to be barefoot, too. They must have missed that to bitch about. The mini-bar was incorrectly charged, for whatever reason. The best I can guess is that it is "weight sensor activated" and even if you picked something up and put it back (or put it back in the wrong spot?) you were charged, regardless.Snooty, rude, unhelpful hotel staff. For my multi-day stay my towels weren't changed at all. WTH? That just seems cheap.And worst of all, no free/complimentary breakfast. They had the nerve to charge like $6 for fruit. Even 2 star hotel chains have free bananas and bagels for breakfast!! I guess the greed of this "classy" establishment couldn't be bothered with complimentary breakfast. (They figure the typical client here will overpay for a subpar hotel breakfast??)Paying for parking irritated me, too. No such thing as validation? At a place like this? You would think the room rate would cover that.I've stayed at TRUE 5 star resorts and hotels before. THIS IS NOT EVEN CLOSE. I've been to comfort inns' that had ALL of the same amenities PLUS had free breakfast AND DIDN'T have a snooty staff, or any of the other problems I had. I RECOMMEND JUST ABOUT ANYWHERE ELSE BESIDES THIS PLACE. This place is literally just "for show". (The nice looking lobby)My wife and I stayed here for one night, on points, while attending the Bulls @ Thunder game. Which, I must tell you, makes this hotel in the perfect location - you can stroll to dinner and drinks in Bricktown, about 5 minutes away, and then walk another 5 minutes to the stadium, and another 5 minutes back to the hotel after the game. Really, the perfect location.We showed up early and got right in. The hotel is an open atrium setup, and feels like an Embassy Suites as a result. They accepted my "high floor" preference, but not my "far from elevator" preference. Oh well. Our room overlooked the convention center and train station, and was very comfortable. Large and spacious, with a huge bathroom...that really could have been made smaller (and the extra room used for the living area. But that's just my preference). I've seen reviews around the Interwebs that housekeeping here is very loud. Before we arrived, I thought "Huh? How can that be? And who cares?" But holy cow, it's true. They're always speaking very loudly in the halls and banging things around at all hours of the day. Nothing better to wake up to on a cold December morning than two housekeepers being incredibly loud at 7:00am. We didn't eat or drink here, but the bar area looked nice. The lobby was spacious and bright. Valet parking is expensive and a pain - they have to park it 4 blocks away, and when you give them your car, they say to expect 15 minutes for it to be returned. Perhaps longer if there is snow and ice. So that's not cool. I would stay again, but I wouldn't be against looking elsewhere.Great location and friendly staff.  Nice rooms that are very comfortable.  Club floor is just okay.FREQUENT TRAVELERS MUST READ. Their ratings do not accurately convey the quality of this hotel. Okay, let me preface this post by telling you how often I am in hotels and how much the little things really matter. I travel every week and I stay in hotel rooms about 3-4 times per week. When you have a 'home away from home', the little details almost everyone neglects become important. It's not about how the rooms are decorated, how new and progressive the features of the hotel are, and how amazing the pool is. It's about comfort, convenience, and making you feel important and valued as a consumer of their service. I got to the hotel, which is conveniently located in the Heart of OKC; check - convenience is taken care of. I get my room key, which was all ready to go due to their mobile check-in feature, and everything goes smoothly. I continue on to my room and I am elated that it is clean, the air conditioning unit doesn't sound like a jet engine, and it's relatively quiet given the location. The bed is comfortable and the room has adequate space for work and 'spreading out'; check - another one off the list. Now for the most important part - feeling valued. Matt Clauson checked me in smoothly and was EXTREMELY prompt in greeting me as soon as I stepped in the door. He had my room key ready and asked if I wanted points or a $10 voucher (perks of Marriott Rewards Membership). I said points but then stated it would be nice to have the voucher, as I had a long day and a beer sounded delicious. Completely unprompted and without me asking, he decided to give me a $20 voucher. I thought to myself: "that was extremely kind and something I have never received (above and beyond) from any other Marriott property I have been to." Don't get me wrong, they are always good with giving bonus points or a free market item but I have never had someone take it one step further. He looked me in the eye and told me: "thank you for being a loyal member of Marriott and have a couple beers on us." Finally, a check for the last item on the list. Matt's professionalism and courtesy on my initial interaction with hotel has made me a loyal customer; I will be staying here every month now. I had just finished up a stay at a Marriott property in Tulsa and did not have a great experience. In fact, I even considered switching my 120-180 nights per year to Hyatt. This small gesture kept me from jumping ship. Again, the SIMPLE things matter the most when you are traveling as much as I do and he nailed it! That man deserves a raise. Well done Renaissance OKC!Everyone else's bad reviews don't do this place justice and are not accurate.I will stay here from now on anytime I need a hotel downtown OKC! We started off on the wrong foot by waiting an hour for a sandwich and soup. The 5 Stars is for how well they did completely making up for it. It made the stay for me and my wife thoroughly enjoyable!If they make a mistake they will bend over backwards making up for it! Thanks to the manager, Morgan, for doing your job so well!The perks here are complimentary limo rides to anywhere downtown (be sure to tip), great food and drink, morning breakfast/brunch buffet was delicious, the rooms are very nice and the in-room coffee is pretty good too, the room service is quick and anything we needed they would have it up to our room within minutes!The valet takes a while (10-15 minutes) but it's understandable because there's no parking downtown so I can't fault the Renaissance for this and they forewarn you too.Other than that... Great stay! Thanks guys!After 12 hours driving from Chicago to Oklahoma City I was expecting at least to enjoy the stay at this hotel for a night until I got here... I got a reservation through Priceline thinking I was getting a good deal but when I got here they wanted to charge me triple what I payed because I had my dog with me . It wasn't saying anything about charging extra for dogs in the reservation . It doesn't make any sense !! And I heard the manager saying that they were booked up so I guess they just wanted to get rid of us so they could charge a guest that was willing to pay full price instead of one who got a reservation through Priceline . SO BAD!!!!!
review_content_20: This hotel - while nice on the inside - offers HORRENDOUS customer service. My personal card was charged over $2,000 for an event that I had nothing to do with and it took over a week for the hotel to refund this amount - after much back and forth. For anyone planning an event in Oklahoma City, do yourself a favor and go with another hotel. The worst customer service. And, the worst Renaissance hotel I have ever had to deal with. How do you incorrectly charge a customer more than TWO THOUSAND dollars and make it seem like they are somehow at fault?Beds...FIVE STARS.sorry, nothing more to reportI just went to be early, slept in...AHHHHHHHI stayed in this hotel the night of 11/20 while making my way back from Austin, Texas.  Considering the reviews and the price, I had fairly high expectations that weren't met.  The hotel isn't bad but it isn't as nice as other hotels that offer rooms for a similar price.
