The lobby has stunning wood paneling and huge pllars.  There is a nice lounge with live jazz, and a great upscale restaurant.  I haven't stayed in a room, but the rest of the building is great.

review_content: I have stayed at this location several times and enjoyed my stay. The staff have always been friendly and helpful. The little pantry they have is always well stocked with lean cuisine meals and other microwave foods for those late night checkins or munches. Plenty of other snacks and beverages as well. This location does not have the usually American Grill they have a seperate brand called the 809 Sports Grill which usually have pretty good food. I love their chili its a thick and hearty chili with a touch of dark chocolate added for a little sweetness. It's amazing. The room is the typical HGI setup and amenities. I like that they do not lock the TV's so I can connect my iPad and watch my shows. Some of the Hampton properties lock the TV so you can't change the input.There are several shops nearby if you forget something and need to stop into a Target for example. Overall it's a good stay and I will be staying here again in the futureOverall I had a good stay the hotel and was happy with my visit. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly.There was one thing however that came up in my stay. I ordered room service while I was there and used the menu from the hotel room. Well, I placed my order for the food and the bill came with the food. Normally I don't usually look closely to the charges on the bill, but I noticed that the prices from the menu differed from the bill I received. All the items on the menu were a dollar less than the bill. I called downstairs to speak with the manager and told him the situation and he said the prices have gone up and the menus have not been updated. I asked him are the menus going to be updated anytime soon because I'm sure other guests will notice. He said yes they will be and that the bill reflects the new prices. At that point he did not suggest or say he would accommodate me with the old prices since it was the hotels mistake. I had to ask him to change it. He gladly said he would fix it, which I appreciated. However, I was just surprised he didn't suggest accommodating me since it was the hotels mistake.I did receive an email from the hotel today asking them how my stay was. I did appreciate the follow up with the hotel. I will for sure let them know.5 stars again for this awesomeness as a hotel.  Wonderful service, location, clean rooms, great rates.  My previous review on The Hilton is pretty much the same nothing to change.  Its hard to come back to a business twice and get the same results but the exceeded my expectations.  When we come back to OKC this will be the hotel we will stay inOMG, Paula is the best over here at HGI OKC Midtown.  My fiancee had wedding planned for earlier this month so started wedding planning last year Dec.  Well, my dad found this hotel near the church and reception dinner.  Paula was able to setup a wedding block for our guests and include free breakfast as well.  The wedding rate was pretty competitive and was better than our company rate.  Plus, Paula was able to secure 2 rooms across from each other since my sister brought her daughter along.  Also, my best man and uncle's room were relatively close by each other.  We enjoyed every morning with our vouchers.  I had omelet the first 2 days and then decided on fried eggs on the last day.  The waiting staff was very accommodating and took omelet orders very quickly.  For our wedding night, we had a Jacuzzi tub upgrade so it was nice they everything was setup very quickly.Great sports bar in lobby, friendly staff...my only complaint is my room, which was otherwise spotless, had wet carpet and a funky smell (room 302) upon arrival. I blasted the air and the odor was controlled. Also called room svc at 8pm Wed night and was told it would be 1hr 15 min for a club sandwich....too late to eat. Girl said they were understaffed.I have stay here over 35 nights during  2014 and every time they seem to be better  and better  their staff  always  go the extra mile to make sure you feel  comfortable great amenities, very clean,lobby is always  clean and nicely  decor. The room service is a plus and the food is overall  good but the staff is the differenceThis was a great place to stay! We got in exhausted after a long day of driving on the way back to Ohio, and we were treated with great customer service at 1:30am or so! I was dead tired, but Chris at the front desk was a great guy, and made our check-in experience the best it possibly could have been, given how exhausted we were.This hotel was really nice, and it was very reasonably priced. The only downside was that it was a little off the interstate; but everything else about it made up for that. The room was clean and comfortable, and had a mini fridge, which was great to stash the snacks I was carrying in a cooler. I would also note there was no complimentary breakfast; but that didn't bother me - good excuse to try a local OKC bakery in the morning!This place was reasonably priced, had such great service, and a really great room that I would seek it out again if I was staying in OKC for a night. I highly recommend it.Was in OKC for a concert last week and all the downtown hotels were outrageously expensive. HGI Midtown seemed like a close enough alternative that was both nice and reasonably priced.Overall a great stay - staff was friendly, there's a bar/restaurant onsite and it's not too far of a drive to downtown. Really nice rooms - clean and modern. Appeared to be great breakfast choices as well, though I stuck to coffee.I've stayed in numerous HGIs and they're always above average - this one was no different. The only snag we hit was when our TV stopped working. We let the front desk know on our way out, but it was still not working when we came back. One of the staff members came up, reattached some cables and we were up and running again.Was in OKC for two nights and whenever I pick up a new territory or state, I usually try multiple locations out, always Hilton or Hyatt, to see where I want to stay in the future. In OKC, it will be the HGI here!  Easy to get into, great location, clean, comfortable and excellent service.  Was greeted warmly at the front desk, acknowledged I was a Gold member and thanked me.  Had two bottles of waters chilled and ready and with a nice touch, had the welcome note on the bottles wrapped around it with my name, room# and contact info for the manager. Also wanted to know if I wanted bkfst the next morning or points. As I was leaving at the crack of dawn I took points and she immediately asked if I needed a wakeup call etc.  Room was typical HGI, clean, comfortable, neat.  It was missing the channel listing and someone ran up one in about 2 minutes with a free drink coupon for the trouble.  Bar in the hotel is a sports bar and was just fine to grab a beer and a snack before I went out.Very pleased by the level of service, nice amenites onsite and overall feel! Will be the Hilton of choice for myself and team in OKC!I stay here at least once a month .. Sometimes twice a month .. Front desk is always very professional and helpful .. The lobby is very welcoming .. The bar/lounge/restaurant is very nice .. Very intimate ... The rooms are always clean .. Comfy bed and mattress ... There's a nice little bar area with a fridge and microwave .. I would highly recommend this place to everyone :)I stayed around 60 nights in this hotel in 2014. It's a great hotel! I was predominantly a Marriott girl before this, and so are all of the other consultants in my company who travel like I do - but the OKC options made me turn to this hotel and I couldn't be happier. Now I go to HGI often.1. The service was great! I heard that it used to be bad, but they hired a management company to come in and help, and I must say it shows. I had zero issues with service and housekeeping was good. Lobby is updated, they offer cookies :)2. The Keurigs in every room really sealed the deal for me, love it. Makes it hard to go back to the old fashioned coffee pots when I stay at other hotel brands.3. This is the only HGI I've been to that offers complimentary loofas. As a woman I appreciate that, other HGI's so far don't offer them. Still can't tell if they should be or if that was something unique to this location.4. The 809 grill was fantastic. I've had everything on the menu - make sure you order the pizza at least once, it was so good. Sit at the bar for better and quicker service. Locals actually come here to eat often and I can see why. There is enough variety on the menu that you would be good to eat here every day if you wanted to. I had the Baha Chicken Wrap several times. Loved ordering room service when coming back to the hotel after a long day.5. It seems like a newer hotel, everything is updated and I found it very inviting. I see some complaints on the dial beds - I don't mind them. I find the beds to be soft and I like that they use the white coverlets that are washed regularly instead of the old school blankets that hotels used to use.Stay here! :)First time in OKC, my suite was very clean and comfortable.  I'm not one for super crowded/high traffic hotels; so this location was perfect.  There is a pool, restaurant/bar, and gym.  It is not too far from downtown and only minutes from Lake Hefner.  The staff was super friendly, parking was free, and Wifi was complimentary.  If I'm ever in OKC, this will be my "go-to" location.Subpar for a hilton, more what I expect from a Hampton Inn. The hallways and lobby were clean, fresh and lovely. The room was decent sized but felt cheap. The linens are thin, the bed has an adjustable knob for firmness (really) that does nothing. And THE NOISE! If you need quite, go somewhere else: loud fridge, high pitch whine from AC unit (no central air) and a loud noise that sounded oddly like a tornado siren (but wasn't). The bathroom was small, with the towels stored in the shower. The faucet covering didn't completely cover the hole in the tile for the plumbing.I stayed here last weekend for a girls' night and while I can say it met the objectives for the evening, I was pretty underwhelmed overall. Pros: Clean lobby and rooms, comfortable beds and central location.Cons: Service left me feeling very 'meh'.  Here's two stories to illustrate just how 'meh'. Upon arriving, we wanted to toast our girlfriend's recent engagement.  We called and asked for champagne flutes, they said 'sure' and then called back and said 'but you have to come get them yourselves.' OK, not the worst request... but when I went to the front desk they said, "Oh, you have to get them at the bar".  {frustration rising a little} I waited a solid 5 minutes at the bar before anyone helped, and what is most frustrating is that I could SEE said glasses just waiting behind the bar!  Finally someone from back of house came out and gave me the glasses.  When we started getting ready to turn in, we realized we were woefully short on pillows and bath towels, so we called and asked for a few extra of each.  Phone rings after the request and guess what? We need to go get them ourselves, because the front desk person was alone and needed to cover.  OK, that's reasonable.  My friend waited another 5 minutes once down there, and strangely enough, there were multiple people working the front desk! She was given 2 pillows and 3 hand towels.  I don't know about you, but I don't usually bathe with a hand towel! So long story short: I realize these are first world and possibly lazy person problems, but if you know what we've requested and you ask us to come get them, at least have them ready.  I know it was a busy weekend and most hotels in OKC were full of NCAA wrestlers for the tournament, but having rooms full of guests should be a good thing and not a surprise you don't know how to handle.  I probably won't be recommending this place to out-of-town guests anytime soon.I still don't get the HGI beds. The adjustment never seems to work. They're not necessarily uncomfortable but they don't have much give. The breakfast waiter guy with a buzz cut was very accommodating to me as well as to other guests. This was one of the best hotel breakfast staffs I've run across in my travels, mostly at Hilton properties. As mentioned by others, the hotel is close to creature comforts, decent restaurants. I wasn't doing business downtown so didn't need to be close to there. OKC just isn't that large so even though this is in NW OKC, it's not far from the airport or anywhere really.I stayed here for the past couple of January visits and will probably do the same next January.The Hilton Garden Inn proved to be a great choice last weekend when I was in town for a concert.  We had hoped to find a place to stay a little closer to the venue but they all turned out to be on the pricey side.  So we saved a couple hundred bucks and stayed in midtown, and just cabbed it to and from the show.  The room was very nice, with large comfy beds and a flat screen TV.  It also had a decent sized fridge and coffee maker.  They serve a free continental breakfast and prepared ones for under ten bucks.  While we didn't make an appearance, there is what seemed to be a decent sports bar in the lobby.  The WiFi hooked right up, at least for us on the top floor.  On a side note, it is a smoke free facility, which (thankfully) is more the norm these days.  As an ex-smoker I thought the Smoking Oasis was a nice touch.  It had a few tables and a heater, to go along with some ash trays.  It was also nice to not see a pile of butts out near the front door!I've stayed at this exact hotel 3 separate times before this trip, and from those 3 past trips, I'd give the hotel 4 stars. It was the most recent that brought it down to two, mainly because of how many negative stars this past stay should receive. In fact I may have written a review of this hotel before that was very good.I checked in around 8:30 on Sunday to a less than enthusiastic front desk person. No "Welcome to the HGI" or "Thank you for being a Diamond member" or "Welcome back" (Hilton guide book tells employees to say welcome back to returning guests - it's noted on their reservation).  Not anything terribly concerning, but off-putting overall.  The room was nice, and clean, as they always have been each time I've stayed here. Two qualms - the bedframe was coming apart - it was secured by brackets, but you could see the pieces of wood coming apart, which made it creaky. The second was the refrigerator - it kept anything you put in there at a perfect 96 degrees Fahrenheit and was mouse-quiet - until 3AM when it decided to play what I'm guessing was a refrigerator's version of a rock concert.The first morning I decided to take advantage of my complimentary breakfast - the food was good as was the service, which, besides the cleanliness of the room, was the sole highlight of the trip. The second day was a tad different. I was greeted by some guy wearing a non-uniform shirt, no nametag, and I had no idea he was supposed to be my waiter. For all I knew he was some guy.That night I had a lot of work to do so when finished I decided to order room service - ordered a plate of their nachos (had them the last time I stayed here - very good!) and a salad. Guy on the phone said 20 minutes. I waited until an hour went by, called back down, and they never put the order in or had any recollection. The supervisor told me I was going to get 5000 Hilton Points as a recompense, but I did not receive them.My final night I had a delicious dinner at Cattleman's and as I was flying out the next day I decided to have a nightcap at the bar. This went well but what was off-putting was that the two bartenders were eating behind the bar, walking around, pouring drinks, with food in hand. Besides how unsanitary this is, it's just plain unprofessional.Finally, when leaving in the morning, they didn't slip the receipt under my door! Every Hilton I've ever stayed at in the past 5 years I've received this. I guess they slipped up again.In conclusion, I'll be staying at the HGI in Bricktown next time, or the Skirvin. I'd recommend the same.Curtis at the front desk was awesome!! He was very friendly and said he was there to help with anything we needed.  He went out of his way to answer questions and give directions and was great!  The hotel lobby is beautifully decorated. You are offered amenities like complimentary  lemon water, coffee and cookies. Rooms are clean and very pretty with everything you need.  We stayed at a different hotel the previous night that was $80 more than this one (way overpriced)!  Overall, very impressed!Brand new hotel built to meet the needs of overflow from the other hilton. Much cheaper than the one just 5 minutes into the city, great access to the highways too.Friendly staff, and sleep number bedsNice Hilton Garden Inn. Hot breakfast was not even warm unfortunately. Otherwise, good stay. I thought the decor and overall design of the hotel was a step up from most Hilton Garden Inns I have stayed at. Nice big rooms.
review_content_20: Nice placeOne of the best hotels on the North side of downtown Oklahoma City.  They call this the Hilton Garden Inn Midtown but that is a stretch as it is located on Northwest Expressway and May Avenue. This Hilton Garden Inn is very new, exceedingly clean and has an ultra hip modern, stylish decor that is more like that you would see at W hotel than a Hilton Garden Inn.As a Hilton Honors loyalist and for the fact that I live 30 minutes east of Oklahoma City I stay at this hotel quite often and must say that this is one of the best Hilton Garden Inns I have stayed at in the entire country - and boy do I stay at a lot of hotels.  In addition to the hotel there is an attached sports bar called the 809 Sports Grill.  Usually, I steer clear of hotel restaurants but this one is super clean, ultra modern, has plenty of flat screens and a really cool laid back ambiance and it is thankfully just a walk away from the elevator should you have a few too many and need a room.  I'm not sure who actually comes here besides people staying at the hotel but that's a shame as it is very nice, has a great selection of food that far surpasses anything I've ever found at a Hilton Garden Inn.  If you're ever in the area and want to watch a game without annoying smoke in a clean, ultra hip environment be sure and check out the 809 Sports Grill. As a result of my job I travel quite frequently and feel confident in my knowledge of the best hotels in most major cities.  And, as a total hotel loyalty points whore, I collect free nights and vacations like they are going out of style.  Remember George Clooney in Up In The Air?  I can totally relate! - and why not?  All of my stays for work and leisure pay for me to take fabulous trips for free so I consider it basically another perk of my job.  Some idiot in Congress attempted in vain to try to get a bill passed several years ago claiming that hotel and airline points should be taxed as income!  The nerve! Thankfully that didn't even get off the ground as no doubt that would elicit riots in Washington.  As a general rule I eschew chain restaurants, opting for local as often as I can, but when traveling I'm much more comfortable with a known chain entity save but for a few boutique hotels and others that have stellar Yelp reviews in select cities.  After staying in all of the major chains across the country for years I have pared my loyalty down to Hilton and Starwoods properties.  Since OKC is a Starwoods wasteland, Hilton it is for me.  For those not familiar with OKC this is kind of a curious area for a hotel like this as it is near quite a few creature comforts but just far enough away from our so-called major attractions.  It is also literally on Northwest Expressway and conveniently located to either I-44 or I-240. It is also very reasonably priced from between $99 on a slow weekend night to $149 for a weeknight.  And unlike another reviewer who mentioned that breakfast isn't free, well it is, provided you are a super duper Hilton member (Diamond) like me, but most hotel breakfasts universally suck anyway so you're much better forgetting any breakfast even if its free and finding a local gem while you're here. Actually, this is very much like an Aloft Hotel, which is thankfully opening soon in downtown Oklahoma City so we will finally have a Starwoods property.Great hotel.  Breakfast is ok, but not free.  The rooms are clean and new and comfy.  Great shower.  Bar/restaurant on-site.  Stylish lobby.  Pool.  Exercise room.  Bars/restaurants/shopping nearby, but not walking distance.

review_content: Slept like a rock at this hotel. Beds and nice and big, and love the pillows. I think they're feather/down pillows. The location of this hotel is pretty good as well. Short walk to Brick Town and the Oklahoma Memorial. What I love the most is the customer service! I stay at hotels frequently so I know and feel when I really have good customer service. The people that work here are super nice! It was very easy to relax and enjoy the stay here.I am a longtime Marriott fan and loyal stayer having logged almost 1200 nights with them over the years.I stay in Courtyards a lot of the time for business based on location and rate. This time I booked a combo rate including self park and breakfast.Check in is not easy for self parkers as you park out front, come in leave bags and check in, leave bags there, get back in car to park in high rise garage and walk back down into the hotel. Reverse that leaving BUT don't turn in key yet as you leave or you can't exit garage. Hated that.At check in there were three ladies working the desk and all three worked on one lady guest for over ten minutes while I stood by in amazement. One even left the front desk with her for an extended period to help her find Advil or something in the little sundry area by the desk while the other two continued doing something to check her in. Weird. When finally my turn I laughed and asked if that was Donald Trumps wife or something.Room was nice for me and room service burger good but pricey at $26 plus. Too tired to venture out although this is a great location for arena and Bricktown walking. Breakfast in AM was good but confusing as other than telling them my breakfast was in the rate I had nothing to show. Server had to get a manager to confirm it. Weird.Then to top off they tried to post bill me for the ripoff in room water at $8 plus, my worst pet peeve being post billed due to my business reporting. I called and was dealt with curtly by a front desk lady, I assume one of the three I encountered on check in. She said a refund was coming and pretty much hung up.Would likely try them again and hope for a tad better experience in the next trip when I do.There is a Renaissance a block away I stayed in first night but rates are higher since it is full service.BEWARE!!!! I booked my room through Hotels.com's website, for a two night stay. The weekend of my arrival, I was unable to make it the first night, because a grandchild had become ill, so I called to let them know. They said it would be fine and that they would keep my room on hold. The next night, he was feeling better, so we got in the car and drove 100 miles out of the way. Only to discover that they GAVE our room away. Our room that we already PAID for. They also refused to refund me for the night. Not to mention, the hotel staff and manager were very rude and uncooperative. I will never pay another dime to stay at a Marriott hotel. They are thieving imbeciles that are lacking a good customer service team. Very disappointed with my overall experience.Very disappointed in this Courtyard.  I stay at a lot of different Marriott properties and would think a downtown location would be one of its best. Location was nice but hotel needs updating. Room were old, rust in shower and felt dirty. The nicest part of hotel was the lobby. I didn't find staff to be particularly helpful either. Will stay somewhere else the rest of my trip out here.Food selection in the market is horrible. You can't get into the parking garage until you check in and get a room key. Makes for a frustrating experience when you arrive late in the day. Decent enough hotel, but the staff was lacking as i stood at the desk for a couple minutes before someone finally popped out of the backroom.  The room was clean and I was on the end so that was a plus.I wouldn't stay here if it weren't for the Marriott points.  Nickel and dime you for everything.  Bathroom smells of sewage.Nice clean great location. Self parking in garage..just tell valet to let you in. There is a charge for parking but wasnt surprised for being in city with this kind of accessibility to everything. Got a chicken noodle soup from bistro, big, hearty and daughter liked it. Drinks were good as well...server was friendly and made sure I liked my appletini or wouldve remade it. Breakfast was big buffet style..service was confusing..had to grab our own utensils...salt n pepper coffee condiments ect. Then wasnt sure how to pay at the end. Food was typical breakfast items but seemed overpriced.The only thing I can really ding is the parking charge, I think it was $15, added to our one-night rate. This wasn't discussed when I made the reservation and it sort of sprung up during check-in. There's no option in the 'hood to park on the street, so it would make more sense to just include it in the room rate. But then again, that would make the downtown rate seem like less of a steal. Great rates for great rooms here. And it certainly helped to have a roof overhead of the truck, as well as my noggin, for one of the worst ice storms in recent Oklahoma City memory. What a way to ring in the holidays, mother nature. When we awoke every twig, plant, tree and sidewalk was covered in a thick sludge of frozen H2O, and by contrast the Courtyard was pretty cozy. Nice bar/restaurant with a breakfast buffet that stays open late into the morning, including an omelette bar. Our room had a mini-fridge, which I consider something of a must if you're dropping anything near a century of bones. The pool was open early, a nice alternative to the exercise room, which was spacious and loaded with newer equipment. For the cost, you can't go wrong at this place. It seems like an ideal spot to plan a stay after a Thunder game and a night on the town. I'm really glad the Yelp Community Manager suggested this shelter from the storm. Thanks, Julie!My friend and I stayed here for a few days for the OKC Thunder game.  It is only a few steps away from Chesapeake Energy Arena and within walking distance to Bricktown restaurants.  We paid $180/night for a 2 Queen bedroom on the top floor with a view of the arena.  The location was very convenient and is the main reason why they earned 5 stars.The room was nice and clean.  We were able to get a good night's sleep while we were there.  They have Paul Mitchell toiletries.  The staff don't smile much but they were ok.  They have 2 elevators, a pool, jacuzzi and a gym.  They need to put darker tint on the gym windows though.  They have a limo that can take you to Bricktown but why even bother when it's only across the street from the hotel?  Finding a cab is rare which is normal even in downtown OKC I guess so you'd have to call for one or have the front desk agent call one for you.  It takes about 20 minutes to get a cab.I would definitely stay here again if I go to another OKC Thunder game.2 stars for location. Fortunately, there are other hotels in the immediate area, We Would never return to this hotel!So here's the "stuff":1. Booked our room. Traveling with two teenagers and a baby, we definitely needed to make sure we signed up for the right room. We requested a roll away in addition to our dbl queen. Roll away Had to be approved by the manager,. it was approved and notated on our account.We were driving from out of state and would not arrive until very late. Called to let them know. Ok, no problem they said. I asked if they would like to go ahead and put the extra bed in the room. They said no, when you come is perfectly fine. We arrived, tired and weary from our long drive. Night concierge said give me a minute I have to find your reservation as  she's already "closed the books for the day" so she doesn't know what room was assigned to us. (?) Spends the next 25 minutes looking through a paper document and computer. Finally she says,  I think I have a room I've got to go check on it, make sure "it's clean' (?). She comes back, and gives the key cards and such, I remind her of our requested roll-away...Concierge: oh, well, we can't get the roll away to the room as it needs to be approved by a managerMe: oh that's great because it was approved by a manager, (manager) earlier today said OK, check the account, we were told they would put a note on it.C: oh, there is nothing here and (manager) is not hereMe: blank stareC: I also don't have anyone to deliver the bed at this timeMe: stare continuedMe: well that is unfortunate, however, not our problem... I've called about this very issue twice today and this is very important, that we have this bed.C: oh I'm suuuuuure it's very important (said very loudly)C: I will do my best to get a bed to your roomMe: I've got an able husband and two teen boys that can take the bed up there just show us where it is.C: I can't do thatEventually a bed made it to the room and everyone was able to fall asleep, eventually.2. Room details-handicapped room (would have been fine however it should have been disclosed)-when taking a shower the WHOLE bathroom floor was soaked, bad drainage, sink also had a broken plug which drained the water like molasses. -stench. I really felt as if I was traveling in a third world country and this was my Third world shower/toilet bathroom combo. -carpet was damp and sticky. So nasty. I have a ONE year old.3. Our room was not  visited by housekeeping the following day. It was about 3pm that I brought it up as I thought, you know, they would have come by then or tried to...nothing. So I went downstairs and asked them if someone could come by.Me: hi, I think you guys might have forgotten our room, can we get housekeeping to the room?C (different Concierge): oh well I think they have left for the day. Are you sure you didn't have the sign on the door?Me: yes, I am very sure.  (Thanks for asking??)Housekeeping did not come however I was able to request trash pick up and more towels. Which they semi-promptly delivered. But not any of he above issues come close to my biggest issue.... That the blatant lack of graciousness and caring and BASIC hospitality is just severely lacking. It makes me feel as if these indifferent employees work for a company run by even more indifferent supervisors/general managers/owners. Maybe we came on an off weekend. Maybe they do have a certain level of indifference based on the level of patron "security" that being in the location they are in affords them. Maybe I expect a certain level of professionalism and graciousness from a hotel... One thing  that NOT a maybe...  We will never give this or any other CY Marriott's our business again!The valet is absent but the hotel staff is friendly. The room is clean and comfortable. The bed is good. The air conditioning is loud and squeaky. The cable is lacking. The hotel seems pretty empty right now. Guess it's not peak time since the Thunder are out of town. Overall a decent place to stay on a short business trip. This room doesn't have a fridge or microwave, and I'm not sure if any do here.It's a good hotel, gets points for location and price.  It's clean, has a nice and basic restaurant and other than Thunder nights, pretty quiet.  Good family hotel, not fancy, just clean, friendly and safe.  But average.Having stayed, eaten and socialized st various times and have always been very pleased.   Today we went free valet, ate and socialized for few hours.  We went to tip valet and receive our car.  Valet requested 60 dollar park fee for 4 hours.  We had just spent couple hundred in rest/bar and also had room reservations for the next evening.   There needs to be a sign that says valet does not count for bar and restaurant use or 60 dollar fee if no overnight stay.  I cancelled my room for the next evening.Nice location, friendly front desk!  Close to a lot of touristy restaurants.  Gym is mediocre at best.  The bartender sucks though... No acknowledgement whatsover, waste of space.   Go to one of the local bars in the area for better service for sure.Great location- food, drinks, entertainment.  Rooms are clean and accommodating.  Only  two complaints- One, coffee pot in room vs individual cup coffee dispenser.  I've heard from too many people claiming to know people who have cleaned their pantyhose in the pots.  Yuck!  Time to update from coffe pots to cups in room.  Two, the front desk couldn't get the wake-up call correctly.  It was set the day prior (at check-in) for 5:30am.  The desk called at 5am.  After answering and not complaining about the incorrect time, the desk called back at 5:40am with a wake-up call.  Not professional.  Other than two cited complaints, I would have possibly given a four star....Staff is very friendly but room noise on courtyard side of hotel is horrendous. Makes for terrible sleeping conditions. I was on 8th floor and the air conditioner or transformer or whatever that thing is hums loudly constantly and although is at street level penetrates the closed windows. Sold out so could not change rooms. And they have the absolute slowest internet. If you want rest I would not recommend this hotel.We enjoyed our stay here! The staff was super nice and very helpful! Thank you Ashley and Gayla @ the front desk and Jason in Valet Parking! People like u are the reason this place gets good ratings! Keep up the great work!! =))Great hotel!! Couldn't have been a better Mothers Day weekend by the river for a Regatta....they are WAY dog friendly (we have a Great Dane & she couldn't have been more welcomed or loved on by the super friendly staff!) The room was great- movies on demand- had a wonderful breakfast buffet (with an omelet station!) a pool, work out room & one of the best bloody Mary's I've ever had! (& I'm a pro at them!) located in Bricktown you're right in the middle of a ton of great restaurants (try Zio's if you're looking for really good Italian for the whole family)....& we ended just as we began...with the friendly & helpful valets at the front...(thx, Josh!) we'll definitely be back!I love the customer service here. Housekeeping goes above and beyond to make you feel at home. The location is prime but the main reason I come back is because of the service and friendly atmosphere.I love this place! The service is fantastic, the BAR is amazing and they have a gym, pool and business area! I travel to OKC often for work and i love how close it is to the Thunder stadium, Bricktown and highway! Bartenders here are friendly and do a great job! The breakfast buffet is a great start to anyone's day! Always will be back!
review_content_20: Great hotel! Nice location. My boyfriend and I walked everywhere! Bricktown is just a block or two over where there are a ton of places to eat.I stayed here last July for about 2 weeks with my BF, who was taking a class in OKC at the time. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was great and the pool was refreshing. You just can't beat the location. We were able to walk or bike (dependent on how stinkin' hot it was) to Bricktown and the surrounding areas in minutes. Downside is that there is no free wifi :(Great hotel! We've stayed here twice in the last few weeks. Both times rooms were spacious and clean. Very comfortable stay. Hotel is easy to get too. Staff is friendly. You're right next to Brick Town. I would definitely recommend this hotel.It is unfortunate that a facility this nice has an outdated billing system that is completely dysfunctional.  The staff was apologetic, but unable to correct the billing issue in a timely fashion.  After repeatedly emailing forms, and then filling them out and faxing them back to the corporate office, my company discovered that the corporate forms are not accepted by this local branch.  This has gone on for two days with multiple employees.  A call to the customer service line yielded equally dismal results.  The operator's solution was to call the front desk and confirm that this billing issue could not be resolved during this stay.  Epic customer service fail, Courtyard by Marriott.  This will be my last visit.Definitely unlike any other Courtyard I have stayed at before.  The location is as good as it gets- next door to the Ford Arena and across the street from the Cox Myriad Center.  I was checking in right as a Thunder game was starting so valet was definitely the way to go.  After that, we were able to walk everywhere when visiting Bricktown and the OKC Museum of Art.  The lobby has a very upscale feel and the room was a bit larger than your average king room.  Very clean and full of cool urban touches.  Even though I was visiting during spring break, we very little noise issues with hearing other guests in their rooms or kids running around unsupervised.I stayed here so much that it got me status with the Marriott chain. I like this hotel - it's clean and friendly. The parking is retarded tho. You need a room card to access the parking garage that costs $10 or $15 a day. When you check you, you have to take a room key and keep it forever cuz you need the card to swipe out of the garage. Great gym!Close to Bricktown.  Good rates.  Nice rooms.I am surprisingly pleased. At first thought I gave this hotel 4 stars but then I reflected a bit more and realized, it really actually deserves five. There was nothing about this hotel that turned me off in the slightest. It was a bit pricey for Oklahoma City in my opinion. I'm not sure what the going rate usually is but let's just put it this way, my hotel room here was more expensive than the hotel I stayed out in New York City. Odd.Anyway, the room was very clean and roomie. As usual, my 'nice room' karma kicked in and I got the corner suite. The temperature was good; not too hot, not too cold. The beds were comfy. Bathroom, clean. The TV was a godsend. It had like every single important channel. The MOST important was ESPN 2 due to the Australian Open. Unfortunately, it only brought me bad news. Roger Federer, the world's number 1 for three consecutive years; has been in 10 consecutive grand slam finals; LOST in the semi-finals to an upcoming young talent, Novak Djokovic (he's quite handsome too but not as cute as his younger brother who looks like he's about 15....is that wrong?). Luckily I know Roger and he'll bounce back. You can't win 'em all. Keep strong, my love. Regardless of the unfortunate outcome, I was able to see the match because I had such a lovely selection of channels.The restaurant was also quite nice. Maybe I will review that in a separate review....Regardless, they had a few things I knew I'd like. The first night I went for the mac n' cheese. Much better than one would have expected from a Marriott hotel in Oklahoma. The second night was the chicken fingers night. Very good. Professionally crisped to perfection with ample dipping sauce and savory spiced fries. I also gained a number from a nice gentleman who was in college. He was an English major and was obsessed with the fact that I was reading "A Million Little Pieces". Then he asked me what else I read. Well, luckily I have been a reading machine these days. No cable=an unprecedented interest in contemporary and historical fiction literature. So I rambled off the last ten books I've red. Instant connection. I gained a number. So, the next time I have the unfortunate luck of finding myself in OKC, I may just give him a ring and have an entertaining evening with a nice guy. (FYI,  did you know that according to the New York Times, 40% of Americans have not read one book in an entire year. What has the world come to?)Anything else??? Oh the guy at the front desk was a flake when I checked out. Um hello....why didn't you tell me I needed my key to get out of the stupid parking lot? Ugh. Oh and I spilled coffee in my rental car this morning. Not good. I was so distraught over the Federer upset that it took me a while to get into my groove.Stay here. It's nice. The people are nice. And you don't have to venture into OKC to get food.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites Oklahoma City - Will Rogers World Airport
review_content: I've been to OKC 5 times now, always stay at this hotel.  Doesn't look like much from the outside, and incredible from the inside! Greatest part (hands down):  THE SERVICE! The breakfast and restaurant crew are so genuine and nice. My stay wouldn't have been as incredible without them.I wanted to love this place. I did. But I am really particular about where I lay my head - literally! Overall a nice hotel. Not what I expected as its more in line with a Springhill Suites or Residence Inn. They offer free breakfast and free cocktail hour in the evenings. It is close to the airport with friendly staff and quick service. But...both my coworker and I had issues with clean linen on the bed and we were on two completely different floors. She inspected her bed and found hair.....nuff said! I inspected mine and found blood. They sent someone immediately but here is where I deduct stars. I know the ins and outs of hotel stays so I know what to expect. However, I found blood on my bed. Yep, blood! They sent someone immediately and she asks me straight away if I began my stay that day. She was building a case I suppose to say it was my blood. But, not me ma'am! I'm not bleeding and have zero cuts or scratches!! She insists that its fresh but I've not been anywhere near the bed and found it as I was turning the bed down. Why are you trying to convince me to sleep on these bloody sheets? Will the linen fairy doc your pay if you change my linen before I've had a 24-hour stay? I don't understand. Anyhow, she finally changes my linen and asks me if I'd like it changed each day. Uhm, that's a no brainer! The hotel was just okay. The furniture is new but a bit old fashioned. The food (I only had breakfast) was actually really good. The only reason it received 3 stars and not two. I bring my own Clorox wipes and Lysol. I disinfect anything I have to touch. But I was dismayed to see urine stains on the side of the pot. Disgusting! There were food crumbs on the floor by the desk and an old bobby pin that says they don't vacuum. I don't use bobby pins - my hair is super short! So the room was not thoroughly cleaned and again, it's just okay. I cannot say I'd go back if in the area again.Don't eat here. The happy hour bartender opens your food with her mouth and eats directly from the snacks laid out for the guests. Gross! Just imagine what goes on in the kitchen when they're not in plain view of the guests! Couldn't hear the Super Bowl over the bartender and another employee laughing and having a loud discussion at the bar.So far, so great! Every Hilton resort I have stayed at has been fabulous. Unfortunately we got 2 rooms on the 2nd floor where there's smoking rooms in the corner and they smelled like cigarettes, bad! They were sold out so there was nothing they could do about it. So we were given fabreze. The mattresses were also very uncomfortable. Open bar from 5-7 was awesome! Hors d'oeuvres were delicious and breakfast was amazing! Kash & Kelsey were very sweet and helpful when checking our family in. I did leave my bathing suit and cover up behind the bathroom door & no word yet. I have to contact "Lost & Found" which is inconvenient. Hopefully I can get them shipped. I will keep you updated!!Food: 2/5Service: 4/5Cleanliness: 4/5Decor & Style: 2/5The free food they serve in the evening is not regular food, just snacks. At least it is free and at least they serve free beer. Unlike other hotels, there is a bartender at this hotel so a tip is expected whereas others is self-severe (no tip). The restaurant on the main floor serves descent food (see The Landing Bar & Grill). Service is decent, and it is overall pretty clean. The rooms looks pretty good, but the entire layout of the hotel is old and needs updating! I do enjoy that the hotel is very large and gives it a more "vacationie" feel.We stayed at this location Embassy Suites OKC Will Rogers World Airport during a cross country move. Because every time we stayed in a hotel during this move we had to unpack our uncovered truck bed we decided to treat ourselves with staying two nights in one location. And what a treat it was. After arriving very late/early morning tired and in need of rest we were looking forward to a welcoming Hilton Brand hotel. We had come from a gorgeous Embassy Suites in Albuquerque so we were excited about staying in another Embassy Suites. The excitement was short lived. Because we arrived so late we couldn't cancel our reservation for the first night. After seeing the lobby & our room we tried to call the Hilton World Wide Reservation number to cancel the second night only to be told the system was down and they couldn't help us for approximately 3 hours (4:AM) It might not be fair to put this Embassy Suites OKC Will Rodgers World Airport in the same category as Albuquerque Embassy Suites because OKC is probably 25+ years older. We asked an employee if this hotel was built as an Embassy Suites they told us no. They informed us this hotel was built over 30+years ago. This hotel is tired. Very tired. This hotel is called Will Rogers World Airport but we never heard an airplane. I do not know if they offer free shuttle service from the hotel to airport terminal. The hotel has a Chili's restaurant right across the street as well as other restaurants. Parking was free. Coffee, tea or iced water are not left out in the lobby. This is new to me. This hotel is definitely not for me but it could be for YOU. If you like to walk past smokers to get in to the hotel, if you love to not be greeted when you enter the lobby, If you like hot stuffy dark lobby's, if you love low ceilings. This hotel is for you if while getting settled in your new room you love finding a dirty towel hiding on the floor on the side of the bed, if you love finding dirty cotton balls in the trash can. This hotel is for you: if you love finding gross hairs in your shower that hasn't been used by you, if you love bathrooms that are so small it is uncomfortable for 1 person. If you love standing in water while taking a shower this hotel is for you. This hotel is for you if you love a room where the air conditioning doesn't work properly, if you love having to move rooms because of air conditioning issues, if you love small elevators that feel more like a hot sauna. This hotel is for you, if you love to go to breakfast to not find a clean table & have to clean your own. This hotel is for you if you love to swat flies with one hand while you are eating with the other (this takes talent). If you love seeing the employees with sweat dripping down their faces because they are also hot. This hotel is for you if you love the feel of springs poking you in the back all night while trying to sleep in the hide a bed. The list goes on. If you love Best Westerns or Drury Hotels this hotel might be for you. This hotel is called Will Rogers World Airport but we never heard an airplane. The hotel has a Chili's restaurant right across the street as well as other restaurants. Parking was free.In the future even if a hotel is a Hilton Brand I might rethink making reservations sight un seen.So far not so great.  Checked in and felt less than welcomed, no water, or snacks given (which I'm accustomed to as Diamond member....  Room clean so that working in their favor.   More in am as need to attend bkfstThis place is great rooms are large and very clean.  Free breakfast and free happy hour. YeahI stayed at this hotel for a women's conference.  Rooms were clean.  Food was good.  I never had to deal with any customer service because my roommates had already checked us in so I don't know how their CS was.  I'm sure they were friendly otherwise my roommates would have said differently.  The beds were smaller than I would have expected a suite to have.  They were double beds.  I know I'm used to sleeping on a king size bed but I would think that for the price of the rooms and the fact that every room is a suite, they would at least have used queen sized beds.  Also, there was so much chlorine in the pool that my eyes started burning after just sitting by the pool for awhile.  I did not go swimming.  The chlorine was definitely potent.If you like Embassy Suites, avoid this one.  Rooms on the East side are very hot. Our 1st room was also dirty. Rooms in the SW corner are closest to the AC water chillers and cool down nicely.I love this place.  Every room is a suite (thus the name of the place) but what's fantastic is the fact that they'll take pets (for a $50 charge).  What's nice is that they don't discriminate pet owners and give you the exact same room as any other guest.The rooms are super comfortable as you walk into a living room area that you can close off with a sofa bed, microwave and mini bar area.  A large LG LCD tv is here too with very modern furnishings.  As you go into the actual bedroom, there's another LG LCD television that faces two beds.  Usual accommodations that you'd expect.You're also given tickets to the breakfast in the morning (which I didn't partake in) which is pretty nice especially since it seemed like a bit more than your usual continental breakfast.This hotel is down the corridor where the airport is, but I didn't hear any aircraft noises.  YMMV here.   The only thing that was a nuisance was the entrance to the hotel area via the street was a very small entrance way and difficult to navigate.  All other entrances are barred off which makes you wonder whether or not they filter traffic due to crime, or if there was some other reason for it.Regardless of the nuisance, this hotel was a joy to stay at and the staff was friendly and the place seemed very current and nice looking.  Very comfortable staying here at an affordable rate and would definitely recommend to anyone that's passing through and looking for a place to stay as we were.Good location, old building but seemed clean. However the prices were awfully high for whatever reason. And the walls near the room door are these strange frosted glass panels as opposed to the usual windows with curtains like Embassy Suites typically have. As another review posted, these frosted glass panels glow rather brightly from the lights outside the room and are not very sound proof. I would imagine trying to sleep in on the couches in the sitting area would not be very easy. It was so bright, I actually closed the door to the bedroom at night. They are in the process of building a new Hampton Inn after the original one on Meridian closed recently which was the cheapest of the Hilton property hotels near the OKC airport. Looking forward to seeing this new Hampton open to offset the high price of this expensive Embassy.It is a very nice, clean hotel that has very good breakfast and everyone that works there seems to be nice also. The only reason I give it four stars is that in the place with the pullout couch is kind bright at night, if you are going to sleep in that room. Overall very nice pretty clean hotel.This place is timeless. I started coming to Embassy Suites when my children were little. They are now pushing 40 so we've been staying at this hotel occasionally for 30 years. The facility shows a little age, but they've been able to maintain it to a pretty high standard for a long time.Mrs Eva was attending a seminar here so we not only roomed, but they catered a dinner for her group. We had steak and the regular trimmings. It was pretty good although not a place that I would seek out for a night on the town.Their foodservice really shines at breakfast where they have a great buffet with all the good breakfast items. It's easy to get overloaded with the large selection. They do have some fresh fruits and a nice cereal bar so there's something for everyone.It is a comfortable and reasonably quiet place to stay. The suites are large with two rooms separated by a door so you can close out the noise of the hallway.A nice place to stay.My family had a great stay at the Embassy Suites in okc. I've been to several ES hotels across the country since I was a kid and this one had the same high level of service as the others.  This Embassy suites seems to be a bit older than others I've stayed at.  The atrium is beautiful by any standards but not as updated or fresh as other ES.  Breakfast was great each morning as well as the complimentary drinks and snacks in the evening when we got back from the days activities.  It was nice to relax and unwind a little each night at the reception.  The pool and hot tub were clean each day and there were plenty of towels each time we were there.  Front desk was great... Actually the entire staff was great.  I'm sure my kids will remember our vacations staying at Embassy suites as much as I do from when I wad a kid.Started off with some maintenance issues (bad tv remote, stuck balcony sliding door, hot water issue) but the sales manager read my previous review and immediately had somebody come to my room and fix everything. She personally made sure my stay was better than ever - I have never had customer service like that before.The beds and rooms are very comfortable and dark. However, if you do have a guest using the foyer, the fogged glass does let light through from the main hotel area so if they prefer a dark sleep, it may not be the best for them. The balconies are tiny and don't offer much excitement.The Manager's reception is very nice and the bartenders are very friendly (they pour well, too.) The snacks provided are party snack mix, a nice variety of veggies and dips, salsa and chips, as well as non-alcoholic drinks. Perfect for an evening snack escapade.The breakfast is amazing - full cooked to order omelettes, including egg whites! Oatmeal, cereal, scrambled eggs, biscuits, bacon, toast, french toast, pancakes, sausage, coffee, juice, hot cocoa, fruits, donuts and pastries. What more could you ask for!I also really appreciate the complimentary airport shuttle - even after hours, you use the blue/yellow airport express vans and the front desk will cover the fare. I used the ATM in the lobby to get some cash and then broke my bills into singles at the front desk.Overall, I had a very nice week and a half stay and I'm glad to have chosen Embassy again. If you are attending the FAA Academy or need transportation to the facility, the Mike Monroney Aeronautical Center provides a daily loop bus that stops at the next few hotels south of this hotel, convenient. Check the FAA website for the schedule.Horrible.  If you are looking for a suite-type hotel (meaning a hotel room with an extra sofa-bed in another room) this is NOT your place.  The "suite" part has ceiling to floor windows without curtains into the hallway.  They are fogged so privacy isn't a concern but the light is.  There is no way to reduce the light intrusion into the room and they are on all night.  The end result - forget about sleeping in that part of the suite.  The windows do not block noise either so you can hear even the slightest conversation in the hall. SEE PICTURES I POSTED.11/23/2013 UPDATE: The hotel apologized and rectified the situation very quickly.  My husband travels often so if his next visit goes smoothly then I will re-update with 5 stars.  My husband (Robert) is part of Embassy Suites' reward program and made special arrangements a week in advance to check in late as he would be flying all day.  He reaches the Embassy Suites in Oklahoma City, again, after flying all day, only to be told they don't have room for him and asked him to go down the street.  They gave him the wrong name for the hotel, so my husband was in a unfamiliar city, past midnight, tired, searching for a hotel that doesn't exist.  This is unacceptable!The hotel over all is nice. Front  desk staff is very helpful and friendly. I don't normally get the opportunity to use the pool or jacuzzi and I was looking forward to a nice soak. Not only was the jacuzzi lukewarm, but the water was more than questionable. And I know using water glasses is never suggested in hotels, and I won't use the ones here either. One of the glass' had a drop of leftover soda in it. And later that day after house keeping was there, still there with a new lid placed on it.Okay, so I asked the cab driver to take me (from the airport) to the row of hotels, this just before he claimed that I told him that some random right offramp was what I wanted (he charged me an additional 20$ for the unauthorized detour). Then the girls @ check in told us @ 1:30pm it would be another hour, only allowing us to "register" for a room that night and then couldn't place us in a room until after 4pm (something about them having given late check out to a large party the night before). The "gift shop" doesn't have ANYTHING (but sodas & suckers) that one might need in an emergency AND since the streets of Commerce Ave are void of sidewalks, I was at the mercy of the local cab scammers or the Embassy Suites shuttle driver in my attempt to find diapers for purchase. So, after taking 2 kids (and a stroller) on an off road adventure to the nearby Sinclair (only to find maxi pads that I tried combining with a swim diaper~ by this time we also needed umbrellas & bandaids for blisters), I called the front desk with my diaper (now with added RASH) crisis. She said that the shuttle driver could pick up diapers for me.....no surprise that it took him 2 hours to squeeze that in. The Embassy Suites in Hot Springs Arkansas is our favorite summer fun destination and the differences between the 2, make OKC and Embassy Suites look awful! The key cards are new though, and really cool.
review_content_20: Great service, friendly staff!! Room service was great. Front desk helped me return my rental car by following me in the shuttle to bring me back from Hertz. All around great hotel to stay at!!!Nice place.  Great service.  Only complaint is the 50.00 non refundable fee for bringing a pet.  I can see putting a hold on your card, but non refundable?  Either you are a pet friendly hotel or not.Good- They have a great breakfast bar and the rooms were large for the price. I liked the fountains and the plants in the center courtyard/atrium.Bad- Very slow elevators, TV kept cutting in and out. Not enough luggage carts to go around.Wonderful first hotel on a long road trip. Staff was helpful and space was nicely located for us since we were just passing through. We missed the Manager's Reception (aka complimentary happy hour) but it looked like a nice way to meet people. Room service was quick and reasonably priced.I really like this place, service, food, other guest's mannerism, etc.Nice hotel. Pet friendly. We were on a cross country road trip with two dogs, and this place worked out quite well. The only problem is that if you have dogs it can be a long walk from your room to an outdoor grassy patch. Breakfast was good, the staff was friendly, and there were no issues during our stay. The room was clean and well kept.Whoooo Hooo! Free breakfast & Happy Hour plus a pool!  It don't get mo betta!Pretty clean, quick room service.  Nice to have a hotel that still has a few smoking rooms on the top floor.I've always been a fan of Embassy Suites.  This location was very accommodating: provided a large variety of hot breakfast items and good cook-to-order omelets/eggs in the morning (thank you to the breakfast cook!), a FREE ice scraper (I really needed it one morning and the desk rep was very nice not to charge), quick check out, and clean, spacious, and warm rooms.  My only grip was that there was no hot water for the shower late at night.  I ran it for 5 minutes and it was luke warm at best.  I had to wait until the morning to take a shower.  One less star for that!This is a good mid range priced hotel near the airport in OKC.  Nothing special and nothing different from any other Embassy Suites that we have stayed at.  My favorite part of staying at Embassy Suites is the hot breakfast bar that is included in the price of the room.  Everything from Omelets to pancakes to muffins or whatever you could want.   The rooms are pretty nice and the overall service is above average.  Another nice thing about this particular hotel is that there are four or five restaurants within walking distance.Overall, it was a good stay but not great.  I would stay there again if we were flying out of OKC under the same situation, but if coming to OKC from somewhere else i would stay closer to downtown.  There are several nicer hotels and you would be closer to other event venues and restaurants.Fantastic hotel. Clean, nice staff, and no added fees. The breakfast was excellent and the staff was warm and helpful to our three kids. We stayed here twice during a cross-country road trip and were very impressed.
